reviews.review: Great puppets, but story impossible to follow. The puppets were great, very clever how they all work and only 8 puppeteers when it looked like it needed lots more. Downside was story is virtually impossible to follow as was entirely in Vietnamese .... which would be fine if there was a program in English or other languages that we could see, to help with the concepts and our engagement with the show. Maybe there are programs or sheets available to buy, but if so they are not made obvious.
Ferie. The puppet show was a good exprience, nice music and the hand made puppets are really nice. Cheap experience that you shouldn't be without if you'r here.

Never heard of the water puppet concept - rather out there!. If you have never heard of water puppets like me and you just go you'll find it interesting but rather weird really. I mean the skill is unquestionable, and you have to enjoy Vietnamese opera music, but still entertaining for 45 minutes.

Keeping traditions. We arrived just before the show began so our seats were waaaay back. We still had an unobstructed view.The show started with some traditional songs before the main event. I liked that they reenacted myths and legends of Vietnam. They had some cute special effects like fireworks. The narration needs a little work as the local pronunciation was sometimes difficult to understand.I think the kids would enjoy the spectacle. Go early to get better seats. I have only seen one other water puppet show and it was pretty similar so I think it's a touristy thing to do at shops surrounding hoan kiem lake.

Very memorable . This is a very memorable experience, and certainly only a tourist attraction. The only locals that participates in this were the ones doing the actual performance. Regardless, very memorable, and a must see.

Worth watching, Culture of vietnam. Show starts promptly. Full house. Seat are narrow, best to arrive earlier if your seat (seat no. 4 to 10) are in the center row. Show are in vietnamese. We tried to figure out the story by its action. Interesting water puppet show. Performer greeted audience at end of show. they were only half-wet @ bottom. Guessed they stationed behind the bamboo curtain & move the puppet.
Find your inner child. Although I don't speak Vietnamese, I can laugh. It's funny watching little puppets dancing in the water. Great orchestra. It's always good to expand your cultural awareness.
Interesting. Interesting theater attraction but a little dull. We needed an explanation of what was going on in order to enjoy it more.

Lovely cultural show. We and our 9-year-old loved this show, which runs for just under an hour several times a day in the afternoon and evening, right next to Hoan Kiem Lake (lovely to walk around in the evening). It was all in Vietnamese but that didn't matter - a beautiful spectacle and story, with high quality local music throughout. A nice cool rest from walking around in the heat! Book tickets in advance (same day is fine) as it's very popular. The café at the bottom is convenient but expensive.

Loved it. Really was not expecting the water puppet show to be as good as it was. Great to hear traditional Vietnamese music and songs that accompanied the actions of the puppets- an age old tradition Not just for kids to enjoy, easy to follow the story even if you don't understand Vietnamese

Water Puppets a must see in Hanoi. The Water Puppets are a classic thing to see in Hanoi. All the puppets move through a pool of water and tell tales of Vietnamese folklore. The accompanying music is excellent too and the puppets themselves are beautifully made. My only criticism is the everyone in the row has to stand up for others coming into their row. I also think they should stop people taking photos or videoing. I had an iPad in my line of vision for almost the whole performance.

The show is good but the theater is not.. No doubt the puppet show is one of its kind in the world. Interesting and a cultural experience with its live musicians playing along the acts and scenes.However the inside is a bit old. The outside is too small and there is no waiting area. There are only a few seats beside the stairs. There are more seats in the restaurant further inside where you need to drink or eat. It will be good if more seats are available for those waitng for the next shows which is 45 minutes away.
Clever and Interesting. I did not have a clue what to expect, this was an interesting venue. A story told by puppets all in a lake setting. Only an hour, but an enjoyable and different time passed.

Great chance to see vietnamese culture. The performances were amazing and the music is beautiful. The water puppet theatre is must visit. They have regular showings in the evening and it is right next to Hoan Kiem lake which is beautiful to walk around in the evening.
Nice Cultural experience . Was nice to see the water puppet show. Book tickets in advance. I could understand that some people get bored after a while but I found the show very interesting.
I fell asleep. Which was nice and relaxing. Without a doubt, beautifully done- I just had no idea what it was about.

Only ok. It's a cultural experience but one that can be missed of you're pressed for time. The show went for 45min and we got our tickets when we arrived no need to pre book. The puppets look a little tired but we still enjoyed ourselves

Lots of fun . Very fun little show that gives you a nice taste of Vietnamese culture. There is no English spoken but that isn't much of a problem. There was only one story that I couldn't work out, something about a large golden turtle. I think it's a Vietnamese folk legend or something. Anyway, defo worth a visit and very reasonably priced.

Quirky and authentic . A great little place to stop for some authentic Vietnamese entertainment. Cheap and well worth the short time needed to watch a performance. Loved it even if I wasn't too sure about what exactly was going on all the time!

Traditional but boring.. The water puppet showed the tradition of the people. But the acts were very repetitive and lasted a long time doing the same thing. The music was good for about 10 mins but was the same the whole way through. It was hot and stuffy and I was happy it ended. I was bored through it.

So boring!!. The traditional music was interesting for the first 5 minutes but then it got boring. It was also very stuffy and hot inside. It went overtime and if we weren't sitting in the middle, we would've left. Definitely won't be doing that again.
Snorefest.... This was really boring and couldn't follow the story. We went to the show because we had loads of time to kill, but wouldn't recommend - the show is very bizarre! Wouldn't recommend.

Wasted time . It is a traditional water puppet theatre, with local traditional music, all in local language without any translation. Wooden puppets play in water 14 simple scenes. The performance takes approx one hour and costs 100,000 VND. To be honest, I found it pretty boring.

A authentic and key part of a Hanoi visit . I have to admit. I am a jaded traveller. But this holiday was about taking a deep breath and enjoying one key location. I was wondering when and if I would see an event that captured Hanoi. The water puppets did for me. The story is old, the delivery is childlike and simple, and the live music is delivered with great respect and purpose. Ask for a seat nearest the front to take the full effect, and reflect in the knowledge that you are watching a style of entertainment that is many centuries old. It's only an hour. See it early in your trip, and it will help with perspective.

Appreciate tradition. There is two water puppet theater around Hoan Kiem Lake. I opted for Thang Long as recommended by my local guide. The price of ticket is reasonable at 100,000 VND per pax. I opted for the last show on Sun which is bout 8pm. Pokemon craze is in town as there are several Pikachus posing in front of the theater to draw in crowd. Gimmicks aside, I felt appreciative of the effort to conserve tradition in face of modern currents. It is definitely not an easy task to manipulate puppets under the water. The show itself is mainly in Vietnamese, slight English in introduction . Would be helpful for greater appreciation of the show if you go in with slight understanding of storyline or belief such as the 4 mythical creatures and the legend of the returning sword. I was most impressed on the opening part where a lady performed with the one stringed harp. Do go in with an open mind and appreciation of culture. It may not be fancy stunts or massive pyrotechnic but it is a beautiful experience. Note : 1. The venue is not air conditioned but with lots of fan . 2. No - you will not get wet, no water is splashed on the audience =)3. For friends of technology, please be respectful and not perpetually put out your phones to take photos or record and thereby obstructing the view of audience behind.

A quick 45 minute show for tourists. A quant theatre near the lake. Grab a leaflet explaining the different facets of each 'puppet act' just near the theatre entrance (inside the building). Doesn't really matter if you don't get one beforehand though as you can generally work it out for yourself. Seating arrangements can be tricky if you attempt to get a ticket at the last minute; so sometimes good to book earlier in the day. Three shows a night, so plenty of options. Cheap entertainment!

Master of Puppets. There is no doubt these puppeteers are 100% masters of their craft. The musicians performed flawlessly and the show was perfect. My only problem: phones are not restricted in the audience. A woman in the second row filmed the entire show on her iPhone. This led to people behind her having trouble seeing and that led them to sit up causing the people behind them to have trouble seeing, etc. etc. The show itself was lovely. But, if you get stuck behind the wrong person, then you're in for trouble, because the puppets are very low to the ground.

Traditional show. Visited here just after arriving to Hanoi. It passed away an hour & was cheap @ only 100,000 dong. Felt a bit gimmicky very touristy & to be honest after 20 minutes I'd had enough! Wouldn't be high on my to do list
Just ok. The puppet show was traditional (in vietnamese ) Easy enough to follow.Musicians were the highlight. Perhaps more enjoyable for younger children.

Besutiful. We loved this show. Very reasonably priced. Beautiful music and visually amazing. The colours of the water puppets was beautiful and the professionalism of the puppet masters was impressive.

Traditional Vietnam show. We think it's the best show for you choice when you be in Hanoi!
Must informants for everyone know about the cultural of Vietnam !

Old fashion. this show in Vietnamese is basically for locals
very primitive, but the good thing is that it consists on short stories - so after we understood the concept we left
it was a good experience afterall

Traditional Vietnamese Entertainment . This was far more than a puppet show. There were three singers and four musicians who played a variety of ancient drums and instruments. The various puppets of fish, animals and people were a show about the beginnings of man's relationship with nature and the food sources that he would come to depend on. There were battles and steam and fire. It was delightful old world entertainment. Get front row seats if you can.

Go to experience and support local arts . We went as a group of 3 adults and 3 kids 8 and under. The 8 year stayed engaged the whole show, spending most of the show trying to figure out how they do it. The other two watched nearly all of it too, some bits more enthusiastically than others. There was a bit with pyrotechnics which everyone loved. Most of the stories didn't need translation as it was entertaining enough without needing to understand the speaking bits, but for others, we would have liked to see subtitles to make it more meaningful. We did receive a paper with a summary of the show but a more detailed narrative would have been nice. Language aside, the music was nice and the puppets and movement of them was very well done. If you have sensitive ears, consider bringing ear plugs (I had a headache and the high pitched notes hurt so I put in ear plugs and enjoyed the show much more).

Okay for 100,000 dong. A nice production, as it's all in Vietnamese it's difficult to follow. Half an hour would have been better for me, rather than an hour. Good what to spend an hour before dinner, but not a must see for me.
Amazing performance. It was amazing to see the performance knowing the puppets were controlled by bamboo poles. A must see when in Hanoi
Good fun for an evening. 45 minutes long, definitely worth a visit if you are in Hanoi for the evening. Historic Vietnamese show. - a bit like Punch and Judy on water but with more music and theatre

Nice cultural performance . Having been to China I have seen plenty of cultural shows and this one is as good as any of them. Go in the afternoon to enjoy the air conditioning inside. Entertaining puppets and music

Very boring . We had some time to kill in Hanoi so we thought we'd go to the puppet show. After 10 mins we were ready to leave. It was the same music the hole time and we didn't understand anything. It was only 100,000 dong each. So thankfully we didn't pay to much.

Good if you speak vietnamese . Worth a visit if you can speak Vietnamese or have an hour to kill. Impressive visual display but after a while it can get a little boring if you do not speak the language. But for just a little over £3 you can't complain much

Excellent skill combined with traditional music. Very popular with tourists and locals. Lively show. Make sure you take a brochure at the beginning to understand the show. Interesting folklore and live music is delightful. One hour show and I absolutely enjoyed it (even with a serious jetlag)

water pappet show. it is a water puppet show and done by very skillfull people. the behind cast are all controlling the puppet in the water. it is a traditional story. you need to read more to understand the show. but it is a unique experience. there are a only a few shows aday and you need to book in advance.

Loved it. The cast are so talented. Everything was in Vietnamese, I couldn't understand anything but you get the gist of what's going on. Oh man this was show was so weird I loved it. Definitely a must do, especially if you need a little reprieve from the heat as its air conditioned. Try to get seats at the back as its higher and you'll get a better view!

Amazing and Interesting Show!. We enjoyed it after walk around Hanoi Old Quarter, it was nearby lake and it was very bright & colourful. Costs about 100,000 VND or 60,000 VND each about US$ 3 – 5. The orchestra/band were amazing. It is very impressive how the puppeteers can do the show underwater. Get ready to see smoke and fire and have some childish fun. Kids will absolutely love it!
Great show!. The show was very cool. An ancient Vietnamese art with live accompaniment. The only sore part for me was the flash photography they allowed. Made it less enjoyable
Tourist. Nice show in a traditional type setting. Seats get a little hard after a while. Explanation of the rice growing process good.

Entertaining unique show! . I will recommend any travelers to go and watch this puppet show. It's a 45 mins show, would recommend to get tickets before going as it is always packed.We went there after our dinner, the show is entertaining . We booked from our hotel reception, cost us around us$5 per ticket. An unique experience to see puppets performing on a pool of water with impressive side effects backup by traditional music. Overall a great experience and we really like it , advise is to get the 1st class seat to have a better view , without any blockage.

An Amazing Venue. The Water Puppet Theater was a great venue for the show. There was plenty of space to find a seat and the show was great. The people controlling the puppets are very skilled. The show was great because it told a story whilst adding a humorous factor to it. Overall a great venue for a great show.

Enjoyable but short. Some pretty effects. Was expecting a bit more really though. The performance is quite short. It is a bit harder as a foreigner to follow what the dances are about but some of the effects are very nice.

Nice evening activity: 50mins entertainment for about 7USD. The show is accompanied by traditional Vietnamese music, live performed. If you don't speak Vietnamese, you won't catch the full story. Since the show is only 50 minutes, its worthwhile visiting. We've booked the tickets through a travel agency and they were conveniently delivered to our hotel.

Not bad .. just weird. It was all very confusing .. I'm sure there was a story to it but it was quite hard to follow. The live music was good but it was very distracting that the singers were having a good old chat in between singing. It was also very warm in there which made the 50 minute (approx) show quite uncomfortable.It is very clever how the puppets are worked and the use of fire was impressive.Not a must-see but if you are in Hanoi for a while then its worth a visit just to say you've been.

Better than expected . Okay I am being honest here. I didn't expect much. Quite ignorant and only went because my friend wanted to go. But it was surprisingly good. Really enjoyed it and had a great time. Although it was in Vietnamese the show was entertaining and funny. The tickets were not expensive and I would advise that you book early so you get allocated a seat near the front. The most annoying thing is when people take pictures during the show. Why?

Bizarre, hilarious and fascinating - but a must-see! . I've never seen anything quite like this before. It's bizarre and strange, but so funny! I couldn't help but laugh. It's one of those must-do things in Hanoi and at only $100,000 Dong for a ticket it's rude not to! We bought tickets in a group early in the day and we're glad we did - when we got there for the 5:20pm show the place was packed. You're also seated according to your tickets, so buy them together if you want to sit together. I took my fan in with me and was glad I did because it can get quite hot in there with so many people. The show lasts around 50 minutes. A definite cultural experience - beautiful music and singing too.

Performance's amazing but.... Must prohibit cameras...Can't watch the show. Amazing live traditional music and toy performers are all wet-never imagine they are wet... but unfortunately I can't recommend.

Delightful performance. Great cultural experience and worth every penny.We arrived just before the show was about to start, and managed to get tickets even thought it said that it was sold out. The tickets cost 100.000 dong per person. And as far as I can remember, there is show on every hour, with the last one being at 8pm. The show itself is delightful. It is in Vietnamese but you can guess the storyline. The way the puppets are made and manipulated on stage really makes them come alive. The show lasted about 50 mins. And it is accompanied by live music.

Must do in Hanoi. Amazing show with amazing music. It is not in English but you can follow along with what is happening. Highly recommend getting front row seats as people have phones out and are taking pictures which is very distracting. They should implement a no picture policy!

Wow. Really amazing. Didn't understand a word of it but you could still get the gist of the story. Definately pay the extra to take photos. I think it was about 60,000 vnd. The music and singing is out of this world and the puppets are magical.Highly recommended!
Water puppets not for everyone. This was ok. I liked watching the people play the instruments. I was glad it was not longer. The theater was hot and stuffy.

Smiling performers. I bought the ticket at the entrance of the theater. They have 3 sessions every day and the latest one is at 8 pm. The session I picked was nearly full-housed but, luckily, I was a solo travel and I walked in the show successfully :)The show was in Vietnamese. So if you don't know Vietnamese, please do get an information leaflet so that you can follow what's going on with the show. I was pretty appreciated by the smile on the face of the performers. They were so into the performance and brought the puppets into life! I highly recommend the show to everyone who will visit Hanoi.
Nice . The puppet show was quite nice. It lasts for about 50 minutes. The music was nice and although it was all in Vietnamees we understood everything.

Delightful talented puppeteers ...needed some translation though. It's a lovely venue for a show....near Westlake and the lovely warm evening with tourists and locals out and about. The show was about the traditions and the culture and it's so inspirational to.watch these young puppeteers be so passionate to showcase this amazing vietnamese culture. The best part for us was the dance of the Dragons. Storyline would have been much more appreciated if we had an English translation even in a booklet form to help.us understand.

No idea what was happening. OK, so I went here as it's a 'must see'. No it isn't. You are not missing out. At 100,000 dong it is an expensive 50minute nap time!!The story made no sense at all. Lots of jumping fish (puppets) not a clue what it was about?Now I am not a whinny Brit, I love culture, but this really needs some English translation at some point.
Fun. A really fun, strange show. We had no idea what was going on in the show but it was still very enjoyable
Entertainment. This is well worth a visit. Very clever and interesting. Show lasts 45 minutes. Very traditional going back to 12th century.
Tipical but boring. I guess this is something everyone should see, but for me was really boring. The location is good though.
Fun. It is very impressive how the puppeteers can do the show underwater. Get ready to see smoke and fire and have some childish fun. Kids will absolutely love it!

Vietnamese Friendly. It would be better if there were a projector with subtitles. The brochure that are placed outside were helpful but, the theatre lighting is not really suitable for reading.Unfortunately, i didn't enjoy my time in watching. [v]

Very nice show. We got the tickets free from our travel agency, we did not know what to expect. The show is in Vietnamese and combined with traditional Vietnamese music, played by live Orchestra, it was very nice and you can learn on the Vietnamese cultural. If you can I recommend to go. This is 45 min show.

Cant miss it. Lasts around 50 minutes. Great show well worth a visit. Children seemed to enjoy it but its all in Vietnamese so you have to guess whats going on, it covers most of the stories youll learn about hanoi on the tours though ( the and the sword!)

Water Puppet Show. I love the show. Eventhough I don't understand the words, I still laughed and enjoyed the show and the Vietnamese music. I never been to a puppet show before, so this is amazing experience for me.

Interesting show. We enjoyed knowing the culture and art whenever we travel. This was an interesting show with of songs (we had no clues but still, it was nice) and colorful puppets dancing on water. And the tickets were cheap. Give it a go. You would enjoy it.

Water Puppet Theatre. Entertaining
Would recommend to anyone
Something rarely seen in the west
Children would love this show
Food & beverages on the premises
Amazing . The music and the control of the puppets need a lot of training.we really enjoy it.the show is very colorful and the time passed very quickly

Traditional culture show. After a fairly quick dinner, we arrived on time to see the famous Vietnamese water puppet show inside a Casino Hotel. To be honest, I fell asleep during the show...
用過晚餐我們就來看水上木偶戲。這是越南最具特色的民間舞台戲。它稀奇的地方，就在於木偶戲於水池面上演出，表演者需長時間浸泡於水中，用強勁臂力以及純熟的控繩技巧令那玩偶生靈活性的演出。因沒什麼劇情，又聽不懂在唱什麼，導致我犯睏。

Great Heritage . Although it was only 50mins, it the pretty amazing to watch 10 different stories beautifully choreographed. Too bad it doesn't come with subtitles so that we can easily understand the storylines better.
Very interesting. Very bright and colourful. The orchestra/band were amazing. Lasts 45 Min which seemed a little long. Quite hot in the theatre so wear light clothing.

Boring after the first 15 minutes.... Okay so this is traditional Vietnamese culture and it's something I have now done twice on two trips to Hanoi ten years apart, but it gets old very quickly. Never again!The first 15 minutes are okay but after that it is just more of the same. I struggled to keep awake and my 14 year old was visibly in pain and wanting to be somewhere else. My 12 year old was a little more forgiving but said this was not something that he enjoyed. There was applause after the first one or two performances then it died completely when people realised how boring it really was. Half of the row in front of us was people playing on their phones to keep entertained.If this show was 15 minutes long it might be good. At 50 minutes it is painful. The only plus is that it cost only about 5 bucks each to see it. That's 5 bucks and 50 minutes of my life that I will never get back.
Uniques Puppetry. Different experience very unexpected. The music and atmosphere was a lovely introduction to Vietnamese instruments and singing styles, a very different experience.
Water puppets. Very interesting well worth a visit performance very enjoyable. This gave an insight in to a traditional way of life

Good to see. Visited Here after walking around old quarter.Costs about 100 dong each about £4 .Worth seeing if in the area but not something I would see again ,lasts about 45 min ,which was long enough to be honest .

Funny, colourful and lots of fun!. I thoroughly enjoyed this water puppetry. The music and singing were divine. I particularly loved the dragons!! Won't give too much away - just Go!! The cost of the ticket is ridiculously cheap!!
Amazing . The is worth the visit. Amazing show by all the artistes. The air conditioner was bad making people fume but once the shoe began it became the main focus.

Not my cup of tea. While lots seem to enjoy this, I was not a fan and found it boring.I couldn't follow it and thought it a bit stupid. It wasn't until after I saw it that I noticed programs in the foyer that I could have read, but as we were hustled upstairs quickly I didn't notice them. On saying that, it is a must see. I wouldn't dissuade anyone from going. It's just my opinion

Something different. I'm glad I've seen it. It's different from any other shows I've seen. It lasts about 45 minutes and incorporates a number of different acts. This troupe is world renowned and worth one trip but probably doesn't need a return visit.
Nice exoerribce. You will awed by the talents. The puppets are remarkable. I just hope they have English translations for better appreciation.
Cheap and worth a visit. The show was interesting but even at just under an hour it was way too long. The show is the exact same from 8 years ago (when I last went)

Subtitle please!. At first, I was pretty sure that this art performance would be amazing. We (Me and BF) got the ticket and whatced the show at 4:10 PM. We run so fast to go to the teater because we almost late. The door almost been closed when we arrived. But in fact, we slept over there! Why?Just like the name, this is a puppet water performance. Yeah it was unusual and attractive but you must note this; The whole story is in Vietnamese. You need subtitle to understand what the story about.The impact? I paid 100k VND for 20 minutes slept in the teather. HahaBut overall, it was entertaining.You can try if you want.

Good for killing time, but keep your expectations low. After several recommendations and seemingly decent reviews on here, we grabbed some tickets and saw the show. Not sure if I am too cynical, but I just didn't get it. The show is in Vietnamese, with only a brief intro translated into English and French. The theatrics were not dazzling enough to distract from the fact that I did not know what the story was about. I get that there is a fair amount of historical and cultural importance to the story that is being told, but for a non-Vietnamese speaker it is impossible to know what that story line is.

Good fun to experience once. It was a good experience to see the water puppet show as part of the effort to get to know the culture, but nothing special to shout about. To some it could be boring, as I witnessed a few in the audience falling asleep soon after the show started. It is something that you can go for at least once and wouldn't go again.
Cultural experience. Saw the 6.30pm show. 45 min show with traditional (live) singers and instruments and traditional puppets operated using bamboo poles.

Worth to try once. I was so surprised when entering the theater with nice Vietnamese traditional music and super cute pupets and lovely funny plays. I am sure kids will be very interested with the show.

Nice . Wroth a visit.
Kids loved it, & its not simething you see anywere alse.
We took the 20:00 show, & it was full.
Cute. The show is cute if you have some time to kill while you are in Hanoi. The singers are good. Good for any age. Theater is not air conditioned but we managed to stay cool.
Boring. Boring show with nothing really WOW or AMAZING. Nicely done, but nothing special. For the price it is worth it and with only 45 minutes doable.
Wouldn't go a second time. An experience. But if you don't have time to see it, you can rest assured that you didn't miss anything. A tourist trap for sure.
Very famous local attraction. It is very nice to watch and it gives you the real perception of the local culpture! Very simple but also very fascianting either like music either like "dance"

Worth visiting, very nice. I had never seen such a show before and I liked it very much, even if only the introduction was translated in English. Actually it is a very visual and acoustic show with puppets on water and you take pleasure to watch it anyway. Just go, it's a must in Hanoï.

An unusual and unique show. . We had read briefly about this theatre and stumbled upon it during our walk at the nearby lake. Ticket prices are cheap at 100k VND per adult, with shows running every 70 minutes, the show itself is 50 minutes long and is in a cool room but not air conditioned. This is our first time seeing a water puppet show having never come across one before. Certainly unique although my better half kept nodding off but thats probably due to jet lag! They have creative ways to make use of the puppetry but without spoiling the show I can't say much more. There is a live musical group with native instruments on the left hand side of the stage which was also interesting to see in action. Overall, a unique experience and popular with tourists. Be warned though that the story itself is told in Vietnamese. You can pick up a flyer in English which gives the title to each act though but would be nice if they included the story of what's actually happening!

Interesting . I wouldn't go for a second time but I also wouldn't have missed it! The puppeteers are very talented! It goes for about and hour. I think 40 mins would have been enough time. Still highly recommend, you won't be disappointed we were just time poor during our visit to Hanoi and had so many things to fit in :-)
Worth it. Decided to move to the back area to see better(people with cameras). Would recommend doing this where possible. Kids enjoyed. Good traditional music. Quite an art form.
Very average. Hard to understand story line interesting puppets but I got very bored also looked like the orchestra crew got bored as well with 5 shows in six hours

Strangely Entertaining . I was entertained even though the performance is in Vietnamese! Musical and vocal skills abound whilst a story unfolds on the water stage with some very cleverly made puppets.The theatre became very stuffy though, so as soon as the performance was over, the entire audience rushed out for fresh air. Sadly, this left the vendors outside the theatre doors with no customers to buy their show souvenirs.

Good fun, something different . Our 6 year old loved it! Theatre comfortable with assigned seating. The show was maybe a little repetitive, but under one hour. Very unique and an interesting art form. Worth seeing for these reasons and live band playing traditional instruments.

Water puppet show. Creative, musical -something you won't see anywhere else. A variety of acts. Puppet masters stand in the water behind a screen and manipulate a large variety puppets, telling a story with music, smoke, excitement

Take in a Little Culture. We went to the English version (intro and ending only). The puppets are well worth seeing, the performance is 45min long.The price is 100000dng.We had font row seats and had a great view.

Who needs to understand the storyline??. I was put off going by some reviews saying it was impossible to understand what was going on....who cares?? The seats are comfy, the set is visually attractive and the orchestra/singers are so beautiful. I picked up the leaflet on entry which explains in a sentence what each section is and I found that was enough.It's very good value for money, like everything else in Hanoi (in others words ridiculously cheap) so go & enjoy!!

amazing. this is a wonderful show that keeps your attention through out. the musicians were wonderful as were the puppeteers . the theatre is self was small and friendly with a fell of being in a historical place wonderful talents long may it continue

Something I wouldnt miss . The show was nice, its very typical Hanoi so it was something I had to see (afterall its part of culture right). And really it wasnt a waste of my time. Although the show was in Vietnamese (since its a traditional act which is cool) and I couldnt follow the whole story they were trying to tell, I found it very funny and beautiful. I appreciate the art the puppetmasters created. Thank you.

Interesting and not usual. Nice place to see a totally different piece of art, typical for Vietnam. Very nice music and nice management. Please note that the entrance ticket here is cheaper or even much cheaper than in other cities. So if you want to see it, do it in Hanoi!
Slice of history. What an amazing cultural experience 50 min show for equivalent of $AU6. English intro but rest in Vietnamese but you get the hang of the story. This art form started 1000 years ago.

Great Cultural Experience . If you are the kind of person who loves to experience the culture of the places you visit, I would most definitely suggest going to see a Water Puppet Show at Thang Long Water Puppet Theater... The music is great and the puppeteers are amazing... *Everything is in Vietnamese though, but the experience was still amazing!** There is no dress code, so you can just show up as you are.*** While you are there, you might aswell treat yourself to an Egg Coffee at Helio Coffee right next door, theirs is pretty good!

Water puppet. . Really amazing. I was very sceptical about the show. I thought it would be more for children than adults. But after watching the show I was completely bowled over. The slick presentation, the extraordinary skills of the puppeteers made the show outstanding. Loved every minute of it.
Awesome fin. Absolutely worth a look, it's very cheap and although in 100% Vietnamese you get the gist of it all. So cheap and so many people go into making this show daily, absolutely amazing!

Very enjoyable and a must do when you're here. I didnt pre book, instead I went to their ticketing office which is very close to hoam kiem lake and paid for a 18.30 show at around 14.00 for 100,000 dong. Well worth a watch and not boring at all. Some precursor is in english but during the show its vietnamese narrative.

one time only. It was a good show at the beginning ,but after 10 minutes u get bored and start to feel sleepy,cause u don't understand what they are saying and the music is monotonous .So only once in a life experience
Enjoyed it, but not a must see. Very nice attraction but if you have small amount of time wouldn't recommend it. The show is very nice but in Vietnamese, amazing talent

Great show. This is a great show and not too long - about an hour. The water puppetry is imaginative and great fun. The theatre is just across the road from the Lake so easy to access but the traffic near there can be quite hazardous. My one reservation is the amount of leg room in the seats which row by row are far too close together unless you manage to get a VIP seat on the front row! Its a good idea to combine a twilight show at the theatre with a stroll around the lake beforehand followed by dinner in the old town which is just a 5/10 minute stroll away.
Great Entertainment. Interesting show with talented puppeteers. The music was very impressive. A good family day out or perfect for couples!

Fun traditional Vietnamese show. Fun show to see as it something really Vietnamese like. As it is not expensive it worth the visit. The show is in Vietnamese but some things can be guessed what they are about. As it is just 45 min up to an hour, it and it has like 15 different acts, it does not really bother that it is in Vietnamese.

Well is different.... We booked onto an evening excursion at our hotel that included the water puppet theatre and a nighttime river cruise. The water puppet theatre is indoors so doesn't quite capture the true feel of this art form. That said the show is reasonably entertaining. The music is performed live and the story itself is self explanatory (you don't need to understand Vietnamese). It's about an hour long and is a good way to pass a bit of time if you have nothing else to do. If this is something you would like to see I would recommend spending a bit more money and getting out into the countryside to see a traditional show.

Staff working is the only best. Staff working is the only best thing
I had a huge problem understanding the Language
So couldn't make out of the story
Hence was left sleeping for more than half an hour

Cute little show . If you want to see a bit of culture then make sure you get a ticket to this show, only goes for about 1 hour and is well worth it. We arranged for a cyclo trip to take us on a tour of the old quarters then to a restaurant within walking distance to the theatre which was a nice touch
Unique Show. I have not seen puppet shows on water before, so this was an entertaining and unique show for me. The show lasts about an hour and well worth the 100k Dong price.
good experience. It was great entertainment show. I could understand the show. Bur many people took a picture during the show.

A great experience. This was a very fun hour in Hanoi. If you have a spare hour, this is a great way to spend it. There is an introduction in Vietnamese, French and English and you get a program that outlines each performance. We had a really good time.
Go early for tickets. A great show and really a highlight of Hanoi for me. One tip is to go early to get your tickets as it does seem to get block booked by tour parties.

A good show . While it looks good and a lot of effort has gone into this - and it's a great way to impart culture - the volume of shows seems to have taken a toll on the energy of the show. Or maybe it was that we saw our show in the heat of the afternoon and didn't get any relief inside (not sure there is an air conditioning system - it certainly wasn't working well for our show). In any event, the performance is engaging but unable to keep people's full attention (I counted six people asleep in the last 10 minutes). The upside is that it takes only 50 minutes and is pretty cheap (100,000VND for anyone over 1.4 meters, so it cost us a little over $20AUS with one of our tackers sneaking in under the bar).
Very good but a bit repetative. Excellent show, but a bit repetitive. Show is split into 14 acts but once you've seen a few acts it becomes a bit of the same. Good job it's only 40 minutes duration.
Delightful. This lively show surpassed our expectations. It was fun, colorful and an altogether delightful experience. If you have a free evening in Hanoi make sure you take in this lovely show!

Unique Tradition . The water puppet show is unique to Vietnam so I definitely recommend seeing it. The show lasts around 50 minutes which I think is perfect. Like most things in Vietnam, this is a cheap activity.

Worth a visit. Some of the acts can become a little tedious but overall runs for a total of 50 minutes so not too bad. Make sure you grab a run sheet on your way in so that you can follow the stories - this helps especially as the entire show is in Vietnamese only. The kids started to get bored but overall found it entertaining enough. Glad we went.
Perfect!. Delivered tickets to hotel. Easy to find. Show was fantastic!! I smiled the whole way through!! :) :)
S. This was very different to anything l have been to before. There is no English explanation of the story but that made it even more fun .

Good show. An interesting show... Very local anf very much reflecting the traditions of vietnamese culture. Be aware, that alot of people bring phones and cameras - pictures taken over head hight WILL spoil the view of those behind. Be attentive.

Cute! . We went to the water puppet show and noticed there were a lot of tourists - something I don't particularly enjoy but the show was very cute and the staff were so passionate. 20 minutes was a reasonable amount of time.

Vietnamese rice civilization. Vietnamese longstanding rice civilization is condense in 1 hour of Thang Long Water Puppet Theater. The Theater is not too big, you should take 1 hand- fan and enjoy the show. Ticket is selling from 8 a.m -21 p.m and traveller should buy it 30 minutes, then have a walk along the Hoan Kiem Lake's street to eat ice cream, coffee in Cau Go street

Has to be done!. Could not have left Vietnam without seeing a water puppet show and this one seems to be a good one. The live music was excellent and the opening piece before the show started was really good.Could have been cooler inside as was baking hot! If you don't like camera freaks who are determined to take dozens of pictures and record whole segments then get a seat at the front, or close to it! They didn't have the DVD for sale so some people were trying to film their own copy, including half standing and leaning forward which kind of spoiled it.

Interesting but glad it didn't last too long. It's something to see, but not gonna blow your mind or anything like that. Was clever and the traditional music was cool. Wouldn't be the biggest shame if you miser this one for something else in the city.

Not bad if you like puppetry and traditional folk music. You need to like puppetry art to enjoy the show. About 25 pee cent of crowd walked out half way during the show although the theatre was full in the beginning. The show was in Vietnamese language and involves some folk music most of the time.

Worth watching. The water puppet show is one of its kind in the world! It was colourful, skillful and interesting. It reflects the local culture of the Vietnamese, and speaks loads of the rich cultural beliefs/heritage of the people. Highly revommended if you are into history/cultural folklore.
Ok to see once. Worth seeing because of the uniqueness of the water puppetry. The show was close to an hour and some scenes drug on. A little hard to watch comfortably in very cramped seats.

Enjoyed..... It was a unique experience because i had never seen a water puppetry show before it....their traditional instruments music was simply amazing....though the language was the barrier bt still enjoyed the show....

Funny and entertaining!. Really enjoyed it...nice way to beat the heat for an hour. Bought tickets ahead at the hotel, assigned seats so we got there just a few minutes before showtime. Looked like there was a bar/cafe downstairs to kill some time if you are early.Still trying to figure out how they maneuver all of those water puppets without getting tangled up - pretty impressive.

Great show. It is a must in Vietnam. We got tickets at the same day of the show at the Thang Long Water Puppet Theater, it was very nice. I would recommend everyone to see it. You can see the show quite good from nearly all the seats. We had fun.

Nice cultural experience. We had a lovely time here. The show is made up of a series of small acts using puppets in the water.They include traditional instruments and songs, which are all live.The theatre itself has about 6-8 fans on the wall and we didn't find it too hot at all.You can see fine, we were in row M and still had a good view of the stage,The show starts exactly on time, and there were people arriving 5,10,15 even 30minutes into the show. Very frustrating and distracting for people who were on time! It was slightly difficult to follow as the skits are spoken in Vietnamese, however it was still enjoyable. The program you grab on the way in tells you which acts are next, so you have a general idea!

Enjoyable show . We managed to get seats in the front row for 100,000dong each which we purchased earlier on in the day.The whole show was in Vietnamese so grab a leaflet before you head in which gives a brief outline of each scene.Enjoyable and worth going if you have time

Great fun. This well priced $10 showed has about 4 show times a day and is fun for any age. It's about and hour and you'll see the original theatre (it started in Hanoi not HCMC) hear traditional music and see a unique performance. I recommend getting tickets in advance and asking for the from row. It doesn't seem to sell out but going around 4 for a 8pm show we were in the third row and it was definitely hard to see some thinks over people's heads - the spacing isn't made for foreigners.

A must see for the first time visitor!. A unique experience not to be missed. Additional explanation could have been provided pertaining to the scenes and acts but overall still worth the time and expense.
One of those must do's in Hanoi. We enjoyed the performance. Great musicians and the puppets are amazing with extremely talented puppeteers

Clever!. The water puppet theatre is a definite must see. Water puppets are unique to Vietnam, and whilst the locals probably won't be here unless they are bringing their kids, it's something you need to see at least once. The puppeteers are very clever, the singers and musicians are very talented and they even sell little puppets at the show afterwards. Go check it out!

Cultural Treasure. The acts are in Vietnamese! However, still a treat to watch this cultural tradition and you can mostly understand what is happening by just watching. The music at the beginning was beautiful. The people taking pictures throughout or filming it were awful. Do everyone a favor and don't do that. I'm sure there are clips on YouTube already.

Unique experience. The performance was extraordinary despite the Vietnamese language!!!
I was so amazed with all the instrumentals and songs.
One of the drawbacks was the quality of the audience!!!
If you see this review and plan to visit here, please do not flash with your camera in the middle of the show and be punctual!!!!!!
Water puppets. If you love the traditional music and can't stand to live without puppets in your life you'll love this. It's only 30 mins of you may enjoy it.

Just to say we had done it. Well we all went along as its one of the sights to see. It was OK I suppose, passed an hour and injected a bit of traditional culture into the holiday. Worth going to see if you are in the old quarter and have time.

Fun activity . Great place to get entertained on a rainy,stormy days in Hanoi.
The kids really enjoyed the experience.
Do it once:)

Very charming and hot. Very much liked the show. Musicians and singers were excellent. Puppet show was amusing and followed a bit of the storyline of Vietnamese history and culture. Only one entrance and exit out of the theatre at the bottom by the stage. God forbid that the fireworks they use in the show ever get away from them as everyone inside will burn alive. Very hot inside and the two fans for over 100 people did not cut it. The elderly Asian couple in front of me looked close to expiring from vigorous fanning. Admittance is so inexpensive maybe switching on the air con is out of budget. I would have paid double for a cool room (and perhaps an emergency exit on the other side).

A must in Hanoi . Cultural show with awesome performance by locals. 100k VND for adult , discounted price for senior citizen , students (make sure you have your ID with you) . Definitely worth a visit !

Suprisingly enjoyable. I went in to this place apprehensive that it is one of those tourist hogwash.It is definitely touristy but can be quite enjoyable too.The music is really nice and for most people act as a great introduction to the world of water puppets

Quite boring. From a cultural standpoint it was a nice insight into a Vietnamese artform. However for us, we found it exceedingly boring. The music was high and screechy, the theater was very hot and that the entire thing was in Vietnamese made it for a performance we were desperate for to be over as quickly as possible. Save the dong for something else.

Loved it. Should try. Good oriented show. Lasts around 55 min. Interesting atmosphere and artists singing and playing local music. Defintely should be visited to sense local history. Liked it very much. Cheap price compared to the show...

Unmissable experience!. If you are in Hanoi then you must see a show here!The show lasts around 50 minutes and there is a schedule in English so you understand what each individual performance is about. There are a few spoken exchanges in Vietnamese but nothing you really need to know. It is easy to follow what is going on. The music is a great accompaniment and the puppets are beautifully decorated. The whole show is a really good experience of Vietnamese culture and we really enjoyed it.The only thing which spoiled it for us was not the fault of the company. A Chinese group tour behind us took up two rows and they were talking throughout the performance. They were very rude and ignorant of other visitors.

See something different. I attended a show with my wife and twin daughters aged 7 recently whilst on holiday.The price for the tickets for a 45 minute show was very cheap. This show is quite interesting and also gave you an insight into Vietnam old culture. The show is performed to live music which is nice, the words however are not in English so can get a little hard to follow.The theatre is quite small, but there are plenty of shows on each day. The theatre is situated next to the lake near the old quarter. I would recommend seeing a show if you can, especially if you have small children. My two daughters really enjoyed this show.

Water puppets. We weren't going to go, but decided at the last minute and we are so glad we did go and see, we actually thought if we didn't we might regret it. Very different and unusual threatre performance, very good.
水上木偶劇. The price was quite cheap.The show is also good in the beginning, but a little be boring in the end.
Water Puppet show is good. I work as tour operator in Hanoi and I highly recommend my clients to enjoy this kind of performance

Fascinating . The water puppet show is just simply a fascinating experience and for 100,000 dong and 45 minutes it's well worth the effort to get to a show. It's just unusual and you won't find anything like it elsewhere.

Ok .... Wouldn't rush to do again. Lovely exposure to the musical culture and historical way of life in Vietnam but as the show was in Vietnamese therefore was hard to follow and stay engaged. In parts I had no idea what the meaning or message they were trying portray.
Clever. The theatre is smallish but the musicians do put their hearts into the performance. The colourful characters must be very difficult to move, it was entertaining and colourful

Fascinating!. I really enjoyed the water puppets. The music is performed live and it is amazing to see all of the skills involved in making the puppets dance on the water. It somewhat told the story of Vietnam's cultural history. I would recommend seeing a show if you can there is about 5 shows a day/night. Located next to the lake.

Freakin awesome. I went and it was super cool, I've been excited to GOTO it for a while and it was worth it. Very beautifully done puppets and it being in the water just looked so cool!!! It was an hour which was perfect cuz just as my attention was on its way out it was the big ending. So worked out lovely. Enjoyed all of it Not really for young children I'd say. Mostly couples or groups of adults.

This was a different evening.. I can understand why it was great back in the day when it was first created, however nothing was English, making it harder to know what's going on. You can book tickets beforehand. If you visit Hanoi, and don't attend, please don't lose any sleep.
Very fun. This was great - the show was well done, the music was beautiful and choreography was fantastic. You have to go see this if you are in Hanoi.....

A nice traditional show. I don't understand much about the story performed because it wa carried out in local language and no translation to English. So I just guessed it was about the history of their country or town.

Weird but wonderful . As a westerner this was a very weird show to go visit, and despite it not being in English it was funny and very impressive! It's cheap enough to go to as well and the musicians were incredibly talented! I would very much recommend people going!

Exactly what you expect - nothing more. I didn't want to go because I'm just not a fan of puppets but the people from my group went and loved it and said it surprised them how good it was so I went to see for myself but I was not impressed. It was exactly the reason I didn't want to go.The instruments are good and it's very traditional. Good vibe and people seem to enjoy it. Pretty cheap too: 100k VND

Loved the show. This show was awesome. The puppets and their movements were so incredibly intricate, and listening to the Vietnamese story-telling was interesting. The show was the perfect length as well, not too drawn out. Only downside was the lack of air conditioning- bring a fan if you have one!

Waste of time if you don't speak Vietnamese. The whole show was in Vietnamese. There was no English translation and only some people were given programmes. Even then, these programmes were not helpful as they only gave the title of each scene and didn't add any information about the puppet show. The puppets themselves were cool but it is almost impossible to appreciate them properly without being able to follow the story which was narrated in Vietnamese.A very overhyped attraction!

Irrevalant. Theatre was hot with no air conditioning and the show was loud with no English interpretation. Unable to make sense of the show.My partner fell asleep. A very long one hour show. Would not recommend at all.
Nice . The show is interesting. It s a water puppet show but in vietnamees so we didn' t understand a thing so after 10 minutes it gets boring.:(

Brilliant night out. This was one of the things we wanted to do in Hanoi, but again our Intrepid guide refused to book it. Fortunately we did it ourselves.Brilliant fun even though we couldnt understand any of the language. The dragons were especially good.Dont miss this one.
A must for every Vietnam visit. Great show the whole family did enjoy very much. Live music and great puppet performance. Multiple shows a day.

Wonderful Vietnamese heritage. We were quite excited to see the show and it was great fun. Even though the dialogue is in Vietnamese, you can understand what's going on. The puppets were varied and very cute. Great way to see part of Vietnamese culture. Tip: Buy tickets for the night shows the day before, they sell out quick!

A bit disappointed but still good. Perhaps I heard to many great things about it before but I have to admit I was disappointed by the show. Puppets are small and we were to high.
My neighbour' flash camera did not help me to enjoy ! Wish you had a better experience than mine.
Better than expected. Better than expected 100k dongs per adult. Cheap an fun 1hlong approx. Full of references to the local mythology.
Amazing . A sensational cultural experience not to be missed. It will enthrall and amaze. Can be a bit stuffy in the theatre.

Cute - but boring and kitschy. Most people might say it is a must to see the water puppet theater. Well...ok.
It is quite funny, very kitschy and after some time a bit boring (but it is only 45min anyways) und only for western tourists.
So, yes, it is nice to see it but do not expect too much.

Mr. Hendrik. Was nice to see this, not only for children.... a fine spectacle !
Live singing and traditional Vietnamese instruments. Unique players.

Interesting and worth a viait. My boyfriend and I weren't sure whether to bother going to a water puppet show whilst we were in Hanoi, but we're glad that we did. For 100,000 dong per adult it's not a bad price, and the show lasted about 50 minutes. The length was enough - there are 14 very short stories told by puppets in the water and some accompanying singing. We couldn't understand the speaking that happened in parts but it didn't matter, and I actually found myself enjoying it - it was a bit of fun, although I'm glad it's not longer! Worth a visit when in Hanoi, for a taste of local culture!

Enjoyable traditional Vietnamese entertainment . Would recommend if you haven't tried before, enjoyed the show and glad I experienced this Vietnamese tradition.Try to book tickets in advance to get seats at the front
Our Trip.. Water puppet Show was very Excellent. We could follow the gist of the Story and the the Girls singing was beautiful and the music was fantastic. Well worth the timeslot to enjoy it.

Really cool experience . I really enjoyed the puppet show. It's all in Vietnamese so I recommend getting a translation card that are by the door. But the music and the puppets are really enjoyable and the price is decent too. Definitely recommend if you enjoy cultural performances.

Interesting but kind of boring. I was happy I did this for the experience but I found it to be pretty boring. The musicians and the puppeteers did an amazing job but I didn't understand what was going on. And it was confusing that on the tickets they hand write your seat number but never mentioned it so I had no idea there were assigned seating.

Glad I went even if I couldn't see much! . I was really looking forward to seeing this. I had, what I thought was a good seat... somewhere in the middle, middle. The ticket price was 100,000 dong and it lasted about 45 minutes.When the show started with music and singing it was lovely. Once the puppets themselves started, everyone started sitting forward to get a better view. This meant that the people behind saw less. What I did see though was amazing...you might say mesmerising and if the theatre could fix the gradient of the seats, it would be well worth it, in my opinion. Be sure to pick up an information sheet before you go in (lots of different languages available) so you know what's going on...if you can see it all of course. The other thing that would enhance the experience is if they could ban flash photography as it was constant and really annoying!
Piece of viet culture. My friends like it, but i think so so. The music is even more attractive to me. But with 100.000 vn they charge, it worth the experience

Good value entertainment . Good fun show which is good value for money. Entertaining and fairly impressive puppetry, with the live music being the highlight. Good fun and not too long for a family /small children. Some spoken bits are in Vietnamese however this isn't that important to enjoy the show, if you're an English speaker. Quite a warm room but fans do help, overall would recommend a visit. Tickets were required a day in advance when I visited.

Surprisingly good. Well with a visit. Surprisingly good musicians and some tender moments. I really enjoyed it. Slightly spoiled by millions of tourists taking pictures of the stage with giant tablets. Worth it despite that.

A must do in Vietnam. My husband and I literally stumbled upon this place while walking around the Old Quarter. There was a show happening in 20 minutes and for 100,000 dong I think, it was very reasonable. You don't need to book a tour or prebook tickets to see this. In 5 minutes, we were sitted happily in the back rows. We saw a tour group arguing that their seats were taken, etc, etc. They were standing around being annoying. Bet they paid more than us. Ours were totally hassle free. It was a one hour show, very entertaining, you can pretty much work out each separate simple sketch story along with the music nuances. Hey, isn't this what you come to Vietnam for? To experience a completely different culture and its traditions? Just absolute entertainment! We even bought a lovely water puppet souvenir to take home after that. Don't miss doing this when coming to Vietnam!
Enjoyable. I went with my teenage son and we enjoyed it. It was very cleverly done and I found the funny side of it. It is not too long and we did have a laugh.

Water puppets in Hanoi . A must see for anyone visiting Hanoi especially if you've got kids. Traditional puppets dance around accompanied by live muscians off to the left who are very talented & equally as interesting to watch. Book in advance to not miss out as its very popular. I didnt think the Seats where uncomfotable.

Rather boring, but must see. We went to see this theater, because well, it is typical, so we did not want to miss it. It was what we expected, rather boring (our son fell asleep), but still, I think you have to see this to check it out yourself. I would recommend it.
Good play. It costs 100000 dong per person and it lasts 40 minutes. It's OK and good plan for a rainy days. It curious seeing water puppets with live music and live singing.

Unique show worth an hour of your time. Many people suggested we go to this theater while in Hanoi. It was inexpensive and only an hour so we figured why not check it out. We bought tickets at the counter and attended the next performance. I believe it was less than an hour long. There is live music and the puppet performance is very unique. We found it odd and entertaining. We're glad we took the time to experience it while in Hanoi.

Beautiful show with a tradition. We went to enjoy a traditional musical puppet show and couldn't be happier about it. You can tell you are watching a real heritage show. Traditional music is played live and the water Puppets are Gorgeous, irrespective of your knowledge of Vietnamese (mine is non-existent).Prepare to enjoy an unmissable experiencie.
Very interesting. I have not yet seem something like that! Very simple, but charmant! Kids will love it! And adult too!! Should buy the tickets in the morning, it may get full!

A must see. If you've never seen it and you are in Vietnam you should definetly go. Trough the whole show we were amazed. We kept asking ourselves how do they do it and because of that we knew the show was even better.

Surprising Fun. We had been told it was a bit ordinary, but we really enjoyed seeing how people were entertained before radio and Telly. The puppets are wonderfully lacquered and really nice to see them in the water, as they were designed originally to play in the rice paddies.

Amazing show. I was sceptic about the water puppet show. I expected to be bored but I was wrong.Even if I was tired I liked the show very much. I was surprised by the mastery and ability they used to move puppets. The players and singers were amazing to. Don't miss the show.

Great fun. I did this a few months ago, and upon reflection, I found this one if the most enjoyable outings in Vietnam- not just Hanou.The performance is led by music played on traditional instruments which are intrinsic to the performance. During the performance there is a myriad of stories that help illustrate Vietnam's values and beliefs. I went to at least one other water puppet show in Vietnsm, and met a maker of the wooden puppets who helped explain their significance to both old and new Vietnam. The show in Hanoi is not to be missed. Lovely stories; amazing dexterity from the puppeteers and the puppets- well, they were characters full of life and colour. Go.
Entertaining and authentic . We watched the show last night. It was a crowd pleaser for every one in our group of 4 adults, 1 teenager and 2 young children.

Classic.. The water puppet show describes different phases of the Vietnamese history. It's interesting that it's all packed into such a 15 minute show, but it actually does. The show is interesting and while 2 women keep singing different songs while another team composing, and after each segment the women would stop singing and describe in Vietnamese and in English what this segment represents in their history. Give it a try, it's a must to see it if you're in Hanoi, you might like it. Note that the theatre is actually located inside a park with surroundings of old local houses that you can see as well.
Engaging traditional show. Worth seeing if you are interested in seeing a genuine water puppet show. The show was very well carried out and lasted less than hour.

Lovely . One of the highlights of my short stay in Hanoi!
I recommend it to everyone that visits Hanoi - amazing!

Quaint, fun but could be a bit shorter. The water puppet show is something unique for sure. The theatre is quite well kept, air conditioned and the seats are numbered and very comfortable. There is a small restaurant at the ground floor, if you want to grab something to eat quickly before the show begins. There are restrooms as well. The show is very well put together. There are some very talented artistes who are part of the show. As this is something that tourists are not used to seeing everywhere they get quite excited. It might be better if they restricted clicking photographs, because half the time people are getting up and clicking pictures, or the flash from a dozen cameras spoil the lighting effect of the show. It is quite interesting, and it is amazing how the artistes have tried to explore various approaches, story lines, plot-twists and characters to make it engaging. Kudos to the team. But I do think the show can be shortened a little bit.

Very well done. This was very well done but I didn't know what was going on! The theatre is small, the tickets cheap - we went in the morning and had no trouble getting tickets for that evening. The seats were a little tight and seeing that I was struggling with this the usher moved us to seats at the very back with extra leg room, this was very kind.
Totally Unique and Enjoyable. This is a must! Very entertaining one hour show that will captivate and amuse you. The ingenuity and skill of the puppeteers is astounding. Very clever!!!

Be amazed and continue a tradition. This troupe of puppetteers is following a centuries long tradition that started in the rice paddies. The puppets perform in the water where they were first used to entertain workers in the field. The puppets are artfully presented in engaging interactions described in the playbill. Live music on traditional instruments accompanies the puppets and is itself top notch. It is a must see event. Get tickets early as shows are sold out.

Very funny show. The show is very nice. When we where there, they had a really funny show. It was easy to follow and to understand without speaking the language. Impressive and authentic Show. You have to go there when you are in the City.

Great cultural experience, surprisingly entertaining. It is listed as one of the main attractions, and it is worth it.Definitely for all ages, young and young at heart.I do not want to give too much away, so you will have to discover it for yourselves.Tip: book as early as possible to get a front row seat !

Worthwhile if you are looking for tradicional culture. The theatre hás been preserve and it is an old small theatre.The música is traditional style and performed livebon the stage.The stories are about people s life in the remote villagesThe puppets are very well manoeuvered in a hidden way. And you will even ser dragons dancing

Nice. It is very interesting music and beautiful art. We saw the daylights show as the 5pm and afterward shows were booked out. Being informed it is the same show and it's indoor one so it did not much matter. There were few customers only so the theatre was small but still felt comfortable.

Wonderful show. This is the perhaps the best way to dive into local culture and folklore. 45 minutes for 100000 dong. You know how good a performance is by how much it is discussed later. A show that is worth seeing for all ages. Even if it's all in Vietnamese, my 5 years boy was very enthusiastic about it. Which made my children keep talking about the show it had brought us a great chance ever to start the trip.

Ancient times experience (do not expect state of the art special effect though). Perfect nice experience, amazing act. Tou get into something like 900years ago and you experience the state of the art special effects of that time.Everything was authentic, music, songs, text, acts, puppets and actors. I still am wondering how they can move such puppets so quick in the water with arms moving and other specialities, but it is amazing.Of course, if you are a spoiled fan of Transformers in 3D, this isn't for you at all. Enjoy !

Quirky but fun . Though clearly a tourist venue, the show was entertaining and worth a visit. This is a centuries old traditional art form, but it seemed modernized for contemporary audiences to mixed effect. The music was great and the performers clearly talented. Inexpensive and only 50 minutes long- just right.

Fun to watch!. I expected a storyline, but actually it's just short sketches.These were fun to watch though and fantastic music sets a really great atmosphere!Around 1h showtime, 100000 dong entry, well worth it!

Definitely worth a trip. We were skeptical about going here at first but we were very pleasantly surprised, this is definitely worth a trip. The puppets themselves are amazing and it's a great way to spend an hour and see a bit of Vietnamese culture. Music was also good .
You'll have fun. You'll have fun with the locals though you don't speak Vietnamese. It is a very interesting theater puppet performance in a pool.
Overrated. Advice is to buy tickets 2+ days before you want to go. Is well choreographed and a lively band. But wouldn't recommend unless you had run out of stuff to do
Great show . Attended a session with the family includng three children. The show was entertaining, enough to keep our 5 year old watching for the entire hour
So loose..... At first, You may think it was very interesting but easily you can feel boring. A person who seat next to me was slept..

I tried really had to find something positive. Okay I know this is a traditional show and I should appreciate that. But even the musicians on the stage looked bored. There is no air conditioning. The show goes for 20 minutes too long and they need a sign to introduce each scene so you have some idea what is going on. Yes it is cheap so you can't really feel ripped off, but don't expect to be amazed.
Water puppet show . Nice show the kids liked it cool cultural live music but the only part we didn't like that only the beginning of it was translated to english.

A must see, but keep your expectations low.. I was told I must see a water puppet show when in Vietnam and Hanoi is the original - it is a unique, cultural experience but as it is all spoken/sung in Vietnamese I found it very difficult to stay interested. I would recommend, but keep your expectations low. And bring a fan as there is no air con and the ceiling fans are pretty mild.
Mrs Donna. Really needed air conditioning!! Show a little drawn out.Nearly fell asleep.Doormen extremely rude when taking tickets. If they only realised that they need us tourists!!

Night View . Walking along the river, people can find some interesting places including some French style architectures, and the Water Puppet Theatre is one of them. In a summer night, hanging out here with friends after drinking some coffee is also relaxing.
Don't rush there. Interesting to see, but after 10 minutes you're praying for the end, as it becomes very monotonous and the music defining.

Amazing. Okay, I’ll just come right out and say it. These little buggers are the creepiest thing I’ve seen in a long time. That being said, this was also one of the coolest productions I’ve ever seen in my life. The theatre itself seems a bit spartan and looks like it’s seen better days, but oddly, I found it added to the ambience. The show consists of live traditional music and stylized puppets “performing” on the surface of a pond of water that is the stage. The puppeteers stand waist-deep in the water behind a bamboo curtain and manipulate the puppets using underwater apparati. Unique to northern Vietnam, effect is amazing and not to be missed.
Puppets!. Must try activity in Hanoi. When I first heard the band played their traditional music, I was kind of transported to another time. Very entertaining!

Pleasant Surprise. I had no idea what to expect. We were told this is a must see. It was not that great, but it was a novelty. You know how good a performance is by how much it is discussed later. We have never discussed this since our trip. It was nice to see and a decent production. But, if you visit Hanoi and miss the show, no big deal. It is obviously for tourists.

Something unique and worth seeing. Water puppetry is a really special art and this theatre troupe have created a lovely series of vignettes to show off Vietnamese culture. It's really nice to see a traditional art form being preserved so well. From rice farming to fishing to dancing and sea monsters, each vignette is accompanied by traditional music, lighting and special effects. The puppets are beautiful creations, and we really enjoyed trying to figure out how they could synchronize arm movements and other movements. The show is about 50 minutes long, which is a good amount of time. There are several performances, but if you can book your tickets early you will have a better chance for a seat close to the stage. At 100,000 dong, it's a good value.The theatre is located at one end of Hoan Kiem Lake, so easy to navigate to and there are lots of coffee shops nearby for a pre or post show refreshment.

Brilliant show, loved it! . I completely underestimated how great this show would be! It is magical! The music, the puppets, the movement and the humour. I loved it all and if anything wanted it to go on longer. Really pleased we squeezed it into our busy schedule and would definitely see it again. Don't worry that the speech is in Vietnamese, it does not ruin the show and you can still understand some of the storyline. Great value for money. Just a warning, you are charged for taking in cameras. We had a large camera and although didn't take any photos with it we had to pay $1 to take it in. I know it isn't much, but if you take photos on your phone then you don't have to pay.

Nice bit of culture!. Water puppets show was a nice bit of culture to add into our trip. The live Vietnamese band and singers were excellent - and the water puppets story and choreography was interesting! Worth a visit as the show is not too long and very reasonably priced!

Fun and interesting show. Watched an afternoon show, 50 minutes. We and our young kids enjoyed the show. They performed 14 three minute songs with different characters with a 6 piece orchestra and 3 singers. Wooden characters in the water included fire spitting dragons Phoenix water buffalo fox clown and farmers. Enjoyable seeing the characters dancing in the water performing short sketches. AC in the theatre was OK, it was a little warm but IK for the kids. Theatre takes about 450 audience and do 6 or 7 shows s day. Best to book at least 24 hours in advance to get the showtime you want and the seats you want. Just turn up a day or two before and book. Do not just turn up and hope for s seat because you probably won't get one unless you are single and don't mind sitting on the end of the row at the back.

Great fun don't miss this show . The music and the performance is great fun for all ages. The scenes are often very funny and easy to follow even thou they are not in english. The stories centre around traditional life on the farms and the tales associated with the lake. 45 minutes for 100000 dong. Great value.

Must see. This show is all about tradition. The water puppet show is an old tradition that you can still experience today. It shows you short stories about history with beautiful music and singing (live!).
intetesting. it is something interesting that we have not seen before. The music is great and it is fun. However after a while it might get a little boring. It is an experience though.

Worth watching . We asked our hotel to get the tickets for us. The theater was not difficult to find. We walked there from our hotel in the old quarter. The show was very interesting and funny. I couldn't stop laughing. Although we didn't understand Vietnamese, we were able to get an idea what's going on. The show was about 45mins. It's not boring and with this price, is worth watching. The seats were comfortable. We enjoyed the performance very much.
Lovely!. Beautiful music played live by skilled musicians and great puppetry. Loved the flying dragons! Really fun for all the family.

Very clever and unique. Just listening to the music was incredible, the talent being demonstrated that night was amazingWe had seats on the fifth row...we took water, although many electric fans, we still made fans from anything in our bag.The puppets were very cleverly manipulated. It was enjoyable, easy to follow the story despite the language barrier.not expensive, allow 45 mins.Felt privileged ...would we go again...no...done it...and happy to say we enjoyed it

A must to visit this is the best!. There are many water puppet theaters in Vietnam this is number one . A great experience and fantastic live traditional music to accompany the stories. A comfortable cinema seat theater ,have to pay extra for you to take photos during show . Forgive the staff attitudes and faces this is a government owned enterprise ,just not changed with the times as private industry has in embracing the tourist. Do not let that put you off it is a memorable event!
The kids didn't appreciate the show, but we enjoyed it. The older went to sleep and the younger moved restlessly in her chair. We liked the exposure to the music and the tails

Amazing artistry - beautiful craft. It was an awesome experience to see Vietnam lore come to life. The vocal artists provided the storyline to the lifelike puppetry done by the deft underwater swimmers. Fabulous craft...

Done it probably never again. Maybe just not for us. It was quite cool but after about 15-20 minutes would have to say we would have been happy if the show ended there.
It's quite cheap to see so can't say we wasted money, but unless you are bored we have found many more better things to do in Hanoi.
Interesting activity. This was an interesting activity albeit hard to really understand if you don't grasp the language. It kept all four kids entertained but not sure I would seek it out again.
