Nice, if you have too much time. Show took 50 minutes. Completely in Vietnamese, but self explanatory. AC in theatre works well. We had an extra day at Hanoi so we had to fill the day. Ticket fee us 100000 VND per Person.

Fantastic!. Really didn't know what to expect from the water puppet show but it really was brilliant. The show only lasts about 45 minutes and is packed with little acts. Amazing how they do the show and move the puppets in the water definitely very clever! Cheap too only 100000d. A must do if you are in Hanoi and doesn't take much time. There are about 5 performances a day 7 days a week.
It was ok. The puppets were nice to see, also the music was good (Vietnamese) but it was a pitty the storyteller was talking in Vietnamese. As a foreigner you didn't understand a thing...

Nice alternative. Went there with my wife and it was a nice experience, especially as a change to busy Hanoi. The puppet show is a Vietnamese tradition and all "dialogues" are in Vietnamese, which obviously made it difficult to follow. Even though you don't really understand what the heck is going on, it is somehow entertaining. Best thing about it probably the band that plays traditional music.It's a 1 hour show and costs about 100th vnd (about 5$)To sum up, if you are tired of eating street food, seeing temples and walking around the old quarter, this theater could be a nice alternative.

Must See!!. My son and I loved this show. We also bought quite a few puppet souvenirs as gifts and the prices were the best around. I would say my only complaint is that the staff is not very polite. When in Hanoi, as a tourist, everywhere else I went the Vietnamese people were incredibly gracious and polite. So, I was a little taken aback at their rude behavior. I visited their twice regarding tickets and times and both times the attitude was lacking. However, the show is worth it.

Amazing . If you should never go to Hanoi without seeing the water puppet show. It is amazing. This show would cost way more in the state's. If you are in Hanoi buy your tickets after you check in to your hotel as the tickets sell out fast.

Definitely a must-do in Hanoi!. Like nothing I've ever seen before! Beautiful Vietnamese music alongside a fantastic display of puppets on water. Would highly recommend to anyone and everyone visiting Hanoi.

done . it is one of the main atractions of Hanoi. Original theatre. Clearly a lot of work behind. The introduction was nice... traditional music, ambient and the first 2-3 parts (14 in total). After that, we were looking for... the exit. We didn t left just because we valued their efforts. Still, few couples left in the middle of the show. Kids around seems to enjoy it. Done
Really worth seeing. Very skilled actors and musicians. A good presentation folder, to enable following the stories. Professional and value for money.

Vietnams history and mythology explained through puppets. The water puppets make use of a pool of water, musicians, singers, fire breathing, water spraying and puppets to tell various Vietnamese folk tales. This will give you some insight and understanding of Vietnam. A country with a long history.
Don't miss. This show is a mustsee. 40 minutes gives a good impression of life in Vietnam, performed by live artists in this old art-form. It is in Vietnamese, but you'll get the hang of it.

Peculiar! . We didn't know what to expect, but as a Vietnamese tradition, we thought that we better check out the water puppet show. Roughly an hour long, it was a little slow to start but soon showed an array of puppets and tried to add in comedy too. Not my cup of tea, however, I think it is something everyone should see.Tip: No need to get there too early, your ticket has a seat number!

Entertaining hour for kids and adults. This was my second time seeing the water puppets, and for the price and short show time, I'd happily go again. I enjoy the music while my kids enjoyed most of the water puppets, especially the firework dragons.
Hay nhưng vé quá đắt. Everything good only ticket price not good , and good location , if i come back Hanoi , i will not come back here again

Has to be seen but.... I guess a visit to Vietnam would not be complete without a visit to the traditional water puppet show. The musicians and singers perform well and watching the little wooden puppets is interesting. The whole experience gives you a feel for vietnamese entertainment but I did come away thinking I wasn't quite sure what I had just seen.

Water puppets by the lake. . I thought the show was delightful. Traditional tales, beautifully coloured and decorated puppets which were skilfully handled. A little girl sitting next to me was often squealing with delight. It certainly put a smile on my face. The theatre was close to the lake and had nice eateries close by for dinner or a snack. It was value for money @ 100,000 dong. About 45 minutes long, which was just right.

Very Enchanting. Convenient location and tickets bought 1 hour before show. Very cultural, creative and skilfully performed. The orchestra were also great to watch. Very enjoyable. All in Vietnamese of course.
Great show. Wasn't sure what to expect but a very enjoyable hour. Tickets can be bought on the day, we booked for a late afternoon show an hour before the performance.
Local talent. Nice Theater and good performance by local artists the location of this theater also very comfortable to reach and they provide free wifi for visitors
Watter puppets. Interesting show, it's only 45 minutes so you don't get bored. There's also traditional music played live.

Entertaining. Very artistic and need alot of skill to control the puppets in the water with all the creative movements. The singers, vocals and musicians were synchronised with the puppet's movement too. During the 50 minutes show they performed 11 short stories. It cost only 100,000Dong which is less than usd5 per adult. Must see if you visit Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh

Must see performance. A splendid performance by a team of skilled puppeteers accompanied by a live orchestra with ancient Musical Instruments accompanying male and female vocalists. The sizeable puppets really come to life and both children and adults are enthralled by the performance which lasts about one hour. Don't miss seing this delightful show !
Waterpuppet show. Need to book the tickets 2-3 hours before as there is a long queue just before show.very nice show and the orchestra is just amazing...a must to see

Surreal!. A great experience and a must for travellers wanting to see something different. The show cost £4 per person and was well worth it. All in Vietnamese but the children definitely understood what was going on!

Its nice, but its in Vietnamese. In general, the artistic see of this performance is amazing. But! It is all in Vietnamese so we didn't understand anything. The puppets were nice, and throughout the show you think-how are they doing this? It is an hour long, we paid 100,000 dong per ticket. It is nice but don't expect to understand anything

A unique theatrical moment that places you into the heart of the Vietnamese culture. If you only have an evening in Hanoi, this is a must see. There are so many wonderful parts; the traditional classical music, the voices so very different to our ears, the balletic puppets dancing and prancing in the water composing a series of short vignettes taken from the country's farming and fishing traditions. Whatever you age, see this performance with the eyes of a child; discover and enjoy.

Not a Scooby what's going on, but a great cultural experience!. It's lots of fun, lovely music by some skilled live musicians and a great cultural experience. You're somewhat lost to whats going on, but nonetheless it's great to enjoy!

Unique, Entertaining, Cheap ,Funny.. The show runs 5x a day at 15h00, 16h10, 17h20, 18h30, 20h00, although i wouldn't suggest booking tickets last minute as they almost always fully booked. Prices are about $5. The stage has a traditional building with fabric covering the puppeteers. There is a rectangular pool of water which is about waist deep and an orchestra at the side. The narrator only speaks in Vietnamese, but you can pretty much get the jist of most of the acts by watching the puppets. The show is about 50 minutes long and there are about 18 short performances. it includes numerous traditional characters from daily life and beliefs, using sparkers, fire and smoke. I was able to use my camera to take pictures, but there are some occasions where you might need to pay for pictures or videos.
Value for money . An enthusiastic display despite the fact they must repeat it numerous times every day. If you have 40 minutes available, definitely take in this show

Disappointed. Interesting experience, but highly overrated. The performance is not tailored towards English speaking crowd and the theatre was not air-conditioned.A waste of time, when there is so much more you could be experiencing in Hanoi.

Go see. Visited on the first night of holiday. Purchased ticket from venue an hour or so before show. Water puppetry is a longstanding part of Vietnamese culture / tradition so definitely worth seeing. The show's not in English but there is a little leaflet you can pick up on way into auditorium which gives a vague explanation of what you’re seeing. Still, there’s no doubt that the puppet masters are highly skilled. Accompanied by singing and music. A nice overall experience. Lasted approx 45 minutes which I felt was enough time to enjoy the puppets and the scene changes without getting bored at not understanding what they’re saying. Tickets were $3 and something cents. A few shows a day but buy ticket beforehand if you can as it was very busy. Cafe at the venue which I didn’t try but seemed very popular.

Great night. Book your tickets the day before you go so you can get a front row ticket , amazing show slightly ruined by idiots with mobile phones recording should be banned and also parents and adults can't keep quiet poor manners in society today if you can't control your children then please don't ruin it for others , otherwise 5 stars , p.s easy to see why children don't use there own imagination these days as parents don't let them

A puppet show. It is kind of different puppet show we have in our country. Players must do it in the water. They are very talented and skillful moving around the puppets. Nice experience to see this show.

It's K. Interesting concept,nice music and show but not as fascinating as thought. The musicians feel bored sometimes,playing the same show over and over. Should be seen , but don't have to high expectations.
Must see when in Hanoi.. We were booked in as part of our trip to Hanoi. Pays to book ahead as it was full. Enjoyed our visit here.

Great show, once in a lifetime experience.. It was worth going to see the show, and found it unique. A bit difficult to understand at times but rather entertaining. Worth booking tickets in advance, as big tour group arrive having bought tickets before. Very colourful and insight of Vietnamese culture.

Really interesting and worth going to. It's was an amazing show. In all the times I've been to Hanoi I never saw it before and it was well worth the time and effort. Great traditional music and easily followed storyline.

The kids loved it. Been to the show with My 4 years and My 1 year old
They were hipnotised to it,
So was i,
Butyfull show acompenied with live music,
And for the price that it costs i thinking no one travling to hanoi shuld miss it
Well worth a look . Kind of understood what was happening....but unlike anything seen before! Didn't need to book for 4 pm show. Got fairly hot inside

Something Unique!. Good to listen Vietnamese traditional music and watch the puppets in the water. Throughout the show how they manage! What bothered was audience kept taking photos with flash or video taping. It would be good that the theater doesn't allow phones and camera.
Anyway, still it is a signature show that you don't miss in Hanoi.

Puppet Show On The Water Surface. This is the first Puppet Show I ever watched and it is done on water..I would said well done ..For those who has kids, this would be the place that will captivate your kids and the theatre is fully air conditioning..This show runs everyday..I went there during Sunday and right after the night show at around 8pm, I went for the weekend bazaar which is very near by...This night market is only opens during Sunday night and only closes around 11pm..I could not imagine before how hot Hanoi will be during summer time but now I do..I could not believe it when I am sweating profusely even during night time..So for those who comes from cold countries, I think a singlet and short pant will be the best attire..

An insight into Vietnamese culture. It was an interesting experience. The only negative is that the room is so hot, with no air con or fans with a lot of people inside. The show is all in Vietnamese so wasn't able to understand what was being said but was still able to watch the show. They were very talented.

Very Good Traditional Show. One of the reasons we came to Hanoi was to see the Water Puppet show that we'd heard about. I'm pleased to say it was very entertaining and very well done. The show is only about 45 minutes long with several shows a day and even though we were in Row Q we enjoyed it. It looked very popular. The 45 minutes was divided up into 14 'acts' between 2 and 5 minutes so moved along at a good pace. Music and singing is live all throughout. Our 3 and 5 year olds had a great time and were not bored due to the quick change of puppets and seamless change from one act to the next one. Excellent.

A glimpse of the Vietnamese traditions. Very entertaining and charming. Traditional legends and scenes of daily life are portrayed in various plays for about an hour. AC theater makes it a nice cool break when you've been walking the whole day in the stifling hot streets of Hanoï

Not for foreigner.... This tradition is beautiful but of course its in Vietnamese and i can get close to this!My friend got sleep well here and wake for just a surprise scene. Luckily this activity is not too high price.The signature of Hanoi, but its okay if you just pass by.

One of the most random experiences of my life - not sure how I feel about it . We went as part of our tour - and it is so random.Floating puppets and local / traditional music combine for a 1 hours show.Lots of colour / noise but at times we were so confused we got the giggles - we weren't alone.Our suggestion is to go in with and open mind and you may enjoy it - just not sure how we feel about it after the event

The Water Puppet Show Was a Little Creepy. While I appreciated the artistry of the puppeteers being able to maneuver these nicely-created puppets through the water, it wasn't really something I'd want to do again. I didn't understand any of the songs or what was going on during the play. Afterward, when our guide told us the story that the water puppet show had acted out, it was nothing like what I thought was going on during the performance.
Interesting show. A show that is worth seeing for all ages. A creative way to do a puppet show, never seen it before. Such a fun experience...

It's ok. I think a person should see a Water Puppet show at least once when in Vietnam. I think this is a great place for kids. For myself it was beautifully done and visually pleasing. But a bit too long for me, and hot inside the theatre!

Never seen anything like it - worth a visit! . I was surprised to read negative reviews of this show, as I thoroughly enjoyed it. Yes, it's in vietnamese so it's hard to understand exactly what's going on but we felt that is part of the charm. Spent the whole show trying to figure out how they were able to operate the puppets so seamlessly. I think it's definitely worth a visit if you want to see something unique on your travels in Hanoi.

Entertainment like I've never seen . Never been to a water puppet show so was unsure what to expect but went away very glad I went. The musicans were excellent and the show entertaining without being to long, approx 1 hour. I recommend you book as it was very popular when we were theand we couldn't get into our preferred time. Inside was cooler than outside but not cold.A nust see in my view
Interesting. The show was entertaining and very traditional. Good to watch at least once to know a little about the history. Beware of people's head blocking you though. Try to get the front seats!

Funny. I went there with my friends on our last night out. You have to get a ticket a few days in advance, it was fully booked. I thought it was really funny how they 'played' with their puppets. They did it in a cute way but nevertheless we didn't understand anything because everything was in vietnamese. We got the story anyway and it was nice to hear some vietnamese music

Most corrupt manager ever!!. This place is absolutely ridiculous. The manager was extremely rude to a group of 9 prepaid ticket holders and would not let us in without a bribe of 4 ADDITIONAL tickets. The corruption and absolute incompetence was staggering. We ended up going later and had a sour time because of how poorly we were treated - they actually closed the ticket office literally in our faces and drove away when we did not pay the bribe. I feel a bitter taste in my mouth knowing these corrupt managers even get to make a living off of innocent tourists who don't know what they're getting into, and probably robbing their employees by pocketing the money. Seriously. DON'T GO!!!

Water puppet show - bit disappointed . I found this a bit disappointing - I suppose if you had children they may like. Show is an hour so I felt bit long. Still it is part of their culture so maybe worth a visit.

Don't waste your money!. If you understand Vietnamese, then maybe you will enjoy this show. Without English subtitles, it was very hard to understand what was going on. About 20 people left during the show that I was at.

Overrated :-(. I went here with a group of children. It was a good experience to see something that is so culturally significant to the Vietnamese however it is difficult in parts to follow due to it being in Vietnamese only. It would be an activity to save for a rainy day.

Unique. This show is only about 50 minutes – if it was any more, I wouldn't recommend. However, it was interesting to see how they work the puppets. Also the music was very good. It's an interesting insight into Vietnamese culture and history
It was ok and hard to understand as is to be expected. As stated one more for the locals than for english speaking toursits. Locals seemed to enjoy it though..

I WOULD GIVE THIS ZERO STARS IF I COULD. I bought nine tickets and lost them. When I went back to the ticket office, the woman who sold me the tickets said that she remembered me and was nice enough to call the restaurant that we went to but they could not find it. Later, she talked to the manager and asked if we could go in without the tickets. The manager said that we would have to buy at least six other tickets for our group of nine in order to get in EVEN THOUGH the previous woman said that she remembered us buying the tickets. We even remembered the places that she sat us in. Of course, I realized that we were at fault for losing the tickets, but that was only about an hour prior, and I do not see how it makes sense for the manager to not let us in if her employee told her that it was indeed us who bought the nine tickets. We pleaded to the manager to let us in, since there were nine empty seats for us and it would not benefit them to turn us away (this was about 15 minutes into the show). She told us that there was more than 20 empty seats and that she would not let us in regardless. She asked if we were students and I said yes. She then said that as students, we must understand that tickets are needed. If you get want to get on an airplane and lose your ticket, you will not be allowed to get on an airplane. First of all, this is such a ridiculous statement. Second of all, I understand her needing of a ticket for people in general. But we were a group of nine students who already paid 900,000 dong to a woman who backed us up. Even with our pleading, she would not let us in. I found this to be infuriating. It was obvious that the manager only wanted more money for something that we already paid for, which was ridiculous. I even spoke to her in Vietnamese, so it's not like there was a language barrier between us. After our group became so frustrated with listening to her unreasonable no's, we walked out of the theatre. The doors were open and she stood there, laughing at us. The lady who sold us tickets in the beginning was super kind. The manager was trash.

The manager of this puppet theatre is incredibly insulting. Would not recommend.. Earlier today, I went with a friend to buy 9 tickets for this show. The saleslady was wonderful and we went to dinner.An hour and a half later, after dinner, I realised I had lost the tickets. After calling the restaurant and going back to make sure that I hadn't left them there, my friend and I went with 7 other people to the puppet theatre to see if they could do anything.The manager there was incredibly insulting, rude and conniving. Despite the saleslady being perfectly willing to let us in, and remembering that she had not only sold us the tickets but chosen our seating for us, the manager refused to let us in without buying a minimum of six more tickets. Corruption? Where was the money going to go?Although I own that it was my fault that I had lost the tickets, I can't get over how rude the manager was to demand that we either buy a minimum of six more tickets, or leave. The saleslady remembered us clearly and was telling her to let us in, knowing that we had bought the tickets, and yet the manager still wanted to squeeze more money out of us. As university students, this trip was supposed to be a fun, cultural experience. Instead, we became extremely frustrated with the terrible customer service by the night manager. None of us felt that it was right to pay for tickets that us, the manager and the saleslady knew that we had already rightfully paid for and what was worse was that the manager had the gall to laugh at us as we left. As students, we also didn't have the means to pay again.This was the most frustrating service experience I have ever had. I am extremely disappointed that I was not able to go visit the theatre, even having paid for the experience, and I do not believe that the manager should be dealing with tourists. Yes, it was my fault that I lost the tickets. But with everyone involved knowing that I had paid for them, and exactly which seats were ours, the way the manager behaved was unforgivable and she was coarse, abusive and just downright mean.

Magical!. The musical performance was beautiful & the puppetry fascinating! There were even fire breathing dragons and a brief scene showing the story of General Le Loi and the golden turtle. This is a must-see in Hanoi. Only downside - be prepared for lots of mobile phone camera flashes...

Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre. We had read some of the reviews on this show which were not so good and very glad we made a choice to go.Certainly our experience was extremely good.There were fans in the building all throughout the show. The seats were comfortable.Everyone had a good view.You get seat numbers.The price was 100,000vnd per person. The music was wonderful and the puppetry was amazing. The only downside was the constant use of people recording and photographing the show with all the light from their devices

Worth to see. This is something interesting that one should do in Hanoi (actually if u have isn't much things to do) very local and traditional show perform by the eminent artists. Oh ya did I forget to mention I do like their humour too in the show ! Lovin it !

Cultural treat. Never heard of the water puppets until jumping on TA. It is a must do. Very unique and a great introduction to Vietnamese culture.45 minutes is plenty of time though as it can get hot in the theater also not a lot of leg room for taller chaps.
Show with historical background. Keeping traditions of the local cultural, it is show short but interesting.Music, song and humor. Ideal both for adults and children.

Nice! But very long! . Nice and must visit if in Hanoi! They put up a good show and put in a lot of effort. Would have given it more stars but felt that after 30 mins, it got a bit long. They should have kept it to around 30-35 minutes to really capture the attention of the audience.

Kids loved it!!. We visited with kids aged 9 and 11 and they loved it. It lasts for 45 minutes and runs through about 15 little stories, the music is unusual. Would say it's a definite watch if you are in Hanoi...

Amazing insight in Vietnamese culture . You might doubt whether to go here or not when hearing "waterpuppets" but you will definitely not regret going! The puppets are beautiful (dragons, fish, people, unicorns, a fenix, you name it) and the orchestra performed very well. The show is entirely in Vietnamese but thanks to the performance of the puppeteers most of the show will be understandable for everyone. Plus it's not expensive at all and takes a little less than an hour, so why not just go for it? ;)

Good experience - shame about staff.... Upon buying our tickets, I found the ticket clerk very rude. I said hello in Vietnamese and she continued to show her friend pictures on her phone. My OH and I waited and she only served me when I turned to walk away. I continued to be very pleasant and I asked for two tickets for the 16:10 showing (we were buying about 2:30 so already had a bit of a wait). All she said was "No!" and pointed to the time of the next showing. I asked again if there were tickets for the earlier showing and she just kept saying no. I then said ok thanks any way and walked away. Then, she bangs on the counter, tells us to come back and gives us the two tickets for the earlier showing!! No explanation given and I was feeling a bit scunnered (excuse my Scots) at this point and we weren't really looking forward to performance.However, the performance, although solely in Vietnamese, was gorgeous and the band were extremely talented too. I would say that they could improve this show further by offering an English synopsis of what each performance is about (there are 14 in total) instead of just a title. There's a fair bit of dialogue/singing that you can't follow. Would recommend checking it out of you're in Hanoi - just beware of rude staff.

Worth the 45 mins if you have it. We were travelling as a group of 16 with 10 children ranging from 7-14yrs and the show kept everybody's attention across all age groups.The theatre itself is a great experience to be in and the seating was comfortable.45 min was about the perfect length for the kids and the show itself captivated everyone's attention with the talking point afterwards all about how much control the artists had.The puppets themselves were fantastic as were the musicians and a good night was had by all

great.. Interesting experiment. when witnessing a unique art form .before my wife and I came here . I 've known this art on television. this is the first time I was watching live . it's hard to describe . feeling very excited .

Loved it. . This was great, we weren't expecting much but we loved it. It was nice to see some cultural art and music. We did the cyclo tour with puppet show but we didn't need to really, it's best just to see the puppet show on its own. A lot cheaper. Just book in advance by a day or two.
Puppet show is a must see. You can't come to Hanoi and miss this. The show was just the right length. The music and puppetry were vert enjoyable and a must see.
Great experience. This is a lovely thing to watch! Musicians are playing live on traditional instruments. They show little stories and episodes, which are easy to understand. Takes about 50 minutes.
very nice music. if you go to hanoi you should go to thang long water puppet. the music is amazing. i came here 2 times. its very close bc family homestay.
Problem with Language . This puppet show must be very great if they perform it in English. The show goes with Vietnam language which I dont understand and make me sleepy along the show.
Surprisingly funny. We went because everyone said it was great even though I don't like puppets. OMG I might have missed this fabulous, funny, entertaining, charming and wonderful show. Go!!

Have to watch at least once. To be fair, the show is really well choreographed and nice costumes and puppets. The voices and story line is really good. However it is all in Vietnamese. Unless there is a translator or you know Vietnamese, there is really no chance of knowing what the show is about. You just see puppets on water and singing. Many were into their dreamland after a while. Might be good if you can try watching on youtube first.

Completely unique, very enjoyable . Would really recommend a visit, without giving too much away; great music and amazing choreography. Leaves a lot to the imagination which I think is the true beauty of it! Never seen anything like it before, really enjoyed it (not too long either)
Go there :-). Must see if you visit Vietnam. 1 hour of vietnamese culture for 5€. A bit touristic but that's ok and we wouldn't want to miss it.

Fun show. The water puppet show is almost exclusively in Vietnamese. The performance is authentic and the singing is nice. Several Vietnamese tales are told and sung. Furthermore, the tickets are cheap!

Meh. It's technically quite impressive how they figured out this little niche in puppet theater, and visually it's a real blast to see. But the lack of subtitles or any kind of program explaining the plot leave the experience feeling like a Lynchian dream... Fun, but maybe a little surreal for some tastes :-)

Superb!. This is the perhaps the best way to dive into local culture and folklore. It costs all of five dollars and it will create lasting memories. This troupe has toured the world and their expertise really shows.

It's all in Vietnamese!. This was recommended in the lonely planet book as an insider tip, what they didn't mention is that it's all in Vietnamese, so unless you already know anything about the local legends, it might be hard to follow! The local spectators seem to have a habit of talking through the whole thing, which didn't help! Quite impressive puppetry, even though I thought the puppeteers were under water the whole time, apparently they are just standing behind the screen..... Not sure I'd go again!
Different!. Impressive performers, and certainly unique -- but does go on a bit -- lets put it this way; a lot of people overcome by jet lag during performance...

Entertaining. Don't to be missed the water puppet show,because the traditional vietnamese folk was great! With profesional vietnamese musician. Funny altough i don't know what they said. You must see the water puppet show and walk around hoan kiem lake then

You have to do it but don't expect to be dazzled . Ok so this is a must do and this place does the longest show blah blah.
Doing this when you're a bit jet lagged may make you feel like you have lost your mind.
Good fun, pretty warm. Bizarre story. Good show. Very cheap. Thankfully didn't last the full hour.

Average Attraction. It was an interesting concept but I found it quite boring. I think this attraction would be more interesting if there was engagement with the audience. The medium of language was of course Vietnamese and those of us who do not speak the language would be left to wonder what the scene is about or what the story is about. I think that they should have an interpretation in English first before the different scenes so that the audience is able to appreciate the show.

A must see with children. Our 5 and 8 years old had they eyes wild opened during the show. Even if it's all in Vietnamese, my 5 years boy was very enthusiastic about it. For 45 mins, the live vietnamese music, singing and small stories with people and animals are there to keep you entertained. A must see with children!
Excellent entertainment. Not to be missed. Entertaining for all ages. You can go to the ticket window and book your ticket in advance for a later show.

Good evening activity . A cheap and entertaining way to spend an evening in Hanoi. Everything was in Vietnamese but it was easy enough to follow along. Now that I've seen it once I wouldn't be rushing back to watch it again but it was entertaining enough.

Children love it. We like the show alot for its' beautiful music, the traditional customs and lives. Which made our children keep talking about the show it had brought us a great chance ever to start the trip

Interesting hour; excellent musicians. Water puppets are an unusual concept and the one hour show is worth the time and modest ticket price. There is no plot, just a series of sketches by a large variety of "puppets": dragons, Phoenix, soldiers, fisherman, children swimming, women dancing. The musicians play live, classical Vietnamese instruments, visible to the audience, while the puppeteers work behind a screen and emerge only at the end of the show.

Entertaining but hot!. Admission cost was 100,000 VND per adult (roughly $5 USD). Show lasted 45 minutes and they start every hour on the 10. The show is entirely in Vietnamese so we didn't understand anything. The puppets were very entertaining. The theatre was packed almost full and there were only a few fans on the sides so it was quite hot.

Surprisingly good. I was skeptical about a water puppet show to be honest. We went because thought it was nice for the kids. And it was nice indeed. I enjoyed it too. It wasn't too long. It didn't drag. Things moved pretty quickly. All in all very entertaining. And the kids were very happy.

Inexpensive tickets to a TOTAL IMMERSION of traditional Vietnamese folk performance. I understand from local guides that water puppetry is a folk performing art of rice farmers dating back at least 1,000 years. The peasants used to entertain one another and the community during the raining/flooding season with this puppetry and music. It is a celebration of rice harvest. The water is the stage. The puppeteers are waist deep in water, hidden behind a screen. Each puppet weighs up to 30 lbs. and is controlled by sticks and strings from above (making it marionette to be precise). The puppeteers can make puppets perform amazing feats, such as turning, flipping, fighting, or even fire-breathing. The puppet characters include, men, women, kids, water buffaloes (popular with rice farmers), turtles (popular in Vietnamese folk legend), dragons (signifying royalty). "Chu Teo" is their equivalence of our Late Night comedian - the main story telling jester. He provides political and social satirical commentary, especially on officials' corruption. The musicians, numbering around 8-10, sit on the side. Instrumentation includes wooden bell, bamboo flutes, drums, cymbals, and gongs. There is vocal accompaniment as well and sung in a very typical Vietnamese nasal sound. It is a form of Vietnamese opera from the north. Singers sing songs that tell the story and interact with the puppets. Unless you do some reading up beforehand or hear it from a guide, I can see why most non-Vietnamese speakers have no clue as to what is happening - not that different from going to a western opera without knowing any Italian or French. I can see many things the performance company can do to better connect and educate non-Vietnamese speaking audience. Maybe a short intro at the beginning, printing more background information in the program, or even translation projection (supertitle). But then the cost will go up.

Goes on a bit. The show takes an hour, and whilst I'm pleased to have seen it I was looking around after 30minutes and switched off from the repetitive water puppets and the singing.
Very cleaver and worth a visit but you wouldn't want to see it twice.

Worth a visit. There are two (related) locations where one can see the well known water puppet shows so make sure you go to the right place. We went to the new building, which looked like an old theatre. The show was interesting and sometimes even amazing. However, as there is no explanation during the show, it would have been nice if we had received the a written explanation beforehand and not afterwards.

Really cute show. Well worth the visit for a cheap and short cultural experience. Simple but clever with a small group of musicians and cultural singers and some unique puppetry. Anyone who thinks the performance should be translated in to 15 different languages so everyone can understand it is culturally void and missing the point of attending a unique experience like this. Those sort of people should stay at home in Sydney or London or wherever and watch a movie on the sofa. Don't bother travelling. I recommend this experience very much.

Old Vietnam culture to the fore. I was so pleased to finally have a chance to see the Water Puppet show when I was in Hanoi for business - this is a dying art in Vietnam and needs to be encouraged to ensure it survives. I cannot speak Vietnamese but I found this of no consequence and thoroughly enjoyed the artistry, music and puppets - plus it was wonderful at the end of the show to see the puppeteers wading through the water to be applauded. Its only an hour and well worth the visit.

Worth A Visit-Fun Novelty. We chose to visit this as a small pause in our otherwise hectic day. It's central location meant that it was easy to get to. Bought our tickets on the day without trouble although it was very busy. The water puppet theatre was a great novelty and the live music and singing was mesmerizing. There was an intro in english for the benefit of the many tourists and intermittent narrative, although to be honest it was pretty easy to follow what was happening in each of the short sketches without much explanation. The theater had strong air conditioning so you may want to bring a long sleeve t-shirt. All in all, for us it was fun, short touristy activity just before dinner and we walked away very pleased with the experience.

Boring.... It is traditional and it is really great how they've made it.. but everything is in vietnamese (okay I know, I am in Vietnam) but if you don't understand what they are saying and singing it is really boring after 10 minutes.. The show last for 40 minutes.. Still glad that I've seen it, but there are better things to see Hanoi.

Worth a visit but set your sights low!. It was a lot of fun, it was cute and silly, the music showed great talent but it is incomprehensible. You have to pick up the brochure which tells you what is happening otherwise you will be lost!

is it exotic? yes . is it a must? hmm... I've never seen a water puppet theater before so thats why i tried. as i've heard before, the traditional live music was definitely worth it but after 10mins i got bored just as the group of people sitting around me. I think it is not worth the ticket price but maybe if youre a family tourists with kids then i'd say maybe yes.

Loved every minute of it!. Whilst in Hanoi I felt this was something I should do rather than something I wanted to do but I'm really glad I did! It's not everyone's cup of tea - some children were enthralled, others bored, some adults (like me) loving every minute of it and others, quite literally, asleep. They have about 4 shows a day, lasting about 45 minutes with the last show at 8pm. We went at 6.30pm and it was very busy but we still bought our ticket 20 minutes before the show. It costs VND100,000. It's definitely worth trying to get a seat nearer to the front, especially if you have kids, as the puppets are quite small. The music was enchanting and the puppets just fantastic. The stories are easy enough to follow and, in places, really funny. Definitely worth doing if you are in Hanoi!

Quality and enjoyable performance. We all enjoyed the water puppet show- it was high quality, with traditional music, and although it was in Vietnamese we understood the simple scenarios and appreciated the Humor. My kids aged 7 & 9 really loved it.

Fantastic and must watch. A beautiful performance carried out by locals. the show is in vietnamese and they try and depict their old history, culture and daily life routine.. A good show for family, kids

Hanoi cultural experience. Try to book as early as possible( numerous days in advance), to have the best chance of getting a front row seat. If you don't that's not the end of the world as seating is similar to a picture theatre.Suitable for all ages and priced about right.Has a live cultural band and narration of the show is in Vietnamese (but does not really distract from the show).I have been once and was glad that I did, but most likely will not go again.Been there done that.

Fabulous experience for young and not so young!. I would have been hesitant about going here for myself - maybe if there was a wet afternoon or evening however as I was travelling with my 3 and a half year old daughter it was a must.... She was mesmerised by the puppets, the musicians and the performance in general. We have a fabulous photo of her with the eyes popping out of her head how these characters are moving so quickly across the water in front of her.I did enjoy it - it felt like a slice of culture but in each to digest pieces.We had seats near the front and towards the middle - I would go for these rather than further back as despite the potential of a few splashes the experience of being so close makes the performance more impressive.

Interesting but sleep inducing. I'll start by saying I am glad we went to the show. There is a history to the puppet shows and it is a pretty strange performance to witness. The show has around 15 acts but after you have seen two they become a bit redundant. It is not very exciting and the music and dark room lulls one to sleep. In fact 3 of the 4 of us drifted off at some point and so did many others around us. It is definitely something you could pass on and not feel too bad about it.They perform every couple hours throughout the day.

Amazing puppetry performed here . Although we were several rows back, which did obscure the very front of the stage, we were amazed at the skill of the puppet artists. The musicians performing at the side of the stage were excellent and added an extra element to the feel of the performance, which really did justice to the whole experience.

A nice extra next door!. To be clear, I haven't been to the water puppet but I want to post this review for all the coming people who are going to visit the water puppet in the future.Today, I have chosen to do the Hanoi free tour with a local student. And during that tour, he brought us to a café for locals but from now on, it will also be visited by some tourists with this review, I hope.First, the place is located only 100m from de water puppet show.It's on Dinh Tien Hoang at the number 13.If you plan doesn't show the street, when you are facing the water puppet building, make a left and follow the road which goes along the lake. That's the Dinh Tien Hoang street.At the number 13, you'll see a shop selling bags. The café is on the first floor.You go through a corridor, than, you go up by some stairs.At the first floor, it's pretty weird. And after a hall, you reach a little café with mainly (if not only) locals.And what's the specialty of the place?The best egg coffee in Hanoi.Besides, for the price of 15.000 vnd (0,60€).In other places, it's the triple said my guide for a lower quality.Before tasting, I said to him that drinking egg coffee in a weird combination. It's just like combining chocolate and mustard.I like eggs and coffee but I was reluctant to take them at the same time...But I had already read that some tourists already had tried and were rather satisfied, so, I gave it a try.What was my impression?It was suprisingly very good. I gave it a 9 out of 10.Actually, it first looked like capuccino.When I took some with your spoon, it was pretty thik and more solid than liquid.And when I tasted it, I had the impression that I was eating a dessert!I have to tell that the whole egg had been wipped and that I couldn't tell that an egg was inside.There was some sugar which gave a sweet taste to the 'thing'. Actually, if they had reduced the quantity of sugar, I even would have given a 10 out of 10 for this experience.Indeed, the place was not especially nice but is local which is also very important to my eyes.You don't go there for the atmosphere but for a new experience.Glasses of water are for free. That would be a good idea to have one with your egg coffee in case you find the egg coffee a little too sweet.If you are open, just like me to discoveries, you can order a glass of white a liquid looking like milk. The guide couldn't translate in English what it was but after tasting his, we have ordered another for us.I'm wandering if it's not made out of potatoes.

Unique Cultural Experience Found Only in Hanoi. Be amazed by these water puppets that are unique to Hanoi. A live band comprising of folk singers and traditional instruments accompanies this intriguing performance that can only be found in Hanoi.Worth a visit even if you can't understand what is happening.
Tuyệt vời. Amazing palce for travelers. If you guys can understand, you will find it's really interested and funny!

Bored within 20minutes. We are 2 adults and 2 kids -7 and 8 English speaking. The whole show is in Vietnamese and well we understood nothing. So when miss 7 went mum I'm bored I have no idea what's going on then son went now much longer I knew it was a bad idea. They got bored and could not get out. Then agitation. Omg annoyed then whinging and whinging. People where recording and the light was distracting from the show. It was OK as an adult but at the end I think I joined the kids. No idea what was happening and some same but different. 45-55 mins. Would not recommend or do it again, sadly.
Wasn't a highlight . Went with friends while in Hanoi during the day. Probably worth seeing, and was an ok experience but don't go in with high expectations.

Entertaining. Although we did not understand a word, it was very entertaining, with 14 small plays. Take the brochure on the way in, then you will at least know the titles of the plays.It only cost 100,000 VND (5 USD), takes about an hour. The seats are numbered, so no reason to show up early - you should however show up a bit early to buy the tickets, otherwise they might be sold out (we experienced sold out about 15-20 mins before the show starts, but just bought for the next show).

Nice... The water puppet show was a different kind of an experience. The musicians were very talented and portrayed the village life in Vietnam. The show was brilliant.The only drawback was that it was in the Vietnamese language. Wish they had given a small brief in the English language too. Would recommend it to be seen.

Amazing. Being a little unsure what to expect I was amazed. The puppets are really cool, the show is great and the music/instruments are fantastic. A must do, and really reasonable prices. Don't bother paying for camera usage, because it being pitch black in the audience.
Fun and cultural. This was the most touristy thing we did while in Hanoi. The opening song was great and our kids enjoyed the action of the puppets, especially the dragons.

DO Not waste ur money coming here!!!. We went to see the water puppet show recomended by our local guide. The show was about 35 min and it was so terrible that my family and i slept there. I wish we have not gone there to waste our time. There is really nothing special about the show... No great technology and the music was mediocre. I believe the puppet dance can be done by children... There is nothing special in it...Dont ever watch the show.
Really enjoyed this unique show. The whole family really enjoyed the puppet show and it was unique, funny and as a bonus was quite inexpensive. A must see.
Unique . I went on an extremely hot night as a distraction, well worth it to hear some live traditional music and culture. Only 100,000 which is only €4. Pretty good deal

Good to see for 15 min. The show was a unique concept I had seen. Puppets in water. Presentation and technique wise it was very good. Especially the fire throwing dragons. But the show loses out on translation. I understand there cannot be a live translation in a puppet show, but they can at least give some background in English before and after the show. So the uniqueness of the show was all we could enjoy there.

More of an obligation.... Apparently on the must see list, but I am not so sure. Music is interesting, and seeing puppets perform in water may be enough to justify the effort. However, it is impossible to get anything other than a vague sense of what is going on and I was pleased to see the curtain come down indicating the end..

Different and Entertaining.. When my husband and I travel, we always try to have something unique and cultural. Definitely this water puppet show fell into that category in Hanoi. The performance was great and most of all my 2 young daughters enjoyed the show a lot. After the show, we bought the water puppet dolls for our souvenirs.

Water Puppet Theatre. We went to the old quarter so I'm not sure if this is the same ie Thang Long. It was quaint but it was really hot inside the theatre. The show was ok for value but wouldn't go again

Great . It was such a great experience and I highly recommend this as something you have to do. It was so interesting and much blowing. The only negative was the obvious fact that you can't understand the words as it's all in Vietnamese. But the play is so good that you can tell what's going on without words.

Excited. Near the Hoan kiem lake so easy to find it.
1 hour 1 show and start at 13h00 every day.
The puppet whose strings are pulled by other

Interesting and colourful. Clever puppetry, behind a bamboo screen. There are actually 4 women and 6 men who come out at the end to accept the applause.
A unique experience but 40 mins is long enough of the high pitched Asian music and fully in Vietnamese.
Water and dolls.... Yes. We believe you sould pay a visit to this theater. Not too long and very entertaining...the live music scene is top value and you can tell those artists love to perform...
Very impolite crowd . People talked loudly through the whole performance. People say you shouldn't miss this, and I did enjoy a few scenes, but I wouldn't have minded passing this one by.

Worth a visit!. This is by no means the best activity we did in Hanoi, but it is definitely worth seeing. The traditional Vietnamese music alone is really interesting if you enjoy music. As for the water puppets themselves, we had never seen anything like them before! There is obvious skill required by the puppeteers.The show is not in English, but you do not need to understand the language to follow the story - it is a visual experience. There isn't really much talking - it is more dancing/movement. There were dramatic moments and in the comedy sections I found myself laughing along at the puppets.It doesn't take much time away from your day (about 45 mins) and it is cheap (about AU $6). I was really pleased we decided to go.

Strange but great. The water puppet show isn't the best thing I've ever seen but I definitely enjoyed it and I am very glad I went. I feel like it's a must-see when you're in Hanoi as I feel it shows a lot about their culture. It is a good performance and good fun.

Nice cultural experience . I have never seen a performance like this- water puppets and live music. It's definitely different from American theater, but I appreciated the show. Nothing was in English and yet I found it entertaining. The show lasted 1 hour and cost 100.000 vd (less that $5). It was a great bargain!
Pass. One for the kids or the neurotically artistic. Not my cup of tea..... Too much splashing around, no idea what was being said in Vietnamese and the music is an acquired taste
Nice and cultural. It was a new experience and the music was fantastic. The wooden dolls in the water were funny. I couldn't understand what they said or sang but it didn't matter.
Water puppets. Graat performers, though it was not really my type of thing. Was very long for someone who wasnt too interested. Half our group(the older ones) really enjoyed it.

Good cultural experience. My wife and I recently attended an 8:00pm show. The entire show is about 50 minutes in length. Note that this is an ancient tradition and not cutting edge. Despite that it is certainly worth your time.The puppets move and dance to the live music and singing that accompanies the performance. The musicians can be seen to the left of the stage. While all of the songs and speaking is in Vietnamese you can pick up a program on the way in which will let you know the origin and what each act is depicting. Certainly worth and hour and a few US dollars for this attraction. Tip: tickets are only sold the day before and the day of the show. Have your hotel secure the tickets for you to save a trip to the theater to purchase them yourself.

A unique one I've never seen. Whilst doing research on Vietnam and its places, Water puppets pop out often. At first, I was quite curious. But its a show quite worth watching, just to fulfil curiosity. The show was done in Vietnamese even when the studio was filled more with tourists, so I don't quite get the conversation and all. They also feature short sequences that didn't interact with each other, so a bit boring (a fisherman is fishing....fishing...and fishing) I appreciate the music and conversation done in it more, because they are done live, not a recording. The woman that sings also plays music (several instruments throughout the show) and even takes part in the conversations. But this is something special of Vietnam
What an experience . A great show for all ages!Tickets are not that expensive but a good price for the show!Nice Vietnamese countryside music while the show kept surprising me!

Spellbound . Fascinating performance, accompanied by amazing music and singing. Our children loved it. All in Vietnamese, so we didn't understand the words, but it wouldn't have been so good if we'd had a translation.

A Vietnamese cultural experience. A 45 minute puppet show, that my kids aged 5 and 7 rated 10/10. Lots of different scenes and puppets, including one about the famous golden sword / turtle story. The singing was all in Vietnamese but we could follow it well enough based on the music and puppet actions. We enjoyed it as a kids activity and thought 45 minutes was the right amount of time.

Worth seeing . Quite a cute show with different puppets and traditional Vietnamese music.The first show starts at 4:10pm (the 3 o'clock show doesn't seem to be running at the moment) and then each hour until 9pm.Tickets are 100k dong each plus an extra 20k if you want to take photos. Doesn't matter that it's all in Vietnamese, you can still enjoy the performance.It's also a nice escape from the afternoon heat.

Fun Traditional Show. Our family of three very much enjoyed this traditional water puppet show. The show was visually and musically delightful. We recommend attending a performance if you are in Hanoi.

Interesting perspective from a non Vietnamese speaking group. Though the entire performance was in Vietnamese, I found the show interesting . The musical instruments used were fascinating Show provides a better appreciation of Vietnamese folklore

Tourist attraction. Was looking forward to the show but we could not understand a thing of what was said as it was all in vietnamese... no subtitles provided... which mean that some of the meaning of the story was lost from the start. Very nice work from the artist, puppets looks good But would not do again.Maybe better with kids (also some tourists in the room were getting wnnoyed at kids standing uo to see)Note that this place charge for you to use your camera for pictures or movies

Fun once, wouldn't go again. It was fun to watch but we wished we had gotten English subtitles beforehand as we had no clue what was going on in the story. Not sure if the staff can give you them, but it's worth an ask!
A cultural experience . Great experience, but only once for me. It was colourful, great instrumentals and vocals. Maybe a good story but hard to know if you do not speak Vietnamese.

A must see attraction when in Hanoi. We loved the water puppet show which is unique to Vietnam. Similar to the AO show in Saigon, the water puppet show enacts daily Vietnamese life in the farm as well as folklores.

Cheap and fun way to spend an hour. The main dialogue of the show is in Vietnamese but there is a short intro in English and French at the beginning. The theatre itself is small and intimate. We were fortunate to get seats in the third row. Wouldn't say its a ''must-see" but if you're looking for a cost effective and whimsical hour then this is the place for you.
All public show. Very interesting traditional show, no need to speak Vietnamese to enjoy it, I recommend choosing close seats, they start sharp at time, don't be late
Must Visit. An excellent water puppet show. Worth the ticket. You get to enjoy the live performance with traditional musical instruments as background music.

Interesting experience. First time watching water puppet show. Although the performance was conducted in Vietnamese language, it was still fun to watch. I could roughly understand what is the story line about. The singers have good voice and also the musical instruments they played were kinda cool! It looked like Chinese traditional instruments. Overall, it is worth visiting if you have plenty of time in Hanoi. Opposite this theatre is the famous lake that you could just walk around and take some cool pictures. There was a few unique cafes around that area that you could chill. I went to HN time located at the first floor. The café was quite unique and we actually spent more than 1 hour there just to chill around and watching people walking and car passing by downstairs. Opposite of the café was the lake.The entrance fee for this puppet show is VND100,000 for an adult.Hope it helps.
Great evening out. Around an hour long, the show offers a beautiful visual display. All in time with a live music and singing, definitely worth a visit!

Don't like theatre, but liked this!. I am not a person for theatre, but this was a real cool experience. I didn't know what to expect but this was awesome. Really nice music and singing throughout the whole show. Real professional muppet masters. If you have a night free in Hanoi, do this. It will not disappoint you. It is for an hour so not too long if you are the one that gets bored fast.

UNIQUE LIVE ENTERTAINMENT. The show is held in a very comfortable theatre just across the road from the lake. Real live entertainment with the puppeteers, singers, musicians and commentator. Clever production and represents great value at just $5.The show runs frequently throughout the day and evening and is suitable for all ages. Ideal entertainment for a rainy day. My wife videoed the show and her students back home loved it as much as the kids did at the actual live perforamance.Highly recommended.
Awesome performance . Really great experience. Very little English in the show but still absolutely beautiful to watch and you can kind of understand. 100% recommend going for the experience.

Fun experience for young and old. The water puppet theatre is a must see if you're in Hanoi not only for partying. For 100.000 Dong, which is about 4 euros. The show lasts just under an hour and consists of music combined with of course the puppets. They manage to make it a fun show and are quite skilled with moving the puppets.

A magical performance . It's a once in a lifetime experience. I mean that in both the positive and negative sense. The Water Puppet theatre is an ancient art form that is definitely worth seeing. It's not expensive for a major cultural attractions, therefore I would recommend it to any visitor to Hanoi. On the other side, there is very little negative to say other than, attending once is sufficient.

Cute 50 minute show. Reasonably priced, good show with live music and people in the water running puppets.With smaller children I would try and sit closer as it is hard for them to see over adults. Buy tickets at counter not thru Viator on trip advisor, they may make you repurchase tickets.

Ancient and a bit dull. We went for a show in the evening. In the beginning, it is nice to see a waterpuppet show for the first time. To hear the Vietnamese music and watch the story unfold. After 10 minutes for us the novelty had worn off already. The full show took 50 minutes. The story is quite slow and predictable. It is told in Vietnamese only. I would say go there once if you would like to see what it entails.
Meh. Not bad for the price (100k dong). Something you only need to see once. Cultural experience but it's all in Vietnamese. Very cool how they line the music up with the puppets dancing.

Very unusual performance. In reading some of the previous reviews it seemed people wanted something other than what the program was about. The accompanying music was very good and traditional as an introduction. To understand how difficult the puppeteers performance was you need to understand they are submerged under water the entire performance it appears. Needless to say that their performance was different, fascinating and wonderful !!

Wouldn't go back but worth a visit.. My boyfriend and I purchased tickets to go see the water puppet show, and are glad we went, however we both agreed once you have seen it once you probably don't need to go again. Ticket price was approximately $5 USD each and goes for 45 minutes. It is pretty spectacular to see as it is unlike anything I have seen before. Was told by my other half that the story is of the tortoise with the golden sword which he had read about earlier that day.The show is not in English but we were kept well entertained, although the same could not be said for 2 gentlemen in the row in front of me who fell asleep during the show.

MUST in Vietnam. Get some information about the reason for water puppetry and go see it, seriously! 50 minutes of authentic Vietnamese show. The first puppet might be weird for you but you'll be swept away in any moment.

fun and enjoyable show. We were taken here as part of a package tour but I highly recommend it to everyone who goes to Ha Noi. It was a captivating show which is enjoyed by people of all ages. The puppeteers and the musicians are some of the best in the world and it really showed.

Worth watching for puppets show lovers. If you have interest in puppetry then it is the place for you as water puppet shows are being performed here which is a delight to watch specially artist stand in water , which makes it unique in itself

Entertaining and beautiful. If you have 45 mins to spare or feel like spending some time off your feet, this is a good option. Visually very beautiful puppet show on water, journey into Vietnamese culture. Music's good too. Didn't understand what was going on, but that's fine, still enjoyable!

Enjoyed it. The cost for an adult is 100 000d and there are signs up saying there is extra cost to take pics and movies. I asked how much, the ticket seller said another 100 000d ...I declined. Don't pay any extra money other than the ticket. It is not policed and you can take as many movies and pics as you like. There are no staff in the theatre once the doors close.Show went for 50 minutes and all in Vietnamese so you have to work out what is going on buy the animations.The introduction is down in 2 languages, English and Vietnamese explaining why they started water puppet shows.Any more than 50min and it would be boring. There is a Vietnamese band and singers playing, singing and speaking to the puppets actions. Very good.

Visually beautiful & engaging for children& adults alike. The show includes a live music ensemble & I was surprised at the fluidity each puppet exhibited. The dragon breathing fire was beautiful & the farmer swimming to get fish made everyone smile/laugh. Showing English subtitles somewhere would have allowed us to appreciate the show more & I feel that the accompanying music could have been more lively & generally less melancholy sounding, but that is what I understand older Viet music to sound like. If i was a Vietnamese farmer, I'd probably be sad most of the time too. A definite recommend. Just remember to bring a fan or something to fan yourself with. Although it was cooler inside than out, it was still warm inside.

Magnificent Display of Culture and skill. After watching the show I am truly spellbound and still not sure how the puppeteers perform this amazing artwork. It's a wonderful work of opera, music, art, and puppeteering at its best form. The seating position unfortunately can cause some blocking of the audience's view. Language issues can cause some dilution of the appreciation. But still it's all good!

Clever. The show was quite entertaining, goes for approximately 45 minutes and is very well done. The story line was a little difficult to understand as it was all said in Vietnamese but you could get the 'gist' of it. Very reasonably priced and worth seeing.

Unique . Great cultural experience. Even though it's in Vietnamese you can still enjoy it. Make sure you book a seat about half a day before you want to go so you don't miss out. They play a number of shows per day.

Average show, no English translation. The show was not so fascinating, there was no English translation but we can make out the story from the show. The seat area was very small, no rooms for legs. However, I still recommend to visit to understand their culture.

Perfect for families with young children . To be honest. My husband and I were not as involved or as interested in the show throughout. We were a bit tired from the days activities, but it was a joy seeing how excited our newly 3 year old son was. Throughout the show he was amazed and loved every part of the theater. He would shout out for us to look even though he was supposed to be quiet. :)We had awesome seats too and we were able to show up 3 minutes before the show on a Sunday evening to buy the tickets. No preplanning. Great and unique 1 hour show. I just wish they had Booster seats for the kids because he ended up sitting on my husband's lap the majority of the show while I held my 8 month old.Definitely worth the 5 usd

So fun and unique. This was such a delightful part of our Vietnam trip! The live music was great and the show was so charming, even though we couldn't understand the story because it was in Vietnamese. This is one tourist activity that is not to be missed!

Recomendable. It was very nice. Better if You get a front row, We had the last one, but still We could see It perfectly. It is close to the hotel, a 10min walk more or less, tickets are cheap and there are different schedules.

Very enjoyable. Nice way to spend an hour in Hanoi and a bit of must see if visiting the city. The kids really enjoyed it and found it funny - it is similar to a Punch and Judy show on a bigger scale and with better music. The theatre is very hot so take a cold drink in with you and a fan to keep cool.

Fantastic Insight . Very beautiful evocation of times past - if you know a little of the backstory you'll recognise the phoenix is the symbol of Vietnam's independence on the back of the mystic turtle as you'll see in the nearby temple shrines of the lake. The rice sowing and fish hunting scenes are also utterly charming. Ignore the idiotic one star reviews.

No english translation. The show is indeed attractive, but there is no translation at all.The singers sang the song in their local language so we wouldn't understand at all what they are singing or telling.The show was about 1.5hr and after 45mins a group of people leaving the theatre. For me, the show would be better with translation or at least a booklet explaining what the stage was all about.

The show is really really nice than any thing I can imagine . Last year this was the first time I came to watch th show at Thang Long water Puppet Theater. The music, song and performance are very traditional of Viet Nam. It is very familiar with my childhood and to foreigners are very special. You should go to see when you visit Ha Noi.

Drowning in emotions. Splendour, delight, anguish, and sadness... All experienced during this mesmerizing show which had me at the edge of my seat the entire time. The show is actually really impressive, featuring a cast of puppet animals whose motions were really lifelike and beautiful. I didn't understand how they were making everything move the way they did, it was great. It's good to not always understand what's happening because then it's more impressive.It's in Vietnamese but it's mostly singing and music. There's not actually that much speech so you can follow along if you don't speak Vietnamese at all, it's mostly physical storytelling. They incorporate pyrotechnics, smoke, and water splashing and each of the stories are really cute and simple. Knowing it was in Vietnamese, I didn't think I'd stay the whole time to be honest, but I did and I was entertained throughout. It proved to be a nice after-dinner activity on a Friday night - one that would not be had anywhere else!Look, you're going to go to plenty of restaurants, see a few museums, and go to several shops on you're trip; the water puppet show will be a fun and unique experience for you that you're guaranteed to remember. 5 USD admission for 8pm show on a Friday night, air conditioned theatre with assigned seats that all have full view.
Weekend trip to Hanoi. This item we found as a last minute addition to our itinerary and feel it was well worth the visit. Enjoyed it thoroughly.

Lovely. Despite understanding nothing that was said (no English, just Vietnamese), it was a beautiful show! Buy in advance in order to get a good seat. The best ones are the ones in the rows A, B and C

Strap yourself in for the ride of your life...... From the moment the lights dimmed and the first bang of the drum, we were taken on a journey to gentler, earlier time....I don't want to give away too much, but there's bullocks, swans, fire-breathing dragons, dogs playing with balls, a pesky cat, and turtle that made me question whether I was on a different astral plane...It's a story of struggle, success, community, love, marriage, war and that turtle...It's the best $4/person I've spent in Hanoi to date. I don't know why we didn't go earlier...Pro-tip: if you're taller than 6ft then try for an aisle seat or the front row as there's limited places to tuck long legs..

Great traditional show. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Hanoi! A great, entertaining show which also contains some Vietnamese music and singing! Very enjoyable experience, don't miss it!

What a treat for the eyes... This show certainly is a praise worthy one, delighted with this kind of unique puppetry. This Vietnamese talent is enjoyable by one & all. Thanks for keeping this show on.

Fun experience . I had a great time seeing the water puppet show. The lasts about 50-60 minutes and during that time you get to see many different acts. The show itself is all in Vietnamese so you can't really understand everything that is happening, but you still get a sense of the story from the brochure that they give you. If you're ever in Hanoi I would defiantly recommend that you see this show.The tickets are 60000 dong for an adult,and the show is definitely worth it.

Amazing performance. I was told that it was a must to see the Water puppet show in Hanoi and boy it did not disappoint at all.Wonderful intimate theater and even though the performance was done in Vietnamese there was some English commentary before the show.There is a great history behind the show and I was very happy to see it and to be transported back in time.Well done and long may it run......
I loved it!. I enjoyed the music and the show so much that I went there twice! The musicians are really good and the show is funny and very interesting!

Entertaining and a must see! Authentic Vietnamese theatre! . Great theatre piece! It's a must-see if travelling through Hanoi! I found it thoroughly enjoyable to read through the act info pamphlet before-hand and then interpret each act as it happened. Lot's of fun, worth the time!
AMAZING!!!!. EXCELLENT SHOW!! Would definitely recommend to everyone and anyone, saw it highly rated on trip advisor and so happy I went to this one!!!

Utterly Unique Experience. I've been to a couple water puppet shows before, but this was the first one with live music. The show was entertaining and I particularly enjoyed the orchestra and pyrotechnics. Totally worth the price to see a show with so many unique and instruments played by skilled musicians. My only complaint is that the tops of people's heads were still obstructing part of my view despite the stadium seating. Still a great experience...pay for the good seats...I will only set you back a couple dollars.
Wow. It was ok to see but we didn't think it was that great. Part of the have to see things but nothing too great for us. Each to their own
A bit boring. We found this boring but one of them things I surpose you have to do , to say you see it wouldn't recommend this much better things to see and do.
Very entertaining . Much better than i thought it would be. Very talented puppeteers and beautiful traditional live music. A fun bit of entertainement for all to enjoy

Good fun!. I went to the theatre on a Friday night. There was a big crowd to get in and I think all the seats were sold out, so book in advance (buying a ticket earlier in the day was fine for me).The show lasts just under an hour, and features a live band, singers, and of course, water puppets! The puppets themselves are quite intricate and their choreography is cool.A series of skits was performed, each with a separate story. The show was entirely in Vietnamese, but the skits were easy enough to understand.The skits are great, but get a little repetitive towards the end. Luckily, the show finished before I got bored.I don't think this show is suitable for non-Vietnamese children under 6 years old. The combination of somewhat-creepy puppets, loud noises and music, flashing lights, sparks, and Vietnamese singing/talking seemed a bit overwhelming for some young children.Overall a fun way to spend an hour in Hanoi!
Must see!. This place is unique. The songs are all in Vietnamese but you can totally understand the story by watching the puppets. Really enjoyed the show.

Very entertaining!. I thought at first that this was an attraction only for kids but I was wrong. The puppet theater was very entertaining and the puppeteers were very skilled at what they do! Highly recommended to visit if you're in Hanoi.

No english but entertaining. Our tour guide bought our tickets ahead of time and our seats were way up in the back while those in our group that decided to get tickets just as they got to the theatre got seats down in the front where they could see everything. we all paid the same price !! - t100.000 dong !!his is the story of the old time fishing village life and it is understandable but there is no english during the play - the band members do some of the singing and of course, provide music to underline the story - they are very talented - at the end about 10 people come out, soaking wet and they have been handling the puppets. stop on the way out at the kiosk and purchase a doll or whatever - it will remind you of the play once you get home

Very skilled piece of entertainment. Really enjoyed this show. Not too long, not too expensive, right in the heart of Hanoi and something that you won't be able to see in too many other places. The puppeteers are extremely skilled in manipulating the puppets through the water. The musicians are playing beautiful music. There is no English but you can get the gist of the storyline from the music and puppet movements.Most annoying thing about the whole event was the iPad brigade in front of us holding up their iPads to film the show. Very rude and inconsiderate as it both blocked view and ruined atmosphere. Staff should do more to stop this happening for the enjoyment of all.

Unique Experience. The water puppet show is truly unique and very entertaining with great ethnic music. It was something that I had never heard about until a local friend in Hanoi invited me. Well worth a visit

Showcase of Vietnamese Ingenuity. This review is quite late. Thang Long Water Puppet Theater in Hanoi is a must see for foreign tourists. There is a modest entrance fee for a show that will last around 45-55 minutes. There is a stage where the performance is done to the tune played by musicians. Although everything is entirely in English, the spectators can still appreciate the story.

Best $4 ever spent!. Great experience! Tickets are crazy cheap for the show and the experience you get. The show itself is super fun, although not in english, but it doesn't even matter because of how great the visuals and music is! If you can, by tickets a few days ahead to get closer seats. The closer the row the better! If not, you will be trying to look through a bunch of heads to get a clear view.

A must see in Vietnam. Only in Vietnam, do you get to see the water puppet show. The songs are in Vietnamese and sung live but you can understand the story by watching the puppets. Very enjoyable. 14 stories and the show lasts about 50 minutes.

Unique. I went with my wife to the water puppet show in May 2016. It was a pleasant surprise. It is definitely a unique and funny show.
I would recommend if you are in the area and have an hour to spare. That being said, I wouldn't make a special trip just to see it.

An interesting cultural experience!. We went along not knowing quite what to expect, but having read earlier reviews.It was very hot in the theatre - maybe take a fan.There is a live orchestra and singers accompanying the puppet show - which is all sung or narrated in Vietnamese. Doesn't matter if you don't understand it - just relax and go with the flow. A fascinating performance that you're unlikely to see anywhere else! Interesting for the Vietnamese musical instruments and also the innovative puppeteering.

Amazing . They should ban cameras though, it kind of ruins the mood. I had to hit someone on the head with a rolled up bit of paper cos he was holding his iPad up right in front of me ! Really fun though and worth a visit !

Fun thing to do while in Hanoi . Visited the theater as part of a tour in June 2016. Yes this is a tourist thing to do, but it was interesting to see a traditional Vietnamese water puppet show and to experience a piece of their culture. The theater was very nice and easy to find. My only complaint is that people were allowed to film so my view was obstructed at times. I wish the theater would not allow this.

Fantastic, but stop people recording it! . I wasn't expecting to enjoy this, but it was excellent! I had no idea what was going on but the performance was lovely - you can tell the musicians and puppeteers really enjoy what they do.
