The show is quite eccentric - almost hallucinogenic, and all the better for it :-)One idea for the theatre owners - why not say at the start that people shouldn't have their phones out recording. We had to move seats as we had four people in front of us all recording on their phones - we couldn't see a thing! One stupid guy stupid in the aisle and recorded the WHOLE show! Trust me, it's much better live than watching on your screen! Don't be that berk with the camera out!

Great 45 mins of audio visual fun. The band and the puppet show and lighting seating was great. Cinema style seating. 100000 dong entry. Cheap for what you get to experience, the music and singing was beautiful. They assign you a seat number, but if you want to avoid people's heads and cameras and bright smart phone screens in front of you just walk to the back row and you get a better view and enjoy the show.We stopped at a water puppet show on the wayback from halong bay as Parton our package which is nowhere near as good. Don't miss this show.
Good Show!. We found this while walking along streets and Hoankiem Lake and wanted to take a rest for coffee here. And it's a nice show and worth a visit.
Great Performance. Classic...the language is in vietnamese ...but worth it..talking about culture of vietnam ..lot of effects with good lighting..

Take it or Leave It. So everybody says the Water Puppet Theatre is a must do. A Vietnamese past-time woven into the culture and identity of the country. A cultural must-do, an evening of art and entertainment… so they say. In our opinion it was a bizarre, super strange, surreal experience. Everything about it was just odd. The story throughout was told in Vietnamese but basically consisted of puppet farmers trying to catch puppet fish. Again. And again. And again. Sometimes there was fire. Sometimes there was comedy. It didn’t take very long for the whole performance to become extremely repetitive. The same routine, same jokes and same god-damn actions.You really could take it or leave it- there’s not much else to say. We turned up without a ticket and at 100,000 Dong it’s really inexpensive. It was raining outside and killed 40 minutes but actually I wouldn’t really recommend it. The venue was very well run and the puppeteers and musicians are clearly talented but it just wasn't our idea of entertainment at all - Sorry Vietnam! After this we went to Dominos and waited 15 minutes for a pizza- on reflection this was probably more entertaining than the show.
Interesting but little context provided. It's hard to make much sense about what's going on or why are these scenes important in Vietnamese culture just from the brochure.

Water Puppet Theatre, Hanoi. Watching water puppet show in a comfortable, modern theatre. Puppets performing short stories about the life and culture of the Vietnamese. You do not need to understand the Vietnamese Language to understand the plots. However, I would recommend reading the brochure explaining about the play, before watching this performance. Entertaining.

Adorable, colorful and entertaining show!. This is a very cute and lively puppet show. The marionettes dance on the water. You get lots of culture in a 45 minute show, and the times are perfect to fit into your schedule right before dinner.I just wish the narration was in English. It was only in Vietnamese, so we didn't always know what was going on, but it was fun anyway. And the tickets were cheap- a few dollars each.
Cultural experience. A lovely show with performance of local music and instruments and of course the water puppets. A visit here is a must!!!!

Amazing music and authentic experienxce. We went to the 6.30pm viewing this evening. It was a great performance to see the traditional water puppets and hear the wonderful songs and music. I think its a must see when visiting Hanoi. First class only $100,000 dong for a 1 hr performance. Its cute, quirky and fun. Worth the visit!

Sadly, no English Translation. The show was not bad, because you can always enjoy the music and the puppet movement. It is really a Vietnamese traditional art, so 100,000 VND entrance fee is a reasonable price. However, it is really ridiculous that there is no verbal nor written English translation for the lyrics or even the summary of the story shown. Everyone around me looks like non-Vietnamese speaking tourists, so I really recommend you to be mentally prepared that you won't be able to understand the story at all. Still, it is a good hangout in the evening after dinner, the last show starts at 8pm. Don't worry about full house, only half of the seats were filled in the show I saw.

Ok, but not amazing. The puppetry is very good, and fireworks are extremely good. However, the songs and speech is Vietnamese. If you don't understand the words, you will miss most of the story.... It is a tourist attraction, so it is not a local people's thing. It is also very expensive. I would advise buying the cheaper seats, and then moving once it starts.
Very well done but not my thing.. I was quite impressed by the puppeteers skills and the musicians but I am not keen on puppets and regret to say I went to sleep.

Brilliant!!. Personally I absolutely loved this little bit of vietnamese culture! It was quirky and fun, they sung in vietnamese but the short stories are so simple its so easy to understand! Puppets were so so clever and I really enjoyed the show! Its 100,000 DNG for a ticket and we attended the 8pm show
A great experience. If you have young children, take them to this show. It only lasts forty five minutes and they will love it. It is unique to Vietnam and is 1000 years old. Absolutely fascinating.

An Unique Art... The Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theather is located nearby Hoan Kiem Lake. This was my first time attending to a show like this, and I enjoyed, you can appreciate this traditional unique art. The only bad thing was that we couldn't understand a word, but reading the show information sheet we were able to figure out that the show were about.This is a good activity while you are exploring Hanoi
Very nice local culture. Nice place to visit for 1 hour and relax. You will see some local culture and nice local music. You will see dancing puppets in different styles. Very surprising.

Hokey but Fun at the same time!. Wasn't sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised by the music, story and talents of the performers involved. Interesting way to spend an hour immersed in music and the lively puppets!

Must see show. . This show was wonderful. Yes, it's only spoken in Vietnamese but that doesn't take away from the experience at all. The live band playing music is a highlight and I would go again just to watch them play. I enjoyed the show as it was something very different and it's done extremely well. It's very cheap (100.000 vnd each) and only goes for 50 minutes. There are many show times so make sure you get your ticket and go! :)
Superb show! . Definitely recommend it!! Amazing artists!! It's only 45 minutes show so it's just right! If you staying in the Old quarter then it's very easily accessible!

Surprising. I didn't think this would be very old at first however I was nicely surprised! The music was lovely, minus the musicians keep talking to each other during the show, and the water puppets were lovely to watch

Best part the music. We had originally not planned to go there as we were not traveling with kids. But someone recommended it and we were glad we went. The music and narration was great even though we didn't understand a word - the stories are universal. the puppets were beautiful. Go early.

Bizarre but educational . I had already seen an abbreviated Water Puppet Show on my way back from Ha Long Bay but I still enjoyed this one. The talented musicians and singers helped to bring the stories to life and indicate comic parts even when we couldn't understand the language. The show was also a great way learn a little about Vietnamese culture and about different parts of their traditional everyday life. I wouldn't call it a must see show but it's a fun start to the evening!

Jeanette . We visited the puppet show as it seemed "the thing to do." It was a nice experience but not speaking the language it was difficult to appreciate what the story was trying to convey. It would have been nice to have some literature provided that gave some guidance regarding what the puppet show was all about. If you have time and nothing else on your to do list then I would do it.

Enjoyable cultural experience. Sometimes perplexing (if not familiar with all the stories and since presented in Vietnamese). However it is overall an interesting and enjoyable experience of classical Vietnamese culture - both the puppetry and the music.

Entertaining. Lovely theatre, puppetry and musicians were excellent, The show is less than an hour and although I enjoyed it, I started looking at my watch after about a half hour. Don't let that deter you. Given Vietnamese water puppet history, I was glad we went. My husband said it was a highlight of his trip to Vietnam.

Charming entertainment. Buy tickets in advance as oftentimes shows sell out. The show includes singers and musicians in addition to the water puppets themselves. Perfect amount of time, about an hour. My only problem was with the bathroom. Not well maintained at all and no toilet paper even though the person responsible was lounging just outside smoking a cigarette so maybe go before the show at your hotel.

Interesting show. A nice insight to vietnamese music, culture, history and art. A fun show that brings out the child in you. An english translation of the musical text would have helped follow the story

A cultural must see when in Hanoi.. The Vietnamese Water Puppets have a history going back a thousand years and they are unique. Although I had seen a good version in Australia recently this performance is in a custom made theatre, the performing area (water) and puppets were much larger and the puppeteers and musicians highly skilled. The singing and music played on many traditional instruments was a beautiful accompaniment to a simple traditional story that was both symbolic and often humorous. The performance goes for about 70 minutes and the theatre is easy to find being near the Lake of the Restored Sword. It was an entertaining and worthwhile dose of local culture.

A must see! . We went to the 2000 hours showing and it was full! The show lasts an hour and it so cheap it really is a much see! The musicians and singers were brilliant and seemed to enjoy themselves! The stories were easy to follow and there was a short English guide explaining each story!

Very well presented. There are 4 shows in the evening, ours was at 6.20pm and the vast majority of the audience were western and it was about half full, may need to book early at the height of the season. It is a really a good performance and if you get a running order before hand you can follow the different scenes. If you haven't seen it before, go and see some Vietnamese culture.

Impressive - handling puppets underwater. This puppet show is close to Hoan Kiem lake in Hanoi. Even if you see the shorter, free show at the Museum of Ethnology, this is worth seeing. The people playing the music, singing and the puppeteers are very good. If you want a decent seat, you need to stop by and buy your ticket ahead of time. We bought for the next day, but even then had to sit in row K. The price is reasonable if you buy (versus a 3rd party person buying for you). If you have someone sitting in front of you who is always taking pictures or videos on their phone, then that is a problem in you seeing, especially when you have children who are trying to see. (We had that happen.) There is a live orchestra and people who sing during the performance telling the story. If you do not speak Vietnamese, you must get a paper before entering the theatre which will tell you what each performance is and a little about the show in English. The show lasts about 45-50 minutes. Young children (under 3 years or so) may not be able to enjoy the show (especially if they can't see well), but children like ours (7+) found it fascinating.
Only if you are interested in a water puppet show. the story told is in vietnamese language. it is an hour show. not too fascinating for me. abt 5usd per pax.
Must go. Exciting 50 mins show, the puppets were lively, you can expect some smoke and fire from the puppets. Lovely music and singing. Will definitely go back again if I'm back in Hanoi.

Very colorful Very beautiful. This is a completely live performance, complete with orchestra, vocalists, tells a story, visually rich. Have not seen anything quite like it before. Definitely good for children!

well worth seeing. We were lucky to be able to get tickets just minutes before the show - the ticket booth is just to the right of the entrance.The show is very sweet - the band are easily visible and the Vietnamese music was really caring - as were the puppets . We saw about 15 little mini scenes including puppets working on the fields, a phoenix and ducks - we didn't always know what was going on as the language - which only features in a small number of scenes was naturally in Vietnamese. The show lasted about 40 minutes and that was probably about right for. Glad we went to see this

Enjoyable despite not understanding a word!. This is an entertaining thing to do, it doesn't last long and even though it's all in Vietnamese it was its easy to follow the story. The puppets ate quite amazing and the puppeteers are in the water the whole time which is amazing! I think it's one of those things that you could miss if you didn't have time but if you do you'll be glad you did it.

Entertaining. Decent way to spend 45 minutes. The show was fairly entertaining, and the music interesting. Wasn't too difficult to follow what was going on. Entertaining for families and individuals alike.

Different, I suppose. We booked the 8pm show for about £3 each so it was inexpensive. The show lasts about 45 mins and is a traditional water puppet show. There is a live band / singers accompanying the puppets showing traditional folk lore stories.I'm glad I've seen it from a curiosity perspective. It was ok for the experience but I wouldn't say it is a 'must do'.

It's not the Muppets. It's Puppets!!The hotel we were staying at told us this was a top attraction so we thought we would give it a try. Not really knowing what to expect. They didn't really have a lot of details around what it was.-The theater only has 17 rows so there really isn't a bad seat. -It is a mix of music and puppets. -It starts on time!!-There is air con & fansThe negative (not the theaters fault) - The row in front of us 9 out of 13 of them recorded the entire performance and the others were on their phones which was a distraction. -The people next to us and around us talked almost the entire performance.Overall it was a fun and interesting experience for 100,000d. The Performance last about 45 minutes.PS it's not in English so you do get a taste of the local culture but might not be best for family's with young children.

Great way to spend an hour!. It was pretty neat, I have never experienced anything like that. The puppets are controlled in a pond in front of a bamboo screen and they dance around as a narrator tells a story and a small orchestra plays music to go along with it.It was a cool experience and not very expensive if you're on a budget.

Unexpectedly enjoyable - get a brochure. I would definitely recommend this because it was such an interesting, unique and strangely entertaining show! It's so cheap, yet really good quality. The musicians, singers and puppeteers were all amazing. There was about 12 different short stories throughout the hour long show. You should definitely get the leaflet/guide/brochure/whatever you want to call it in your language - they are available just before you go through the theatre doors and make the show make soooo much more sense because they give you the titles of each of the short stories. I would have had absolutely no idea what was going on without this. Book in advance and enjoy this wonderful piece of quirky Vietnamese culture.

Muchas fun!. We went for the water puppet show on our last evening in Hanoi. I was expecting it to be a cheesy and touristy show, but I was surprised by how much I enjoyed it. The live music and general quality of the show was very good. Even though, all the narration is in the local language, the story told with the puppets is very clear. I personally enjoy performance arts, so this was a very good experience for me. It's interesting how all the movement is managed so well in spite of the water. The show is just an hour long, so if you're looking for some quick, local entertainment, this is a nice change!

One of its kind!. Must visit. For 100,000 vnd per person it offers an hour worth of entertainment. More importantly I had never seen a puppet show in water. Had live commentary with music. Seats were comfortable. Usually the show is full so try booking 12 hours in advance. There are 4-5 shows everyday and the last one at 8 pm is usually in higher demand.

Surprisingly awesome . Tried this for some exposure yo Vietnamese history and culture. For about $6CDN, we saw a great traditional show with a 9 piece band playing traditional Vietnamese instruments. 10 puppeteers. Just under an hour, we were really impressed with the quality of this show. We weren't sure what to expect but so glad we went.
Surprisingly not that bad!. The title says it all. It was actually quite enjoyable, and good that it last only 45min. If you don't know what to do or it starts raining, it can be a good activity!

Ok ok. Nice experience. Saw the different instruments played by the performers. Unique.
But it's all in Vietnamese, so couldn't follow anything.
It's for about 40mins.
Worth a visit.

Unique and fun!. For 100.000 dong you can see a 1 hour performance here. The puppets are beautiful, funny, creative, interesting! The puppeteers are very skilled, coordinating the puppet movement so well from behind screens while waist high in water themselves. We wonder if the same puppeteers do all of the daily shows?? And if so, do they have skin issues from being in water so much, or maybe they have protective clothing underneath their outfits? Interesting job to say the least!The puppets sometimes had candles or sparklers and the lights were well done. The puppets am were accompanied by musicians, percussionists and vocalists who sang alongside and spoke with the characters (puppets) in the play.

Fabulous fun. We weren't sure what to expect: the YouTube videos don't convey the ambience, so we were happily surprised that the whole family were amused and entertained throughout. As my son has just said "it was fun and funny and I'm impressed how they could stay underwater for so long!" Definitely something to add to your itinerary.

Incredibly professional water puppet performance. I would love to see anybody who says this is ordinary try to do it themselves. It is incredibly skillful and the Thang Long Puppet theatre artists have been performing in many parts of the world for over a quarter of a century. It is a traditional re-enactment of rural life in Vietnam that was begun over 1,000 years ago, and features such acts as swimming contests, dragon dancing, fishing, catching frogs, as well as Le Loi returning the precious sword. The performance is introduced with a folk music composition on traditional musical instruments, and is then followed by 14 items selected from a repertoire of some 400 items of the ancient Vietnamese puppetry. The whole performance lasts 40 minutes and takes place at the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre at 57B Dinh Tien Hoang Street. Admission is 100,000 dong and there is an additional 20,000 dong fee for taking photos, although this does not seem to be strictly enforced. It is advisable to purchase tickets earlier in the day at certain times of the year, as the theatre does get very full. An absolute "must see" whilst on Hanoi.

Loved it!!. This show was a totally new experience for me, and was so entertaining- even if I didn't entirely know what was going on. You are given a brochure with some minimal descriptions, which is sufficient. Reserve your tickets early (same day is ok)- the show sells out quickly!
Fun with puppets. The orchestra and the choreography of the puppets add to the highlights. And a neat little art gallery upstairs. Enjoy the show and Walk around the lake.
Ordinary but ok for first timer. Vietnamese cultural show. Ok to see once if you hv not seen before. USD5 or so per person for abt 1 hr show.

Must do for all ages . Both times I have visited Hanoi and I have gone to see the Thang Long Water puppet show suitable for all ages 14 acts in total given you an overview of the Vietnamese past show goes for one hour very colorful and beautiful music by very talented bunch of performers its only 100000 dong we'll worth the money

Water puppet show with live music. Beautiful show with live music performance in Vietnamese. We rushed to the show immediately after reaching our Hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter and it was worth it. There are several performances during the day. It is great value as well. We booked online and paid AUD15 per person but at the ticket window it was about AUD 7

A Must-Do. This is one of those things that you simply must do when in Hanoi. The show is so atmospheric and fun and, well, charming.The singers are gorgeous and there is a surprising variety in the little tales the puppets act out. Don't miss it!

Authentic piece of local art. Fun and interesting way of get a better snapchat of vietnamese culture. It is not an only-for-children activity, it is a very original and well directed pupettey act. I highly recommend this if you come to Hanoi. It is very non-costly (100000 dangs) or 4.5 usd, and it is just 1 hour show. And there are 3 or 4 acts a day.

Traditional Cultural Theatre .. worth seeing. An hour long show that is crammed full of live music, lovely Vietnamese songs, lights, fire and plenty of splashing.. the dragon puppets breathing fire are amazing..The English programme explains the individual acts .. fortunately as no English commentary is provided. When the show finishes and the puppeteers come out you realise just how cleverly done it is.. each puppet moves rapidly , all directions etcThere are displays and items for sale afterwards too.Enjoy it for what it is.. another culture.. another clever craft, well performed...

Just watch . Tickets are pretty cheap, a perfect way to spend 45 min or so after a whole day of sightseeing. Quite interesting, although towards the end it can get a little repetitive. It's in Vietnamese but most of the audience there don't Speak it anyway so no fear on the language side
Interesting . Was a new experience.Amazing art. Excellent live band and singing. Well priced. Was sold out.Definitely go have a look.
Good show . Definitely a new experience, very well done. The dragon was my favourite part. Singing and instruments were traditional
Tourist trap - but professional:). A bit hard to understand stories but...performers are professional, show is nice especially dragons. If u r short of time do not go there. If u are not, u can try:)

Not for everyone!. We understand this was an integral part of Vietnamese culture but for us it didn't really do much unfortunately. If you have time to kill or if it's raining then maybe give it a go but otherwise if you're on a time constrained trip as we were then, without meaning any disrespect to the Vietnamese culture, I would suggest doing something else.
Interesting and different. Enjoyed the show, it was full of action and very colorful puppets, skillfully manipulated from underwater. Completely different from a marionette show

Good for experience. Personally I didn't enjoy that much however it was good for experience.The show is about the tell the Vietnamese history with puppets, dragons, fishes in the water. $5 per person for front seats or $3 for back seats.

Bizzare. Really, for 60,000 vnd can you really complain? This was one of the more bizzare shows I have ever seen! If you have time to kill and want to get off the crazy streets of the Old Quarter the water puppets is a cheap option.

Highly enjoyable experience. I'm very wary of a tourist trap, but this show was anything but. The performers were professional and entertaining. Sure it's in Vietnamese, but it wouldn't be as authentic if it was in any other language!You can still get the gist of all the scenes, and I burst out laughing at the appropriate moments despite not understanding a word. Impressive puppetry, and excellent value for money at $5. Definitely a must do (I don't often say this!) in Hanoi.

Traditional puppetry. The show is more appealing to kids, slow and not so attractive for the trendy. Can't really understand storyline as its mostly in Vuetnamese. Nice to feel the historic culture of Vietnam.

Strange, funny, great!. This was one of the things we had planned to make sure we do in Hanoi, glad we did.Totally in Vietnamese but strangely captivating and funny. After listening to some of the legends of Vietnam this puppet show recreates some of them and you begin to understand parts of the show, the rest of the time we just watched and laughed.Definitely worth visiting and it's only about 45 minutes long, Don't miss it!
Cant understand a thing. I didint enjoy the show because i cant understand a thing . The performers are submerge to the water all thru the show. For me its not worth it.

Don't Think This Is Just For Kids. Ifyou really want to feel the culture this is an excellent place to visit. The show is very professional. There is a small troupe of musicians who accompany the show. They are wonderful. Although you may not understand the words the characters (puppets) actions will tell the story. The performance is lovely and happy so you leave with a smile on your face. Try to get a seat in the front (as close to the stage as possible). Center is best. The seats are ok but not super comfy.

Amazing . We had seen a small village puppet show whilst on our tour to Ha Long bay so knew what to expect. But for the price (VND100k each) was so impressed by the quality of the show and the amazing musicianship. Bit annoying was the number of iPads and iPhones in the air during the performance , but that aside it is well worth you spending 50 mins of your time and a little money to enjoy genuine Vietnamese culture performed by the generally young puppeteers.

Waterpuppet show. 100000 dong worth it! Although its played in vietnam language but its enjoyable and cultural! You can infer abit from the scenes. It shows the day to day living of folks at the villages, portrays viet national history & legends through most of the acts too! Really interesting to watch water puppet & its not easy to do! Worth your dong! The shows have 3 timings a day in the evening, if i dont rmb wrongly!

Worth doing ....in Vietnamese . Not the greatest show you'll ever see, but unique and can't really come to Hanoi and not do the water puppets. Shows are only about 45 mins, so good to go to a show around 6pm and then go for dinner. There are two theatres/locations. One does a show in English, the other in Vietnamese. We went to the Vietnamese one. Even tho we didn't understand the words or songs, it was great to see the puppets accompanied with authentic dialogue. Excellent singing and instruments, that was the highlight for me.
Enjoyable cultural experience . I didn't expect much from this, however found it very entertaining and loved the traditional folk instruments. Kids loved it

Delightful!. The water puppets, musicians, singers and set make this a great show and really worth seeing. It was not in English but you could easily understand the stories presented through the water puppets. The choreography of the entire show was extremely well done and the puppeteers were masters of their craft. You could also tell that the musicians and singers really enjoyed what they did also as they were always genuinely smiling.My 19 year old daughter and I sat entranced as did most of the audience. Our seats were great and I think the theater seating would give you a really good view regardless of where you sat, The show definitely appeals to all age groups and we could quite easily watch performances over and over again. We loved it!

One of a kind puppet show. Live music and puppet show, one of a kind in Vietnam. A different experience. Performance last for about 45 minutes. Worth a visit. The only downside, narration is in Vietnamese. Nevertheless the performance is good enough to draw attention. Entrance fee:100,000 VND
Completely strange yet well worth it. Definitely something that should be experienced. Not dear to attend! Well organised seating and a very creative show. The live band are amazing

Great show, worth the entry price!. We got tickets included in a Halong Bat trip we booked at our hotel (Diamond Hotel) so we didn't pay for the tickets but I believe it is around 100,000VND.Great show, very interesting folk art show. Most of the hour was pretty captivating - in fact the worst part was tourists on their phones/cameras blocking the view!Well worth it, multiple show times in a day and only an hour out of your day to see some art!

Great show!. Loved the show! So interesting to see. Live musicians on the side of stage. Just the right length of time. Any longer and it would be too long ;) Worthwhile seeing this part of unique Vietnam culture

Interesting. Really enjoyed this show and even though it was totally in Vietnamese, I have to add I wasn't expecting it to be in English. The stories are easy to follow. The musicians are excellent. Very entertaining.

Must see . This is a very unusual type of puppetry as the puppets are floating on the water to tell the story. It is accompanied by soft music and lovely singing. After the show when the puppeteers come out you can't help but wonder where they were hiding. Look for it. I think I know how they do it but don't want to spoil your fun.

What a great experience. I really loved the waterpuppet theater. With a mix of traditional music, local stories and the fascinating techniques with the waterpuppets this was a great cultural experience. I got my ticket in the morning for an evening show but there were tickets left. Price is totally fine for almost an hour show.

Water Puppet Show. It was really unique in terms of the set up. The performance was theme based. Very well done and the puppets were beautifully painted. Part of the show featured their agricultural way of life. The accompanying music and the musical instruments were really awesome. It's worth a visit.

Clever, good for kids. I was impressed by the skill of the puppeteers but found the show a bit boring. Would have been better if had some understanding of what the stories were about. I think it would appeal to children although didn't see any present on the night we were there.

Interesting. Just only around 01 hours show, we are very happy and surprise about a type of cultural. The type of the theater is very typical. Water, musical, light and the puppets. Love it's and we want to recommended Thang Long water puppet theater.

Fun and entertaining stories!. Very interesting, glad I went - live music is a great touch - there were some wonderful moments during the performance. Also some very funny stories that seemed quite dramatic when played out in that format! I would definitely recommend this for light evening entertainment - the fish were my favorite part. Only an hour long which was also nice.

An ancient art well worth seeing. Water puppetry has been an art in Vietnam for hundreds of years. Enjoyed an hour show. The theatre was packed with locals and tourists. The talented musicians and singers made the show worthwhile, playing traditional instruments and signing traditional songs. Quite entertaining. The only downfall was the visitor filming the entire show on his Ipad in front of me.
Puppet mastery. This was a very interesting show with amazing music and theatrics. It is wonderful to try to interpret the stories as a non Vietnamese speaking tourist.

Too good! It's funny, full of magic and culture!. If you are in Hanoi it is a must go! We found this tip on Lonely Planet and we were expecting nothing special, but we were totally wrong! Wow what a good surprise! It is 45 minutes show and when it is done you feel sorry because want stay more.It is a colourful funny show of puppets in the water, that is involved of traditional songs and music, full of colorful lights as well. It is really worth, please check it out!

Not really our sort of thing. The best thing about the show was that it lasted for less than an hour and that the theatre was well air conditioned. It is very touristy. In its own way I guess it's quite sweet and the puppetry is very clever but in my opinion it does not make the "must do" list.

A cute show, but not likely to be the highlight of your trip. The show is about 45 minutes long. Introductions were it Vietnamese with some English translation and the rest of the show was no speech and set to music.It was a cute & entertaining show, but not something I think you absolutely must attend while in Hanoi. If you have the time, it's worth it to pay 100,000 dong (about $4.50 US) for the entertainment & air conditioning.

it's ok. is a good place to go if you travel with children, but is not ,"a must do "..definitely you can skip this show..we whent because is listed to be one of the best thing to do in Hanoi..while you waiting for the show,do not go to the restaurant/bar in the premises,is super expensive,go next door for a cup o coffee/beer and you pay 3 times less..

Disappointing. In my opinion it was not worth seeing. It was just puppets splashing in water randomly, it made no sense to me. It apparently had a story line but I didn't get it , it went for just over an hour as I recall. Not worth my time.

Brilliant experience. I've done this twice now, in about 3 years. It's such a fun night, a great show and really entertaining and informative. Good for families or singles, couples or friends. It's fun and completely different to what you'd expect. Buy tickets before hand (a couple of hours in advance) and be prepared for fun and an awesome show.

Not a great . We saw the show as part of a hectic day in ha noi and I begrudgingly suppose it was worth going to. It is very reasonably priced and quite colourful. Also interesting to see the music and the musicians who are quite entertaining. They seem to very in to the show and give it 100% - very difficult to do in a theater half full.It would be a good idea to have a program printed - even if it was to buy in additional to the tickets giving you more history and the story but otherwise just rest and experience the show.Worth going to but do not worry if you miss it.

First water puppet show. This was the first time that I seen a water puppet show, very traditional with the music and theme. Attended for $5 usd and it lasted just under 1 hour. Extremely busy area in the French quarter. There is air conditioning and the area is clean.

Absolutely wonderful. Absolutely fantastic show - a must do. Beautiful singing & music- very clever puppetry and not one dull moment. About an hour long and 100,000vnd = £3 or $5 for a front row seat
Great for all ages

A Must Do in Hanoi. Take the time to enjoy a water puppet show - it is really impressive and enjoyable. Book your seats early in the day (or even before) if you don't want to face a fully booked session, especially for evening shows
Great. . I wasn't sure what to expect but it wasn't this! Not a long show, but well worth the money. It was entertaining, funny in places and you certainly don't need to understand Vietnamese.

A great cultural experience. Water puppetry originated as entertainment in the rice paddies of Vietnam's country side. The puppeteers are behind a curtain in waist deep water and the puppets, instead of string are manipulated with long bamboo poles.The music is live with traditional Vietnamese instruments. The story plots are part of the Vietnamese folklore.The show is 45 to 50 minutes long and very entertaining.

Beautiful. When you are in hanoi you should go for the show... It is really lovely to see the puppets in the water dancing.Its a pitty that some parts are only in vietnamese but its not really a problem.Why only 4 stars? Because you have to pay seperatly for taking pictures.

Not sure. Yes it's very beautiful and you do need to visit but I can't say I really liked it. The tickets are cheap so it's a must just not my cup of tea. It's suitable for all the family as there were lots of babies but it is very loud!

Very entertaining. A very entertaining show supported by excellent musicians using traditional instruments. Add a bit of culture to your holiday! If only people would put away their cameras in the theatre. Purchase a keepsake puppet after the show at a great price. Well worth a view.

Great cultural experience . I fell in love with this show. It's all in Vietnamese (but you expect that, being that is the language spoken in this country). You could still follow the story, the music was fantastic too! It got a tiny bit tedious in the last 10 mins (45min show). But I still highly recommend!
Puppets. Worth a visit to see how much fun it is to watch the puppet antics.music quite loud but watching the musicians fascinating

A must see. A gem of a surprise in Hanoi. Not to be missed. Beautiful performance. Very entertaining. Super affordable tickets:$5pp. My husband was adamant on visiting and glad we did. Make sure to buy tickets at the theater ahead of time-seems like they tend to sell out. 50min performance.

Bit Basic. The music was great , but the puppets were very hard to follow all was in Vietnamese, which is as expected but there was no written explanation about what was happening, there were pamphlets with the titles of each act in a number of languages but no story to accompany so it was hard to follow. Still worth a look, not expensive.

Great show. I loved the water puppet show. It was all in Vietnamese language which didn't matter as the puppets told the story visually. Very clever production originating historically from rice padi farmers. The authentic music is wonderful too, especially the unique one stringed harp.

Wasted one hour of my life. . I live in Hanoi and appreciate Vietnamese culture. But this show is totally for Vietnamese people who 1. Can speak the language 2. Are familiar with the history of the country. It was very cheesy, completely in Vietnamese (not catering for tourists at all), and was a complete waste of an hour of my life. Even our kids didn't enjoy it, and that is saying a lot. Do yourself a favour and avoid going to this show.

Peculiar to Vietnam. We thought we would go and see something peculiar to Vietnam and this was a great choice. The show lasts about 50 minutes and they have a live orchestra and singers. Don't let the fact it is in Vietnamese put you off, each little story is self explanatory with the program giving you the title. All the seats are good so I wouldn't get worried about where you sit.

Below average . I have an impression that people like to think they know what was happening in the story of the water puppets but it was genuinely unstructured. The choreography was mediocre and the sound just above average. If you want traditional water puppet theatre look further afield than the '14'th best thing to do in Hanoi'.

Don't know the meaning of the show. Water puppet is a nice show, but I didn't know the story of because there were no translation at all. For public entertainment who one destination choice most of tourist, should have translation of the show
Great show worth seeing. Really interesting show, something I've not seen before. Combination of music and puppets was excellent. Would really recommend for something different to see for an hour.
Might seem cheesy; totally worth the cheese!. Traditional and well worth it, even if you think its a bit of a cheese fest! Traditional music and fun puppetry!

Interesting cultural show!. Very touristy but worth a visit. Was $100,000d. Practically entire show was in Vietnamese but the show is still entertaining enough with the music and puppetry. I would go a couple of hours earlier to buy tickets as tickets seemed sold out by show time. We didn't go with children but the kids who were there seemed to have a great time.

Water puppet show. The puppet show is interesting. It is a very old Vietnamese tradition. The show lasts about 45 minutes. It is in a air conditioned theatre. It is very clever how all the puppets are in the water. I would give it a 7 out of 10.
It's okay. It was okay, pretty simple. Culturally rich but not extremely entertaining. Some really good puppetry and probably way more complicated than it looked.
Happy in Hanoi. We loved the show. We were thrilled to see the orchestra and singers perform right beside the puppet show. Excellent, easy to follow entertainment for all ages and nationalities.

Magical. We weren't really sure what to expect from the show, but it was really magical. The show is performed with traditional Vietnamese music, although we couldn't understand anything from the songs the story, as told by the puppets, was easy to follow. There are some really lovely and magical moments in the show, well worth a visit.

Not my cup of tea. The puppets were entertaining I guess but it just really isn't my thing. All I did was stare at the puppets and notice how badly damaged they all were. The love music was probably the best part but at less than five dollars a ticket I guess you get what you pay for

Water Puppet Show. It was pretty boring as they speak in vietnamese language. The show last about an hour telling different stories. However you will be amaze on the starting part and find it boring. If you brought your camera along, they will charge you USD$1 for taking pictures.

Entertaining . One hour of entertainment which we found to be quite entertaining and humorous. Plenty of cultural references to Vietnamese history. We didn't book ahead despite being told tickets would run out - we just turned up an hour before and paid at the ticket booth and went to the next showing. It wasn't a sell out at 8pm.
Great show. The water puppet show is pretty interesting, even if it doesn't immediately seem like your thing. Very good value for money and good showcase for Viet culture!
Beautiful & fun performance!!. Lovely music on traditional instruments. Humorous puppetry and a cool break from the hot summer day. Fun for the whole family!!

Glad we went!. Wanted to see this and glad we could get tickets, well worth seeing, very clever! The theatre was nearly full so it is definitely a great tourist attraction. Tickets only 100 000 dong, very cheap!

Nice but not fantastic. It showed a little bit boring assist 50 minutes of the show... it nice but not fantastic and if you are tired you will sleep for sure :(
Go only if you have to much time to spend in the city!

Puppets on water???. One of the worst shows I have ever seen. Besides a bit of Vietnamese history nothing to be exited about. I don't understand why there is so much hype about this show. I almost fell asleep during it. Waste of time.

Worth it but just barely.. Worth a visit especially since the tickets are so cheap. Try and buy your tickets earlier in the day or the day before so you can sit closer to the front. Kind of annoying that they allow flash photography. There was a couple people with big cameras taking a bunch of photos with a huge flash. Kind of took away from the experience. Either way, kind of cool for the culture and the one string harp is awesome.

A Hanoi Must. The presentation was well presented and the music and vocals were tremendous. Good seating with no obstructions. Cameras were allowed. Use a video camera. A very unique puppet presentation done in a pool with rods that controlled the puppets. Great choreograph as well. The show was started on time and lasted about an hour.

Traditional Vietnamese Show. This traditional puppet theater combined with live music played on traditional instruments is a must see for anyone coming to Hanoi. A nice way to relax after a long day in the city while taking in some culture at the same time.

Never seen anything like it. If you have a couple of hours, go see this. It is an interesting art form and very entertaining. The theatre was full when we went in the middle of the afternoon. It was a fun way to spend some time in Hanoi.

Late afternoon Show . A quick overview of entertainments in rice growing villages. The special effects were unexpected and very creative. A very well done show. The little kid next to us was shouting in delight.

Nice show . The show was for 45 mns , it was good and lot of hard work has gone through the making . Only drawback - some explanations in English would been good since most of the crowd were westerners ...

To do in Hanoi, keep expectations low. We did the water puppet show as it seems to be one of the things to do in Hanoi, and we wanted to get the full experience.The show is in Vietnamese, so read up on it before if you want to understand the storyline, otherwise all you see are puppets in the water. Do not go in with high expectations, as it is nothing great, but worth it for the few dollars that it costs

Hanoi must see!. Absolutely fantastic show! Brilliantly choreographed and laugh out loud funny in places. Do book in advance to make sure you're in the first few rows. Also, pick up a brochure (if you don't speak Vietnamese) so you can follow what's happening scene by scene. Wonderfully unique, a must see show if you're in Hanoi!

Colorfull, different. This show is kind of unique for Vietnam form of art. Its beautifful, colorfull, with amazing music. The only problem is that its in vietnamese so i wasnt abke to understand a story plot (im not even sure there was a story plot) so at times i was really bored :).
Average show. Good experience for first time visit to Vietnam. It was in narrated in Vietnamese and we found it quite boring.

What have they done!. The first time I saw this show 20 years ago it was completely amazing, so I'm not sure if the original crew is out of town on the road, but this performance really lacked any Wow factor, even though the puppets now are far more creative introducing animal puppets to keep up the interest. Having said that I would still recommend visiting the water puppets in Hanoi, it's still a very unique show and also great for kids.

A Great Show, Must See!. Going to Thang Long Water Puppet Theater is something everyone should do on a trip to Hanoi. The show was great and the tickets were cheap. Tickets tend to sellout, so if you want to go on a weekend it is best to buy tickets ahead of time.

Must do in Hanoi!. The Thang Long water puppet show is really one of a kind. It is an excellent experience and being quite cheap, definitely a must do. The good thing is that it doesn't go on for too long either so you get the excitement of the water puppets, theatric and live music but don't get tired of it.

Feel bored after 10minutes. The show is only showing at certain timing. Tickets bought at the counter with allocated seats by the cashier. Seats in the theater is abit squeezy. The water puppet show is interesting as this is my first time watching puppet performing in water. Each performance is showing a different story. I do not know whats the story as it is narrated in viètam language. And the puppets' motion are control by the puppeteer hidding behind the screen. But after about 10 minutes, I find the show abit bored. Motions of the puppets are almost similar and predictable.Overall, at least visit once.

You have to do this. The Water Puppet Theatre was part of the city tour. We weren't sure what to expect, so weren't really that expecting much, although every guide book and tour guide recommend it. We loved it! There is a language barrier, but the puppeteers are so skilled they can explain the story through movement, and the traditional Vietnamese music supports the story. The music was very skilful (we heard some pretty bad music elsewhere - but this was lovely) and the singers gifted. Well worth going. You can see why every performance is packed.
Great cultural experience . Fantastic cultural experience lasting about 45 min . It was all on vietnamese but was a great sight . Be early the tickets sell fast . Well worth a look

OK, so this is a very touristy thing to do!. We didn't understand what was being said but that wasn't a problem as its a puppet show and very visual. Thoroughly enjoyed the show. I wish they had a program ahead to read about the history!
FANTASTIC!. What a wonderful thing to do in Hanoi!! Such a great little theatre, and wonderful to see such a magnificent display of Vietnamese culture. I was emotionally floored when i left.
Fun. It was a fun experience, not boring at all (as mentioned in some other reviews). Some nice effects and a round performance. I can totally recommend visiting the water puppet show.

Entertaining . This is a typical thing to do here in Hanoi.
Don't expect much content. It is an overview of the vietnamese traditions for agriculture, farming, hunting and others.
I recommend it if you are interested in local culture, music and things like that.

A great hour's entertainment. Unlike anything we've ever seen, the music and singing very different but interesting and the puppets are very entertaining and at times amusing even if you don't understand because it's all in Vietnamese. Very clever and kids would enjoy it especially as it's not too long. We spent the whole time trying to work out how it was done. All is revealed at the end.
Ok for a visit . Puppet show is unique as the concept is unique.OK to visit if you have time.paid 100 Vietnamese dong per ticket.quite a few shows per day
Waterpuppet Show. The show is about an hour. It is quite interesting seeing the water puppets performing in the water with Vietnamese music and songs.

Must see traditional water puppet show. We were told, "You haven't see Vietnam if you haven't seen the water puppet show". It was fascinating look at an ancient Vietnamese art including a musical introduction featuring a one string guitar like instrument. The program provided a description of each of the 14 acts in the water puppet performance so we weren't in the dark about what was going on.

Water puppet show . My partner and I just happened to walk by the theatre and saw lots of people walking in. We decided to give it a shot despite not knowing anything about it. At the end, we all walked out with a smile on our faces. We really enjoyed the show. Thumbs up!! And it only costs 100,000 VND per person

Think Twice. I fell for it....ancient Vietnamese art, once reserved for royalty....but, it was ridiculous. 45 min of ugly puppets thrashing around in a pool...charged way too much. I think had it been less money, it wouldn't have seemed like such a rip off. To make matters worse, the tourists were horrible---ipads & phones blocking the view, constant talking...it was a most unpleasant experience. Less money & shorter program would help and still give you the flavor of a local tradition.

A "Must Do" in Hanoi. This show is most likely the best water puppet performance not only in Vietnam but also worldwide. The duration of the show is 50 minutes and there are 4 to 6 performances daily but as it is well patronised, it is best to book well ahead by visiting the box office personally during the hours of 8.30 a.m. to 5.00 p.m. as performances are often sold out well ahead. Although the commentary is in Vietnamese, the repertoire which consists of 14 items is visual and thus explanation is hardly required. The performance is slick and professional with one act leading straight to the next. The puppets are colourfully dressed and often perform acrobatic movements on or under the water and sometimes in the air. Around 10 puppeteers are involved, accompanied by a small orchestra playing local instruments and 3 to 4 ladies singing or acting as narrators of the puppets voices. An imaginative production well worth seeing once. The only drawback is that a few audience members who chose to video much of the action with total disregard to other members of the audience. Entrance fee VD100,000.

A must do in Hanoi. Fantastic cultural experience, amazing water puppetry depicting Vietnamese life, with humour and beauty, accompanied by traditional live orchestra and singers. Lovely old theatre setting, near the lake with art gallery and antique puppets on display on ground floor. Try to get a seat near the front, for a closer view of the action.

An entertaining introduction to Vietnamese culture.. Adults & children alike will enjoy the short series of vignettes about Vietnam folklore with unique puppets manipulated by underwater puppeteers. Fish, serpents, and farm life are depicted and accompanied by Vietnamese singers.
The Puppet theater is just by the lake in the heart of Oldtown Hanoi. Light & entertaining.at a modest cost.

Interesting cultural show!. Didn't know what to expect but the water puppet show turned out to be entertaining and fun to watch. It is amazing, the way how they control the puppets, as well as the special effects added in!

Worth a visit . Worth a visit to see a part of Vietnamese history. Definitely read the leaflet or guide book as to what the scenes mean prior to the performance otherwise you definitely won't have a clue what's going on.

Nice show on the water.. This art show is really unique and meaningful. We learned a lot about Vietnamese culture and lifestyle as well as history through this performance. This is surely the one not to be missed in Hanoi.

Great Tourist attaction. Its different and unique compared to all those other normal puppet shows and feels like traditional Vietnamese. Would definitely prefer more english version of music however its really very beautiful and enjoyable.

Well worth going to. The shows run every hour and a half or so and you don't need to book in advance so it's ideal to check the times and arrive when you tire of wandering around the old quarter (not that you ever do really). It's worth it for the music alone which is beautiful and haunting. Very relaxing and enjoyable, it only lasts about an hour and it won't break the bank. Recommended.
Entertaining and interesting. This 45 minute show was very enjoyable for our whole family. It was fun and also a nice look at a part of Vietnamese culture.

Very traditional. We saw this on the first night of our Vietnam trip and didn't know what to expect. It was interesting to watch and hear the traditional music. I'm not sure I would see it again but worth catching it if you are in town

Lovely. We'd been told by a french woman that the water puppet show was so-so, but I am happy to report that wasn't the case. Sure, you don't go expecting an opera. But it was nicely done, with little surprises thrown in here and there, which make your go "Oh cool!"This is a must do on a visit to hanoi.

Okay. We finally went to the show in Hanoi after seeing in advertised in Saigon and Hoi An. It was okay, impressive how they control the puppets in the water.I wouldn't go out of your way to see it, but if you are in Hanoi with a spare couple of hours you may as well. Try not to sit behind a French lady with an afro who keeps moving her head...

Lost in translation. The show is just under an hour long and cost us 100,000vd. It was nice to hear some traditional music and the fire breathing dragon puppets were the most impressive. Staff at our hotel say that the show used to have English and French subtitles appearing at the sides of the stage. This would have been helpful to understand some of the scenes.

A must see but not super impressive. This is something I think everyone should see this... It is very good and well worth the few dollars that it costs. Viewing it is difficult unless you get seats in the first few rows as people hold their phones and cameras up in front so you have to peer through and around them. Very cute and easy to find.
Fantastic. My 8 year old and 11 year old kids were enthralled with this. Although it is in vietnamese language, the colour, movement, humour and beautiful music is fantastic.

Enjoyable. The tickets were quite cheap and the show very enjoyable. On the surface there doesn't seem to be too many activities/shows on offer in Hanoi at night so this is recommended. My only negative comment is that the angle of the seats as they raise towards the back of the room is quite low. So it's a bit hard to see the show the further back you are, or if someone in front has an IPAD or larger than average head.

I will watch it once, and not anymore. (Don't have to buy the tickets in advance!). It is interesting to watch the water puppet show but I don't find it super fascinating.I don't have any bad review about the show, the show did live up to what it promises, puppet performing above the water. But I do find that the show is slightly repetitive for the stories they presents, also the plots weren't very captive. I am also a bit disappointed that the show does not have any English subtitles (but that is the general setting in Vietnam, very few people speak English).There are many review saying that booking in advance is recommended but my personal experience showed that same day booking was fine. I booked my ticket 2pm in the afternoon for show at 6.30pm on Sunday. Ticket price was VND100,000 (as of Apr 2016).
Worth the visit. The show is good fun and really cheap for what it is. It only lasts 50 minutes but is great entertainment. Definitely worth a visit if you have the time.

Really worth the visit . Don't miss this unique show, it is worth seeing as it a mixture of music and puppetry , but not like you've ever seen. Book tickets as it is very busy there are many shows a day to choose from.

Fun experirnce. This is a fun cultural experience. The puppets are amazing and the accompanying music is a live band. I'd never heard of a one stringed harp before!! Be warned you should book a few days ahead to be certain of getting a seat. Also we did find that the audience manners were a bit, um, lacking - people filming most of the show on iPhones held above their heads not really bothering about how that impacted the view of those behind .... Just a personal gripe!!! The puppets make up for it!!
Okay for 20mins.... I get easily bored so after 20mins or so started to doze but defiantly worth going to if you have time in Hanoi and don't know what to do.

Don't miss this!. This was far better than expected! You don't need to speak Vietnamese as there is only one or two scenes with talking in, the puppets are impressive and the music is very traditional. It's a wonderful bit of culture for you to see!We thought it would be very strange, and its definitely different, but still really enjoyable!

poor seating. We were told we must see this water puppet show. hmmm...I am sure it might have been somewhat interesting but unless you are in the first 2 rows, or very tall, you can't more than a sliver of the stage. My kids were not impressed. So, unless you get lucky with the seats, be warned. We had noticed an outdoor water puppet show at the Ethnology Museum earlier in the day, and did not stop because we already had tickets for the evening. Wish we had - it would have been easier to see and it was exactly the same thing. Also, 45 minutes is enough.

Well worth a look. We went here with our two children. We all had a good laugh and enjoyed the experience. It's quite magical for the kids and their enjoyment is infectious. go along. Enjoy. Smile. Try to get towards the front so you have as few obstructions to your view as possible.
Good city. My friendly had recommend for water puppet theater during time visit Hanoi city. A good city for visiting 2016. Thank you

Even Better the Second Time Around!. I can't fault this show for its uniqueness and of course the quality of performance. These days there are too many mobile device screens blocking some view points like anywhere, it just seems more out of place here even compared to a rock concert.
it's just ok.. can enjoy.but it was not good as others say.should watch once?maybe yes, for memory.but not necesary.ticket booth staff was hyper rude.won't visit again.
A traditional entertainment. Ok if you like this sort of thing. Very colorful, if not tuneful. It is obviously geared totally to tourists, but that's all right: it's very well managed!

Not a must but worth a visit. I went with my 15 year old daughter and was able to get tickets for the show 15 mins before the show. Not great seats but I didn't think you needed to get up any closer. Although water puppetry is an ancient Vietnamese tradition and the very reason I went - I didn't feel it was very authentic. Most of the audience where tourists. The musicians were by far very entertaining. Easy to get to but I found the lack of a story line dissapointing
Cool, but not doing it again. It was a cool experience, you got to see a bit of Vietnamese culture. Would not do it again however. They did not speak english.

Interesting . This was an interesting cultural experience and some in our group enjoyed it more than others. Personally I thought that the skill to manoeuvre the puppets is not an easy thing to learn. Certainly it was all interesting but something you only need to see once.

It's something to do.. I went to the show based on the positive reviews on trip advisor, but found the show to be uninteresting. The movements of the puppets were similar and repetitive. The story was difficult to follow. The only dialogue was in Vietnamese. The band was actually more interesting to watch than the actual puppets. The cost of admission was inexpensive and lasted about an hour. Overall, this is something you can skip.

High quality production. This was a thoroughly entertaining show. I had only seen the puppet show in Saigon to compare with and this one was much better in terms of music and the theatre. The musicians caught our attention as much as the puppets - very entertaining and a nice intimate venue easily accessed by foot from our hotel in the old quarter.

Not a must. Although water puppetry is an ancient Vietnamese tradition, don't come here expecting an authentic local experience. The audience is almost entirely composed of tourists. The puppets are engaging, and it is a pleasant way to spend 45 minutes and a few dollars, but the stories are largely inaccessible if you don't speak Vietnamese. All in all, good fun, but not a mandatory part of your visit to Hanoi.

Surprisingly good. . Visited this with rather low expectations, but thought the grandchildren (7&9) would enjoy it. Instead it was something we all enjoyed. The music was truely lovely and the characters and stories very funny. The interior has been recently refurbished and the seats were very comfortable. It is also close to the night market so it was perfect for a browse and to sample some of the street food.
Extremely entertaining production. This heritage art form was both interesting and entertaining. The sets were well done, the stories easy to follow, the music and narratives incredible.

An experience for all ages!. We couldn't wait to attend this ancient and traditional water puppet show that dates back to the 11th century!Originally performed in rice paddies, a pagoda would have been erected as a stage to hide the puppet masters who stand in a waist deep pool. The water creates wonderful acoustics for the live orchestra and singers who are all dressed in native costumes!The puppets are made of wood and painted in lacquer, my favourite being the fire-breathing dragons! It is quite spectacular and this art form is totally unique to North Vietnam and the Red Delta River area.The stories or skits are based on folklore, handed down from generation to generation and tells tales of the rice harvest, festivals, fishing and life in general of a farming people. It would be worthwhile to learn some of the legends and tales of which they tell before you attend one of the shows, as it is difficult to understand what some of the skits are about unless you speak Vietnamese. But even if you don’t, it is an entertaining and pleasurable 35-45 minutes way to amuse yourself.I recommend you book your tickets at least one day in advance if not sooner, as the shows sell out very quickly from morning until night!Adults, children, young and old will find this a truly unique experience. The puppets are enchanting and the puppet masters are a talent unto themselves!Enjoy!
Recommend for special Vietnamese. I would recommend this place for Vietnamese special culture in Hanoi. It was nice for everything.Thank you for all in Hanoi!!!

Hilarious - great entertainment. My mum and I easily walked up to the ticket booking office around 11am to book an afternoon show on the same day. Show started on time with some singing and and an orchestra. Be aware there is only one small bit at the start in English, the rest in Vietnamese, but that doesn't matter. When the puppets started coming out we couldn't stop laughing, it's quite a funny thing to see. Major skills from the puppeteers and the fire parts are pretty amazing! We really enjoyed it and the 40 minutes went really fast. Go along for some light entertainment and something unique to Hanoi.
Worth going to see . When we went we didn't really know what to expect. It's definitely something worth going to see. It's a cheap hour activity for the family and friends

Warning ! Customers are crap to them. Beware: tourist trap.Even though the show might be good, we couldn't see more than 5 minutes :Booked placement not respected. Split from my wife with a rude word : «hey guy it's just for 50 minutes, you can make it»Organisation and concern for customers are a JOKE.They started the show as planned but they knew that 2 groups would arrive late because of traffic jams... But they kept the front rows for them so that 60 persons disturbed the rest of the customers when sitting down (slooooowly). The staff simply answered: «you wait, they paid» to the numerous complaints of customers.They added «you're higher in the audience, you can see perfectly, stop complaining» (which is not true, see picts attached)No manager that day.The employee pretended a man who didn't speak anything but Chinese was the manager... He turned out to be the driver of the bus!!!When complaining, the staff only smiled widely and waited (and nothing to do with the real embarrassed smile in Asia, I'm expatriate, and can tell the difference), emphasising they're poised of your complaints...We finally got refund after stalking the employee for a «manager», but some other customers weren't...We finally had to leave Hanoi without seeing the show :((In a nutshell, beware of this formerly traditional show which has become a mass tourist trap...You warned.

A show not to be missed while in Hanoi. What a fantastic show for all ages. I was so looking forward to going and I was not disappointed in any way. To me it was a magical mystery show. We had seats right in the middle of thr front row. Best place to be seated ( not to close at all) and dont worry you will not be asked to participate. These puppeteers are very talented and have travel abroad with their show. The cost is aroubd $5 AUD

Water puppet show. Very good attraction to do in Hanoi! great for kids and adults! we got front row seats and absolutely loved it. Such an amazing way to learn about Vietnam culture and there way of life ! Great entertainment for whole family.
Puppet review . Don't come to Hanoi without seeing puppets. Very clever, easy to understand and funny. Seating a little cramped but worth it

Not worth it. I don't think this belongs in the top things to see / do in Hanoi. It's fairly cheap, and kills an hour, so if you have kids it wouldn't be so bad. It's some singing, some instruments, and puppets splashing around in water. I did find it interesting how they control the puppets under water from behind the screens, but beyond the actual mechanics of it, the substance is rather dull. Backpackers, save your money.

Not to miss. This was a wonderful experience. Our 8 year old daughter was mesmerized for the whole show. Trying to figure out how they did it and enjoying the impressive story telling. Yes it's in Vietnamese but that really doesn't matter. Most of the stories told don't even have talking. Not knowing what they were saying did not detract from the enjoyment. Temperature wise it was not as bad as some reviews made out and I don't handle heat well! If you can get seats at the end of an aisle you will be near the fans though.

Quite bizarre, but enjoyable. I thought I'd give this a shot as I was walking past anyway and it was only 100k dong. The stage scenery and props were great and full of details, music and puppet choreography worked well most of the time.There wasn't exactly a consistent story but make sure you pick up a programme before you go into the show as it explain what each of the scenes are!

Entertaining. We went to this thinking it would be a bit ho-hum. It was awesome and very funny. The orchestra was good too, a woman playing a stringed instrument with a tall vibrato thing was fascinating. The people working the puppets are very skilled. Good value for money
Afternon visit. Not sure exactly what to expect but this was brilliant entertainment and something a bit different. Highly recommended.

Brilliant!. The show is great, lasts just under a hour. The theatre is cool and comfortable to sit in.The whole cast from musicians to puppeteers are brilliant! There's a guide at the entrance in different languages do you can follow what the different scenes are about.We bought our tickets early morning for that nights show which I recommend you do as it gets really busy.You can buy little replica puppets after the show which are so cheap at £2.5O each! Well worth the visit!

Nice and wonderful. We enjoyed the Water Puppet show which is a traditional art form in Vietnam. Although only tourists watch the show, it is worth it and quite short (50 min). The kids in the audience were having fun. The entire show is in Vietnamese.
A must see. What a fabulous show. I didn't know what to expect because there is nothing like it in UK. It's funny,colourful and truly entertaining. Would recommend to adults as well as children

Excellent. Didn't know what to expect.
I was pleasantly surprised.
Performance, musicians and singers were brilliant.
An enjoyable hour spent here.

Smiled the whole time :). Started 8pm - 100.000d - 50minWe really enjoyed the water puppets. It was a good price and a good length show.It's set inside a nice theatre and I did no research beforehand so did not know what to expect. I imagined puppets on strings and was very impressed with how the show was done, very clever. Although the show is in Vietnamese you can understand what's going go visually only missing out on a few jokes. I would recommend buying tickets the morning or day before as one show sold out and we had to go the following night. There are only two shows daily so if you have an older lonely planet ignore the times in there. If seeing other people taking photos bothers you ask for tickets near the front although you get a good view of the puppets from anywhere you will have a better view of the band from the right hand side.
Uniquely Vietnam. Must see if its the first time you visited Vietnam. Its in their language. Interesting and entertaining.

Very clever show . Great show and reasonably priced. Only let down was the theatre he's very hot making it a little uncomfortable. We booked our tickets the day before which seemed to be a good idea as they were turning some people away.

Talented musicians and puppeteers but.... ...the show just didn't do it for us. It didn't hold our interest and we both dozed off a couple of times. The tickets were very cheap, however. and the show lasts for under an hour so we are glad we decided to go along and experience our first water puppet show.

An interesting experience... Beware of flashing lights!. The water puppet show is definitely worth seeing as the ticket prices were very cheap, and you don't have to travel far as the theatre is located by the lake which is easily accessible. We were able to book tickets on the day of the show, however, if you wanted seats in the first few rows we were told we needed to book months in advance.The show lasts approx. 1 hour, and gets pretty packed. After the show started, there were still groups of tourists entering which wasn't great as it was quite distracting. The puppet show was interesting, and the live orchestra were amazing (they played some beautiful pieces). However, the experience was slightly ruined by inconsiderate tourists extending their arms vertically so that they could record the show and take pictures. The constant flashing of the cameras made me feel nauseous.I would still recommend the show despite the negatives, just something to take into consideration.
Cute. We are in our late 20s/early 30s and thought the show was good. It is a little childish but in a good way, very light hearted. Something you should do once.

Wished there was English subtitles . Interesting puppet show performed in waist deep pool. Whole show was in Vietnamese and was about local folklore. Wished there was English subtitles to translate for tourists so that we can better appreciate the stories!

enjoy the artistic masterclass. even if you don't understand the story and even if you don't like the loud shrieking music and the singing, even if you can't see the artists manipulating the puppets coming in and out of water, you have to applaud the colourful mastery movements presented in the show!These puppets are "alive" and lively, the fast movements defy any imagination, after all, there are no motors attached to them!

Too much cameras. The show is amazing. But -1 star because seriously people, please put those cameras down. Or at least be considerate of those behind you. Someone even used flash. Some others even checked the photo/videos that they took of the show WHILE THE SHOW WAS STILL ON! Try to get the seats in the front and don't abuse your camera use, you'll be fine!

Great Experience. Tickets are cheap and there are several shows a day. The folk music and puppet show were very well done and this has definitely been one of my highlights in Vietnam. Despite not understanding the Vietnamese dialogue during the show it was still understandable the stories and culture represented. Also plenty of humourous scenes.

Great Traditional Music. Loved the music, the puppets are well made and colourful. The skills of the puppeteers are fantastic. However the show is repetitive and could easily be scaled down for a shorter version. Perhaps more for the kids, but there weren't many in the audience.

the only drawback is not knowing the language. the puppet show was very entretaining with nice storyline, music and action. the only negative was not undrestanding the language. But it is still a good show to see, even with some young children.

Dont get the hype . The girls doing the music at the side wouldn't stop chatting the whole way threw and laughing which isn't very professional. The puppets were very cheap looking the story is in Vietnamese so nobody had a huge deal of what was going on.
I wouldn't rush or say it's a must do on your list if you are here.

Great fun. A very unusual art form and something we were keen to see. The music was very enjoyable and the little details in the show were a joy. Tourists joining late and leaving early were a bit of a nuisance, as we're kids unable to sit still. Grab the first or second row seats if you can to avoid them - it's very unlikely you'll be splashed !
Good music. As a musician my ear is always a searching for something to hang on to. The music here is very well rehearsed and the instrumentation truly authentic. The play was good too ;)

Loved it,. We felt obliged to do the cultural bit but enjoyed it a lot more than expected. The local musical instruments kept us fascinated. The puppets and the puppeteers were amazing, a great talent!

Wonderful experience!. Despite not understanding the language, the show was amazing! The puppeteers were very skillful and the puppets were beautifully colored and life like. Get your hotel to get you the tickets as it can get fully booked very fast. Definitely worth a visit!

An enjoyable hour of traditional culture.. This was our second day in a misty and atmospheric Hanoi. The theatre was small and full which enabled the audience to engage with the performance. The entire show was in Vietnamese (but was easy to follow) and was accompanied by traditional music and singing. We also bought some (reasonably priced) souvenir puppets, which were on sale in the entrance of the theatre.

Do not miss this . Absolutely not to be missed ! This theatre is just so interesting and historically correct although all in vietnamese you just sit enthralled for the full 45 - 50 minute show again superb and do not miss

Waterpuppet, medium great. It was nice to see, but we expected al little more. It's vert touristic, and it uit pricy for a show for les than a hour. Bring a jumper because when you sit at the back it's very very cold. Still quite impressive that the puppetplayers can do this!

Not as bad as expecting. Came here as part of a private buffalo tour. It was quite good no where near as bad as I was expecting. Have heard it's like swinging cats but I was really pleasantly surprised. The kids loved it to be honest they were on the edge of their seats wondering what would appear next. Ran for about an hour which was long enough. Was glad to have done it.

Good fun, especially for families. I was worried that my partner might find the show a bit boring but we really enjoyed it. The puppet show was cleverly done, and although only Vietnamese was spoken it wasn't difficult to follow. The theatre was full and our hotel recommended we booked tickets in advance at the ticket office but they got sold in bulk for large tours.

Worth a teip. We were unsure to go here or not. And thought for 100VND why not. It was close to our hotel so we decided to go. Must say we actually enjoyed it. Lovely to see a different culture performing arts. The music was good too.

Unexpected delight. The mixture of traditional music and songs plus a puppet show conducted in water is unbelievably good, My wife and I do not speak Vietnamese and therefore could not understand what was being said or sung during the show, but we totally enjoyed the performance. The music was excellent and the singing very easy to listen to. The actions of the puppets were hilarious at times and told several stories of the Vietnamese culture.This show is a must thing to see during a visit to Hanoi.
Absolutely brilliant!. I thought this was just for kids! I really enjoyed it and my 8 year old was mesmerised. A great night. Lovely old cinema style theatre.

Water and puppets? Really?. I had no preconceived ideas about this hour of entertainment but dang...it's just silly fun. I so love the different cultures of our world. Who'da ever thought to combine music singing puppets and water. Go see this. Quite unusual. I want to thank this troupe of artists for keeping their heritage alive and well. Well done folks.
