Thoroughly enjoyed this activity. Be sure to take your kids!!!

Interesting live traditional music. We bought our tickets for an evening show earlier in the day while strolling around Hoan Kiem Lake. We bought the VND100 tickets and was given a seat in the fourth row. Ask for the first row if you want to snap excellent photo/video.. don't let some alien's head spoil your photo like we do :(.Will not be everyone's cup of tea though, but I enjoyed the experience.This exciting performance comes with special effects such as smoke and mini-fireworks as well as live traditional music played by old folks. Honestly, I enjoyed the live music more than the puppet show lol. I highly recommend you guys to watch this show at least once because you weren't be able to see this play in other countries.

Cheap show but really well done. Second time I've visited here and it's a good show. Various shows throughout the day. Quaint puppets and even though it's mostly in Vietnamese, you still get the essence of the pieces.

Neat cultural experience. For starters, the auditorium is not well ventilated (no A/C) and the seats are not the most comfortable and are pretty crammed (I am 5'11" and it is worst than US air carriers economy seat spacing between rows) aside from the auditorium issue, the show was quite an experience. It was very neat to see skits related to rural way of life and Vietnamese folklore with some humorous twists. It was filed with unique colorful puppets along with singing and dialect between the puppets and to the orchestra. The down side of the dialects is that it was all in Vietnamese and for a foreigner, you will need to image what the story is about based on the puppets that show up. It would be nice if they had some sort of scrolling panel with some English translations so foreigners to help them understand/follow the show better, than again most places don't do this (seen it once in China, but that is about it). Also the show had some special effects (mini fireworks - more like flares). The orchestra in the show included some Asian traditional instruments and the music flowed well with the skits. Again this was a very unique cultural experience and would recommend it if you have the time.

Seriously, don't bother...... We went along as this show had good reviews and was always sold out. What were we thinking?! It's an hour of my life I won't get back.Yes it's colourful, kinda cutesy. First 5-10 mins is bearable. By 20 mins in 3/4 of the theatre were asleep !!!! Including my hubby lol. A row of 6 kids in front of me were all snoring and several people behind me it was hilarious to see. Really, really boring. Sad but true.

Tradition Kept Alive. The show is about an hour and is done using wooden puppets. The theater is very old and the seats are very uncomfortable. The fables can be understood through these puppets, I enjoyed the show and I think it is a must see for any culture loving tourist.

Mix feelings . It's always sold out..buy your ticket in advance. Just go to the theater and buy it..it's only 100, 000 VND for adult. Your hotel can help you to buy but they charge you extra to deliver to your hotel. There's a lot of shops and restaurants around the theater but overpriced. Please note that this is Hanoi traditional art and musical. Some intro are in french and English. The storyline is in Vietnamese. It's interesting ti see the show but middle of the show you will see a few people will get up to leave because they don't like he traditional music or no translation.Have an opemind and appreciate the art of the culture. It's an okay 45 min show. You pay for the experience.

Very impressive. The puppets are beautifully made but even more impressive is the choreographey. Considering how the water puppets are controlled it is hard to imagine how they manage to have so many puppets interacting at the same time. Seems to book up quickly so buy tickets in advance.

Impressive kind of art. So worth the 100k vnd. You definitely get what it is about although the speaking part is Vietnamese. Music is way better than the Vietnamese music I've heard before:D and the puppet show is just great. So nice what they integrated in the show and how they do it.

Unique Cultural Show. Attended the show as part of our Gate 1 tour. I enjoyed the experience. Very colorful. If you go it is helpful to read the program notes ahead of the show so you have a sense of what it is about.

Highly recommend this. You need to get tickets early to this as it does book out but make sure you do see it. Although it's in Vietnamese you can still understand it. The music is beautiful and there are some funny parts to the show. It's very different to anything I've seen before and my teenagers enjoyed it too

Amusing, different, fun, inexpensive... The Water Puppet Theatre is situated next to the lake and very easy to find. We were too late to see the last show of the evening so booked and paid for seats in advance for a 6.30pm show in two days time. Although we didn't ask for it we were given front row seats. The show lasted about 45 minutes and was fun, entertaining and different. It is very inexpensive and I think worth going to see. There is Vietnamese music and singing throughout the puppet show. This seemed very loud, although maybe because we were right in the front row. It didn't bother us but small children may find it too loud. I thought the whole show very cleverly done and enjoyable.

Real Vietnamese culture, but not my thing. If you want to enjoy the Vietnamese music and if you know something about their culture, this could be extremely interesting. For us, two girls, with rather little knowledge of either of those, it was fun to see, but not really special and quite hard to follow. It is, however, fascinating how they make the show.

Very Interesting. Had several different stories and puppets. The skill to manipulate the puppets is astonishing and well done. I don't think that just under £3 is expensive for a show but if you are on a very tight budget then I suppose this is not for you. It is very difficult to stay awake as the room is very warm but it is not the fault of the performers.

A great show to see with kids. Our 9 and 7 year old loved this show despite it not being in English. It only went for an hour and is performed in an indoor theater. Take a long sleeved top or jacket though as we did get cold in there.

A bit expensive but truly worth it. Beautifully curated show, one must visit when in Hanoi old quarter.
The show is in Vietnamese but the play is based on very normal day to day life and very easy to understand the whole scenario(do grab the item list before entering the theatre)
Evening shows can easily get houseful so get tickets beforehand.

Not sure what I saw. The show is impresive. BUT beside the fact that the crew was very talented and the puppets were beautiful we didn't understand whatvis going on because it was all in vietnamease. If you are a low budget traveler you might want to skip this because the 100k VND can be used for many different things in your trip
Very Different. Well worth a vist, it is unusual and very cleverly executed by the puppeteers. The shop lasts about 40-45 minutes and is highly entertaining.

Interesting traditional show in Vietnamese . It's a very interesting art. It consists of around 10 local stories/tales about the river; however, narrated in Vietnamese no English at all. In some stories we couldn't really understand what's happening or what the characters were. As a first-timer to Vietnam and Hanoi, I am happy I went, but won't go to another one again. There is a free one at the Ethnological Museum if you don't want to pay.
Just skip it. Nuff said.. Impossible to follow, stuffy venue and an utter waste of time. Three out of four were asleep within minutes. Li s of other worthwhile sites.

Uniquely Vietnamese. It is uniquely Vietnamese and well worth a visit. Go to listen to the traditional musicians and songs and watch the skillful puppeteers. At an hour long it just about held my interest. It was worth reading the programme card to understand each of the acts.
A nice experience . A nice experience in Hanoi, it is max 1 hour. The show is in Vietnamese, but there is a document that you receive with a bit of explanation on the show sequence.

Undervalued. It don't cost a much or last long. So go for it. This thing historical value is big(it was a way to tell news and what ever happend in country at those days) Now it's really old. But still you have to have a skills to control those dummies.

Very enjoyable but don't go if think it's going to be too touristy for you. We had second row seats so had an excellent view of the musicians, singers and puppets. It was the second show of the day and not as crowded as later shows.If traditional Asian style music puts you to sleep - don't go. But we thoroughly enjoyed watching one particular musician playing her traditional stringed instrument. The storyline seemed pretty basic to me.It may have been nice to have had an English translation but even listening to the young girl behind me she grasped the idea of the various scenes being portrayed as she asked her father what the cat, the crane, the turtle, the dragon etc were doing.It's about a 50 minute show and I thought the puppetry excellent. I found it thoroughly entertaining.I would highly recommend it but don't go if you hate culture, traditional music, traditional singing or puppets. Just go with the flow and enjoy something cultural of Vietnam.

Culturally interesting entertainment concept, GET SEATS in FRONT, go early & get gelato in the lobby for the show. GO early to get good seat locations.they have several shows during the day too besides at night. Concept is interesting, puppets on long sticks underwater with puppeteers behind a screen. There's not much to do in this city so it provides an activity to do. The gelato/sorbet in the theater lobby is excellent refreshment and you CAN take it inside. Try and get seats in front or its hard to see.seats are very close together and the rows too.it gets warm inside so be prepared. The show we saw had 13 short sequences, they were kind of boring but at least the puppets look neat. The music & singers are interesting to see & hear too.
Colorful but.... It's in Vietnamese so well come for the experience but I'd skip it if time is an issue.Tickets are at 100k vnd and tickets are sold starting 2:00pm

Fab little show.. Went here as part of our tour. Fab little theatre with lovely little stories shown via water puppets, funny at times. Really enjoyed the relaxing show after a hectic run around Hanoi.

Really enjoyable!. We went to an afternoon show and found the whole show very entertaining. Buy tickets earlier as the shows fill up and seats are assigned. The first show time was at 2:30pm and continued through the evening. Each show is 50 minutes long. The show has live music and narration. The instruments used were old Vietnamese-like a one string harp. The show songs are Vietnamese but the puppet actions still carry the stories. This is an old art and very unique. Worth a visit.

Nice cultural element of the trip . Well organized. Good live music. Smiling singers. The puppets were good and entertaining. Really liked the special effects and the apt music. Felt like a lovely cultural experience
Nice show. Thang Long water pappet show is the best traditional show in ha noi old quater near hoan kiem lake. Hight recomment to everybody.

Probably the best thing to do in Hanoi. The water puppet show is the most entertaining thing we have done in Hanoi. My daughter (11) loved it. My son (8) fell asleep. The puppets are amazing. The choreography superb. The music and singing excellent. We took front row seats for a premium price. Well worth paying the 100,000 Dong. Show lasts about 45 minutes and is supposed to be representative of a bygone age when television did not exist. If you do anything at all in Hanoi, make sure this is the top of the list.
Cultural experience . Worth seeing as it is a cultural experience unique to Vietnam. Lively show with live music traditional tales which are skilfully "acted" out.

Subtitles please. Watching the show should have been a nice cultural experience showcasing the Vietnamese way of life and tradition. The venue was full of eager tourists. There must have been 5 consecutive shows one after another.The only problem was it was difficult to understand the various episodes of the show. If they had a short english explanation before the start of each portion, tourists would appreciate the show better.Instead what we experienced was repetitive music and incomprehensible water puppets dancing on the water. Towards the end, the 45 minutes of loud music can get to you.We got to see a chance to see the end part of the open air water puppet show at the Vietnam Ethnology museum. This was free and might give you a better experience
Overrated. Did not really enjoy the puppet show, it seemed like a confusing grab for extra tourist dollars. Would not recommend orGo again

Second visit. We visited the water puppets in Hanoi over 10 years ago and this time the show was totally new but still incredible. Our friends were very impressed as it was their first visit and it was great to revisit through their eyes as well. The original instruments continue to amaze me and how they get some of those puppets to move the way they do is very clever. A must see in Hanoi.

a traditional activity. it is nice and refreshing to see those daily rural life scenes represented in the different scnes of the water puppet show.the Vietnames spectators are particlarly enthisaistic, and that gives an additional flair to the experience :-)

Amazing. Pre book your tickets ahead of desired time, 100.000 DSeats are numbered and are arranged in tiers.A program card is free in many languages to explain the 14 acts.The traditional music is excellent and the puppet show was very clever.

Professional and Entertaining. This is well worth the time. A small theater by some standards, but a great performance. Book early and try to get the row at the front for photos. Great actions and theatrics.

Water Puppets. Well you can't go to Vietnam and not see these at least once. The show wasn't overly long - about an hour - any longer would have been too long. What I found most interesting were the musicians and singers - not least because I couldn't name any of the instruments that they used - a sort of guitar, a sort of drum kit, a sort of cello etc, plus others that I couldn't compare to anything else. Well worth doing, but once was enough for me.

Good for catching up on lost sleep.. Slept through the entire thing. Says something about the quality. Despite supposedly having to pay to use your camera, our view was blocked by a flurry of tourists taking pictures with cameras and iPads. Nothing special if you've been anywhere else in Asia.

A must see!!!. This is now our second time seeing the water puppets. Read up a little if you can first. Don't sit in the front, you may get wet. The artist tell a wonderful story. They say you have to pay extra for you camera but many don't just don't use your flash.

Overall quite ok, I think it is a little pricy. . I visited last 2 days with my 68 yo mom. Unfortunately she felt asleep half of the show. I think it is OK with the short time for puppet show but a little pricy.

Excellent entertainment for all ages. This was far better, more clever and intricate than I was expecting and well worth the £3 ticket. This was the highlight of our day. It is brilliantly done and suitable for all ages from the youngest of kids to the oldest of adults. I recommend getting tickets early to get a seat as near the front as possible.
An entertaining hour. Even not knowing the stories behind each part of the show you can get the gist of what's going on. A worthwhile stop if time allows.

Visit puppet water theatre. Something different in this musically based show that runs for 45 minutes. I wouldn't say it was a "must see". The kids were unable to follow the story which was really just singing with puppets the depicted Vietnamese life.

A Different Experience. I never knew such a thing as water puppets existed much less that they would be enjoyable to watch. There is an honest simplicity that lets you know that this is a real Vietnamese entertainment and not something thought up for tourists. It does not matter that you do not understand the language, the actions speak louder than words.

Fun and professional. We happened to come across this theatre and were lucky enough to grab tickets to a show that had just started. The musicians were fabulous and it was great to see them playing live. The puppets were really well made, bright and the puppeteers were very skilled. A good length show of about 40 mins ( just long enough)

Refreshing and authentic. In a over-crowded bustling city which has a glowing KFC logo at the center circle, it is a breath of fresh air to know traditional art and performances exists in Hanoi.The musicians are wonderful to hear and watch, and the water puppet show is fun and something you will not see elsewhere. We really enjoyed our time and would definitely recommend checking this out.

Wonderful. This most unique Vietnamese art must be seen, as it does not exist anywhere else. After a few minutes one forgets that the puppets are being manipulated by people as they take on a life of their own and are quite charming. Seats are old and worn, but the show lasts 50 minutes and it is quite survivable.

Wonderfully artistic and fun. Stories told through live music and puppets gliding though water. There is a lot of action and numerous people behind the scenes making it work. Traditional music and songs make this a magical attraction. Get a seat neat the front if you want a good view of the rough and tumble - Punch & Judy style.

Interesting show. 50 min water puppet show. 100k Dong. Glad we saw it and it was interesting to imagine the hard work behind the scenes. You need to make your own mind up whether to see it or not though!
Wonderful experience . I really enjoyed the show. The music was do beautiful and the puppets were so masterfully crafted. Definitely a must see in Hanoi!

Worth it for the music alone. My g/f loved watching the puppets - which I'll admit were well done; but my favourite part was watching the musicians to the side playing all the traditional instruments. It's worth going to , and not the pricey (5US)
Well, what to say. . You must go. At £3 for entry you will have a very entertaining hour indeed. Think Punch & Judy meets a small orchestra and put it all on water. Brilliant!!

Very skilful but goodness only knows what it was about. I have to say was sceptical about going to this as not one for puppetry. However, you have to admire the skill of moving puppets from below rather than above.Lucky wasn't too long as given had no idea what it was about was starting to nod off a bit.Wouldn't go twice but given the fact it's a Vietnam tradition well worth a look.

It was amazzing! Don't miss it.. I think this is one of the best highlights of Hanoi for me. I didn't know anything about this water puppet show until I got there. This puppet show has its roots in an art form that dates back to the 11th century. I was told the tradition of water puppet theatre started from a time when rice paddy fields were flooded and villagers would make entertainment by standing in the waist-deep water with the puppets performing over the water. The show will start with folk music composition then the show with various themes such as dragon's dance, fishing, catching frogs etc. The show lasted about one hour and I enjoyed every minute of it. The cost of puppet show is 60,000 dong which is around £3. Don't miss!

pleasant ,for all ages.... something different, not your usual puppet show, suitable for all ages,and very entertaining.,a traditional Vietnamese music band plays along with the show,purchase your tickets at the ticket window early if you want a seat close to the front,however all seats have a good view..

Fun for every age, just right duration. Be forewarned: depending on the season, this place books up quickly! My husband and I went to the ticket counter around 3:30 pm hoping for a show around 5 or 6 pm (they have up to 6 ships per day). Unfortunately, the evening shows were booked up for this night and the next night. So we chose the 3 pm show for the following day.Price sounder $5 per person.The theatre is small so even though we were in row L, we had an excellent view. There are about 20 separate puppet shows, each of them lasting a couple of,I Utes. Great for short attention spans and for tired tourists who need a little rest for their weary feet. This show is. Like nothing g else we've every seen. It took us a few Mai Utes to figure out how the actually operate them (we won't spoil it for you).If you'd like, you can pay $1 extra to be able to take photos during the show. Or you can photograph lots of puppets in the gift shop and in the adjoining restaurant (2nd floor). This is a must-see, even for the most jaded traveler.

Good fun Vietnamese show. Although parts of this show were confusing because they were spoken in Vietnamese, this was an enjoyable way to spend an hour. The puppetry was excellent and the music distinctive. It did not cost very much for a ticket($6) and you get a pretty good view from the whole theatre. It provided a little insight into the culture.

Boring but the kids kind of liked it.... So I wouldn't say this was a must see by any means. But I suppose if you like traditional and historic entertainment it would be enjoyable. For me I'd probably enjoy taking a coffee or a beer and watching the motorbikes zoom past... actually a personal highlight was taking a green lemon iced tea opposite the catholic church and relaxing munching on some roasted sun flour seeds. That also felt like a cultural experienced and I didn't feel trapped for 60 minutes. But go if you you've got nothing higher on your list.

PLEASE - NO PHOTOS. Our experience of this beautiful ancient artform was marred by the masses spending the entire performance looking through their phones. One lady in front of us didn't put down her phone the entire time - she went between filming snapshots to uploading photos to even browsing facebook. Appalling. If you can't spend an hour off your phone then PLEASE stay in your hotel room so that people who want to enjoy the show can IN PEACE!Ensure that you book tickets in the front two rows - if you can't then do not bother!Very upset, as the performance itself was beautifully done.

Interesting unique vietnamese tradition. Unique vietnamese tradition. The show lasted about one hour and included a puppet theater and a live music performance. The cost of the ticket was low. It is primarily visited by tourists and there are many performances during the day. It is crucial to secure a seat in the front of the theater because when sitting in the back you can no longer see the stage. Furthermore they do not explain in englidh the story that is being performed so it is difficult to understand waht exactly is going on. Last but not least one has to pay a small fee to take fotos or video. All in all, a recommended activity.

Always a nice place. Yes, just like the title. The show was simply amazing with beautiful performance and nice traditional music. I came here with my friend and we both enjoy the show very much. Looking forward to coming back here with my family soon!
Puppet show . It was good & you should see it if visiting Hanoi. Easy booking opposite the lake & its held indoors. Best don't use the toilets-pay a cheap price 100 meters away

Unexpected . My hotel manager recommend this show. I was not sure at first but I went to see. What I saw was enjoyable even I didn't understand a word of it. If you haven't seen it should go and watch it.
Everyone recommends. I dont. It seems to be a highlight of traditional culture. I found it boring and only tourist were there. Something I won't repeat o. My next visit

Fantastic cultural experience . Don't need to understand Vietnamese to get the gist of the little stories performed from the beautiful visual display and the accompanying skillfully played traditional music. A truly unique experience

Cultural Experience. A very interesting & enjoyable show. A must see when visiting Hanoi. This show gives you insight into the life of the farmers in this region of Vietnam. Their entertainment when the floods came. A theater with no stage but a pool instead.

A must see for Hanoi. Authentic and traditional, the puppet show was well worth being a part of our trip. It should be a must - low cost, high quality, and just under an hour. It was a great show and positive experience!

Very fun and interesting entertainment. Very fun water puppetry - all ages will enjoy fables and scenes from rural Vietnam history. Live music and beautiful voices a plus! Get you tix on-line early or they may be sold-out or you may have bad seats. Show runs 50 minutes for tix around 10$US.

Nice cultural experience. This is worth visiting if you are in Hanoi. It is inexpensive and only lasts an hour. Just s tip: Don't go if you are very jet-lagged or tired. The music is lovely, but it may put you to sleep!

Sweet and very different.. Water puppets are a Vietnamese form of entertainment where the puppets perform in an indoor pool of water and are manipulated by puppeteers behind a curtain. They dance to live musicians and the costumes were fabulous. A very new experience and one not to be missed. We had a very interesting afternoon.

Worth a visit. Visited the show during our 2 night stay in Hanoi, it's not west end show entertainment but it's worth watching. It's only 45 minutes long and doesn't cost that much and is easy to find.

Small seating, but good show. It's nice to see a bit off original Vietnamese culture, but the show hangs something between the old traditions and modern techniques. It's somehow not original enough and the modern stuff is to out of date. The story of the show itself is very good. For someone of 1m80 the seating isn't adequate enough. My knees kept hitting the Chinese tourist in front of me.

Very engaging show. Front row seats for this cultural experience.
Very clever. Fabulous production from these clearly talented people.
The experience would have been improved had we been able to understand the language.
Definitely worth a visit.

Great fun. This is a popular tourist attraction so you will need to book a couple of days ahead if you want to get your time slot. The show goes for about an hour and that's long enough. It is very entertaining and the "photographers" were a little intrusive but don't let it spoil your day and try to get a seat closer to the front. Would I do it again? Probably not too soon but we enjoyed it and it was very clever and inexpensive. I'd recommend this to anyone visiting Hanoi.

I feel awful saying this but.... ... Frankly, this is a complete waste of time. I appreciate the deep roots in Vietnamese culture and it is wonderful that this is being rekindled but the show itself is not entertaining. This might have been a hit in the 11th century, but it hasn't kept up with the times I'm afraid. As a medium, you'd think it has potential and they might benefit from reinventing the stories, music, puppets and effects to bring it in to the modern world. Go see it if you have run out of things to do in Hanoi!

Seating for small people.. Very uncomfortable seats and there is no leg room. I had to sit with my legs in the aisle.The show is well done but each story seems the same. I noticed many people with their eyes closed and bored awaiting the end of the show. Not for me.

Fun(ny), varied, inventive. Went with three friends. I struggled to stay awake because of the lighting, having drank a beer beforehand and being quite far from the front, but other than that it was really funny, varied and interesting. Lots of surprising. Things you can do with puppets and even (i think) a story about the sword in the neighbouring lake. Loved it - would deffo recommend.
Awesome performance. This is a "must do". It was part of our tour. I'd never heard of it otherwise. Astounding how these puppets are brought to life. The theatre was full of people.

1000 dong..... if i was going again i would try and get the seats in rows a.b.c.d as i was to far back, but i enjoyed the story and the music, the operatic were very good, loved the firework dragons.....all ways packed, i had some coffee and food next door to puppet theater, the girls in there explained what you should do....i also brought two tickets as gifts for friends i made while in Hanoi..

Entertaining!. Looking for a cultural experience, try this one on. It is definitely entertaining, although there is no script or story to understand if you do not speak Vietnamese, the puppet mastery is unique. More so for kids than adults. Near the Old City, it is something to do for an hour.

A must see. Our last stop in SE Asia and we finally got to see the Water Puppet show. I found it very entertaining, it's well choreographed, professional and at times has you in a fit of laughter. The price is right and the musicians and puppeteers are extremely talented. A must see in hanoi.

Lively and colourful show!. The theatre is located right across the street from Hoan Kiem lake, and is amazing value for your money. It is all in Vietnamese, but you can get a program in many different languages and helps you to understand what is going on. The only downside was that since you can pay to take photos, there are many people doing so and sometimes it blocks your view. To avoid this just get there a few minutes before the show to get a front seat.

Efficient show. Very good show, well run, wonderful musicians and puppeteers. Though it's got that feel of a tourist attraction made for big bus groups. If you have a chance to see water puppets outside Ha Noi, rather do that.

A great taste of this traditional Vietnamese art form . Very reasonably priced, shows running every hour or so from noon until 8pm. A great taste of this traditional Vietnamese art form in the Old Quarter. Able to take in your own drinks and snacks 👍

Superb Traditional Performance. This Water Puppet Performance should not be missed during your visit to Hanoi. The folklore stories are expressed via traditional music and water puppet. It is worth watching the performance.

Surprisingly fun. There was no board explaining the story, but it didn't matter. The scenes were short, amusing, fire breathing dragons, jumping fish, beautiful puppets and quite a skill. Seats not that comfortable, but it is an hour's performance. Apparently quite a few a day. It is skilled so for that worth a visit, and honestly, the locals laughing was infectious and started us all smiling and laughing . . .it is historic Vietnamese story telling.

Very clever . Hanoi is not the most attractive of cities or is there much to do. It is more like a hub to transfer to other destinations. The water puppet theatre is probably the only attraction worth actually viewing in Hanoi. It is very clever how they put on such a good show in a small aquarium theatre. Along with live music and signing, a must see if your in Hanoi
Not fantastic. Went for a matinée show with the kids. I thought they would enjoy it more. The production was good but I wasn't overly impressed by it. Not something that you HAVE to see in Hanoi.

Must see. Very good. You must see it at least once on your life. A performance with dragons, birds, human, all puppets,making extensive use of dramatic music from the traditional orchestra and special effects like smoke, etc, tells us stories and tales.

You will be thrilled if it's your first.. Haven't been to a water puppet show before. So it was a nice and exciting experience. But it was looking a bit monotonous for me personally by the end, probably because I was tired. Should definitely do this if you have never been to a show before. The tickets are always sold out particularly over the weekends. Better book them in advance.The show was completely in Vietnamese language showing their culture. It was not that bad hearing throughout.

Quirky but worth VND100k. This was my second visit to Hanoi and this time I made sure I saw the water puppets. Most of the show is in vietnamese so as a none speaker it's more about the visual performance. It is worth going once as it is very impressive but I doubt I would visit again.

Great puppets, tired venue. Of course, when they tell you "not to be missed" you do it. First, buy tickets at the venue: always spaces and only 100k dong for adult and 60k for children. Expect a 1 hour show of nice traditional music, singing and puppetry. Puppet show quite nicely done and surely requires some good skill. However, the venue is very tired, no AC and latecomers are allowed to distract others by being allowed to come in late (and many do).The ladies singing had beautiful voices but seemed quite distracted and were chatting to each other. I suppose after 5 previous shows same day one would get bored.After the show you can buy some nice hand carved puppets which are cheaper than in shops outside.Overall, a good place to visit once and the price very reasonable.

Traditional and interesting. This is not an activity I would have chosen but was glad to have done. The skillful maneuvering of the puppets with boards a great length from the puppet masters person was quite novel. The music was uniquely Asian in fitting with the story lines of the different parts. If you are in front, beware of unannounced water coming your way!

See it for the first time. It is highly recommended to watch the show if you are in Vietnam. The performance was entertaining and interesting. The first part was a few items of live music and singing. It was followed by a series of water puppet performances. Though no translation was available, just sit back, relax and enjoy the show.Strongly recommend you book in advance and get a seat in the front few rows for better view and photography.
Amused and Entertained !. First time watching water puppet show. The show was in Vietnamese but my family and I were amused and entertained by the puppets and story line.
Excellent . A fantastic delightful show. Extremely cleverly done. Was lucky that our guide had given us a history lesson and i was able to interpret the story. A must for all

Good effort . Not sure what more they can do - quite impressive actions but could have included a better story for audience ownership.Excellent music If you are in Hanoi, worth doing if you gave time - not expensive at under $5.

Fantastic!. This was a highlight of my holiday. It made me laugh so much. It was so well done. Book early as it does get sold out. It doesn't matter where you sit you will have a good view. Music and narrative was expertly done.
An entertaining hour. The water puppet show was fun, without being spectacular. We enjoyed the show, and the musicians and singers, and felt that it was worth the time and the modest price charged.

Reginald and Ocilvinora. Very unique and entertaining. The music was quite interesting with a few fascinating instruments. Good to see that this tradition continues and was much appreciated by all who were at the show.

Most unusual and most enjoable. Although it was in Vietnamese this did not attract from the performance as it is very visual and musical. What they can do with these puppets is very clever and it was a joy to watch. The music was also good and the puppets are brilliant. The performance is not too long and represents the puppet shows that many villages put on to entertain themselves in the paddy fields. Vietnam is supposed to be the only place in the world where such shows take place. Definitely a must-see.
Not interesting. I really don't like this water puppet show. It's just people playing puppets on the water. Nothing special.

Blown Away!. On three previous visits to Hanoi, we'd avoided the water puppets, thinking they were likely a dopey tourist trap. Well, the audience was mostly tourists, but the show was stunning -- totally exceeded my expectations. Incredible variety of puppets -- humaniform, fish, dragons, ducks, fishing boats....The water wasn't just a stage, but used very effectively as part of the action. The music was also great. Good value at 100,000 dong/person. Highly recommended.

Great Show. Something you must see. Is not a long show but worth it. Great for children too. You can take pictures and filming. A tip: buy tickets in the morning or the day before. There are a few sessions at day but sold out easily!! I loved it!!

Bit of fun . One of the experiences everyone does while in Hanoi. The music and the singers were really good and the puppeteers very talented. Found the people coming to their seats once the performance started quite distracting. Avoid the bathrooms.
outstanding. This was the best attaction in Hanoi. The puppets were amazing, the audience was captivated for the whole show. It was so good we went twice.

A charming production. The water puppet show was an enchanting experience. We were seated in the first row so we had a quite intimate experience. The show combines beautiful music, performed with a live Vietnamese orchestra and vocalists. The puppets performed on the water, fished, swam, fought demons, courted each other. The story lines were simple the artistry was superb.
Little overrated but funny show. Always almost full theatre , very good advertised in Lonely planet but little kiddish show with simple but local music. Good but not great live performance.
Short and sweet. Show only lasted 45 mins, but was excellent valueThe musicians were first class, as were the puppet costumesVery impressed, our young kids loved it

Interesting cultural puppet display (if you like that sort of thing). Went with a group tour. Some of us loved it, others not so much but there is no denying that it is interesting and loud and colourful and definitely worth a visit.

The original Hanoi experience. . Very popular Hanoi spectacle. Unique experience. About 50 mins long. Very clever. Might not be to everyone's liking but it's sure different and you are located in the Hanoi Old Quarter ready for a night exploring. Close to Hoan Kiem lake too.

Fun to watch. Loved it but found it disruptive that they allow late comers in. We were asked to move seat 15 min after the show started. Because of the language barrier it was not as interesting. But it's not their fault. Good to see at least once if you don't understand Thai.
lovely way to spend an evening in hanoi. we loved the water puppet show. not expensive to get in. its just delightful, lovely traditional band and singers providing the music a must see when in hanoi

Puppets with a difference. Located north east of Hoan Kiem lake at 57b Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Hanoi. It is advisable to book tickets in advance. Budget permitting, get seats closer to the action as the puppets are small and the theatre seats about 200 people. There are about 15 short sketches in the hour long performance. Shows are from 2pm to 8pm. There is an additional camera or video fee if you wish to film the show.

Simple but magical - kids will love it.. We arrived on Saturday afternoon and could only get Sunday 9.15pm for evening shows - so best checking ahead.Simple but magical as 50+ adults we enjoyed but it was clearly enchanting enough for kids n only 45 minutes long.ENJOY

Release your inner child. A delightful escape from the chaotic street life of Hanoi. Come with an open mind and watch this colourful spectacle as if you were a child again. We were lucky to have front row seats and families with children were invited to sit in the spare seats on the front row - the children next to us loved the show and that helped us to embrace the experience. We became children again for 45 minutes and laughed and smiled at the simple stories of foxes chasing fish, dragons breathing fire and fairies dancing. The live music accompanying the show as well as the sound effects added to the overall experience. It did not matter that we couldn't understand the dialogue, we came out smiling. Some things don't date and there's a reason they are have been popular for hundreds of years.

Fun and entertaining.. The show was fun and interesting, very inexpensive. Although it was in Vietnamese and we did not understand a word, you kind of get the idea of the story. It was a fun and interesting experience.

An impromptu visit . Some local culture while in Hanoi. A quaint old theatre with several shows a day. Gets booked up so don't delay if you want to go Enjoyed something that we would not normally see. Rather hot in the theatre and our friend decided to have an unexpected nap - more due to the temperature and time difference than anything else I think!!
Different!. Very quaint show, enjoyable and a little local culture. Surprised how busy it is so make sure you don't leave it to the last minute. Small old theatre and very hot.

A nice production to pass the time in Hanoi. Myself and my boyfriend went to watch the production, we both enjoyed it and thought it was great to do if you have plenty of time in Hanoi. It would be nice to see with a family- young children would find it great. It lasts just under an hour and is very well produced :)

A unique experience not to be missed!!!. Water puppetry is a Vietnamese tradition and this theater presents it in all its glory. Live music was enchanting and lovely. The puppet stories were amusing and understandable even to our non-Vietnamese group. Very comfortable seating (do not sit in the first or second rows - the view is better from further up)

Worth seeing!. The water puppet show is totally worth seeing. It's all in Vietnamese but it doesn't matter at all. The music is great the puppets and puppeteers are amazing. It will hold your attention the whole time. I will go again next time in Hanoi!

A nice change. Traditional Vietnamese water puppet show
A nice break from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi
This was in Nov 2014

First Vietnam Tour. This was included in our tour package and it is one of the must-see if you are a first timer to Vietnam. The theatre is not big and there's no "bad" seats. You can see everything up close. It is not sophisticated but it is a form of entertainment originally developed in Vietnam.

Don't miss. . Was a little sceptical about what we were going to experience but honestly it was absolutely brilliant and the hour long show flew by.
The music and the puppeteers were outstanding. Their skills in moving the puppets was quite phenomenal.

Fun and different entertainment. I liked the waterpuppet show! I didn't really know what to expect, but I was pleasently surprised. They speak in Vietnamese, so you dont really understand anything, but it doesn't really matter, the main thing is the waterpuppets. I would say it was worth the money, fun to see something new!
Puppet theatre . Very interesting. We went to the new theatre. Easy to find and an interesting evening. We had never seen this type of entertainment before. Recommended!

It's a Hanoi local treasure. The puppet show is steeped in history and shows a funny little stories into traditional local life, in a time me gone by.
Don't expect Edwardian theatre or a show to rival Broadway but it's a lovely inside to life and entertainment from a traditional Vietnamese perspective.

Best $5 and hour you'll spend in Hanoi. After an opening musical number the action moves to a 10' by 20' pond at the front of the theater. For the next 50 minutes hidden puppeteers will guide elaborate puppets through the water in stunning synchronization with the music. The show consists of 14 separate short acts. Highlights include the dragon's dance (with underwater fire), agricultural work (which is replete with water buffalo, women planting and harvesting rice, and men ploughing) and the fox that catches ducks. You don't need to know Vietnamese to enjoy the music or understand the stories (except possibly unicorn's dance - that one eluded me). Multiple shows daily; schedule at:Thanglongwaterpuppet,org

Great little theatre and show. Water puppets is a must see fantastic show goes for around 45min and is very entertaining .cost is around $6 a us all in Vietnamese but you get the drift .recomended to see for whole family or adults

Interesting and Different . I wasn't sure what to expect but did enjoy this show with live musicians. It was colourful depicting life in Vietnam (and some legends) and is about an hour long.The mastery of the puppets is very good.

Whelmed. . Ok. I came here thinking this was going to be a memorable authentic cultural experience. But....maybe I'm jaded....it was pretty darned dull. Puppets on sticks splashing around in filthy brown water....honestly it got old quick.... 5 minutes was enough for us. We pretty much made fun of it for the rest of the show. Maybe it's better for kids.

One of hanoi's best. Must visit and watch when in hanoi. Showcases hanoi's love for art, musicality and creativity! The show portray vietnamises' way of life with a mix of humour. uniquely hanoi! Located just opposite hoan kiem lake.
Great show. Great show do not pre book! Book when you arrive it is only about 6aud. Get in early though as the shows do sell out.

Show with live music. Very nice show. The folk music and vocals were amazing. The puppet performance was unusual and very entertaining. During the dragon’s dance, the fire caught the curtain, but the artists were able to bring it down quickly. All was perfect accept that close to the end, the children of some tourists from Asian country, started to talk too loudly, and disturbed the performance. Besides that, all was very good.

Simple yet Charming........... Although I wouldn't rate this activity as a 'must do', it was a lovely experience for an hour or so. The simplicity of the show offers great charm and the local vietnamese music is quite lovely - as it adds to the atmosphere.
Water Puppets Hanoi. BRILLIANT. Do not miss this if you are visiting Hanoi. It's absolutely amazing. A wonderful experience,

Check it out...if you have time. Shows are only in the evening, from 3pm to 9.30pm..might need to go there at least 30 mins before if you want to watch the show on the same night or suggest booking it in advance if you can.Some funny moments.... Thought it was good. We liked it because we were keen to explore and learn their culture..not sure if everyone will like it as much..

Reluctant to go, but surprisingly good. A cleverly done show depicting different facets of country life in Vietnam. The puppets are controlled by sticks under the water surface. While you can't understand what is being said, the whole thing works and is quite humorous and entertaining. An obviously commercial enterprise in this communist country. There are many shows a day and the turn round is rapid. You need to book in advance.
Worth a watch. If your in the area definitely worth a watch amazing craft! The dragon puppets were the best. All speaking is in vietnamese however you get the picture
Evening entertainment . The show was entertaining and amusing.I wouldn't go back for a second viewing but it was a worthwhile experience.

Night at the theatre.... Visited the Thang Long Water Puppet Theater with friends while exploring the city on foot. The theatre provides a great insight into Vietnamese life, culture and art, as the announcements were in Vietnamese and English, but the performances were in Vietnamese only. The theatre would be ideal for art and theatre lovers, but it is a bit hard to follow the acts with only the theatre programs as your guide. The acts are accompanied by live music and a great way to immerse yourself in Vietnamese culture in a short time. The cost is reasonable and takes over an hour at the longest, but if your short on time and not a fan of art of the theatre then there are better things you can do with your time. Also this is very close to the lake of the restored sword.

Interesting - 45 Minutes of Vietnam folklore via water puppets. So i bought tickets to this last minute as a friend was persistent that I had to go and I had pretty much exhausted the old quarter of activities. I attended the 8pm show, they run several throughout the day. The 60k Dong($2.75) tickets were sold out so I had to buy the 100k Dong tickets($4.50) not a huge deal but my seat was in row D. God forbid you are over 4 feet tall and sit in row D... the guy to the right of me was 6'3'' and had his knees in his chest with just his toes on the ground, the guy to my left was from San Francisco and a riot but as well was breaking his knees to sit in these seats. Perhaps it's a cruel trick they play on foreigners, but this place is pretty small and I don't see a need to get the more expensive tickets. The performance goes through 14 scenes and is very well performed with traditional folk music. It's not translated but if you pay attention and have a bit of imagination you get the idea of what is going on. Grab an English Program in the upstairs lobby and you will be able to follow pretty easily, and have an idea when the show is about to be over if you get stuck in a short row...The performances are as follows: 1. Prelude by clown Teu2. Thang Long festival drumming3. Dragon's dance4. Buffalo-boy playing the flute5. Agricultural work (rice planting, soil ploughing, water scooping) 6. Catching frogs7. Chasing the fox that tries to catch ducks8. Fishing9. Xa thuong: a melody in the collection of hymns dedicated to the cult of Holy Mothers.10. Phoenix's dance11. Le Loi returning the sword12. Unicorn's dance13 Eight fairies' dance14. Four sacred animals' dance (dragon, unicorn, tortoise, phoenix) Worth an hour of your time while in Hanoi. An interesting diversion.

Neat Experience. This was something I really wanted to do in Hanoi and I am not sure what my expectations were for it exactly but it was really neat! We heard (and saw played) traditional Vietnamese music and instruments and the puppet show was really entertaining, even quite funny at times despite us not being able to understand the words. I felt like we learned a little bit more about Vietnamese culture and history too in a way.

Cute and touristy. This water puppet show was very adorable and it was nice to see the musicians play and sing. The puppets told the story quite well along with the music and the puppet masters are really doing a good job. For me the experiences wasn't as good as it could have been as cameras and telephones are constantly in the air filming or taking pictures.

I expect more . I thought the show is gonna be in English, or at least Vietnamese and English. It was pretty cute and interesting for the first few shows. But after a while, it actually made me feel sleepy. I don't know if they have another timing but I watched the puppet show at 9.30pm after all my whole day trip. It was pretty boring.For me, it was not worth it.

One time thing. I would rate this as average. I thought some parts of the show was pretty creative and neat, but also boring. You dont really know if theres a story or a meaning behind the show/acts so youre just watching puppets moving around. The live music was awesome. I would only recommend to art and theater lovers.

Puppet theatre. Thoroughly enjoyed the puppet theatre . Although mostly in Vietnamese just watching the show gives you an idea of what the story is about. Great musicians using traditional instruments . The best seats would be front row as it can be hard to see above people's heads . Cost was reasonable & show went for about 1 hour.

SEE AT LEAST ONE WATER PUPPET SHOW IN VIETNAM!. Saw two water puppet shows while in Vietnam, and this was by far the best one! Traditional Vietnamese folklore and way of life shown via water puppets. Vietnamese spoken, however one gets the gist of the show. A small fee is payable (20,000 VND) in order to take photos during the show.
Cute. It is cute & an old art form but don't expect to be overwhelmed by the performance. The show is in Vietnamese with no translation. The music was good.

Special show. I was hesitant at first and thought puppet shows were for children. My wife forced me to go along and I did. The tickets are about USD 5 per head and there are multiple shows every day. The show itself is colorful, artistic and interesting. Live music adds to the charm and this is no ordinary puppet show and I would strongly urge you to visit. The show is only 45 minutes.
Puppet show. Excellent music n show n must visit. Show contains puppets in water n some acts include dragons throwing out fire.

Worth a visit. Entertaining puppet show even if you do not understand the language! Last for 45 mins, recommend that you buy your tickets in advance if you plan to watch the evening shows as they sell out pretty fast!

We were falling asleep . The show goes for about an hour and while there are lots of colours and the music is nice, we had no idea what was going on because it's in Vietnamese. I liked that it was traditional, it just wasn't for us

Husband fell asleep . We were both tired but the whiney music and dark lighting didn't do much to wake us up.
Doesn't help that you can't make head or tail of the plot, presuming there is one.
Not for us.

Amazing to watch. This was part of Scenic Enrich activities and to be honest we weren't really looking forward to it but it was very good and amazing to watch. We met the puppeteers after the show which gave us an extra insight into how they make the puppets and how much training they have to do. Very interesting.

Amazing colorful show. What an experience. Great music and cute puppets in this water show - cleverly performed. Theater adequate and restrooms horrible but being fixed and repaired as we were there. The show was great and imaginative.

Everyone should see this show. The water puppet show in Hanoi is a must see. How the puppets are manipulated in the water behind a screen is amazing. The show depicts ancient Vietnamese stories of the farmers and is a perfect experience for children to see as well as adults. The musicians who accompany play the most interesting ancient instruments and their voices are beautiful.

Fantastic!. They do many performances a day here. We booked a couple days in advance - go to the box office when it is raining and in between mealtimes. There's an orchestra with singing. One of the percussion women seemed to be having a strop with a woman on a stringed instrument. That was fun to watch. The puppets are operated on long poles under water by puppeteers behind a screen. There are lots of little stories and they almost all involve being in a rice paddy and catching food - dragon flies, ducks, fish, frogs. It is charming and doesn't take up a lot of your time - maybe 3/4hr.

Loved it for everyone . We were told we probably wouldn't enjoy it since it's told in Vietnamese. That person was entirely wrong. Anyone can appreciate the antique music by a 9 piece ensemble and anyone can follow the storyline in each vignette with the puppets. We purchased the more expensive ticket and had good seats. But the theater is modest in size so I don't think there are bad seats. It runs 45 minutes and was fun. Tip: don't pay the camera fee as it is not enfoced.

Great show!. We weren't sure whether we would enjoy the water puppet show or not, but we wanted to experience the local culture. I have to say, it was one of my favourite things in Hanoi! It was very funny and not serious. Only 45 minutes long which was perfect. Would highly recommend it!

A Cultural Treat. This was a unique experience that can't be seen anywhere else in the world. The puppets actually perform in the water. The puppets themselves are large and there are many different ones which are used to depict various events in Vietnamese life like farming, fishing, boating etc. A band of traditional instruments plus several vocalists add to the experience. These performers are visible to the audience. The performance lasts under an hour, which is plenty long enough. While this is not exciting per se, it is interesting to see a traditional Vietnamese folk craft.

Vietnamese Water Puppets. Our guide took us here one evening. A wonderful experience. The live orchestra and singers were to the side and played along throughout. The fire and smoke enhanced the performance. Also you could buy puppets and gifts on the way out. Really magic.
Very cleverly done. Quite unusual.

A bit expensive.. I felt this was a bit pricey for a puppet show. Some of the puppets could do with a lick of paint. The way it is done is very clever and you spend the time wondering where the puppeteers are.My 8 year old son said he wished it was in english so he could understand what was being said. By the end he enjoyed it and was impressed by the fact the puppeteers were in the water the whole time. Overall enjoyed it as it is a bit of a touristy thing to do with kids while in Hanoi.The toilets of which there are not enough were blocked on our visit and we're backing up and overflowing with sewage. This was quite disgusting and ruined the end of this visit for me.

Entertaining and Unique. I've never seen puppets do their thing submerged in a large tank. The background music sets a very authentic feeling and I enjoyed the singing they did. The puppeteers (perhaps as many as 10-12) were magical making several puppets interact at once. The show is fast paced and colorful, yet after about 30 minutes seems to become redundant.

Creative and entertaining, if you can get past the photo obsessed!. We really loved the music and artistic elements of this show, well worth the money spent. However, a request to the future audience members, to be mindful of the interference of flash photography. We had people in front of us that probably took 50 or 60 pictures, I can't understand how they even experienced the show, but more importantly it's not considerate of others. Sit back and enjoy the experience and leave your camera alone for a while! Much better that way :)

Funny play with beautiful music. I really wanted to go here since i felt it was a very entertaining way to understand a bit about the culture.The puppets did funny dances, as they were doing short plays in Vietnamese. But what was really impressive for me and my boyfriend was the music and the old Vietnamese instruments that were being used. It was nice short expercience :) (The chairs though, like most things in Vietnam, are not designed for tall people)

Lost in translation . There are some good parts to the water puppet show the dragons with fireworks are good. But I could not follow the story being told, and I think this would have made the experience much better. I think a translation in english and other languages might have helped to overcome this.

The Puppet Show was amazing - Kept you Engaged. Our family of 5 enjoyed the performance and the show was very professional. The theater is not very large, so it is a more personal experience. You almost forget they are puppets.Wish there weren't so many tourists filming the whole performance instead of sitting back and enjoying it. My 11 and 14 year-old grandchildren enjoyed it too. Was just the right amount of time, 45 minutes.

Enthralling . Steeped in Vietnamese culture the short show was really enthralling. Had short episodes of the Vietnamese way of life from fishing , farming to rural and other activities in days gone by and a couple of mythological ones as well. Would have been nicer if there had been a short synopsis of the episodes in other languages. A must do when in Hanoi. Shows start from late noon everyday with weekend specials at 1.45pm. Cost 100000 dong which is approximately $5. You need to book ahead to get front row seats so you can enjoy a better view.

Enchanting!. We loved this! The staging and the accompanying music were wonderful, but the puppetry itself was remarkable. The various puppets and the ways in which they were manipulated, showing many aspects of traditional Vietnamese life, were just a delight. Can't recommend this enough!
Interesting. I enjoyed it. Kids did not, i found the performance interesting. Reading up ahead the Vietnamese culture ahead of time will help you appreciate this more. Seats are small.

An entertaining show . We visited the Water Puppet Theatre as part of an organised holiday with a travel company. We found the show amusing and entertaining. The puppets are fascinating and the puppeteers are extremely skillful, it's the type of show you may only see once in your life so if you are in Hanoi it is worth making the effort to attend.

Great experience. We got in just as the show was starting so we didn't know what waa going on in terms of voices etc. But the show is amazing. The puppet operators are really talented. I was blown away how it was all done. The show definitely exceeded my expectations. It is a must see if in Hanoi

Almost great. It's a really nice theatre, and the musicians are amazing. BUT the actual puppetry seems quite amateurish compared to what we saw in Ho Chi Minh City's water puppet show.
If it's a choice between this and never seeing a water puppet show, then go. But if you have the time and opportunity go in Saigon instead.

Cute show . I went to the puppet show with my boyfriend and our friend, we paid the higher price for seating 100,000d so we were in the third row from the front. If you are tall and you book early I wouldn't bother paying the extra for front row seats. It was just good for me because I am short so being so close meant I didn't need to look through so many heads. But for my Bf and my friend it didn't really matter. The show was really cute and funny. Even though it's mostly in Vietnamese you can easily follow along with help from the program. There is a live traditional Vietnamese band which is also really cool. I would recommend going, it was a nice thing to do at the end of the day.

Beautiful play.. it was my first time of water puppetry. it was very interesring and wonderful. although they were playing with only Vietnam language, You can easily understand their play with only handout. note that you can see everything in the back seat which is lower price than a front seat.
Worth checking out. Fun, quick show to learn a little of Viet arts! Tickets are cheap and there are several shows per night

Water Puppet Show. It is absolutely worth visiting once since it is one of a kind and beyond once imagination. Very unique and creative. Avoid sitting in first four to five rows. Get your tickets a day in advance to get a better deal. Have fun

Charming . This charming show is a perfect activity to end your day before dinner. It's lovely to sit and be entertained after a day of touring. The show is colorful, delightful, and short enough to enjoy without getting tired. Highly recommended for all ages.
Worth a visit. The performance was most beautiful. extremely touristy but still rather authentic and worth seeing. It is advised to buy the ticket s for one day in advance to get good seats
Hanoi no 1 must do. My 3 year old was entranced and it was a fantastic opportunity to hear and learn more about Vietnemese folk and music. It was a fantastic spectacle and well worth the money.

Better than I expected so worth a visit. This sells out quickly & we got the last 2 tickets for the performance in an hours time. Part of the problem is that this appears to be the spot where all the tourist coaches/buses disgorge their contents to either queue for tickets or go off on organised city tours. The cost is 100,000 dong (sounds a lot but is about £3.30) & the performance lasts for about 50 minsThe water puppets are fun & handled skilfully. The associated musicians & singers sing the stories in Vietnamese but there are foreign language leaflets that help explain what's happening. I suspect if they tried singing in English, then the rthymn would be lost.An entertaining time & I would recommend seeing this

Enjoyed it. I was not expecting much fromm the Thang Long Water Puppet Show, as at this point of the trip I was feeling everything in Vietnam is just a cheap tourist show. Well, this one was too, but at least it felt something different and good. The show takes one hour more or less and is comprised by many scenes. Some of them are really surprising, but after a few, the limitations of the puppets make the show a bit repetitive. Nonetheless, the show has a high standard artistic quality, with live music and a very significant number of different puppets. No need of subtitles or explanations as the acts are quite simple indeed. Photography permit required.

Tinny music ,fireworks,dancing fish ,water buffalo and dragons connect with the child you once were ~ it's all Magic. Some previous reviews seem to have been a little stingy with their accolades for this lovely trip into the rural folklore of old Vietnam . I guess some people have become accustomed to expect something like Disneyland wherever they roam and if you are of that ilk avoid this place by all means as you will annoy people like me and it will not float you boat . But this little word link explains it all because the mastery of swooshing puppets and facing magic fish is what it's all about and this is enhanced of course by music and singing which would probably not appeal to many Western ears for too long.. But give it a chance after all it doesn't go on too long and if you are eight feet tall like me you will be glad about that because the seating was obviously planned for smaller people . All the characters are so true to their origin it's a pity that the story is not translated on paper for our benefit but l think we got the gist of it and we are so glad we bought our " Happy Man " puppet and his partner " Happy Woman " l'm looking at them now with a smile on my silly face and they're smiling right back at me - in fact if l am not mistaken Happy Man has just given me a little wave..

Good . Very different. It was good, a little hard to follow as it was in Vietnamese but you do get an English brochure. Very beautiful singing and an interesting way to learn about Vietnam's history. Quite impressive.

Something new. I have read about the Water Puppet show but wasn't actually sure if this is worth the money and the time since the comments here in Tripadvisor differs. Nonetheless, we tried since it was one of the main attraction of Hanoi. We were seated at the front row (I suggest you not to do that if you're allergic since smoke from the show is just in front of you). What I love about the show is their artistry / creativity. The puppets are choreographed, sound effects, lighting, and the story line. The sound of the voice of the singers is very relaxing.But since everything is in Vietnamese, I couldn't understand anything and let my mind wander.. it could've been better if they would at least give the non-Vietnamese speaking people something to understand what's going on. It was worth the visit, but if you have limited time in Hanoi, I don't suggest the show. You can try and roam around the Quarter instead. That was my first visit, and prolly the last.
Fantastic, worth buying the expensive seats. Great music, great performances, very nice way to learn a few things about the Vietnamese culture, excellent show

Once is enough . The most I can say is it's only 45 mins! Although I appreciate how talented the puppeteers are this just wasn't my thing. I was in a group of 16 and, probably 2 or 3 enjoyed it, at the most! But, when in Rome...

A different experience . This was our first water puppet experience, the show is unique and worth a watch. Normal tickets are 60,000 VND (last 3 rows) and 100,000 VND. kindly book in advance as there is a good chance you will not get the ticket on the day you go. First row is recommended however difficult to get as there is a lot of advance booking. The place is located next to the hoan kiem lake. Extra show on weekends. The show takes place around 5 times a day.It gets a little Boring in between when they use local language. Overall it is a one time watch nothing extra ordinary. Try for 60,000 tickets.

Blew My Expectations Out Of The Water. We attended an afternoon performance as part of a tour group. We didn't have high hopes for this; we thought it would be sort of kitschy. But, it ended up being one of our favorite attractions in Hanoi (coming in just behind the street food tour). The musicians were excellent (especially the vocalist), and the puppeteers are crazy talented. The beauty of a show like this is that the puppets tell the story, and you'll understand it no matter what language you speak. After the show, souvenir puppets are sold for very reasonable prices (I think $4 US). I got one, but wish I would have gotten multiple varieties, because they make a great authentic decoration on our mantel at home.The bathroom on the first floor (shared with the cafe) is a little scuzzy. Ladies, make sure you bring your own tissue and hand sanitizer. The cafe staff was washing the dishes in the bathroom sink, so I'm not sure that's where I would grab a bite to eat.

Enjoyed it!. Fun to see how the puppets were choreographed with special effects.Music played from live troupe on side stage and voices coming from them to make puppets alive.Obviously a water pool is the stage and thus a lot of movement in the water.Amazed at the creativity behind all this.Strongly suggest seeing it if you haven't been to water puppet theater.

Oh dear..... Sorry, but clearly Hanoi is scraping the bucket with attractions with this one! I had no expectations, in fact no idea what to expect at all, and what I saw, well, no wonder there wasn't much information, nothing really happens. Yes, clap clap to the depressed looking musicians , and yes what a skill it must be to be a puppeteer up to your waist in water. But other than that, theres nothing to say. Leg room is awful, everything is in Vietnamese so you understand absolutely nothing, and its incredibly short...like the legroom. If you don't have much time in Hanoi, please don't waste your time or money on this, go explore the streets and markets, wander, get lost, don't join the masses in this puzzling show! Pass.

Worth Considering. One of the must do in Hanoi. Not really great but a must do. Located close to the Hoan Kiem Lake. Cost of the ticket is VD100k and you can buy it at the entrance. It is a world acclaimed puppet show that showcases the rich culture and tradition of Vietnam people with live music and singing. However, it's in Vietnamese and there's no English translation.

Average show. Cheap to get in , an OK show ten minutes was enough for us , try to be about five rows back if possible, it sells out fast so book as early as possible, toilets in coffee bar next door but gets very large queues after the show, good thing was wheelchairs were carried up a flight of about 30 steps

Not amazing. The water puppet show was recommended by our hotel. It was a unique experience and very traditional. I didnt love it but i didnt hate it. I would recommend it if you are into vietnamese culture and history but i probably wouldnt go again. The price was good with the best seats being 100k dong. Not bad but not essential.

Great way to spend 4$ and 45 minutes. Worth going if you have a bit of free time in hanoi. Get dinner near the lake, watch the show, then check out the night market nearby. The show itself was great. Only 4/5 because they allow pictures and the flash/phone screens are quite annoying. (Guilty of taking pictures)
Worth a look. The show only lasts approx 40 mns. It is quite clever the way they hide the strings. Well worth a visit as it doesn't cost very much and it's an unusual experience
Amazing show. We loved this show well worth an hour of your time. Also very cheap. We pre booked our seats very close to the front and I would recommend these especially for children.
Fantastic!. We really enjoyed this show. It's very different to anything else we've seen A bit like Punch and Judy but in the water.Actually it's telling about life in the Vietnam countryside.

Pretty good! . This place is packed with tour groups. It's $5 of fun though. The benefit of sitting up front is that you won't see all the phone screens when people take pictures. I'd recommend going.

Great show, not great experience. . The show was amazing! However, they allow flash photography, thus impacting the viewing pleasure. If they had a "no flash" policy I would have been much happier. Still worth a visit, it only cost 100,000 VD.

Unique Heritage Puppet Show. Highly recommended for all visitors to Hanoi. This World acclaimed Puppet show is a must visit in Hanoi as the show showcases the rich culture and tradition of Vietnam people.The show is breathtakingly well choreographed, the lights and pyrotechnics beautifully intergrated into the ancient art of puppetry on water. This spectacle is unlikely to be seen elsewhere in the world and a feast to the eyes and mind. The theater is comfortable and conveniently situated. They are many restaurants and eateries nearby which can be patronized while waiting for the show to starts.

Interesting if you understand about local culture. It is a should-see activity. The show come with 45 minutes, with 3-5$/ticket. They will use the wooden puppets to describe the culture of Vietnamese people in past. it is funny, interesting, even with a local people. Beside cycling tour in The old quarter, Water puppet show should be in your day tour in Hanoi.

Brilliant crazy!. We opted to buy our tickets at the door rather than before leaving Australia which resulted in us paying MUCH LESS than we would have. Also opted for the superior seats for a couple of $AUD extra. The show was brilliant. Whether or not it truly reflected the ancient traditions is not for us to judge, but as a piece of theatre it ticked all the boxes. At times there was more entertainment watching the choir and their body language or trying to see what was going on behind the scenes in the water, but the different episodes of the puppetry were certainly captivating. Worth every Dhong.
Do not miss this!. Amazing puppet show that you will not seeanyplace else. Live music, singing and puppets in water. Wait till you see how the puppets are manipulated.

Not to be missed. Well a great way to spend 1 hour after breakfast or a break half way shopping at the Old Quarter . Located right at the perimeter of Hoan Kiem Lake towards the Old Quarter to the north, not to be missed. The show is in Viet (its a CULTURAL show. what do u expect ?) Really enjoyed it. Good performance, good music and yes there's Wifi! And you able to record and take videos during the show which is super irritating though. An hour and 100,000 Dong well spent before continuing my day ahead :)) Do buy the ticket a day in advance. Don't Queue for the ticket at 2.50pm for a 3pm show. It ain't rocket science.

Complimentary tickets from hotel. We watched a water puppet show in HCM some years ago. Same loud songs and music in Vietnamese... there was no translation nor subtitles in English. Didn't understand what the story was. There was also no restriction on using cameras with flash; many people were leaning forward to take photos of the tiny water puppets in the small water stage below and blocked the views of those sitting in the back rows. The camera flashes were also distracting. If not for the complimentary tickets from our hotel, we would have skipped the show since we already watched it once in HCM...that's enough.

It was okay. The show was interesting however maybe a little bit to long. The theatre constantly smelt of cigarette smoke and lots of people just happy snapping with cameras ruining the show. If you have only a limited amount of time get out and wonder the streets and do a walking food tour.

Very interesting and enjoyable, colourful. The show contains 15 brief vignettes, with a wide range of puppets, from dragons to phoenix, and many recognisable Vietnamese characters. Very well done, entertaining. Not too long. Demonstrated greet skill on behalf of the puppeteers.

Pleasant experience. Well worth a visit as it shows you a taste of the Vietnamese culture. Make sure you sit on the ground floor though as we were originally sat on second floor and could see the bamboo sticks used to move the puppets which spoilt it a little. However, we spotted two seats downstairs and decided to move halfway through making the experience much more enjoyable and realistic.

Splish splash I was catching a show. Stopped by the water puppet show in Hanoi tonight as it's one of the typical tourist boxes to tick off. We hadn't booked or got in early to choose seats near the front so ended up in the back row. Splashed out ( pun intended ) the 60000 dong each and sat back for the show. We wouldn't put it on the must see list for Hanoi but we really enjoyed the show, for the price why not take an hour to relax and enjoy some music and entertainment.

Very different and worth going. Was a nice way to see Vietnamese culture, very cheap to watch and busy so book a few hours before you go and get a lower floor seat as you can see the sticks hanging out from the top floor
Wow! . I loved this place. It showed Vietnamese water puppetry at its very best. Definitely worth a visit! I could have watched the water puppets every day of my holiday! :)

Wasn't convinced before but appreciated it after the show. Our guide convinced us to visit and as this is something you will only see in Vietnam I would recommend a visit. The start was well basic but it increased in interest and skill. The show lasts just long enough about 50 mins. Plenty of show times to choose from but be careful with kids it gets busy outside.
Interesting. Fun little show, but it did carry on a bit longer than expected. All in all, it was well put together and I enjoyed learning some history.

Puppet Theater over the Water. The water puppet show is a great attraction for turist of all over the world and locals. The first thing is the life orchestra wich accompanies the show. The puppets themselfs arevery colourfull and extremely well handeld. The show is full of humor and surprices and can be understood witout words.

great value for your dong. This is a great way to spend a little time out of the sun and letting your feet rest. The whole show is really great. The skill level involved in operating the puppets is amazing. The music that comes from the 6 musicians is also a real surprise. Overall, this a great value for your entertainment dollar...

Should See. We saw this show years ago, and I didn't care for it much. It hasn't changed at all, but this time we had our kids with us (ages 8 and 10). I enjoyed it so much more! Our son was captivated and loved the fire breathing dragons. H talked about the show frequently and would have easily returned had we let him.

What else can you do for $5. We didn't expect much but were pleasantly surprised by the show. It goes for about 50 minutes so it's over before you get bored. My tip would be to buy tickets as soon as you arrive in Hanoi as you really want to be in the front row at least the first couple of rows as everyone had their camera phones in the air taking pictures.

Delightful performance . I thoroughly enjoyed this performance. I definitely recommend seeing it. I would also recommend maybe buying tickets early in the day so you get good seats as it can be very frustrating when you have people in front leaning forward to block your view or with their phones in the air.
