Other than that, it was wonderful and I highly recommend.

Interesting show at the Water Puppet Theater in Hanoi. Definitely worth seeing. Get the seat in the first 3 rows as the view seems best. Show lasts about an hour so it doesn't get boring. If you are into orient music you will love this part of the show. What we didn't like, was the fact that many people were late, but still let in and interrupted the first 15-20 minutes of the show. Book your ticket as it might be sold out in the high season.

Had low expectations given other people's review. But turns out more entertaining than expected, even I don't understand a bit about the narratives or songs. A must see for tourist.
Go with low expectation and be amazed by this old traditional art form.

A Fun Introduction to Vietnamese Culture.. This water puppet opera portrays the lifestyles and entertainment of the early rice farmers. English narration would have been helpful, but the imagery, the master puppeteers, and the accompanying orchestra told their stories beautifully.

Entertaining for a short time. The puppeteers who are hidden manipulate puppets by moving long stocks which are hidden under the water. The 1 hour show consists of 14 scenes. There are few talking sequences which are difficult to grasp because they are only in Vietnamese. If you read about the legends and customs you will recognize some of the scenes. The whole show gets very repetitive. Live music and singing is very nice but a mild music combined with fumes coming from the stage made some people very sleepy. There are very little place between the rows so if you are tall aim for the first row or sitting close to the side.

Hanoi Muppets . This show is so much fun you would swear Jim Henson was part of it. This ancient entertainment originated in the paddy fields many years ago. It is only an hour but its 100% captivating for every minute. It's very inexpensive and the theatre is clean and comfortable. It's easy to find. On the northeast corner of Turtle Lake in the Old Quarter. Go see it!

Entertaining and professional. It was the second time I've come to see this show and the quality remains unchanged. Shows start on time, tickets are inexpensive and the live singing is amazing !! Music is also played live. Water puppetry is an ancient entertainment that rice field farmers created and it is preserved in this theatre. Definitely something to see when exploring Vietnam.

Vietnamese Culture at its best. Amazing 50 minute performance. Vietnamese orchestra with female vocalists very talented and an array of percussion and string instruments. Wonderful talent all round - puppet construction, puppeteers and choreography( not sure if this correct term) Thoroughly enjoyed the performance and well worth 100,000 dong ( about $7 AUD)Would have been nice to have a quick explanation of the musical instruments and a brief synopsis of the short stories performed. Would go again on next visit to Hanoi.

Book early to get front and center seats. You cannot leave Vietnam without seeing a water puppet show. While this theatre is geared for the tourist industry, you may find other better quality water puppet shows elsewhere in the country but if you are on a schedule, then this is a must see. Indeed, the seats are small with limited leg room and it is cramped. Might be problematic for tall or big people. They do provide a short written summary in their program brochure about each show. But during the actual show, you won't be reading the brochure and so have to figure out what you are watching. Yet, it can be unique experience for a visitor in Vietnam and fun for all ages.

Must see!. This is the thing that everyone seems to see.....The performance is about an hour and is exactly what it say, puppets splashing about in water, operated by puppeteers who are also in the water (you only see them at the end). Some of it is quite funny, some of it is unintelligible if you don't understand Vietnamese (the band obviously find it funny!) or mysterious if you don't understand Vietnamese folk tales. It's pretty unique, I think, and makes you think of what a watery country this is. In the beginning a woman played a single stringed harp - how I don't know, but it sounds wonderful.

Unique. Well worth a visit. The seats are quite small and not much leg room but the show, which is a bit under an hour, is very clever and a joy to watch. The accompanying traditional music and singing is also lovely.

Amazing. First time to see water puppet show. It was amazing, but it was in their local language. We didn't understand what's going on at first. Good thing we had the Hanoi Tour and was able to get a little information on the history and culture. So, we were able to grasp what the show was about. Do not leave Hanoi without seeing it.
Water Puppets. A must to see - just 30 minutes and located at Helio cafe near the Lake....fascinating depiction of life in the rice fields and a great orchestra

Very enjoyable!. My partner and I loved the performance! We purchased our tickets in the morning (around 10am) for the first afternoon show at 3pm. We were given seats right in the centre of Row E, which was a perfect view. At only 100 000 VND, the price we paid was well worth the 50 minutes of entertainment. Would recommend for all ages. Note: signage outside says you have to pay 20 000 VND to take pictures or 60 000 VND to film, however I'm sure no one paid this as there were many people with iPads and phones out recording the show.
Puppet Theater in Hanoi. A traditional water puppet show, well done. Theater was in a nice location in Hanoi, and the performance was lively. Amazing to see how many actors and puppeteers.

Good with kids . That was a bit weird for the grownup, the fact has it is in Vietnamese didn't help but our 2.5 daughter loved it and the seats were very comfortable so that was a good break from walking the city!

An experience.... This show is definitely a unique experience which combined water puppet performances with traditional Vietnamese music. The stories are in Vietnamese which made it hard to understand at times but the kids in the crowd seemed to enjoy it. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance on the day to get good seats at the time that is suitable for you.

It was included in our tour and interesting, but.... The actors stand knee-deep in water behind a screen and manipulate puppets with long poles; accompanied by a band. I'm sure the artists were accomplished, but the music is kind of screechy for me.

Unique and good value. This is something very unique, and well done. It is not expensive to visit and you will certainly be amazed at the ability of the puppeteers. It is so different from any other show I have seen.

Special . The water puppets show was awesome, with the beautiful music for each scene and the different scenes performed by the puppets. This show has been cleverly put together in a lovely theatre near the lake. I wish it was in English, but still very entertaining.

A precious demonstraon & poor visibility.. If you ever come to Vietnam it is one of the show which you must surely watch! Colourful and enjoyable. Music was wonderful. However rows were positioned so straight and stage was very low. By the way people were allowed to take pics by extra fee except entrance fee, so when people were starting to take pictures it becomes more difficult to watch. So I suggest to be closer to the stage at least till 5th row. ;)
Truly weird. Daughter had recommended this so went along. Very popular so I guess I am missing the point. Bizarre that's all I can say!

Charming. Very much recommended, if a little off the wall. The theatre is a little tatty, and hard to get a good view of the water at times, but a charming demonstration of Vietnamese artistic heritage which we will remember.

Entertaining show. Impressive puppetry. The puppeteers stand in a pool of water behind a screen and control puppets in front of the screen. Dialogue is all in Vietnamese but you can typically tell what is going on. Entertaining show that lasted about an hour. Shows start around 3pm until the afternoon and run until around 9pm or so every hour or 90 min.

Entertaining . The puppet show was very entertaining, good stories with some humour. The work of the puppeteers is incredible. The music is enjoyable and it's a great way to spend 1 hr. Be sure to go early and buy tickets a few hours ahead of the show time you want as its not a big theatre. Suggest the closer to the stage the better as some people's heads can get in the way of your view. If you are tall or above avg size seats can be tight. I'm 6'1 and it was a tight fit (seated row H). Overall great show and very affordable.

Unique, one of a kind marionette show. Beautiful music, especially the prelude before the show. Wasn't expecting such high quality live performance when we bought the tickets.The puppeteers were extremely skillful too, the resemblance to real life Vietnamese scenes were on point at certain scenes. However, the audience as observed during the show I was at were mostly travellers like me. As the performance is in Vietnamese, I struggled to understand most stories as I'm not well versed with the legends nor Vietnamese cultures, until I read the pamphlet in English. This however does not affect my enjoyment throughout the 50 minutes show.

17:20pm show. The water puppet show was an extremely unique experience which combined traditional Vietnamese music with a theatrical water puppet performance. In particular I appreciated being able to see the musicians and singers alongside the water puppets. The only downside of the show was that the movements of the puppets became a bit repetitive and predictable. Nonetheless I would still recommend this show.

Definitely worth a visit. A extremely well done and performed show. The music is exceptional and the performance is a joy to see. Although, the plot is a bit hard to see as it is all in Vietnamese but it's still very enjoying and entertaining to an extent and is a nice way to spend an hour in a theatre.

Strange. Interesting to see, especially just for $5. I think it is intended for an older generation or young children and people who understand Vietnamese because I had no idea what was going on. At the end all the puppeteers came out which was probably the best part but you could definitely tell that a lot of work had gone into making this show!
Different . A different experience, worth seeing only once, its all in vietnamese, a english version might be good
Kids love it . Not so much entertainment for adults but the kids really love it. Probably because there are many kids and legendary characters in fairy tale setting.

Loved the Orchestra and Singers. Best part of the show were the music and the singing. Could have used a primer on what the story line was but kind of figured it out as went along. Some of the scenes were rather childish but on the whole worth the 50 minutes to see this art live.

Unique experience . Have never seen anything like this before. The only reasons that it doesn't get five stars is administrative and not because of the quality of the show itself. First, there's no legroom between seat rows and is suitable for people who might be under 5'6". Second, they let people in who are late. So unlike other theater and live performances there's no deadline and therefore a constant barrage of latecomers interrupting the show.

An interesting look into Vietnam. I have mostly been going around looking at places that have educated me about the war and vietnams rebuilding since the war. So this was important for me because it was something completely different. We got tickets for 100,000D. I heard ticket prices vary but this was all they were offering. The music was traditional and fantastic. The puppet dancing was incredible and very unique. Leg room was a major concern - I have bad knees but managed the hour okay. Be warned though because it is a little cramped. Our session was probably only one third full so a lot of people decided to move forward and closer to the stage just as the show began which is also good value for money if you're concerned. We caught the 8pm show. They do around 3 shows per day, check their website to see what will suit you best. I definitely suggest trying to catch it! Plus there's so much to do and see in the old quarter so it is well worth a trip

Boring but you have to go to one. It's great for a few minutes but when the novelty of the water puppetry wore off I was just itching for it to end. It's famous in Hanoi so you have to go for the experience but, in my opinion, you could equally easily give it a miss.

Expected more...but ok. The puppet show was fine. However i thought the performers were a bit unprofessional since they were clearly chatting away during the performance. I know it's quite redundant for them and possibly not the best work conditions but i did expect a bit more. Oh and the entire show is in Vietnamese so some parts were lost but you can still follow along with the actions

I had high expectations. But was disappointed. Apparently there was some humour involved in the show but I didn't get the storyline or the humour. The musicians were great as were the puppeteers but was happy when it finished. Don't bother with the tourist trap restaurant underneath, pizza is terrible and expensive, no toilet paper or soap in the toilet which is shared with puppet theatre, very long queues after the show.

Unique experience. You just cannot believe that the puppeteers are all under the water until you see them emerge at the end. Very cleverly done and entertaining with well played live music. Reasonably priced and not to be missed.

Sweet experience. People who like what they do there. It starts with some traditional music, then the puppets. They present short scenes from the vietnamese life, most of them funny .. Fishing, dancing etc.

Best Puppet Show I've Ever Seen. . This was the best thing I've done in my 5 years of travelling. The ambience was magnifique and I particularly enjoyed the water aspect. Could not recommend enough. You should probably see it twice to really get it. You can't go to Hanoi without seeing this. Best. Thing. Ever. Can't believe such a treasure is ranked so low on trip advisor. PG though!!! People that have seen will understand ;) Immersion was incomparable- my friends and I completely forgot that we were in a theatre, when the puppeteers revealed themselves I actually jumped! A bit of advice though: book early and purchase the more expensive seats. You won't regret it when you're being splashed by the cool waters of the puppet show. In a sentence, it's like the sea world splash zone but with inanimate wooden puppets. Toilets could have been cleaner. All in all, 2/10.

I just don't get it. Well, I sort of knew ip front that I was not going to love it, but it was on my groups itinerary, so as Hanoi was really cold this day, I thought at least I could get warm and take a nap, as we already had checked out of our hotel.I was so wrong. First I could not fit my long legs in, My knees were in there neck of the guy in front of me.Then they started with a lullaby, that would give my nightmares had I been ready to sleep in that noise.When the puppets came, they were well made and the moved around looking good, but of course they speak vietnamese and play loud music.We were sitting right next to an exit, so half an hour in I managed to convince my polite husband to leave.The rest of the group had apparently managed to get a good nap :-)

interesting cultural experience. The water puppet show was interesting, but a bit boring. The puppet masters moved the water puppets cleverly and presented interesting skits. The musicians accompanying the puppet show were very good. We were happy to see this show which originally was presented only for royalty.

Interesting show. The puppet show is broken into a number of short acts each with a story line. Backed by traditional music from a live band, the puppets splash their way through water operated by a surprisingly large number of people. To be emit from the show you really need to pretend to be in a village in the Vietnam countryside and put yourself in the villagers shoes.
Must see, but dont expect too much. This is a must see, but you should not expect any fancy exceltional show, its just a "Kasperltheather" as we had in the TV long time ago.

Unusual and entertaining. Our tour group went to the water puppet show this afternoon. It began with live beautiful Vietnamese traditional music and singing. Short vignettes showing scenes from Vietnamese history and mythology were depicted by the masterfully capable puppeteers and the musicians. What a treat of sound, movement and color!

Short Performance Pleasant Surprise. I really enjoyed the Thang Long Water Puppet show. It was only an hour but it was very enjoyable. The artists are very talented at the way they manipulate the puppets. It does help if you have Asian puppets of south east Asia before. There is no English translation. Both musicians and puppeteers are all talented Tip : book early , arrive early , seats in the front row best options

Good fun watching water puppets splashing about. I made it very high on the list of things to do and it was great also with two teenagers in tow ! they really secretly they liked it but being so attached to social media it was a challenge for them, well mostly the music was a little out of their world. I found the music and singing fantasic.

Very enjoyable evening. Water puppetry is very traditional in Vietnam. We went one evening to see this show although there are many performances throughout the day. Very interesting how they manipulate these puppets under water. A little tough to understand as it's all in Vietnamese but you get the gist from watching the puppets.
A must to experience. Great value to experience a piece if Vietnamese culture. Seats aren't that great of us long legged westerners, try to get the front row. Enjoyable performance

The show was really nice. The theater building is near to the lake. The show was interesting but I think it's too short for me. They can make it little bit longer cause its great show btw. It's a interesting show that you have to try. It's worth it with they entrance fee.

OK if you like this sort of thing . We had two tickets courtesy of our travel company so went to one of the shows on our first night in Hanoi. I have to say I'm not really into this sort of thing, however as it is only 45 minutes, what's the harm.All in all, a pleasant and interesting experience, just don't expect excitement
Boring . Hard to see and all in Vietnamese with puppet actions unclear as to the storyline. Was clock watching for it to end... Not expensive though.

Puppetry and Vietnamese music. It's a nice way to experience some Vietnamese culture. There are leaflets in the lobby, and you can read the names of the acts/songs in English (some other languages too). This made it easier to follow the show. A con: some bad smell in the theater (not that surprising, since there's water inside the building), but it wasn't too bad, I enjoyed the show anyway.

Not for me. I can't understand why this is so popular - the theatre is filled several times a day (apparently mostly by large tour groups arriving in busloads).Although the music was nice, I found the puppet show very tedious.Perhaps there was a story, or a cultural context - but this wasn't explained to us. I should have just gone for another coffee instead of coming here.

We weren't thrilled.... This theatre production has potential....Though I think it's probably produced more for children, it could be enjoyed by all if it were produced in English. The show itself and the music is quite lovely but the message or lesson is completely lost on a foreign audience, because nothing is explained or explicit so my family and I walked away feeling disappointed and uninformed.This show would have been received better if there was an option to purchase English audio or if there were an English voice-over during the production. Seems a shame that the theatre doesn't cater to the genuinely interested tourist.

Interesting Cultural Experience. My wife and I attended the Thang Long Water Puppet show on a Thursday night in mid-January. Tickets were 100,000 dong each ($4.47 or 4.12 Euro each). The show is about 45 minutes long and provides some insight into the culture, history, and legends of Vietnam. I would recommend this after taking a few tours or reading at least a little about the country from guidebooks. I say this because the performance is not in English, but if you know things like the phoenix, turtle, unicorn, and dragon are sacred animals, for instance, you still get the gist of the performance. And even if you don't catch it all, the puppetry and accompanying music on local instruments are interesting. Overall, we think it's worth 45 minutes and $4.50. There are cheaper seats, 60,000, (about $3) and those tickets would be fine, too. The place is small enough that you can see from anywhere.
Very interesting . We had a nice time watching the water puppet show. You can also listen to live vietnamese instruments and songs. Worth visiting
Awesome show. A great place to see with the children, the show was fantastic to say the least. The children thoroughly enjoyed the puppets. A must place to visit.

Over rated tourist trap. Was disappointed in more ways than one. The seats are packed too close to each other with inadequate leg room. The gradient of the theatre is so poor that I had to crane my neck and then dodge the heads in front of you to get even 1/2 a view of a very average performance. Yes, it is definitely an unusual form of puppetry but I still feel it is too touristy & over-rated. Would not recommend unless you have nothing better to do.
Good Show. It was awsome and funny, but i really missed an explantion about the story, since it is all in vietnamese and we didn't understand.

Totally reccomended. Go watch this, it is an experience, and dont get the cheap ticket. It is worth paying the 100 000 for a good seat. It could be a good idea to book one day in advance to assure a front row seat. i was located in the middle, and would have loved to be a little closer.

Interesting show. It's something you kind of need to see when your here. It's so special and only performed here in Vietnam. I like the fact that you don't need to understand the language to get the point of the story.
Worth a visit. Went here with my wife one night. It's a great way to immerse oneself in local culture. We really enjoyed this. Maybe a little too long and repetitive but that's being pedantic.

Worth a watch if the weathers bad. Watched the water puppets last night. All in vietnamese but watchable. Lasted approx 50mins and aome funny parts in it and we had never been to a water puppet show Seeing as it was 5 degrees outside we prefered being here for an hour and for 100,000VND it wasnt scandalous. You can get seats for 60,000VND if your really on a budget. All the seats are the same. Just further back.Iwouldnt say its a must see but i enjoyed it for what it was

Disappointing. After having such a great show in ho chi Minh, we decided to go to see the one of Hanoi. Such a disappointment! Personal was not nice, show had no energy, you could feel that they do it five times a day and are tired of it. If you have the chance to go to ho chi Minh as well, keep it for there and avoid this tourist trap in Hanoi. Maybe the puppets of Hanoi are fancier, but you can feel that the artists were not happy to make the show.

Worth a Visit . We visited the water puppet theater as part of a tour group. It was a very entertaining hour long show. The puppets are operated by people who wade in the water off stage or behind the curtains so you won't see them except when they come out to take a bow at the end of the show. Not sure how much the show costs if you pay by the single admission.
Bigriverbill . Nice 45 minute presentation. Not very expensive and they pack the place. Seats were a little tight but I'm a little bigger than the average Vietnamese person.
It is fun way of expressing Vietnamese legends . :) don't miss it!! Read the write up before the show, helps you connect the dots as the whole act is in Vietnamese

Cool to see buy photography and cell phone should not be allowed!. Of course if you go to Hanoi you have to see the water puppet show.Buy tickets at the door.60 000 to 100 000 vdn ( not even 6$ cad )All presentations were full and it was totally chaotic outarde but glad I went.Flashes and cell phone display was extremely annoying.Should not be allowed.
Cool. Seriously a cool show. Not really my idea of fun but I appreciated it. Probably more suitable for families.

Great fun - a must!. The farmers used to spend their time inbetween rice harvests playing in the village pond and this is now a full scale attraction in Hanoi and other cities in Vietnam. The performance is around an hour and there are skits of different scenes of village life. Highly entertaining for all ages!

Unique and very good performance!. We've never watched a water puppet show before. But it was a very entertaining and pleasant surprise. Majority of the show is in Vietnamese (we can't understand but it's OK). The language does not matter as the performance spoke for itself.Ticket costs between 60.000 - 100.000 VND ($3-5) and can be purchased at doors or by contacting the theater.

Very good performance . Really professional performance. The traditional music was very high quality and the puppet show was well performed. I would recommend this puppet show over the other shows available in Han Nói.

Good Concept but Boring. Water puppets are quite different to the usual puppet shows but once the novelty of the concept wears off, the show tends to drag a bit and becomes boring. This is also possibly because the show is in Vietnamese and difficult to understand past the general plot.
Great show. A bit touristy but still great. It was the first time I've seen this kind of puppet show. The content is based on vietnamese folk stories and very self explanatory and easy to understand.

Nice show. I had this show after the street food tour... it realy nice... the show tell us some stories in the pass and some activities of Vietnamese!
Highly recommend!

Great show. Terrible audience. The show was absolutely excellent, the music was mesmerizing with humorous short stories told through puppetry. The only issue was the loud and rude audience, we watched most of the show through the rows of phones recording the show with shaky never to be rewatched footage. The people directly in front of us took a phone call and kept turning on their torch to read.
Simply amazing!. It is an amazing water performance! Fun for children and adults alike. You will love this show. At the end they sell some of the wood puppets.
Good to watch . I'm not a fan of musical, however this is a fairly unique and well done experience which I'd recommend for anyone to see at least once in their lives.

Interesting show but context lacking. While the show was visually pleasing, we had a hard time following the themes. A bit more of an explanation, either verbally or in writing, would have give us a better understanding of what was going on.
A cute show . A 45min show with water puppets, cute and entertaining! Live music and song to the show. 100'vnd or 60'vnd depending on your seat.

Really entertaining and different. Having never watched a water puppet show below this was a very entertaining and pleasant surprise. Some English commentary was offered in the beginning but the majority of the show is in Vietnamese. But the language does not matter as the performance spoke for itself.

Interesting but........ We were interested to come and see the water puppet show, but after nearly 1 hour it was just too long. They need to shorten the show by half an hour. there were people all around us asleep after 5 minutes. I don't like putting up bad reviews but I have to be honest. It was interesting at the start and I enjoyed it for about 30 minutes. decide for yourself.
Adorable. the artists and the instruments they were playing were too good,and also the entry of the dragons with fire.never seen a puppet show like this .

Interesting to watch nice music. The music is great as they use the traditional old instruments with a modern flair. Visually the show is interesting but no synopsis is provided and there are no subtitles so there is no way of following the story.
It's ok.. The tickets are very cheap, so going to a show is ok. It is not a briljant show ans seats are small, but as already mentioned. It is ok.
Water Puppet show.. It was a good 45 minute entertainment.It was worth it watching the dancing puppets and fire breathing dragons.Thats the ones on the water stage not the Chinese tourists.Good show.
Loved this!. You cannot come to Hanoi and not see the water puppets. They are a great mix of culture and entertainment. Brilliant for all ages. Loved it!
Don't miss this!. We weren't planning to see this but our guide insisted and we are so grateful. It is not expensive and is utterly charming and a true representation of an ancient folk art form.

Interesting. We watched the water puppet show. It was good specially the first few mins is very interesting. But a little bit boring to keep on watching. There were some very interesting scenes that would catch the attention. However, English was hardly used and sometimes you don't understand the story when Vietnamese is used.

A 'must see' if your're into Vietnamese culture and you like music.. What an entertaining evening! This theatre features almost a dozen puppet masters hidden behind the curtain, working their very entertaining wooden water puppets, as well as several musicians entertaining you on these unique Vietnamese instruments. Our $5 was very well spent! Good for the family.

Unique experience.... I visited with a group last week and was surprised at how well it is done.It is an inexpensive way to spend the evening and you won't be disappointed unless you're one of those hard to please tourists.The music was a highlight even tho some of the stories were hard to follow as it was all in Vietnamese it was still a performance to admire.

Unique that I haven't seen anywhere else in the world. I & my spouse were able to get the tickets for the last show.
Despite the fact that we were very tired from a hectic day's schedule, the show kept us fully engrossed.
The puppets are colourful with the background music & theme that give a good flavour of Vietnaam's culture.

Entertaining despite the language barrier. This is in a small theatre with stadium style seating. I was intrigued as to how this would work before it started. I found it quite clever and probably hard work for the puppeteers. The dialogue and music were all in Vietnamese but they had handed out a pamphlet explaining the story in English first, and often it was quite clear what was happening anyway. It was amusing and entertaining. The kids loved it and I enjoyed it too. It was a fun evening out. Beware all of the vendors at the entrance - there were heaps on the lookout for tourists.
A real gem.. Fantastic show. Even our 2year old boy sat like mesmerized. Don't miss this experience. Did not understand a thing (vietnamese) but it doesn't matter. Very professional.

Water Puppets. I was lucky enough to be taken to this water puppet show on my last night in Hanoi. It celebrities the culture of the city and country and is a taste of the history all wrapped into one. I did find it much more enjoyable in terms of understanding it by been there with a local person who helped explain a lot of the meanings. It features a live band and really is quite neat.

Nice place with different experience. We have been there on December. Place is near lake so it serene show is good. The only thing I have notice this is entire in Vietnamese and people who are there are most foreigner, It would be nice if things are in english.Show was full on the day visited but somehow we got seat and able to watch.Overall good for onetime.
Cool, but very long!. Before booking, know that the show is 1 hour long. it's well orchestrated but really becomes a bit much after 20 minutes.

Visually dramatic. Whilst the water puppeteer img is very skilled and the puppets are beautiful, I found it hard to follow despite the information. The musicians were excellent which helped the overall impact..

Love this place. I have been here several times and still love seeing it. Such a unique cultural gem. Buy the more expensive tickets so you are closer to the front. Also get there early as huge bus groups pitch up right before the show. There are several showings a day and they are about an hour or so.
Entertaining . Entertaining. Had front row. Price good but didn't understand what the story was about because not in English. Did enjoy

A must visit...Lovely !!. It gives an insight of Vietnamese culture and music. The musicians, singers and people performing the puppet show were excellent. The performance was mesmerizing. Enjoyed it to the fullest. It was a unique experience. Kids also liked it.We had got the tickets booked in advance thru our hotel guys. So did not have to wait in the queue.

Listen Carefully to What your Concierge says Between the Lines. Here's a dialogue with my concierge:Me: What do you think of the water puppet show?She: it is a bit longMe: how long is the show all in all?She: forty five minutes.Me: hmmI should have understood the hint, but I was a bit dense, and I went to the show. Most fortunately I was tired that day and so I dozed off and the time went faster

Fun show . We had an hour to kill and glad we went. For the price you pay, it was a decent enough show. We arrived an hour before our show and were able to buy tickets with great seats. From what I saw they do not offer any refreshments (there is a coffee shop next door) so we brought our own drinks to the show.

Ruined by the audience & their cameras!!!. I attended the 8pm puppet show after booking premium seats at approximately 1pm the same day. When we arrived we were seated in row G which is 1/2 way to a 3rd of the way up the seating rows. The best seating row is 'A'. The show starts with delightful instrumental music & soon after the puppet action starts.At this point every narrow minded & inconsiderate twit pulls out their smart phone or camera & starts holding it up in front of your view & snapping away at terrible photos. For the entire show I had almost every person from row 'A' to 'F' holding up their recording divides, flashes and all. Then there are the people who can't sit in their allocated seats & end up blocking the view for about 10 people behind them. For the short time I got to get a glimpse at the show & story line I thought it was absolutely fantastic. Bottom line is, make sure you get seated in row A or book out the whole theatre for yourself.

Excellent Water Puppet Show but ..... The show is very good and defintly not to miss if you are in Vietnam for the first time, except that we also stopped in our way back from Halong Bay in a farming village to see a show in an outdoor theatre, although the show was shorter it felt 100 times nicer and more authentic than the show inside the Hanoi Theater.Overall the show is very intresting and it depicts some of the most important Vietnam cultural aspects and Hanoi legends through the unique water puppets.We also had no issue coming there 40 minutes before and getting tickets 4 standard ticket for an evening session, we got the row before last and you could see perfectly OK. The show is long enough to be intresting but not too long to get tedious so our 6 and 10 year old kids also enjoyed it.

Great show with small seats. The show was very colourfull in the water with traditional live music. But in the theater are very small seats. Suggestion for tall people, ask for a chair to have a seat on the stairway. Or in the 1st row.

VIEW TO BE AMAZED. It's not often I gush about traditional shows but this one was worth watching.Humorous and fun.The puppets are so well crafted they look almost alive and in a deft change of hand swim effortlessly across the shallow pond.With a mix of history and folk lore the show was really entertaining.I would advice those planning a visit here ,to first take the day tour offered by agents to understand the historical parts of this show, like the story of the general and the mythical turtle sword.Fun for the family too, we were laughing and recounting parts on our way home too...

Kind of a must. This is a bit of a cultural icon in hanoi. I found it worth seeing but once was more than enough. There really isn't much difference between the 100k seats and 60k ones so that's a pretty easy way to save some coin.

Entertaining. I was surprisingly amused by the show throughout the 45 minutes. It was not exactly what I had expected where the seats were similar to what one gets in a cinema and the puppets were handled from behind screens. But still worth the experience.

Water Puppets. We decided to visit the Water Puppet Theatre because we felt it was important to try to understand the culture of the Vietnamese culture. There are many shows in the afternoon and evening. Each performance lasts about 45 minutes. It is a good idea to book your tickets. We did not buy the premium tickets but we could easily see the performance. We were about half way back in the theatre. There were a number of different stories. I think we managed to understand most of the stories but be aware the performance is in Vietnamese. It is colourful and at times humorous. It is not expensive and is worth the effort.

Water Puppet Theatre. Great value. Great taste of Viennese iconography. Very clever artists. Highly recommend. Children should sit on an adult knee or a cushion. It was a bit difficult to see in the full theatre.
Fun show!. A nice way to spend an hour watching something typically Vietnamese. Very good value at 100k VND. There are three showings a day and usually tickets available on the day. Go!

Charming and fun. The show latest just under an hour and it was a great amusement. Very impressive how the actors operate, act and sing at the same time in tune with the live Vietnamese music as well.
For the evening shows get there early as they sell out quickly.
Overall a great experience and highly recommended.
Not bad. Interesting show but is a bit childish in presentation. Only presented in vietnamese so not that easy to follow but a cultural experience none the less

Entertaining and well performed!. This was a very nice and cultural experience! The creativity and effects in the water was very impressive! I was entertained the whole show, even though it was not in English. And the small orchestra next to the water, were vert talented, playing on instruments thats i have never seen or heard before. Definitely worth seeing! It's a good idea to book ahead as it can be crowded - especially the late shows.
Nice show . We did enjoy the show. Nice puppets and music. It die not last too long so it dir not get boring. Seats are too small for european guys.
great show. The music and puppetry were great - a must-see in Hanoi. Great for kids - show is under an hour - good views from anywhere in theater.

Absolutely charming . If you attend this and aren't utterly charmed, drop everything and call up a search party, because clearly you have lost your inner child. It starts slow but is funny, clever, and captivating. The music is also beautiful and catchy. The only downside is the audience whipping out their cameras throughout but you can't really blame them because this is so cute, you don't want to forget it!
Very interesting. A must see!! But book ur seats ahead as the front seats are the best. Dont take large bags & shopping bags with u as the chairs are small

Really fun but leave your camera at home!. The show's just under an hour long, and it's great! You can see the orchestra play traditional instruments, and the puppetry is amazing. There are dragons, phoenixes, fairies... I didn't know what to expect, and I'm really glad I went, as it's an important part of Vietnamese culture.HOWEVER... People with cameras, camera phones and iPads ruined the view sometimes. I found it frustrating trying to lean over to avoid seeing the show through someone's iPhone screen. So please, do the audience a favour, and enjoy the show WITHOUT filming it or taking pictures of it.

Great cultural experience. Definitely recommend this for an insight into Vietnamese culture.Performed in Vietnamese, it can be a little difficult for non Vietnamese speakers to understand. It runs for about 50 min and has pretty remarkable tricks with the puppets.Beware the seats offer very limited leg room.Customer service at reception was absolutely appalling. She was too busy answering 2 personal calls on the mobile and 1 call on the work phone than responding to any of our queries.Would recommend sitting in VIP seating, but above row B to be sure you don't get wet (as some others have suggested).

My first water puppet show!. I missed seeing this show in my previous visit to Hanoi. Hence this time, the hotel I stayed in (Hanoi Elegance Emerald) assisted me in procuring tickets for that Sunday show which was my first day of arrival.Although the songs were all in Vietnamese, and I really didn't know what it was all about, I recommend seeing this at least once, if only to pay homage to this unique puppet show. The costumes of the puppet, lighting, stage and singers as well as musicians give us a good performance (even though I bet they've probably could have done this in their sleep with all the performances they do every day!).If you are staying at the Old Quarter and near the Hoan Kiem Lake, pop on over to this theater and get your tickets earlier so that you can choose which time and seat you will have when you see the show. I think its best if you sit a bit nearer to the front because sometimes you have people with bigger heads and bodies blocking your view (funnily, one or two guys were apparently sleeping in some acts).Arrive earlier so that you can queue decently as well as not disturb other folks who may already be seated or if the show has already started.There's a couple of shows scheduled every day, usually starting mid-afternoon.We got the VND 100,000 ticket and were seated comfortably away from any water splashing which may inadvertently occur.You can buy some souvenir puppets in the lobby area, or you can enjoy a cup of Vietnamese coffee when you leave the theater.

Great Educational Show. A very nice way of sharing the Vietnamese tradition and their local musical instruments.Very talented musicians and singers and of course the back stage team who together an extremely brilliant Water Puppet show with added humour.Bring your kids and am sure they will enjoy it. Fun and educational and there is no language barrier for sure.

Fun and unusual. Could get a more interesting 50 minutes if you tried. Love the fire breathing water dragons! Worth your while going to see it. It is not dear but get in a little early to ensure you have tickets.

once is enough. been here 3 times, because i brought 3 different groups of people to hanoi. once is sufficient especially if you dont understand vietnamese. tickets are relatively cheap at about 3usd/pax, for a 45min show.

Something different. Skilful and worth a look if you are in Hanoi. Ladies seemed to enjoy the experience more than the men. Live orchestra and a skilled single string harpist. Full Vietnamese story made it quite challenging to embrace the experience. PS - some napping may have occurred.

A must see! Great fun. . People of all ages will love it. Entertaining- cheap outing - easy to locate / right next to the lake. Best ice cream I've ever tasted - passion fruit, coconut and mango yoghurt. We had a cheap foot massage from a place a few doors up and fell asleep.

Not to be missed.. This is perhaps one of the best tourist features in Hanoi. Its a memorable hour or so watching the puppet characters play out a host of Vietnamese stories. For the cost of about $6 Aus, its great value and a unique show.The live music itself was amazing and the group of 6 to 8 musicians and singers brought that SE Asian atmosphere to life. Although the songs were all in Vietnames, the music and the puppet characters, together, made the story come alive. A spacious theatre with plenty of tiered seats so there is no panic to grab the first few front rows. tickets and bookings are done at the entrance throughout the day with several shows sarting about 1330 through to 2100.There is a bit of a museum in the theatre lobby with toilets and a cafe.A show not to be missed.

Fantastic . We went to the 3pm show not knowing what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed the 50 min experience. Both the puppets and the musicians fascinated us. Afterwards it was possible, of course, to buy puppet characters that appeared in the show but there was no hard sell and prices were a lot lower than the gift shops were charging. Well worth a visit for a taste of Vietnamese folk history.

Quaint, cute and funny. Quaint puppet show. Be careful because the booking office and theatre are not together which caused us to arrive late to the performance. A display with English translation would be helpful because we could not understand the narrative. But overall worth a visit.
Intersting. The show was well done but not in English so we were unsure what was going on. The seats were quite close together which was uncomfortable for my 6 foot tall husband.

Squishy squashy splashy with Water Puppets. Many people suggested we make this a top priority to visit during our stay in Hanoi.Travelling with an 8 and 5 year old we thought they would love this, and they did. It was creative and a magical experience which had us captivated for the duration - 50minutes.The only downside, which we coped with, was the legroom, or rather lack of. I'm not tall but at 5ft 4in even I struggled with folding myself in and out of the seat. My husband is over 6ft...Despite the legroom issue I would recommend this enthralling show

Charming, Amusing and good fun. Well worthwhile for a bit of fun. Really great traditional music and adorable skits with puppets in water. No need to speak Vietnamese as the humor is easy to understand. Only problem is the audience and their damn cell phones being held up in front of your view and flash photography blinding you. Try and sit near the front or in one of the side chairs as I found it hard to see at 5foot 2inches.

Great Entertainment For All. Great entertainment for all ages and types of people. The show is compromised of puppets performing in water to live music, lasting approx 1hr. I'd recommend advanced ticket purchase as it can sell out quite quickly.

A peek in the water theater!. This is one of Hanoi's main tourist attraction. The show was alright, maybe it is just not one of our likings. It is a old folk story accompanied by musical instruments. The only interesting part which we found amazing was that the pupet masters are so good that they are able to hold their breathe in the water for a long time.

Water Puppets. An amazing spectacle. We were seated in comfy seats and attended to by an English speaking guide. The show was fantastic. So inspiring and active. Excellent entertainment for the whole family.

A great cultural show for the whole family. A tourist-accessible showing of an important Vietnamese cultural performance, combining traditional instruments, singers, and choreographed carved wooden puppets being manipulated on bamboo poles on the other side of the screen. We bought our very affordable tickets earlier in the day from the easily seen ticket booth. Located right by Hoan Kiem Lake. Get there early. Hopefully you won't be stuck in front of tall people who, because of seating arrangement, obscure the view!

A must if in Hanoi!. This is a fantastically entertaining 45 minute show of traditional Vietnamese folk art. Alas, it is spoiled by other members of the audience holding up cameras and video recording devices. PLEASE Thang Long, stop this distraction! Remember to take a free "programme" from the rack outside the auditorium entrance as it has a list of the scenes.

Must see if you are interested in VN culture. Definitely a must see if you want to learn a little bit about VN culture, and dont have much time. But it is always full, so you will have to take tickets in advance most of the time (take the tickets in the morning for a show.in the afternoom for example)

Cultural activity worth watching. Water puppet show is a cultural activity in Hanoi you can enjoy. There will be a band performing the background music for the show at the side. You will be given a piece of paper which is the introduction of the show. Even though the show is performed in Vietnamese however it is very easy to understand the plot.

A must see and do in Hanoi - abosolutely. I was not too keen on this touristy thing to do, not because it’s touristy but because I imagined it was highly cheesy and boring. WOW! Was I ever wrong. At about 45-minutes long, the water puppet show we saw on Tien Hoang Street was absolutely the most amazing thing. The puppets were fascinating but more than that I was transfixed by the musicians playing. I do not want to write anymore but I highly recommend this activity for the whole family – minus infants.Try to get seats close the front. You must get tickets ahead of time because we barely got tickets for our 6pm show. Bear in mind there are several water puppets shows in Hanoi – we saw the THANG LONG WATER PUPPET show. Check it out! Cost 100 VND.
Hanoi Water Puppets. The water puppet show is in Vietnamese so much of it was hard to follow. Great costumes and music. More entertaining for children than adults.

Probably Good for Children, So So for Adults. A very simple way to spend an hour in Hanoi. I really liked the traditional music and the puppet costumes were beautiful and colorful. The show is simple in theme and the seats were uncomfortable for anyone over 5'5".

Very touristy puppet show . This is cute but gets old quick so don't expect something experimental or edgy. If you are 6' or over don't go unless you have front row seats. Otherwise you're in for 45 minutes of agony.

A good one hour experience. It was good to see something new and well worth its money. Just not anything spectacular. Would help if non Vietnamese speakers would umderstand the stories played. Music beautiful.

Water Puppet show. Amazing!!
Highly recommended. Get there 20mins plus earlier to get best seats.
Beautiful music also!
Vietnam . Once you watch this, you can understand many things about their history. Well played, it wasn't childish at all.

Must See!. This is traditional Vietnamese and was recommended to us. We went with our 2 adult (20"s) daughters and 14 yr old daughter and we all loved it! Many shows to pick from but you should buy tickets in advance to ensure seating, maybe day before. Tickets are 60,000 dong-100,000 dong (better seats) or $3.00-$5.00 US. Shows are 45" and incorporate Vietnamese music!

Very nice and advice for good seats. First, the puppet show was very good and the music nice. It is fascinating how much strength the puppeteers need to do this job. It was a great performance and just long enough. We went the day before to get tickets for the next evening but they were sold out. The had tickets for the next day 2:30 performance so we bought those. We had the first 2 seats in the first row. Wonderful. So you might want to try that approach.

Painless way to spend an hour!. This was an unexpected stop for me, my 12-year-old, and my 10-year-old. All three of us found it entertaining and painless -- it's worth the 3 USD each that we paid. It's nice to catch a glimpse of a cultural aspect of Vietnam. Definitely memorable...!Annoyances: Theatre did smell vaguely of urine. Theatre staff should implement hockey-game style admittance for late-comers -- only allow entry to those arriving late between scenes. Total disregard for signs stating "No photographs" throughout performance -- tell me this...are you REALLY going to watch the video you took of this later????Bought tickets an hour before showtime on New Year's Day. Got seats in the last row and were perfectly content with our view.

Well presented (if a bit incomprehensible). I'd read mixed reviews of Water Puppet theature, but was pleased we went to this one. the presentation, live band and puppetry was all first rate. As this is a national cultural icon it was of course all in Vietnamese, unfortunately we couldnt get anything to translate what was happening into English, so no doubt we missed some of the sublety! No matter, we could still make out the main intent of each vignette, and enjoyed the show irrepective. It only went for 45 minutes, and at $6/person, was great value for seeing something truly different.

Interesting entertainment . I had fairly low expectations but found it really lovely experience. Music was really interesting on traditional instruments. Costumes lovely. The show was about 45 minutes long and had a lot of short play scenes with really humorous and interesting acts. I would recommend!

A cultural experience. This is a charming small show that captures the traditions and spirit of the Vietnamese people.
The old theater is an attraction itself and the 50 minutes show is a delight.

Worth the visit. Really enjoyable show, the kids enjoyed it and it was something different to do in Hanoi. Maybe a bid more information about what was happening in the show may have been useful but entertaining to watch none the less.Be careful of pick pockets out the front of the theatre, we had a guy with his hands on my wife's pack pack , but when he saw my daughter watching he disappeared into the crowd....but this happens in most tourist areas. Don't let it stop you seeing the show, just be careful.

Good show with live folk music. Lovely experience of traditional village storytelling through water puppets. A must-do in Hanoi. But do arrive on time. The shows start promptly and noisy latecomers spoil it for the rest!

Well preserved and presented. Contrary to the other reviewers I like the show very much. The music and setting took me into another space/time immediately and the lack of subtitle meant that the performance became completely alien to me which added a mystical quality to the whole thing. The puppetry is very well done, kids are especially excited to see actual objects moving around the stage, that's the magic of a show that actually involves some physicality instead of just moving images. For sure its touristic and people take photos/vids with their phones and make noises but isn't that nice to enjoy a show once in a while with interaction from the audience and just pure innocent fun? Completely great for the price and experience.

Good show if you are traveling with kids. The show is entertaining and well produced. We travelled with a 7 year old so it was a must do. But, it's the type of attraction you can skip if you don't have time or prefer to spend time outdoors. It does sell out, so buying tickets in advance is probably a good idea.

Very good . The staff of hotel was recommend us to looking water puppet theater at the end of December 2015. It's special and good experience in Hanoi, Vietnam. Strong recoommend to other travellers for acknowledge

Great Show!. The show was amazing and funny. I can't believe the artistry behind the live music and skillful puppetry. It made for great visuals and wonderful sounds. I would definitely recommend this art show to others. The only downsides were that people in the audience were talking loudly for the entirity of the show and that the room was freezing.

Better than expected . I wasn't quite sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the water puppet performance. The live music was good and the program handout made it easy to follow. Seats where pretty comfortable and the performance went for just about the right length of time.
It's a Vietnam tradition. If you like puppets its a must see, but maybe overpriced and more of a tourist thing than a visitor thing.I could think of other sites worth more for the price

Only If Time Permits. I was disappointed with the show. Firstly I booked seats early & right in the middle. I turned up just as the show started & could not get to my seats as there is absolutely no room between the seats to squeeze by. So if you want to go you MUST get front row seats or else you'll get blocked views from the people in front of you videoing etc. Also there was a constant damp smell throughout the show which made me feel uncomfortable. Finally, unless you understand Vietnamese it's difficult to know what is actually happening, hence there should be an English session of the show programmed.
Avoid. Longest hour of my life. The seats have absolutely no legroom, so I sat crammed up the entire time. Everything is also in Vietnamese, so if you don't speak the language there's no point.
Very interesting. A good way to understand ancient culture of Vietnam. Local little orchestra besides the stage. Deserves a go by all tourists. Recommended.

Very funny theatre! Очень забавный театр!. The water's puppet show is very funny! National music and short history's movies about life of Vietnams people is very interesting! take A-C lines, better on middle. .. fine view! Этот водный театр кукол очень забавный! национальная музыка и короткие сценки о жизни вьетнамских жителей очень интересны! берите билеты на 1-3 ряд... отлично видно!

A must do if you are in Hanoi. Go and see this! Ticket prices are less than 10 dollars and the performance is unique to Vietnam. The puppet masters bring the puppets to life to the accompaniment of soulful Vietnamese folk singing and traditional instruments. The whole thing is in Vietnamese but it does not matter - it is about life of the folk and their traditions with some mystical creatures making an appearance. You will get the drift.
Amazing . If you visit Hanoi you must see the Thang Long Water Puppets show - it amazing, very artistic and entertaining - and very affordable (USD $3-$5) - lasts about 45min.
30 minutes longer than it needs to be. Definitely great value for money, although after the half way mark it seemed to drag on a bit for me personally.

Fantastic authentic cultural experience . It was suggested to us by the hotel staff, to go and see a Vietnamese puppet show. We were surprising very impressed. The mechanics behind the puppets were unbelievable!! Although it was in Vietnamese the light and sound effects helped to portray a story. This was a much enjoyed experience and you should definitely check it out when in Hanoi

Cute . We went to see this show on New Year's Eve. It is a short show - 45 minutes which is about right. The music is great. It is one of those shows that for 100k dong you really have to see, even if you don't understand Vietnamese. Make sure you get the tickets up the front otherwise you will struggle to see.

Fun and different entertainment. We really enjoyed the Water Puppet show that was full of colour and comedy. We did need to buy our tickets the day before the show as some shows were already sold out.
Cute. We were entertained by all the puppets, even though we couldn't understand what they were saying! Try to get seats in the first row

Interesting - but not a must see!. Enjoyed the show and was fascinated by the traditional music, puppets / puppeteers and story (which was a little hard to make sense of!). Just don't go expecting a top quality production. Was worth the 60,000 spent on tickets...

Intriguing.. So weird but so cool.
I was intrigued by everything. The muscles, the movements, the grace of it all and my god it was just so weird that I couldn't look away. There was a point where I had to ask myself what the heck I was watching again but I'm so glad I went.
Worth the money.

Entertaining but not impressed. The show was similar as the one I saw earlier at the Vietnam Museum of Ethnology (for free), they were both telling same stories about the activities of rural Vietnam, can be quite humorous sometimes. Appreciate the details and effort put into the short skits.Had to buy the tickets 3 days prior the show hoping to get the best seats. The lady at the counter was on the phone the whole time and got my tickets wrong at first. Wasn't very attentive when I wanted to change dates.My experience would have been more enjoyable if my view wasn't blocked by tall audiences and an audience trying to record the show (me being short, I was irritated) and I was sitting at the 4th/5th row. Tips: 1. Get your tickets as early as possible.2. Be considerate of the people behind you.
55 mins boredom . It's cultural yes, but you can skip it. My teenaged son would have rather people watched from a cafe in the area. It's not a "must see"

Different . Enjoyed it as it was so unique ..and pretty cheap.a must visit when in hanoi.They put in a lot of efforts and many people behind the puppetry..However one hour becomes a stretch to my mind ..40minute would have been crisp.The attached cafe is a bonus...Do go
Water puppets with teens. Water puppet shows are a traditional VN form of theater, entertaining for a few minutes on a rainy day. Teens were itching to leave after 5 minutes.

Snooze fest for my demographic. . If you are not that inclined to culture, traditional folk music, and wooden puppets portraying paddy field farmers, water buffaloes, snakes and dragons then this is probably one you will be forced to sit through with your travel companions that are! It was more or less annoying as the puppet show given by the Von Trapp family in sound of snoozic... But if that's your bag then you will most likely enjoy this show. (Both my children slept through half of it)The outside of the theatre is always full of street traffic, petrol fumes and people, which makes getting inside quite a battle. Be warned, the leg room is minimal inside the theatre. I recommend a nice coffee shop to sit in and wait for the others while they watch the show!

A must-see show that is breathtakingly amazing. This was the highlight of my free-and-easy visit to Hanoi. The mere title of the show conjures images of puppets prancing, dancing, floating on water. True to the title, the puppets are brought to life by the skillful and adept manouvering of behind-the-screen 'players'. The unraveling of the Vietnamese peasantry folklore story really kept me at the edge of my seat even though it was in their native language. The crystal clear sound effects and seamless performance of the water puppets are unparalleled to other performances I have watched hitherto. At the end of the show, I gave these superb water puppet 'players' a standing ovation. It's highly recommended to visitors to Hanoi.

Quirky piece of local culture. I have long been fascinated with Asian puppets, particularly those used in the Ramayana. This show is something else. Apparently water puppetry originated in northern Vietnam and this show is a good example of the tradition. Location: The theatre is located off the northeastern part of the Hoan Kiem Lake.Tickets: bought at the theatre for 60,000 or 100,000 VND. The theatre is small, but children will get better views at the front. Performances are almost on an hourly basis see photo for current times.Show: a series of short sketches, mixing comedy and legend, accompanied by a live folk band. All singing and lines are in Vietnamese and on our visit there were no subtitled performances or information in any other language for sale at the theatre.Overall: enchanting show, one is completely immersed by the scenery and music (we had front roll seats and did not get splashed with water!). However some of the singers were clearly bored to have to sing the same songs for hours on a daily basis. Still, the show is highly recommended!
Puppet theatre 1 hour show . Well worth an hour, very colourful and quaint. Excellent production and cheap as chips :) good location next to the lake also

Very busy Very interesting ... Get there early to get tickets ...queue can be long and there queue to use toilet at the cafe next door are even longer so be prepare .. There are paid toilets available across the road if urgent ..the show is very interesting without translation or sub title screen but I still managed to enjoyed it very much

ahhhmazingggg. a must see in hanoi!! what a beautiful and talented show this is. although it is all in vietnamese, you can get a small show schedule which describes each performance. the music is so beautiful. the performance is out of this world. so well done and well worth the money which is super cheap. i could watch this show again and again. be sure to purchase tickets well in advance. sadly tickets cannot be purchased online. but they run out super quick even if there are 4-5 shows per day! the only disappointing and bad things about this place is there was a huge rat running around loose in the theatre!! this rat was not scared of the people at all. it was so huge and i am not a huge fan of them. so having to watch my feet for this was very difficult and quite disgusting task to do. i hope this will not be there in the future as its such a shame.

Mixed reviews. I really enjoyed the water puppet show but my boyfriend didn't- making our joint view 'average'. Although it is a bit 'tourist trappy' I love theatre and anything different that I haven't seen before and this ticked those boxes for me. The live music and the beauty of the puppets as well as the stories told made it very enjoyable. Be sure to do some research on Hanoi legends (particularly that of the turtle) to enhance your experience. My boyfriend on the other hand found it 'boring' and struggled to stay awake- can't please them all!

Kind of what I expected . Well the show was kind of what we expected, a puppet show on water as the name suggests.Nothing we've ever seen before so the concept was interesting...Booked tickets through our hotel and just paid and picked up on arrival. Were told the show was booked out although there were quite a few seats left, I imagine people book like we did but because no payment is made until you get there it is no big deal for them to do a no show if they feel like it. Because of that I would rock up to a show even if it says booked out as I imagine it happens to most of the sittings.Chairs were small in leg room and I imagine a problem for tall people. Show only goes for 45 min all in Vietnamese. I agree with others it would help to have it spoken or at least subtitled in English. This is a show aimed at tourists, most of who cannot understand a word.It seemed to be lots of little skits. Some we caught on to the meaning, some we didn't.Most exciting thing was near the beginning, some of the sparklers caught the curtain on fire and there was an audible gasp from the audience but the flames were quickly put out by someone backstage with the water from the pool! Needless to say it had me looking for the nearest exit just in case...It was a good way to kill some time and see a bit of Vietnamese culture.

a handful of Vietnamese art and culture!!. a visit to Hanoi is incomplete without witnessing the Thang long water puppet theatre located in the heart of the city right next to the sword lake. we bought 100 VND tickets and must say it was worth it...sitting right in the front and seeing the magic on water. they open with a small rendition of the traditional music including a single stringed harp performance which is brilliant. the water puppetry is a definite must visit in hanoi.

Great show!. This show is well worth it if you are in Hanoi.It's not very expensive and a very entertaining show.Be aware you will need to get tickets in advance, we went to the ticket counter the morning of the showing we wanted to see and they only had 9:15pm available. If you only have a short amount of time in Hanoi then might be worth getting your hotel to help purchase tickets for you.Inside the theatre is very warm and the seats are snug, as is every other seat in Vietnam!The puppet show is fascinating and very enjoyable, don't miss it!

Nice to see the traditional culture. A must see for only 100k for best seats.Sunday mornings they have a kids show I think I should of attended that one as baby was scared a few times. Overall enjoyed.

Unique show. Was interesting, since I've never seen water puppets or such a show before. The musicians were really talented and played unique instruments. Do note that it fills up fast. And try getting the more expensive seats. The cheaper ones are very uncomfortable for moderately tall people. Also, don't expect English subtitles.

Good show. Good show with many talented artists. Only down side is the seats are pretty cramped and they let people after it starts so you are constantly getting blocked by them. Also the no photography policy is not really enforced so you end up watching through the camera of the people in front.

Christmas treat. Nice but booked in Australia and when got here found out the price was $6 each not $36 !!!!! Booked through viator. Was cross to get ripped off . We did get a tour of the old city for half an hour after the 50min show . He was very helpful and dropped us at little hanoi for supper really good value and yummy .

Well worth it. A great way to spend an hour relaxing A unique art form - sadly rude noisy tourists and latecomers were a bit irritating but that didn't take away from the fun and artistry of the performance. It's quite obvious the puppeteers are very skilled and it's no easy feat to manipulate the water puppets A fun thing to do and highly recommended

Vietnamese Art. I enjoyed the water puppet show in December 2015. I went to the ticket office to buy the tickets around 2 hours before the show. I watched 3pm show and when I bought the tickets, the lady in the office said all 60,000VTN had sold out and just remained a few seats for 100,000 VTN. The show let me know more about the culture of Vietnam. It was really worthy for 100,000VTN. I think if you want to watch the show, you better go there earlier.
An interesting piece of entertainment . I really enjoyed this show, it is was interesting to understand their storytelling via traditional music and puppets. Chairs were a little small.
Great tradition. Entertaining and a real glimpse into this traditional art and other traditions in Vietnamese culture.

Totally Unimpressed. My partner and I found the show very boring and the musicians unprofessional as they can be seen giggling among themselves sometimes during the performance. There wasn't much storyline to the show and some puppets even looked scary. Luckily, the tickets are not very expensive and the duration of the show is less than an hour. We have seen much nicer and impressive cultural performances in other Asian countries. This show can be missed if you have elsewhere to spend time at.

It is a nice show to find out more on their culture!. This is a really long show, if you are a theater person, you would love it.Well i am not, i got bored in first 20 mins, well, thank god they had wifi! One of my friend was also surfing nets and alot of tourist were searching for wifi as well, while one of my other friend really enjoyed the show. They do have some creative ideas and it was a good experience.But if you ask me, will i go again, my answer is no.
Cultural entertainment. Great way to spend an hour watching something that is not in Western culture. Loved the firework dragons and love music.Reasonable price too.

Interesting Cultural Immersion . Was there after being recommended by a friends. It's something for tourist to enjoy and appreciate the Vietnamese cultural. The songs and lyric may be seems alien to us but the fact that it display the everyday life and Vietnamese culture is something for us to appreciate. I am much amaze by the techniques is moving the puppet the have and it's in water. It's not that easy I believe. I strongly recommend this place to anyone who visit Hanoi.

Quite funny and bizarre . Really enjoyed the show. No real need to understand what's going on. It's quite funny. The kids in the crowd loved it. We got the 100,000 tickets near the front which was worth it.

Worth a visit for its historical significance. Just an hour long show representing the old ways farmers and fishermen would entertain their families in the paddy fields with puppet shows over water. Couldn't understand the dialogue, but the spectacular of the puppets, music, fire and water was enough to keep us entertained. Short and sweet and just a nice thing to do.

Just want to know the show, that's all to it.. Was curious at first what sort of performance behind the water puppet show. Once got into the auditorium, the place was fully packed with extra chairs put up at the sides. The seats were really crammed and small. The auditorium started to get warm as it is packed with people, not sure they turn up the aircond's celcius as it is winter day on month of Dec.The only uniqueness about the show is that the puppets are controlled by puppeteers underneath the water and the show was enhanced with fireworks effects and dry ice smoke. There's one scene where the puppet (an animal) climbs up the tree and i thought that was quite cool!Do notice some viewers dozes off as the lights were out. Anyway, it's an eye opener to have watched the show but would not experience it again as it is not engaging or something memorable.
The other water puppets in Hanoi.. An amazing show with Lions, Dragons, Fishermen and many more... very good live music with six musicians and an excellent location.

Music is wonderful. The musicians here were incredibly talented, as well as the singers. Found the puppet masters less talented (sloppy movements, the flames on puppets were snuffed out due to splashing, puppets ran in to each other, etc)The puppets could also use repair. I wouldn't mind paying more than the current cost of $5 a ticket (100,000 VND) if there were some overall improvements. Nice for kids, the little girl next to us definitely enjoyed it!

Nice night out. We took our two kids aged 12 and 9 to see the show. We paid a bit extra and got the front row which I would recommend. The music and singing were lovely and it was a very professional show. A must do with kids!

Don't bother if you're on the tall side. While the water puppets could have be entertaining the seats are far to small for westerners (particulary if 6 foot) and 45 minutes being squeezed in is too much. Furthermore the seats don't give a very good view is you are any further back than first couple of rows.

Great experience. This is a must-see in Hanoi! A group of people plays traditional music, which is beautiful, and the show depicts scenes of daily life in Vietnam as well as mythical creatures. Having been in Vietnam for a few weeks already, I recognized many elements.

Once would be enough. This show talks about the legendary stories behind Hanoi (for example the sword lake). There will be a group playing music instruments alongside singing, and another group that controls the water puppets. Throughout the 50mins show, you would see water puppets moving left and right in the water accompanied by singing and instrumental playing in Vietnamese. The show is somehow divided into different sections and storylines linking each sections.There were no English conversed during the whole show. Lucky me, I had my eBuddies explaining the story for most plays. I do see people dozing off halfway through the show. It would be good if you are interested to see the water puppet show for the first time but if you have seen water puppet shows before, I would suggest that you can skip this.

Must See! Enjoyable for Whole Family.. LOVED it!!!! Despite having to convince my husband I wanted to go, For the 100,000dong admission fee. it was so worth it! So much fun!! Definitely more geared to children so if you are travelling with children take them here!!!The talking is all in Vietnamese but it doesn't make or break it. Still very enjoyable for the music and artistry. They provide an English legend. Show is around 45 mins long.
Go for it if you have time. You wouldnt miss much even if you dont have time for it. They could have put up a screen for subtitles since most tourist dont understand vietnam language.
Better than we expected.... Unexpectedly good fun. Didn't expect to enjoy it as much as we did and our kids were transfixed, especially the five year old. Worth an hour of your time.

Performance excellence . Very exciting for my son who love this culture very much and great musical while performance for this who love art. For busy backpacker who love art perormace will sure love this
Nice cultural folklore, although a bit touristic . The water puppet show is nice to go to, if you have a spare bour. Certainly not a must, but fun to see,especially with young children.

Water Puppet Show - Good value for money.. We visited this attraction on our second night in Hanoi and were very impressed. Excellent live music, accompanying some colourful and fascinating puppetry skills made for a short but very entertaining performance. Ticket prices were very reasonable - 100,000 Dong (about £3.50) each - though there was a further charge if you wanted to use your camera to take photographs. Very close to eating places and a very busy night shopping area in the Old Quarter, so plenty to see and do pre- or post-show.

Well worth the visit!. Very interesting venue! Traditional scenes sung in Vietnamese, but easy to understand. Not expensive.Can be quite crowded at dinner time with tours and families, so to garantee a better seat, I suggest that you book very early for the latest show, and that you ask for a frontrow seat (my partner had trouble seeing some of the scenes because of poor seating). But overall, magical :)

A must see but don't expect too much. You should see this local experience but you better be prepared with the background and the story and don't expect too much. It's nice experience and part of the local culture so you better see this

Directionless. Enter a world of the Ancient Art of Puppetry and allow yourself to be transported to the Hanoi pre the days of the noisy constant humming and pollution of motorbikes.The haunting notes of the singers and the musicians take you to a Hanoi in days gone by of Princes and warriors and Dragons. This is not conventional puppetry with strings and I'd love to tell you what the story was about, but there was no translation or program ( at least we didn't see one.) That didn't, however detract from the visual and audible effects of this ancient artform and the lovely old theatre.Children under 5 may become a bit restless after a while. Definitely worth a visit.

Good fun!. A unique experience in Vietnam - this was is far better than some of 'after-thought' puppet shows that are included in trips back from Halong Bay. Be careful of getting splashed if you are sitting in the front. Both the puppeteers and the musicians were impressive.

So so. Performance of the water puppets are in vietnameseYou can skip this attraction if you are in a hurry or on a budgeted trip Nothing fancyKids behind our seats like to kick and rock our chair as well as scream Not a great experience

Well worth a visit!. I'm so glad to see countries that try to maintain part of their heritage and don't just bulldoze everything in the name of progress and capitalism like North America!
