This show is so simply done yet so intricate. An interesting piece of Vietnamese culture that highly suggest you check out!

closed for restoration work?. this should be nice, but when we visited Hanoi, there were fences around it, and they were installing huge panels to hide the construction site we think it'll be for the next few months

Great show! . We visited the water puppet theatre after reading about it in the lonely planet guide, walking past it several times and out of sheer curiosity! We were pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed the show, especially the traditional Vietnamese live music. A definite attraction for children and adults alike.

Unique water puppets . This is a unique show that you will not see anywhere else. No Vietnamese required. Appeals to adults and children. Reasonable ticket prices at door. Show just on an hour. A good break from the hussle and bussle of Hanoi streets.

Great puppet show ruined by ignorant crowd. We looked forward to this experience with some authentic folk tale puppetry -and although an enjoyable 45mins we had the unfortunate experience of:1. People arriving after show started and shuffling along in dark to seats. People behind you who were on time had their experience diminished by your tardiness.2. Ignoramus's with their cell phones capturing moments they will probably never look at again. One even had a bright light on camera that illuminated several rows in front. These people to a person were oblivious to their surrounding viewers discomfort. 3. The woman who sat next to us filming the entire show and watching through the lens - wake up people and watch the world live with your eyes. But hey the show was worth the trip but good luck on the crowd you get.Puppeteers were excellent.

Interesting, value for money. My friends told me that this was a must-see, so I decided to check it out during my trip to Hanoi. I booked a ticket for an 8 pm show on 16 December, which happened to be packed with tourists (not surprising, given that it's 8 pm). There are 5 showtimes in a day, the earliest starting at 3.30 pm. Would strongly recommend individual travellers/tourists to book their tickets in advance - one or two days prior will suffice - because most seats would be taken up by tour groups. Ticket prices are 100 000 VND for first class tickets, and 60 000 VND for normal tickets. I got the first class ticket, but was allocated to Row L. Not too ideal, since it wasn't exactly what I've hoped for. Advice to fellow travellers - book your tickets early! And try to get the front rows (Row A to about Row G), otherwise you'll be staring at the back of people's heads if you're not too tall. Show was rather interesting, despite it being entirely in Vietnamese. The only performance that I understood was the return of Emperor Le Loi's sword to the heavens! The rest of the performances depicted Vietnamese lives and legends eg. growing rice in paddy fields, dragons bantering with one another. Walked away being really impressed by the puppetry and the art of water puppet theater - you have to admit that the puppeteers are really skilled in controlling and handling the puppets! A great way to spend 45 minutes, and would recommend it to tourists heading to Hanoi.

Made us giggle. We loved this charming glimpse into traditional Vietnamese entertainment, which features a live orchestra and narrators. The staging and scenery is good and we were both impressed with the quality of the puppets.The show itself is all in Vietnamese. However the beautiful music and slapstick comedy means you can understand what is going on.We laughed out loud at some parts and ooohed and ahhhed at the sparklers and fire. At an hour long, it's just the right length. We paid 60vnd pp for a ticket and there are about 5 showings a day. Book early though as the shows fill up quickly.

Transported out of this world. I was literally transported out of this world into another when I paid a visit to the Thang Long Water puppet theatre. The music was traditional and the stories were folklore yet their message is timeless and humorous. There is another water puppet theatre called The Lotus water puppet theatre at the other end of Hoan kiem lake but I chose this one because it had more shows and the timing was convenient for me.I enjoyed the show very much as it was something unique which showcases Vietnamese culture and tradition.

Vietnamese Water Puppet Show. We went to the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre as part of a tour-group. The pre-show music comprising of the traditional Vietnamese musical instrument - Dan Bau - was very soothing. The stage itself was a huge water tank and the water-puppet show depicting various stories connected with Vietnamese village life-styles accompanied with traditional music was very interesting. The water puppet show of approximately one-hour was unique and fascinating.

unusual puppet show. We spent a delightful afternoon at the water puppet theater. We did not know what to expect. When the show started we were mesmerized by the whole concept. Great for children of all ages from 2 years to 90 years.

A fun show, but best if you are not too tall. We went to this expecting it to be rather touristy, but it was well done and worth the reasonable cost. A pity the staff were all so unwelcoming (unlike most Vietnamese), and the seats are very tight if you are over 1.6m tall. The performance is about an hour long.

Boring... And underwhelming . It was boring and underwhelming. We Akzo found out that a sister version of this was part of our ha long Bay trip so it became redundant.
The seats are very tight and uncomfortable for tablet people. But on the plus side, its only 45 mins!

Nice show. A traditional show and this is very good to watch. Per ticket is 100,000 vnd about one hr time. But i feel unhappy with many tourist during watching the show raise their handphone shooting video and this were block the eyesight to the stage.
Super fun!. Beautiful music and really fun puppetry! Glad they give a translated program so that you can have an idea of what each act entails.

You have to do this!. This is unique to Vietnam apparently, so as such, we felt we really ought to go, though my husband was a little sceptical. This theatre seems to be the best one. We weren't really sure what to expect, but it was pretty good fun for the first half an hour at least, though it would have been nice to understand a little more of some of the stories that were being played out. The frogs are brilliant! Definitely something to do once, but I don't think you'd want to go a second time!

Fun to see. The 1 hour show is worth the money.The people playing the songs and the puppet players are very talented and gave me the impression they put everything in to the play as if it were the first time.I enjoyed watching it. Even ot understanding the language it was very funny.

A little bit random but a must do!. We had been told to go to the water puppet show when we arrived in Hanoi. They have around 5 performances on daily and when we arrived at the 6:30 showing it was packed! If you are over 6ft or have long legs I would advise getting a front row or end of aisle seat and the leg room is small. The show itself was a little random, although I couldn't stop watching and the hours show flew by. It's all in Vietnamese but you could still understand what was happening and the stories for each song. It was 100,000 Dong per person which is worth the money, even if it's for a funny talking point with fellow travelers! Enjoy!

Intriguing!. Was a really interesting show with incredible music. A must-do cultural experience in Hanoi, worth the $6. Unfortunately it isn't subtitled so the jokes were a bit lost on us.The puppets were beautiful and very impressive.

An hour of innocent fun. 100,000 Dong entrance is an absolute bargain as you sit back and enjoy the enormously talented puppeteers and musicians. Really recommend getting tickets early as you will get tickets towards the front. Arrive early. There's nothing worse than a tour group walking in 10 minutes into the show. Enjoy.
Great show!. Very impressive show! We brought our sons (3 & 5 years old) and they liked it very much! The show is about 1 hour long and totally worth the 100.000/ticket!

a unique puppeteer setup. Having lived in India, where puppeteers have really differentiated their art, the experience at the Water Puppet theater was really unique! with puppets being controlled using sticks under a water curtain, the stories are entertaining, and the music is enchanting.Tickets for entry can be tough to get, particularly around peak seasons, recommend booking it much in advance to get good seats.

Cool experience . Really enjoyed this afternoons performance, like nothing I had seen before! A nice hour to relax & enjoy what's going on. Some staff were abit rude & some were asleep in the lobby when we came out, slightly strange.

Great hour of fun!. Loved this show - the live music was lively and the singers were so talented! Also the puppets were well-crafted and funny, and even though the singing was in Vietnamese, you can understand the meaning and emotions behind each little act perfectly. Would highly recommend!

Charming, amusing and good fun. Well worthwhile for a bit of fun. Great traditional music and adorable skits with puppets in water. No need to speak Vietnamese as the humor is easy to understand. Only problem is ppl and their dam cell phones being held up in front of your view and flash photography. Try and sit near the front or in one of the side chairs as I found it hard to see.

Different puppet show. Interesting take on the traditional puppet show where the whole action is on water . Full vietnamese orchestra and some fine vietnamese singing. Not so easy to follow the vietnamese dialogue though the action is sufficent. Good chance to broaden your cultural horizons.

Fun thing to do, glad we did. I enjoyed this a lot more than I thought I would. Despite chattery tourists who talked all the way through, or couldn't last the 45mins without toilet breaks in their droves. I liked reading about the history of this in the brochure, and watching them perform their art, musically and puppetry, was great.
Brilliant . These puppeteers have been doing this for a number of years, their skill and artistry had us enthralled, it's located centrally. We had never seen anything like this before amazing.
Great. It is a must to See. Only in Vietnam is it posible to see this event. Not only for children. It was really funny and the price wasn't expansive

14 days in Vietnam. This is a must see event if you are in Hanoi. We enjoyed the performance, this show was very clever and funny with local music, singing and acted out folk tales from rural life. There are plenty of showings throughout the evening and it only lasted for 50mins so is not an inconvenience. We absolutely loved it from start to finish. Worth seeing a different culture.

Surprisingly good fun!. We had heard of water puppets, and made a booking. It was only £2 and we had a decent view. It was really good fun, and although some dialogue was in Vietnamese , as an English speaker we didn't feel like we missed out on too much. Get the brief English guide before you sit down. If you've got an hour spare, definitely pay it a visit!

So much fun. We didn't know what to expect but it was a great show. 30 mins of fun, live traditional music and great performance you can't see anywhere else in the world. Get lost in the magic of the puppets

A million miles away from the crazy Hanoi traffic! . A very well presented and unique theatre experience. Be warned though. Probably not ideal if it's your first day in Hanoi and experienced the mayhem and noise of the streets. The rhythmic music and splashing of the water puppets can easily induce sleep. A real shame as the show is worth seeing and I would love to see it again.

Worth visiting . This show was very clever and funny with local music, singing and acted out folk tales from rural life. To get best view try to get nearer the front. We didn't have children with us but I think they would like the slapstick humour. Definitely worth a visit.

Interesting!!. A great little one hour show and cheap entertainment. Hilarious!! We took a cyclo tour around Hanoi and ended up at the water puppet theatre. A great way to see Hanoi and end up in this part of town. There are plenty of restaurants and bars to visit and enjoy your evening late into the night after the show.

Enjoyable Show. This was my first water puppet show, and very much enjoyed the history and story. They explain in the intro what the overall story is about in english, but after that it is not translated which I think I would prefer anyway. The only complaint I had was regarding their lack of a flash photography policy. During the show a lot of people would be taking pictures with their cell phones, which I could understand since it is such a unique experience, but some people went full flash with their cameras and that became very distracting (and seriously, how great can those pictures be when it basically highlights the heads of the people in the row in front of you). It would be nice if they banned flash photography during the show.

Great fun! A must do for any Hanoi vistors. We went here on the recommendation from friends who had been previously and thank goodness we did! There are plenty of showings throughout the evening and it only lasted for 50mins so is not an inconvenience. We absolutely loved it from start to finish. Even though we did not know the language, it really didn't matter. It was great fun watching each little sketch. The puppets were impressive and beautiful. This is great fun for all ages. It's really good value and you would not regret it.
Must watch. Can watch the show with few dollar and get a excellent performance, get 1st class tickets if want to seat infront near the stage

Children love it. Went there with 2 kids; 2 yrs old and 9 mths old. To my surprise, both of them loved it.The puppets were lively, the colors were vibrant, the rhythm of the music was catchy. My kids kept quiet and paid attention throughout the whole 45 min show.I believe the stories were a portrayal of traditional folklore, it would have been better if they were narrated in a language that we understood, but I guess that would mean losing a bit of its tradition.

Worth the money. It was very crowded, very hot (no AC) and every tourist is taking flash pictures during the entire show.The show itself misses an English explanation, because it is all in Vietnam language.

Water Puppets. Very special traditional theatre with puppets in water - based on village culture. Traditional singing and traditional instruments. Very casual by very wonderful experience. Recommended for all ages.

A Fascinating Experience. The Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre is located just in front of the Ho Hoan Kien lake in Hanoi. The busy streets of Hanoi itself is already quite an experience. The theatre had a nice cafe on the ground floor. The performance was interesting, showing a myriad of activities by the padi field farmers in the olden days. The only downside is the whole show is in Vietnamese otherwise I would have enjoyed the show a lot more.
Well worth seeing. A must see in this interesting city. Just sit back, relax and enjoy this fantastic cultural experience. Very clever production for all ages.

Not to be missed. This is definitely a sight not to be missed. I enjoyed the performance which had live music accompanying each scene. The seats are nicely arranged so that you are not having to strain your head to see the performance area. They have designated seating which is great.They performed for an hour without an intermission which was just the right time. A great way to spend an evening for all ages.

Very interesting. Water puppet is some kind of tamraditional show that I trust you only can find in Indochina countries. And Vietnam is probably one of the most famous place for water puppet. And you conly find it Hanoi. Should see the show once if you visit Hanoi. Very interesting show.
Great show. The beautiful show to understand more about the local people entertainment in the villages nearby. It's also a good glance Vietnam culture

Bizzare. Really, for 60,000 vnd can you really complain? This was one of the more bizzare shows I have ever seen! If you have time to kill and want to get off the crazy streets of the Old Quarter the water puppets is a cheap option.

The original Hanoi experience. . Very popular Hanoi spectacle. Unique experience. About 50 mins long. Very clever. Might not be to everyone's liking but it's sure different and you are located in the Hanoi Old Quarter ready for a night exploring.

we were on a city tour and this was included,,, we initially thought why, but fantastic show. We had a free day before our train left that evening so we decided to book a city tour. We saw that the tour went around different places of the city but this was not mentioned. When we arrived and was told about we were going in to see show,, we thought why as it was not something we would normally see. We were totally surprised and glad we saw this show. Even though it was not in English you picked up the story easy. Fantastic, loved every minute of the show and funny as well. Great performance and really amazing cast and how it is all brought together. Must see event whilst here.

Good fun + cultural experience. The shows were full all day, so if you have a timetable I'd suggest booking for example earlier on that day. Plenty of taxis & tuktuks offering rides home or wherever in front of the theater, and I bet all the drivers know the place when you're coming in.The show was good fun though all in Vietnamese; you caught a hold of what was going on. There were about a dozen short stories played. The live band and narrators were visible next to the stage and they, with the puppeteers, made the audience laugh heartily several times.There's a small gift shop too which opens after the show.

Unique and entertaining cultural experience. I thought I might be bored at a puppet show but this was so fast-paced and cleverly done that I thoroughly enjoyed it. The puppeteers actually come out at the end and have been submerged up to the hips in water the whole time. Fascinating show for all ages!

A Fun and Charming Experience. Hordes of foreigners and natives are here every day. Buy tix in advance, if possible for the first three rows, to avoid the lines. Once seated inside, you'll settle into an enjoyable time with a puppet show, instrumental music and some singing. Xin Chao!
Great way to take a break. Great little show a must do in Hanoi. Don't go in expecting much and you will have a fun night. Great for kids

Mesmerizing puppetry for all ages. Water puppet theatre is unique to Vietnam. It is an experience not to be missed. The shows include Vietnamese songs, instruments, and stories. The audience viewed the performance while wondering what would be the next delightful life size puppet to arise from the water. The theatre and show in Hanoi are similar to the one in Saigon. There is a difference in the souvenir goods sold and the Hanoi theatre has a lovely eating venue.Although the narration and songs are in Vietnamese, the stories are easily understood and the puppets are visually stunning, and sometimes brought to life with added effects of flame and smoke. Fun for all

Really enjoyable . We didn't really know what to expect. But it was fascinating to watch. We paid 60k dong each (£2 each) and it lasted about an hour. Wonderful music and singing. Never seen anything like it in England. Puppets are very clever and show is very amusing. Lots of kids enjoying the show too.We'd recommend.

Waterpuppetshow. Although we could not understand anything, the show was set up in a way you know where it is about, like the turtle with the sword, the Fisherman etc.It was amazing how people behind curtains manage the puppets (almost invinseble).Together with the music and singing it was a show you must see for only hundred thousand Dong (€ 4,-)

A worthwhile show to watch for the family. We brought our kids to watch the 3pm matinee as the 6pm and 8pm shows sold out ery quickly.The show is a good change from all the computerized special effects that we've become accustomed to. The auditorium is air conditioned and the seats are comfortable.The narrative are all in Vietnamese, but there is a program booklet that describes each puppet dance so you'll be able to figure out what's going on.Don't miss the chance to see it if you're in Hanoi. The theatre is just by Hoem Kien lake so it's not difficult to find at all.

Worth the experience. Water Puppet is an interesting art prevailing in this region. It is extremely creative and fun to watch the show. You should not miss this one.Some things to keep in mind:Try to get the seats in the front half of the auditorium.Show is predominantly in Vietnamese (Although there is not much to understand from the language)
Boring. The show and the puppets were quiet old. There was not simultaneous translation, not enough descriptions in the program of what they show.

Great little show. We weren't really sure what we had booked to see but really enjoyed the performance. It's a set of short traditional stories accompanied by music. Definitely worth a visit as never seen something like this before back at home!
smokey!. Enjoyable music and watching puppets dance across the water. Unfortunately I had to walk out partway through as the entire theatre was filled with cigarette smoke.

Yes, worth doing. Dong 100,000 for a 1 hour show. Theatre seats approximately 340. Ticket has row and seat number written on it. Row K was ok but I would have preferred front row. The show was professional, entertaining and the audience seemed to enjoy it. We attended at 6.30pm, lots of people waiting to get in.A walk around the lake that was beautifully lit up would have been lovely afterwards.

Good way to kill an hour . Not bad. Inexpensive so you aren't really losing anything. Definitely didn't blow my mind but a fun way to pass some time and maybe glean a little culture if you squint past the obvious tourist trappings. Really enjoyed the music and that everything was in the local language. Lent to the authenticity of it.

I was surprised how much I liked this. We had tickets included in our cycling tour. My initial thought was ho-hum, another "made for tourists" show. Actually the origins date back over 10 centuries to the rice fields and are an Asian tradition.I was surprised how captivating it was, from the musicians (unknown to me instruments, beautiful voices), to the very unique puppets performing in water. Though dialogue was in Vietnamese (obviously) the story line was easy to follow, and even if you were a bit lost with the story, the music and puppet action kept me engaged.Ticket prices vary based on seating. We were very close to the front and unfortunately I had a real tall guy in front of me--I'm not sure it's worth paying the extra for close-up seating, but if you're short or have kids along (and didn't have a tall guy in front of you!) maybe it would be.Show lasts under an hour which for us was just right. I would go see it again.

Very interesting. I really enjoyed this theatre. Ticket were about 100000 dong and the performance lasted about 45 minutes. Be sure to pick up the leaflet in the foyer on what it's all about! Really nice thing to do in the city.

Lacks authenticity. This was one of the stops on our guided tour of Hanoi and we would quite happily have missed out on it.While this art form is part of the heritage of the country it didn't feel particularly cultural, more of a money spinner targeted at tourists.

Cool but once is enough. Amazing musicians and singers and the puppets are interesting to watch, if you understand Vietnamese it would be a little more enjoyable because anyone that does seemed to be quite entertained during some parts. Have to visit once but that's about enough, nice look into Vietnamese activities and the people working are very talented

A must do.. I found this whole performance to be totally captivating. The musicians fascinated me from beginning to end mainly because I've never seen or heard traditional instruments like this played live. Some of these are so intricate and the sounds are wonderful.It's about the puppets - & they were amazing. Those puppeteers managed to bring everything to life & have so much personality. It only goes for about 45 mins which is perfect timing. Go see it. Pre book your tickets though - there are choices of about 3 performances most days from memory.

A great end to your day. We got tickets for the evening show. We paid 100k each for 3rd row seats. Although the view is good from the cheaper seats as well. The performance was really fun and well worth the money. We paid 20k extra to use a camera but nobody checks this so you dont need to.
Nothing extraordinary about it. Thought it would be something extra but just a puppetshow. U could see the poles in the water too often and dances were a little unsynced at times.

great show!. I arrived at 3 for the 4 pm show and barely got a ticket, so perhaps one should prebook through hotel. It was a great break from the Hanoi heat and humidity! Great music and interesting show depicting history of Vietnam. Perfect length at just under an hour!
Something different. This was very entertaining for us. The show went fot 50 minutes which included mudic played ad well.Be warned the seating is very small and tight with very limited leg room

Fun and Interesting Experience. This was great. A cultural experience not to be missed. My son and I laughed even though we could not understand the words, were amazed at the craftsmanship that went into making the puppets and were blown away by the beauty of the traditional music. Please do yourselves a favor and take an hour out of your day to go and see these talented artists.

Back in time. This art was developed by the farmers in the rice fields in the rain season. If you understand that and imagine that you are a farmer worked whole day and now just want to enjoy the evening then you will enjoy this for sure. Yes I am a tourist and this is done for us and we want to see it still it is an beautiful art to enjoy.

Cleverly done. This show of 50 minutes is just the right length to sample the skills of the puppeteers and the themes from everyday life and legend in Vietnam. One is left wondering how the puppets are manoeuvred, even after the 10 puppeteers emerged at the end of the show - immersed waist deep in water.
Interesting . Enjoyed our visit, was performed well and the music was great. Bits were funny and it was the perfect length.

Cultural experience!. Beautiful singing and music. Entertaining puppet show. The theatre was full so be prepared for a crowd! Seats very close together so be prepared to sit sideways if over 5'8"! Short people sit to the front as other people will occlude your view if sitting at the back. A must do when in Hanoi.

Amazing. Amazing touching stories from everyday life in so unusual manner were great. It is worth to see. We also enjoyed alive music. I saw all those musical instruments first time in my life. It was really interesting. But book ticket in advance. If you are lucky it is possible to get ticket at strapontin straight before show.

Horrible . I visited the puppet show as it was recommended in a couple of travel blogs, and high on the activites in TA. Oh my god.The show is interesting the first two minutes, right until they start with the music intro. The puppet show is around 45 minutes and at the end of minute one you have pretty much seen everything they got. The rest of the time is absolutely a waste of time and money. Interesting as it could sound as part of ancient vietnamese culture, only tourists can be found in the audience. So that i found quite telling. After the first story everybody claps and pays attention. You can totally feel how gradually the audience is either sleeping, talking with the neighbour or just sitting there wondering if it is possible to exit the theatre in the middle of the show. Not good at all.

Good for children, not young adults travelling with family. 50 min duration was long. Nice air con. Orchestra was very talented. The performances are in Vietnamese making understanding a little difficult. Interesting cultural experience in Hanoi. Recommend buying tickets ahead of intended show time.

Exquisite experience. The place has an old-world charm to it. I really liked the live band, with traditional musical instruments, the musicians dressed for the occasion and put up a great show. The entire group was spell-bound by the performance.The show in itself talks about the many aspects of Vietnamese lifestyle and philosophy. Very enriching.Do book your tickets in advance during the day as the theatre can seat only limited number of people.

Just plain weird!. Definitely a crazy must see, but perhaps more of a must see when you have a seat near the exit and may be able to sneak out when it all gets a bit mad :-) enjoyable and different! My favourite song / performance was the one about Dong Bao/Bao Dong.

Great bit of unique Vietnamese Culture. At a quick 50 minutes, the Water Puppet Theater show was a fun introduction to this distinctly Vietnamese form of entertainment. Accompanied by Vietnamese instruments, the Water Puppet show showcased classic Vietnamese folklore in an engaging and entertaining way. Mad props to the puppeteers, what they do is magic.

entertaining 50 mins. An old style cinema setup, the whole show sounded quite humorous though we didn't understand their language. Be early for a little read up on the show, Vnd100,000 ticket +Vnd20,000 for cameras. Don't know if it costs more for the front row?

Absolutely creative illusion. The water puppet show, is a dynamic and creative presentation. It is an attraction, that should not be missed.In addition to the puppets, the music and singing, that accompanies the show is wonderful.I have never seen anything like it in the world. I have tried to describe it to my friends, but it was too difficult to recreate the excitement. Instead, I found a YouTube video, and showed to them.It is one of the highlights of Hanoi !

Fifty minutes of excitement. I do not like puppet theater from the time I was a child, so we did not plan to visit this theater. We got there by a mistake: we had 4 hours before our train and were walking in the old quarter. We saw a lot of people and decided to find the reason. We found out that in 5 minutes there will be some show in water theater. We bought the tickets (60k VND per person) and took our places. What was a surprise when we understood that it's puppet show! It was amazing!!!! During the whole show I tried to understand how...how they do this. It's hard to explain how great it was. Just try it by yourself.
Really unique. I was hesitant on going as I was worried it would be a bit cheesy. It was actually a really unique thing to do. The music was live and the puppets were really cool to watch

It's very . I really like the show is very nice with the traditional music and good performance. You don't need to speak Vietnamease to understand what the history is about they are so good that you can feel it. For me it's the best attraction in this city.

Traditional Vietnamese. The show was funny to my Vietnamese friend who spoke the language. Unfortunately as a native English speaker, this was lost on me. Was a nice evening and the puppeters are skilled.
Nog really worth it. Funny to see how people entertained themselves many years ago. But not a 'must have seen this one in Hanoi'...

Thang Long Water Puppet Show. Something unusual. Normally a puppet show is on land these puppets are in the water. It was nice but I wish they would give the commentary in English also because most of us are tourist who do not understand the local language. You can follow it but it would be more interesting to get a jist of the show. It is a one hour show so be entertained.

A must see. I'm so happy we made time to see the show. It was a highlight of our time in Hanoi. We went to an evening performance. For those with long legs there isn't much room but worth it for the hour show.

Unique & entertaining show. our first water puppet show and we enjoyed it. It's just under an hour and is only $3- $5 to get in. The music is great and the show is very entertaining. Would recommend while in Hanoi.
Loved it!. You can see a lot of things of Vietnam culture here. Beautiful and very interesting, recommended! It's just 60.000 dong.

W ater Puppet theatre. I was so happy that this was part of the tour as we had had a long day and I may
have opted out had I been travelling solo, well worth the visit. It was a fascinating
experience.

Great!. My daughter and I went to see an early evening performance. It's very convenient as you can wander down and get a ticket for later in the evening and they do several performances so it's quite flexible.
We really enjoyed the show and it wa a great taster of Vietnamese culture.
We particularly like the underwater fireworks!!

Don't be a puppet and manipulated to go. While it is interesting for the first 10 minutes, the balance of the show became a repeat of the first 10 minutes. There is no linkage between performances and no story that is being told. However it is a cultural experience in the old quarter. A fair visit.

A little long but worth seeing. This is one of those "must do" things simply because it is unique to Hanoi. The theatre is quite large and comfortably air conditioned and the music and vocals are performed live on a side stage. The puppetry is simple and everything is in Vietnamese but it is a fun way to spend an evening. If I have any criticism...it's too long and after the first 30 minutes it's just more of the same.
Interesting show. We enjoyed the spectacle and the music even though it was a little hard to figure out what was going on sometimes. A cool and different piece of cultural expression - worth seeing.

Boring !. Boring Show ! Price at 100,000 VND for an hour show. Would prefer the Water Puppet show in Ho Chi Minh. Regretted of going for this. Should have spent our time around the Hoan Kiem lake instead.

Charming is the right word... I went here on a day off (I live in Hanoi currently). I really loved it, despite the lack,of English. The Orchestra are excellent, and the pyrotechnics and use of puppets is really something to watch. A must-see. Only about £3 for an hour.
Awesome talent. Language not needed to understand this unique puppetry. Thoroughly enjoyable. We didn't know what to expect and were very pleasantly surprised by this very talented production.
A unique show. A unique cultural entertaining show that should not be missed while visiting Vietnam! The show recommended for everyone and family to enjoyed.

Quick, entertaining and unique. Some hotels book tickets for you, ours didn't, so we walked up and booked it ourselves at the box office. There are two price categories, I would recommend the front seats, as the effect of the water puppetry is better. Be sure to book an hour or more earlier, as its a popular attraction in the evening for tourists.

It is a quick, good cultural activity. we asked our hotel to get us tickets which made it very easy to just walk up and go in. Seating is general admission. If you have jet lag it would he hard to stay awake since it is dark inside. The show was 45 minutes and right by the lake so a great, inexpensive activity to do after a cup of coffee around the lake.

Something New. It is nice to attend a cultural function. A water puppet is a new experience to me. The hall was full. Started with Vietnamese song and then water puppet show begin. It last for 1 hour.

Impressive...I think?!. This was...odd. Intro was in English, but then the rest was in Vietnamese therefore I wasn't really sure what was going on or what the underlying story was. The control of the puppets was quite impressive and pretty funny at times (when you could see over all the cameras and camcorders (seriously will you ever watch this back?)). Not a 'must see' in my opinion but something to use up a bit of time in Hanoi if you need something to do.

Fantastic theater. Great Theater, great presentation. The Theater was sold out but we got good seats. It was a wonderful show with nice music, great singers and of course fantastic puppet masters. Even if you can no Vietnamese is the story easy to understand. Who likes some culture should definitely come here!

Primarily a Check in the Box. For US$5 for a premium seat, it's a really inexpensive way to observe some traditional culture... but you'll be sitting in a densely packed theater with 500 other tourists and watching a show that lasts about 50 minutes.The music is probably the highlight of the show with a traditional Vietnamese band off to the side; however, given that the theater does a ton of these shows every day, it all feels a bit uninspired.I would not recommend it... walking around the night markets and shopping areas is far more entertaining.

Funny. It is fun to see when you are in Hanoi, but dont expect to know what it is about, which isnt a problem though the waterpuppets are amazing to just look at. A big downside is that the seats are really small and you camt sit properly for about 1 hour.

Spur of the moment-entertaining!. I took a walk one night. I passed this theater and remembering my tour guide mentioning it I stopped. Just so happens a show was just beginning. I purchased a ticket which was equal to a couple of dollars. (U.S.). It was a good seat near the front in an almost filled theater. Being American I did not understand one word of it but grasped the overall gist of it just by watching the puppets. There were all different skits and quite entertaining. My seat was near the "live cast" who were doing the sound affects and music. This is something I would have never planned on doing but it just happened and was quite enjoyable. The lighting was good, the seats were comfortable, and the stage set was good bring that this was a puppet show on water.

Great way to pass an hour. This is a great way to pass an hour in busy Hanoi. Altough performed in the local language, I found the show very entertaining. All for 100VND / 3 GBP - bargain! Book tickets in advance from the box office at the front of the Theatre.

Unique amazing experience. We attended water puppet show on recommendation of guide and it turned out amazing experience. The puppets move on water accompanied by live traditional songs and music played also on traditional instruments.The play consists of several shot stories and lasts around 50min.We recommend to select tickets for around 5$ which are in front rows which ensures better view.Shows are performed several times in the afternoon every day.
Very nice. Very nice and not expensive. Excellent to finish a long and hot walking day around the city.Also very good location

Lovely thing to see. Make the trip if you like culture and to see an ancient form brought to life on stage. It's only 45 mins and a lovely thing to see. Don't go if you are expecting Disney on ice or anything! Go to theatre and grab tickets and early and ask for a good seat and they will give you one.
Interesting with kids. Nice, enjoyable..we were travelling with friends n family.. kids were v happy. They have daily shows. The puppet show narrates the daily life of Vietnam!

Interesting form of arts. Need to sit at the front. It is great to see this form of art in Vietnam. The water puppets are very flexible. If U want to take pictures U will need to sit at the front. Good sound and light effects.

What a waste of time.. The experience was totally marred by the money grabbing nature of the Management. The result being that i couldn't see much of the performance because the management sold video and photography right to anyone willing to pay. Basically, there were video cameras, etc being held up throughout the performance. Unless you can be assured of a front row seat, I wouldn't bother.

What a laugh. What a laugh it was so bad it was funny!!! It was like Punch and Judy in water! ( for you non UK readers Punch and Judy is a traditional puppet show which can be seen at most UK seaside resorts) Look it only cost a couple of quid so go and check it out. We must be going daft we even bought a souvenir puppet at the end !!!!

So-so. It's a world known water puppet show and they have performed worldwide also, it's a must do for all visitors however if you have been to water puppet shows before like the one in Bangkok, you won't find this interesting. First it's only a 50 minutes show, second there's no subtitle you won't be able to tell the storyline simply by listening to them. You have to guess your whole way. There is a fact sheet listing each of the chapters but that's just a headline. It's a pleasant indoor activity on a hot night but nothing else to me.

Excellent show. This is definitely worth doing. This theatre is very well renowned and steeped I'm history. The live music is wonderful and the skill of the puppeteers is astounding. At 45 minutes long, it's just enough. It is located close to Lake and to many great restaurants. Don't miss this!

Bizarre but magical - worth watching. Really clever puppetry and an enjoyable experience even though we had no idea what was going on! Gets booked up so reserve seats. Visibility is not great so try to sit near the front and avoid tall people!

Very Interesting. We found it great and although it was in Vietnamese you could get the idea of the story and their culture. the musicans were awesome and it was a nice interlude to finish a very busy day of rushing here and there. What incredibly talented players both the musicans and puppeteers were. The cost was minimal whoo $3US you certainly would not get anything like that in the western world for that amount. There were certainly lots of faces beaming and very animated when we came out of the theatre which was awesome as well. the French influence strong in Hanoi.

unexpected rip-off in thang long water puppet show. i'm posting this to forewarn tourists that it is best that you pay the exact amount so you won't be conned by the lady in the ticket booth. just 3 hours ago, i paid 500,000 VND for two tickets costing 120,000 VND. when that lady gave me only 80,000 VND change, i asked for 300,000 VND more. she refused and insisted that my money was only 200,000 VND. since there was no one else to complain to, i did the next best thing - i moved back and tried to take her photo . . . but she quickly moved away.
100,000 dong for a ticket? Just do it . Definitely worth the money - good music played by a live group on the side of theater, very interesting to watch, 100,000 dong for 45 mins is a no brainer

Pleasant local culture show. We really enjoyed this show it's only about an hour and really inexpensive, the people operating the puppets are very talented it's well worth a visit when in Hanoi! Might tip would be pick your tickets up in the day to save queuing and to avoid disappointment also there is varied times of day for the show so you can pick which ever suits you. Enjoy well worth it great job

A different kind of entertainment . I'll keep this one short and simple. Pros: culturally significantMusicians very talentedActs are short, show moves along quite quicklyFunny at timesShort in durationCons: no English (a more significant pamphlet would do fine) Puppets....they are interesting to select few I'm thinkingNo context to the acts themselvesWe appreciate everything we see and we wouldn't saw dont go, only just keep an open mind (ie no expectations) . Seems like a bit of a money grab as there would be much nicer ways to enjoy the musicians and talent of the puppet masters.

Puppets in the Water.... Well designed theatre... although you really need to sit in the first 6 rows to get a good view of the puppets. A very old Vietnamese art form....it is being continued by the younger generation. How they make the puppets move is a mystery to me. A very colorful and sometimes funny performance that lasts about an hour. Acompanied by a small orchestra with narration by two young with great voices.
Citr. It is fUn but it goes on for too long. The music was lovely and the musicians were incredibly graceful

Interesting but Exclusive. Having read online as a must see experience in Hanoi, my friends and I saw the 5PM showing which costed at 60,000 VND. Visually speaking, it was interesting. However, it got quite boring given that we couldn't understand anything because everything was spoken in Vietnamese. The language barrier is something you could not ignore. They could've at least spoken in english bearing in mind that it was a tourist attraction and majority of the viewers were visitors. Looking around the crowd, I saw that a lot of people were getting drowsy and started falling asleep halfway. So was I.I recommend to watch this early in the day before getting tired from all the other activities of your itinerary so that you won't get easily drowsy and have more energy to persevere. Nevertheless, it was quite a sight to see.

It's a Puppet - but no Brian Conley in sight. Got dig in the ribs from the Mrs for falling asleep!. Ummmmmm. It's one of those that you probably should see, but then again...I nodded off and got a disapproving dig in the ribs from Mrs B, who quite liked it. The best bit was the fire eating dragons, after that, well not much really.And the band played on and on and on....£3 do it, but don't blame me if you fall asleep, ok?

Water Puppet Show. We had to watch it since it was something cultural but was a tad boring because of the language barrier and was done even before you fall asleep. It was a fun experience. Will recommend but will.not watch again
Water Puppets. Something you should do as it is unique but felt it was a little long in the lack of air conditioning.
Family. Was a superb show. Unbelievable. Not to be missed! I have never seen anything more amazing! The music n puppets. ...wow!

Good for cultural experience. The live music and puppet show are nice, but it is a bit disappointing because the entire show was performed in their local language without any subtitle. In short, it is nice if you just want to experience the culture, given the price is not too expensive (VND100,000 per person, or VND60,000 for cheaper option).
Big surprise. I did not know what to expect and it was really nice surprise, show was graduating, and was not too long to get boring. I can definitely recommend it!
Water puppet performance. Great show and entertainers. All 12 acts very entertaining. Only problem I had was seat too small @ 190 cm found very uncomfortable for legs. Would recommend gladly

Insight to Vietnam culture . Enjoyed this show. Visually stunning and great live orchestra backing. The show presents different elements of Vietnam traditional culture and while not translated quite easy to follow. The skill of the puppetry is awesome. Recommended.

Ok, its an experience! . Visited the theater, we got the cheap seats as it was just as the show was starting it cost 60,000 dong as they said there was none of the 100,000 seats available,even though when we got in loads were free, so the seats we had were plastic fold out ones that were up the aisle. They were fine and saw all of the stage. None of it was in English but u could kind of guess what was going on. Its very clever and good to see but wouldn't rush back!
Worth visiting, book early. Make sure to book ahead, it gets full. Lasts 1h, and includes music and some short stories through the puppet show to talk through traditional Vietnamese life.

Loved it. I took a walk to the water puppet theatre as it was not far from where I was staying. I found it very cheap and entertaining. The puppets, colours and traditional musice were all great and I would go back again.

Novel theatre. Our hotel arranged tickets for us in the morning for the 6.30 performance. The theatre was full so it's a good job we booked in advance. The water puppets are great and tell a local fishing story but as its all sung and spoken in Vietnamese it's hard to follow but this does nt spoil it! It lasts about 50 mins which is just about long enough to be honest... There are an orchestra of narratives at the side of the stage and then throes who work the puppets are behind a screen but come out at the end to bow. It's well worth a visit as one of the main attractions in Hanoi. ... I would recommend but maybe not for very young children who don't understand Vietnamese
Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre. Very good entertainment. Impressive puppetry skills with very good accompaniment by team of musicians and singers.

Must do. All ages will enjoy this special attraction. I particularly enjoyed the traditional music, my husband enjoyed the artistry of the puppets and the children sitting near us - of all ages seemed enthralled. Try to book through your hotel to get closer seats as we did.
Water Puppets. The show was delightful--all done with a water setting and a Vietnamese theme. After it was over the puppeteers came out, in the water. Amazing how many there were. Highly recommend.

Very skilled, very entertaining. OK, so this is a very touristy thing to do! However, I have seen water puppet shows in three locations in Vietnam but the Thang Long is in a league of its own. If there are lulls in the attraction of the puppets this is completely overridden by the musicianship and singing. I found the 45 minute show compelling and do recommend this even if you think you are going to a tourist trap! The theatre is normally full with a good atmosphere.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE THING TO DO IN HANOI!!!!!!! I saw this amazing historical performance 10 years ago for the first time and wouldn't miss it for the world!!! such an amazing piece of history told in a traditional way! I love the story, though you should read the pamphlet before the show since it's all in vietnamese. I LOVE the music!! its got such a quality of value that it rings true all the way to my core. it very well might be the best thing you do in vietnam! DON'T MISS IT!!!

A must see. Went here as it's a must see show.But it's a little to long and the view is not always good.You get people standing up to take photos which is very annoying.The place turns around very quickly so don't be late.Am glad I went but won't go again

Great way to spend a couple of hours. We went to see this after seeing the reviews and it was great. Didn't understand what was being said but that wasn't a problem as its a puppet show and very visual. Would definitely recommend.

One of a kind . Great authentic music/ traditional orchestra. Although the language is in Vietnamese, there's no need for translation as it's still entertaining with great energy. I also couldn't stop trying to figure out how they manoeuvre the puppets! Good stuff.

Waters come to life. Thoroughly enjoyed the show. I was blown away with the artistry shown. The aquarium scene had to be my favorite. What amazed me at the end was the number of puppeteers it took to produce the show. I wish they had a program ahead to read about the history and incite into the different acts. Beautiful music with traditional instruments. Building is not wheelchair friendly but the seats were comfortable.

Interesting and probably a tourist must. We visited the Tha Long Water Puppet show as we were given free tickets by our tour operator otherwise we may not have gone. The show lasts for 45 minutes which is long enough because though at first it is an interesting cultural spectacle it does get a bit tedious after a while - there are only so many splashing puppets you can take really. Also the whole show is narrated in Vietnamese so even though I accept it may have an interesting story I had no idea what was going on. The live musicians who accompany the show are excellent though, playing traditional Vietnamese instruments. The puppeteers are hidden behind the water tank and they operate the puppets using long sticks hidden under the water. The use of fire and sparklers does make some of the show quite impressive but as I said it does start to drag on after a while and 45 minutes is long enough. Definitely worth seeing though.

Beautiful music, entertaining show. Worth doing.. The highlight of the 50-minute show was undoubtedly the stunning live Vietnamese music played on unusual traditional instruments. The puppets were beautiful and nothing was lost for it being in Vietnamese. A good view despite a packed theatre and well-worth the 100,000VND..I've recommended this show to fellow travellers already. Definitely a must in Hanoi.
Worth seeing. The show goes for around 45 mins but that is all you need. Really interesting to see history played out by puppets and vocals / music.

Great entertainment. The Thang Long Water Puppet Theater is an exploration into he historical traditions and culture of Hanoi. Thirteen acts included, the show is a wonderful attraction for anyone looking for entertainment in Hanoi. Great value for your money. Furthermore, the show gives you an insight into musical aspect of their culture, preformed live with a small band. Highly talented puppeteers make the show what it is, and you will not find anything like this anywhere else in the world. Must go if you visit the old quarters of Hanoi.

Don' tmiss this!. This really is a must. Wonderful music and very entertaining puppetry. Show lasts for about 50 mins and tickets are only about £3.00. Saw the show on the last day of our holiday and it sent us home smiling.

Great Show with lively puppet. The puppet show was great and true entertaining, we got our ticket early through our tour agent. and the ticket seller was kind enough to change our seating to front row when she saw our seating was slight behind. Though we not really understand much on the language part, the gesture and the action of the whole story is very entertaining and clear with the life and culture and history of Vietnamese People.

entertaining show . Cute and entertaining show that depicts the legends of the Vietnamese culture. As many of the previous reviewers stated, the entire show is in Vietnamese, but still entertaining to watch as it amazing how the water puppets are moved underwater. I was able to purchase my tickets as late as 40 minutes before the show on a Thursday evening. The employees are relaxed in regards to where people sit as it approaches showtime. There were people that were sitting in our assigned seats and the staff didn't ask them to move. We sat in the next available seats we saw open. The leg room maybe a little cramped for a 6 foot individual but comfortable for a 5'5" person. With nosebleed seats, we were still able to see the puppets. From where we were sitting we could easily differentiate between the puppets, but we couldn't see their painted eyes.

well worth a visit. Great to visit just to get a bit of the local culture in hanoi... only costs a couple of quid and is highly entertaining . Located right in the centre beside the lake if youve got a spare hour I would go
Well worth a visit. Traditional culture. Colorful, fun and musical. Try to get a front seat if you can. Show runs about 50 minutes.

Really awesome!. About a 45 min show. You can buy tickets directly in front of the theatre for ~ 3 usd (cheap seats) ~5 usd (more expensive seats). They have several shows a day and you can access their exact show times by googling their website). The puppets themselves are ugly but the way they are manipulated is almost magical. You cannot see the strings and they have effects such as fire or fog etc. The stories are only told in Vietnamese with no subtitles but the show is still very enjoyable as the puppets do well to represent a storyline although if Vietnamese was understood, it may be even funnier!

Puppet show is worth a visit. If you have some time, visit the show. Its very touristic, but the puppeteers are skilled and music is good. Everything is in Vietnamese, so it might be useful to read something about the stories before the show. I could not follow most parts, bus still enjoyed it.

Good show. Don't buy the cheap ticket, get the 100000vnd one, if you buy the cheap one you wouldn't see.
Good show nice music and interesting instruments

Nice show, but a bit too touristy and quite worn out. The water puppet show was excellent.
The building okay, but a bit cramped, not particularly clean and somewhat worn looking.
The musicians looked bored and non committed.
I would recommend this place for the show and easy location, not for the overall ambiance.

Welcome change to outside bustle . We really enjoyed this, with kids aged 2,4&5 absolutely ravished! Welcome break. It is interesting if you like a shallow introduction to Vietnamese culture and music :)

Worth a visit! . The Thang Long water puppet theatre is one of its kind. Very unique performance for a reasonable price (3usd). Show is about 45 mins and only at allocated timings! Be sure to book your ticket before the show as it is always sold out! Enjoy!

Interesting experience, good show!. Went for an hour long show which featured a selection of scenes from old Vietnamese water puppet shows. It was a unique experience that I'd recommend checking out when visiting Vietnam. A tip is to try and avoid getting a front row seat, as soon as the show started, mice ran out from under the stage and if you're in the front row, through your legs...

Really unique puppet show. This isn't a typical puppet show, it's all done on water with the puppets operated on long poles by people holding them on very long poles while the operators are hidden behind a curtain. There are multiple acts with different puppets appearing as people and various animals. The music and singing is all live, but none in English.

Must see!!. I arrived in Hanoi and was told to have a look at the water puppets at first i wasn't sure what to expect. The show is great value for money and its a great display via water puppets and the music as well. The sync was perfect and told a story you could understand as well. I came out knowing I have experienced something different and wont ever see back in the UK.

Interesting . It was nice to see their traditional water puppets acting out scenes from their rural life and historic events. Only lasts around an hour and all music is live. Interesting to see if you have the time.

So different and intriguing.. We bought tickets in the afternoon for that evenings performance. It cost very little. We arrived and were shown to our seats which were about three rows from the stage. The water in the tank in front of us looked a bit murky but we later discovered this is so you can't see the workings of the puppets.It was unnecessary to speak the language as all was done with mime. The local musicians played various instruments and sang along to the various scenes. Most of it is based on old pieces that were done in the rice paddies to entertain the workers.I have never seen anything like it anywhere before and it was a very interesting experience. Colourful and fascinating. Very worth a visit.

Oh God!!. Now this places depends on your personal preference. In one respect it is great to see traditional puppetry and traditional music. However our vietnamese guide told us after that even if you are vietnamese it makes no sense unless you are over 50!! all in all rather painful on the ears!!!

Excellent puppet show with a difference..... don't miss it.. We went here quite unsure what to expect and were pleasantly surprised. Basically it's a puppet show on water with local music, singing and a story line. It's ideal for all ages and specifically adult tourists.The puppeteers work extremely well to deliver a fast moving show (I think the perform it about five times per day !!). The story line although in Vietnamese is easy to follow and the singing is very captivating.Highly recommended that you purchase your tickets in advance of the show, only about 100 VND each. Try and get a seat near the front (as some people insist on trying to film it using iPads blocking the view !!!).Highly recommended, you have likely never seen a show like this before......
Water puppets . Although many may see initially as a little simplistic , we found it very engaging . Cleverly done and a beautiful insight into part of Vietnamese culture.

Fun & suitable for the whole family. Book early in your visit as some of the shows were booked out a day in advance. The show is short enough to be charming and unusual, with a series of short 'tales' about rural Vietnamese life - remember to pick up a brochure at the door that explains each section. Our kids bought reasonably priced puppets in the shop afterwards and acted their own shows out later, so it inspired them too.
Part of a great evening. A great look into the culture of Vietnam - history, songs, music, and humour. Coupled with a dinner cruise on the Saigon River - a great night.
One of the best puppet shows!. Never before have seen puppets on water.Very beautifully presented by the artistes.Puppets are manipulated and moved under water!

Overview the Legends of vietnam. This show is a must to get a general understanding of some the legends of vietnam. The set and puppets were amazing. The only down side was it was very very loud with a high sound pitch.

Great puppet show. This place was included in our tour package so we end up watching it. The show was quite nice. I liked the combination of the music and the way they performed the puppets in the water with all fire and stuff. It was quite nice.

Worth seeing. The water puppet show is well advertised. It is very well done, even though the average visitor cannot follow the story behind the performance. The puppeteers are very talented and do a very nice job. The musical accompaniment has some very unique instruments with equally unique sounds. It moves at a very nice pace.

Fun entertainment. It's not very expensive and only lasts about an hour so it's definitely worth going for some fun entertainment. You can get a ticket very easily on the day from the theatre and there are many showings throughout the day. I bought my ticket around midday for a 6.30pm showing for 100,000 VND and I'm not sure if they allocate the best seats first but my seat was on the second row which was pretty awesome.For my show, the theatre seemed pretty packed and you can grab a leaflet on the way in, showing the order of performances. There are musicians to the left of the stage with some Vietnamese instruments which I had not seen before. All puppet shows are done to background music with some singing and voice overs in Vietnamese which I did not understand, but I did not feel that it hindered my enjoyment of the performance.They make the shows very fun and enjoyable to all the family, and it's an interesting concept which I believe was derived as local entertainment when the rice paddies flooded.

An Enjoyable Experience. We went here as part of a tour group and had front row seats so were very comfortable. The show is done in Vietnamese but we could still work out what was happening. The puppets are in water as are the puppeteers who are in waist deep water behind a screen. It is amazing how they manoeuvre the puppets and get them to do all the things they do. The show lasts for about 50 minutes and is definitely worthwhile seeing.

WOW!. I didn’t know what to expect but wow, this show was terrific and so cheap. The music set the scene and then the show started. One of the highlights was when the dragons appeared breathing fire and smoke.Get your tickets early. The "expensive" seats were sold out (these are about $5) but the “cheap” seats we had still allowed us to clearly see everything.Don't miss it.
Unusual show. Interesting show of traditional form of art. Well produced, impressive execution, worth time and money.
Entertaining! . Worth the trip. Traditional music, cute stories, lighthearted entertainment. Unique. Suggest getting tickets early in the day as the one we intended to go to was sold out.

Definitely worth it!. After reading about the water puppets in the Lonely Planet, we deiced to go for a show at Thang Long Water Puppet Theater. My suggestion would be to book tickets a few hours prior to the show, especially if you're going on a weekend. Pay for the "more expensive" seats because they're about $5, although the inexpensive seats aren't bad either, just further away. The music and performance are quite an experience. Water puppets are a part of Vietnamese culture and have been around for over a thousand years. I'm glad I went for a show and got to experience it.

Puppets in water. It might be just me, but I thought this was a bit rubbish. My other half did like it much more than me though...So there are these puppets and they do silly things in water, some are like small stories.. The music is kind of good.The seats are not designed for anyone over 6foot unless you get a seat on the A row. Watch out if you get a big lady with a big hair do in front of you as the person sitting on one side of me did!The show lasts about 40 mins

Traditional Experience. We attended the Thang Long Water Puppet Theater on a very hot Hanoi day and we weren't disappointed. It was the last point of call on a day long private tour organised by EXO Travel. As the whole show is in Vietnamese it was fortunate that our tour guide had explained some of the more popular legends like the sword in the Hoan Kiem Lake to us before we arrived.The performers are very skilful with the various puppets (fairies, dragons, snakes etc) dancing and jumping in and out of the water. It is easy to see how this artistic expression has its origins in the village pond where all the community came together to share their legends and be close to their natural environment. The instrumentalists and vocalists also displayed a high degree of skill and provided a lovely background to the puppetry. It would be great if some of the stories were available in English to take away and absorb as I'm sure we missed some of the finer intricacies of the performance.

All ages will love this theatre. This was such a fantastic experience, I went expecting to be entertained and I was more than I thought. The way the voices and music complemented the puppets as great. All through the performance I was wondering how the puppeteers did, which was revealed at the end

Second visit still a charm. I visited this place more than 10 years back and the second visit is a still a charm. I don't full understand the story, but it was fun watching smoke rise from the water and the songs sung live. the puppetry is fun. don't sit too close, you might get a little wet. its been travelling round the world and i think it shows the culture of vietnam.The place is crowded, seats really narrow. so if you are a big guy, it makes more sense to sit at the sides. they will provide chairs for you on the steps. Don't want you to get deep vein thrombosis sitting in the seats. Enjoy a bit of culture and art. Surrounding the theatre gets very bz. watch out, thats all.
Water Puppet Show. India is very famous for puppet show, but the thing that I saw here is pretty great. One of the must visit locations of Hanoi specially if you have kids.

You shoul go. It is a must in Hanoi. It really deserve the ticket. The room is like a cinema, however it is recommendable to sit as front as possible even though it is more expensive. 10 people move the puppet with incredible talent in the water and you do not see them.If you take pictures or videos you are supposed to pay more but no one checked us.It lasts 50 minutes. The shows starts at 15:00 until 20:00. We buy out tickets just 15 minutes before entering but the first row where already taken.
Traditional fun. Absolutely delightful! An insight into the traditional way of life which needs no translation. A lovely theatre too and not expensive.
Worth a visit. Very well done,but, why oh why are people allowed to take pictures. There was a constant flashing all the way through. This spoilt the show for me.

Hilarious!. I am not sure if this was supposed to be funny but we absolutely loved it amd couldn't stop laughing. It is an absolute must! No one seems to pay the camera charge so just get a regular ticket.
Local culture . Don't expect 5*, but do expect a unique experience. No need to pay for "better" tickets. I have been a few times and would go again with friends who haven't been before.

Puppets are amazing but it's not in English . Puppets are very pretty and it's clever how they all work. The show is in Vietnamese so it is very hard to follow what is happening. Still something I would recommend as it's only 45 mins long and there are numerous shows throughout the day.

A Great way to spend one hour. We went to see the 3pm show and it was really good the show is all based on folklore and it's good fun, the cast of puppeteers all work behind the scenes waist deep in water

Must Watch it once in your life. We could not judge that puppet show with modern Hollywood or Disney Standard. If you do, then you would be very disappointed. It is a unique folk art that originated a thousand years ago during the Ly dynasty (1009). The show is in the water, and the people who control those puppets are also in the water, too. There is no much conversation during the show, so, it is no need for you to understand the Vietnamese at all. The content is mainly reflected the simple local life in the ancient time, like farming or fishing. I really like the way how they preserve their traditional culture. That’s not an 5 stars show, but I think you must watch it once in your life. At least you know what is Vietnamese water puppet.

Very fun!. We had no idea what to expect, but several people had recommended the experience. The theater is neat and the set is beautiful. The puppets are somehow operated by the puppeteers under water - very impressive! The show was one of the trippiest things I've ever seen - and it's entirely in Vietnamese so we had no idea what was going on - but we were very entertained. Performances aren't even an hour long, tickets are affordable, so this is easy to do! I had a huge smile on my face for the whole performance!

Great music, unique puppetry show!. Loved the show! You need to buy tickets in advance to get best seats. It is great value at 100,000 dong ($5) a ticket. There are various shows, all in the afternoon. It sells out fast, especially popular with tour groups! If you are taller than about five foot three, you might want to book seats on the first row (row A) because the leg room is very tight! The set was beautiful, like a temple backdrop with a pool in front. The musicians sit to the side and the music and singing was beautiful as was the unique puppetry. They allow photography. The entire show is in Vietnamese, however it is easy to follow. The only thing that could have been been better is that this one hour show could have been shorter.The cafe inside the theater is a little pricey, but it has good quality food. It sells pastries, coffee, ice cream, pizza, sandwiches, pasta and salad. It was quite busy before my show, so I didn't have enough time to order a proper meal.

Nice show. I do not understand much about the story of the show but the way to control these puppet is unique. The actress operated the puppet behind the scene in vietnamese trditional music. Most of audience is foreigners. I liked it, though I didn't understand. Nice time.

Suitable for young and not so young. This is defiantly worth the hour long visit. V entertaining even if it's in the local language. The only negative is if your a tall person not much room in the seats

Great show, poor service. Interesting puppetry of short stories that can be followed even without translation. An inexpensive taste of folklore and culture although you need to pay extra if you want to take photos and even more for video during the show. The live traditional instruments were a real highlight. But service was non existent. The single ticket office lady was quite rude and ignored the line of customers while shopping online on her tablet. When she finally gave us her attention she asked for the day and time then didn't let us choose our own seats but immediately circled them for us. The entire first row was empty and wasn't reserved but she wouldn't allocate them. Right when we were handing over the money for the tickets the phone rang and she ignored us while talking for 5 minutes about an enquiry in Vietnamese then finally hung up but the phone immediately rang again and she answered the second call once more. Surely customer service should be balanced. She should've answered the call, asked them to hold, finish the transaction then go back to the phone and alternate between the phone customers and physical customers. Instead the line was continually growing. The person behind us said something to her in Vietnamese while she was on the phone because it really took that long but she just ignored him. When she finally got off the phone there was no apology or smile and she even gave us the wrong time even though she had already allocated the tickets. Despite the lack of service, a great show that's well worth a visit.

Very well worth a visit . The performance is less than an hour but the musicians and puppet masters are very entertaining. You don't need to know the language and the humour and stories come over well.

Worth seeing! . It's an interesting show which is in Vietnamese. I would have given five stars if they would have at least given a short intro in English about what's about to happen before each show. Considering the fact that the audience is mostly tourists. Maybe I'm asking for too much;) Overall enjoyed it and worth paying a visit when you're in Hanoi! Mind you there are at least two theatres I know of which have this show. So perhaps do your homework before choosing. Two theatres are close by around the lake. Not sure if there are more.

Quite interesting despite you might think in the first place. I'm not such a big fan of theatre but this is something I would have missed. Takes an hour and the seating is tight for taller adults. But it tells a lot about Vietnam.

So weird. This show was good, but it was just not my cup of tea. I was constantly looking at the watch as I did not understand any of it, but it's a weird and nice experience :) Some people may enjoy it very much!
Entertainment. Well sorry worth going to. Unusual performance and suitable for visitors. book it to be sure of a place.

Don't miss out. Show was fabulous. I don't undestand really well about this kind of, but sound track was great to me. Over than 40mins then it's finished. They gave us some flyers before sat to watched. Ticket costs 100,000 vnd. I think it's good price.

Entertaining and Fun. The water puppets are a unique form of performance art that are unique to Vietnam. It's unlike anything I've seen any where else. My personal opinion is that every traveler to Vietnam should attend a performance at least once. I think you'll be entertained and fascinated by the way the puppets are controlled and you'll enjoy the stories that are represented by the colorful puppets. There is live Vietnamese music to accompany each scene which is also interesting and entertaining. Get a seat toward the front of the auditorium to get the best view - arrive a little early, or purchase your ticket ahead of time, as the best seats sell out. The performance lasts a little less than an hour and there are multiple performances every day. Have fun.
Special but must change.. I think this show should improve itself. It is so traditional and specialist show of Vietnam culture but it must be change in near future. No translation, no subtitle.

Looks interesting but do not understand the show. As it is in vietnamese, so we not fully understand the storyline. But it is interesting to see it at least once, with puppets moving or dancing on the water.

a different form of art. I wasn't all over the moon about what I saw but I appreciated the different form of art. Though the language is in Vietnamese, I did not miss out on the artistry and music. The sketches featured Vietnamese culture and they infused humor to it. Worth the watch for a 100,000 dong ticket.
Great Performance . A nice vietnamese cultural experience! The band is very good & sing in vietnamese! The show lasts for about 50 mins!

Water Puppet Theater. We really enjoyed this. All done in Vietnamese but it didn't matter as there was no need to translate. The puppets are lovely and it was all done very well. Great special effects. A must visit and well worth it.

Cute!. It took some effort to get a ticket, apparently many tourists want to experience the water puppet theatre. And rightly so. Although after a while the performance becomes a bit repeititve, it is an entertaining introduction to Vietnamese theatre and music. Well worth the visit!
Fun afternoon activity for kids. Lots of eye candy for little children, but the seats were excruciatingly small for adults! Have an ice cream at the adjoining cafe.
Back to basics. Loved this traditional performance. Although lyrics are in vietnamese there is no need for a translation, the numbers are just adorable

Great cultural visit. Puppets were really interesting and they had lofe musical performers on traditional musical instrument.
Must see!

Good Cultural Experience. This was a truly cultural experience. The show was basically a series of nine stories (if I remember correctly) enacted using puppets on water. Since the stories were narrated in Vietnamese, we didn't really comprehend what was happening in certain stories (especially the ones with the narrator just talking to the puppets). But we were able to get a gist of a couple of stories (the ones with just dancing puppets and no dialogue). After the show got over, we saw many people carrying brochures and we found out that the brochures explained the basic plot of the stories (although not in too much detail and I didn't see anyone consulting the brochure during the show). Somehow these were not given to us. If you visit, make sure you get your hands on one. The show is not extremely entertaining as such. But I recommend you go if you are interested in having a truly cultural experience. The location of the theatre is very convenient as it is right across from the Hoan Kiem lake.The ticket costs VND 100,000 and there are about 4 shows a day with each lasting about 50 minutes. The show timings are 15:30, 17:00, 18:30 and 20:00.

Quirky, worth an hour of your time!. We were in the old quarter doing a walking food tour and added this puppet show to the end of our tour...What little speaking that's done is in Vietnamese but it won't take from the show which seems to be a selection of 10-15 short acts from a far larger repertoire... The music and singing are very good... We found it entertaining and some good fun in placesIt's a one off experience and worth it with that in mind...Only minor quibble is that the seats are tiny... If you're over 1.7m tall it's a squeeze!

Exceptional. Not to be missed.. We have visited this special event a couple of times and each time are amazed at the spectacle. Everything is live including the music that makes the event very memorable. Buy tickets in advance as this is a popular venue and a little chaotic just before a performance so hold onto everything. Front rows get youy very close to the action.
