Water Puppets - Fairly average. This show was different. I don't think I'd spend money to see it again.It was spoken/sung in Vietnamese which is expected but is a little hard for the English speaking to follow.Some of the special effects were fun but I don't think it worth what we paid.
Worth seeing . An enjoyable experience. Fantastic little puppets that tell a story with some traditional music.A must see while in Hanoi.
Water Puppets. In my opinion, thisi is hightly overrated and a tourist trap. Perhaps not just this one, but water puppets, in general. There are better ways to spend an evening in Viet Nam.
Not a really amazing show. For us it weren't that worthful to see. A little bit boring. And the seats were really thight. But mabye you like it.

Not so interesting. It is quite unusual to see puppets play in the water and the performance would be super, except for some drawbacks. The atmosphere was heavy due to the water evaporation which made it a bit difficult to breathe. All dialogues were presented in Vietnamese (why not have a subtitles monitor somewhere?). It lasted toooo long... After the first couple of acts, there was no actual interest as you cannot understand. Nevertheless, the acts were funny and generally it was a good attempt. I was also disappointed by the toilets condition... No paper, no hands soap and a bit dirty.
A must see . Watched the show after a long flight. This was absolutely awesome. They are so talented and a show with a very different twist. A must see your trip is incomplete without watching this

Great and relax experience!. This is a nice place to learn and understand the Vietnamese mythos. The theater is the perfect size to this show. The price of the show is honest and compatible.The music and the musicians are amazing. The musical instruments are different from a Western point of view.The story is spoken in Vietnamese only...then its hard to understand the sequence of the action with the many figures on the water stage...you have to have a little previous knowledge about Vietnamese history.The puppets are simple and because that all scenery is so amazing!

Not too impressed. Maybe it was just the particular show that we see, don't really know if they have different shows, but we were underwelmed.No doubt the skills of the puppeteers and the musicians were to be applauded but the story telling needs some kind of interpreting even if just an occasional wording in english being projected, etc. So that non Vietnamese speakers will not lose interest. It was at least cheap and short enough.

True cultural highlight. A Vietnam Chinese style opera with life Orchestra performed with puppets in a pool. The puppet players stand in the water, invisible to the spectator. Truly special. Unforgettable experience.

Angkor Wat trip and so much more. I really didn't know what to expect from this but was really pleased it was included in the itinerary. There are several different stories all executed with humour and skill and the audience all seemed to enjoy the show as did I. Well worth taking the time to see the show.

Glad to have seen but wouldn't go back. This was an interesting experience. I enjoyed it for what it was but it is something that you wouldn't necessarily go back for again. Being tall, you are definitely at a disadvantage sitting for the whole show. I was glad when it was finished just so I could stand up and stretch my knees and I think the person I n front of me was glad to get my knees out of their back
Boring. After the first 2 shows it was boring. Couldnt wait for it to end. It was in Vietnamese and my friends couldnt understand

Not for me. Sorry yes there was skill in the puppetry, I am sure the singing was top notch, but the seats were uncomfortable and I got bored very quickly.A number of people appeared to enjoy it, so I am sure I might be in the minority, the show lasted just 45 minutes and cost 100k Dong which is probably US$5.
Unique Experience... Something different.. very well presented.. Vietnamese folklore presented in am innovative way. The artists are talented and they seemwd at ease.
Ok. This show was great for fifteen minutes then same same. No good if you are over five foot tall the seats are made for short people so he knees get sore after ten minutes.
Interesting . It was good but don't expect to understand too much as it is in vietnamese with littke translation. Lots of tour groups.

Worth a visit, fun and touristy. Walked in just as performance was starting to get ticket. Don't book through agency just go to box office. Wonderful hour of cultural entertainment. Funny, colourful, vibrant and entertaining. A must do in Hanoi.

Fun entertaining show. This is a fun show to watch. We watched a 40 minute version, kept us laughing and entertained thoughout. The water puppet concept is traditional and interesting if you have not seen it before. The theatre does get full so arrive on time, if you are late you might need to sit on the aisle.

AN ENJOYABLE SHOW. The water puppet show was an interesting and well choreographed show. It was entertaining. However, as there was no translation to English, we were a bit lost as to what the story back line was. But, with the movement and flow of the show which was split into several themes,we sort of understood what it was all about. It is a show worth seeing and it is always shown to packed houses.

Fun for a while. When you visit Vietnam, a water puppet show is a must see on the list.It's not super, it's not bad, it fun for a while. The show was with live music and singing. All in Vietnamese, so we could'n't understand a word of it. But it was fun to watch. Get you're ticket in advance to get a better place. We bought a rang 1 ticket and we had to sit way back. So get you're ticket soon !

Holiday to Vietnam & Cambodia with friends. I was expecting a show best suited to children but I was very impressed with the puppeteers who worked the various puppets by very long poles.The place was packed out & everyone enjoyed the show.

A worthwhile, uniquely Vietnamese show. A nice piece of Vietnamese culture. Great musicians, good singing, and the water puppets are unique. The price is more than reasonable and the show is about 45 minutes. Although everything is in Vietnamese I had no trouble understanding the story line. The puppeteering is excellent.If you are in Hanoi, you should see the show.

A waste of time. Firstly, the entire puppet show I caught was in Vietnamese language so I didn't understand a word of what was going on. There was no English commentary or screen prints at each scene change to explain the transition. The preformers were not engaging. Personally, I felt that I could have spent my time exploring more of old quarters instead.

Boring. If you're not theater lover or owns your own water puppet show don't waste your time. 50 minutes were more then enough. 60,000 vnd for the back seats, 120,000 for the front ones. I won't recommend this place.

Nice expirience but not consider it as good art. Although it looks a bit weird, im happy i went to it. It feels like a real folklore. i enjoyed most from the live orchestra playing there, all with traditional and special instruments that i have never seen before, and im a musician.. that was really impressive

Amazing show. I was truly amazed by this one of a kind of puppet show that I have never seen before. One tip though it is better to book a front row seat so that you get good pics and videos. I visited in September 2015 and the price for front row seating is 100,000 VND (apx $5). The show is for around 45 minutes with the program of performances being handed out to you before you enter the hall. Definitely worth your time:)

Good clean fun!. This was such a sweet experience. I was expecting it to be a bit like a pantomime, where it feels over rated and not really aimed at me! But it was very lovely, clever and fun to watch and listen, the musicians and singers were very good and the puppets were fascinating. It's only about £3 and lasts less than an hour. A full house and deservedly so.

Such a cute and unique performance. Two type of tickets, type 1 (VND100,000) and type 2 (VND60,000). We walked in at around 3PM to buy type 1, but it was sold out. We have to settle with type 2, performance at 8PM. For better view, recommended to buy type 1 well in advance.

Worth seeing, but not comfortable. This is something that you should see. We were given plastic seats at the side, but there were plenty of seats available in the main seating area. Not a lot of leg room. This is in Vietnamese so I couldn't understand the conversation between the puppets and the singers. It goes for about 45 minutes. We had a giggle at some of the actions of the puppets. Go, have a look, it is worth it.

Interesting show. Went in and it was full house so we sat in makeshift chairs along the stairs, which wasn't too much of a problem. Show was interesting incorporating the various scenes of Vietnamese life, and the art of water puppetry is just something so rare to find!
Amazing!!!. It was an amazing show! one of the best i have ever seen, so funny, live music and traditional vietnamese singing, not expensive at all, get front seats!!

Mental!. I have NO idea what was going on but we all loved it. I think it's vignettes from folk tales or something. But the puppets were fun and each scene was different. The musicians were excellent and really brought it to life. The seats however offer you slightly less legroom than Vietnam Airlines (which is about the most squashed I've been on a plane...) Def worth seeing....

Fun lighthearted entertainment. This was enjoyable even though we couldn't understand the stories which were in Vietnamese (not all the acts have speaking parts). The puppets were each unique with different moving parts and the choreography was impressive. The music was performed by a live band of traditional musical instruments which gave it a nice feel. Not a costly show, 100,000 dong for seats near the front vs. 60,000 dong for the back.

Great fun. We had heard so much about the water puppets and this show is definitely worth going to see. Indoors theatre style it's easy to see from where ever you sit. Great skill and the musicians are also very good. A great tradition and you get to applaud the puppeteers at the end.

Enjoyable. A short, fun, inexpensive event watching water puppets weave thru the water telling a story. Vietnamese music played live by singers and a band sit on the side of the stage. I would have liked a bit more explanation in English, but all in all worthwhile.

Great fun for the family. Definitely a 'different' highlight of our Indochinese holiday. The show was in several chapters, for want of a better word, with ancient stories being recounted by the puppets. The puppet-masters are highly skilled, and there were numerous moments when we just could not work out how the puppet-strings didn't get tangled. To the right of the water stage there were 6 -8 musicians playing suitably appropriate music. The show lasted some 40 minutes and we heartily recommend a visit. I cannot remember the cost as it was included in our day tour.The kids will love it.
Something different. A different type of puppet show and some traditional Vietnamese music. The show is well paced and broken into small stories. Worth a look.

Cute! . We enjoyed the puppet show! It was in Vietnamese with a little English translation at the beginning. Its great for the whole family! There's a live band there providing the music for the show as well. They use traditional instruments. Worth a visit!

Water Puppet show. Very cleverly done. The show was in Vietnamese so it was a bit difficult to understand, but one could get the general idea. A good cultural experience to experience once--not a show you'd return to again.

a nice bit of Vietnamese culture. Although the kids will love it more, this is still entertaining for adults. It is cleverly done with great skill. Not what you would call a spectacular show, but a nice bit of old culture that is worth experiencing if you have time.

Outstanding puppetry and even better music. We have just returned to our hotel after seeing the fabulous water puppets. We knew we were in for a great show even before the puppets appeared, because of the opening number from the band, which featured a one-string harp, which sounded like a cross between a slide guitar and a theremin! As musicians ourselves, we were amazed by the skill and artistry of the nine or so musicians, who provided every bang, boing and twang of incidental accompaniment, as well as full songs and tunes. As for the puppets themselves, they were entrancing, amusing and fun. There were water-blowing and fire-breathing drams, leaping fish, dancing chickens (or were they Phoenixes??), dancing maidens, a mini-tiger catching a duck and climbing a tree, and more. It's something you won't see anywhere else in the world. And even though the words are in Vietnamese, the languages of music and theatre are easy to understand.

Great play!. One should never miss going to Hanoi and not see this. In this 45 minute play you can get to learn Hanoi's culture. It has a great musical score and talented puppeteers. Overall, it's fun, educating and entertaining at the same time. =)
Very Vietnamese. Very clever with lots of short stories but all in Vietnamese so a bit difficult to understand. Never the less well worth a visit.

Water Puppets. Walking distance from the Sofitel about 20 minutes. My wife & I very much enjoyed this show which is a bit different. A Traditional Vietnamese performance telling a story. Yes in Vietnamese & a bit hard to follow the story line, but still able to appreciate.

Nice cultural experience. If you are looking for a Vietnamese cultural experience then this place is the best place to learn in an hour or so. It does attract a reasonable crowd in the evening. They charge bit extra for the photography and video but in my opinion it's not worth it especially if you got a ticket for back seats as the video/photographs will not be clear due to lighting and the size of puppets running around in water. I will certainly recommend to pay a visit though!
Nice show!. Even i can't understand the songs I am amazed how the plot of the story goes... we even laugh on some stints... loved this

Interesting but needs English explanations!. We enjoyed this traditional performance with the music, special effects and costumes but found it hard too follow the story lines. After the performance we discovered brochures with the explanation of the stories. Wish we had been given this sooner. Overall I would recommend a visit but visitors would appreciate it more if they knew what was happening.
Water Puppets. Very good,very clever how they did it,but,it was all in Vietnamese,so we couldn't understand the story.

A must do in Vietnam. One of the must see attractions on a visit to Vietnam. Although once seen you probably wouldn't go for a return visit. Reasonably priced for a 45 minute show. Easy to understand even though there is no English spoken. Very enjoyable.

Unique puppet show in hanoi. This was a pretty unique kind of puppet show. It was in a regular theatre with the puppeteers underwater. I had no idea what the story was about as the narrator was in Vietnamese but the music and singing from the 'band' was pleasant. It was a short show, only about an hour and filled an evening after dinner. I have heard since that it is quite a dangerous profession, so you have to admire the puppeteers for their skill.

Must see - fantastic. We had a great time! The puppets are so cute and original! They play out little scenes and there is live music to go along with it. Definitely would go again, highly recommend it!

Fun way to experience some Vietnamese tradition . Show lasts about an hour and tickets start at just 60dong (just under £1). It's in Vietnamese so unless you speak the language don't expect to keep up with the storyline but it's still fun to watch.

Uncomfortable . No room for legs, old, smelly and a guest appearance by a rat on the side of the stage.However, i do respect the art of pupperty and the voices of the orchestra. I can say I have been there done that. The Vietnamese love it and I see it food entertainment for kids.

Entertaining and enjoyable . The show was well presented the singing good the length of show just right. The puppets nice and colorful. The show had moments of humour and story telling make sure you get program in English. It was a bit squashy on seats no leg room.Slightly hot too. Enjoyable.
Too fun!. A must see for people of all ages. Beautiful music by live band and puppet show portraying history and mythology of the Vietnamese people. Smoking dragons, firecrackers and drama.
Fantastic!. An exciting surprise! We loved every minute of it: the puppets, the music and singing. Highly recommended!

An Entertaining Performance. We arrived at the theatre and were able to book tickets for the next session (in Septembe). We were in the 4th row and had a great view, there was a brief introduction in English but I recommend viewing each segment individually rather than trying to work out an overall story.

Enjoyable show. Live music, folklore show. Very naive and beautifule. We have seen it after visitibg Sa-Pa and othere places so all country scenes where familier.The length is just right - one hour.Not to miss.

A bit boring. One gets curious with how the water puppet is done. Once you see the show the first minute you uhderstand how and that's it. Appreciation of the story is limited because no translation is made. At 100,000 dong, it's not so bad.

Unusual puppet show and extremely cheap. Different people will have different opinions of this show but for what it costs, it is value for money. Also the show runs so often once it is open for the day, you have a choice of times. As the theater is quite small and fills up quite easily, it is advisable to book in advance. The ticket seller will try and sell you the more expensive seats but in reality you can get just as good a view with the cheaper seats since the theater is so small.Even if you don't understand the show and language, no matter; the music is great.

Nice end to an evening . It's a part of the Vietnamese Culture and it was an entertaining show. Kids would,love to watch the water puppet show. Water puppet show should be a part of anyone's trip to Hanoi.
Confused and weird. It was very weird and confusing especially because it wasn't in English. Pretty much the entire time I wanted to go swimming in the water. Other than that it was pretty funky

Great water puppet show.. Comprise of different short stories. The show is completely in vietnam language. Even thought, my family n I do not understand the language, we enjoyed watching it. The simplicity of the stories and the music is great and fanastic. I would recommend anyone visiting Hanoi not to miss. There are various time slot for the water puppet show daily. The theatre is very near to Hoan Kiem lake n old quarter.

Great, but way too many big phones and iPads.. They let people use whatever they have with them to take pictures of the show and unfortunately in our case it was a very rude woman with an iPad. She was filming the whole show and was very combative when asked to move the iPad by people around us. They allow people to film/take pictures if they pay extra, but it really distracts from the show when you have flashes going off and iPads being used.Otherwise it was a very fun and fantastic show. We didn't always know what was going on, but the information page did a good job of explaining.
Don't Bother. This is a ridiculous show that makes no sense. We all fell asleep! No one knew what was going on and even if it had been in English we still wouldn't have known what was going on!
So charming!!. Beautiful, lovely and very recommended! If you read the program before the show starts it will be much clearer
Strange and boooorrring! . It's boring, it's strange and we were close to fall asleep. Maybe nice for children? Don't know... Really don't understand these many goid ratings on TA.

Must see for Kids. I took my son to the show this evening and he enjoyed every moment of it. Purchased the ticket for 100k Dong per person and the show was worth it. Probably the best puppet show that I have seen so far.

Not a must, but nice. If you have some spare time you should go. The show is pretty impressive, and exposes you Vietnamese culture, tradition and myths. Although not very long, I got bored towards the end, since it felt it is repeating itself.

Musicians "steal" the show!. The musicians are incredible! We had never seen a show like this. Water puppets are an old institution/tradition. The puppeteers are behind a screen and the puppets appear "floating" upright on long sticks. Cows, fish, birds, butterflies, people. The dancing is remarkably expressive for wooden figures. Watch the musicians. They are amazing and play instruments unfamiliar to the western audience. Spring for the 100,000 dang seats ($4) which will place you in row A or B and there will be less interference from the camera flashes.

Great one time experience. If toy are visiting Hanoi this is one of must visit places. Thus is great experience. However as for us it was too long. Half time would be just right to 'feel and touch' old culture. Later on it become more out less the same. Having say that, you must visit this place to complete your experience and read about Vietnam culture and legends before it will enhance your overall experience.

too long.... The spectacle has some dynanic and interesting moments but overall is boring and uninteresting . At first, the fact that the puppets move on the water and the combination with the traditional music makes a different show from the performances of puppets we usually see . But the show lasts 1.5 hours ... too long to see similar and repetitive situations and music.

Puppets with stories to tell. This is something that is very different and fun , not like a normal puppet show, goes for about 1.5 hours, and very cheap, no matter what time you arrive the shows start soon after so you buy the ticket at the door, 120 VND per adult about $7 AUD and get the ticket with the show time, (there is a lovely little coffee shop next door to eat and drink whilst you wait) the puppets all tell a story with there actions, and even some comedy..

Interesting, but not enough to keep me awake.. The show sounded quite interesting so I bought tickets and off I went. The first 10 minutes really caught my attention. The orchestra was fun to hear, and the puppets cool to watch, and then it wasn't so interesting anymore. It got little repetitive and then I fell asleep...Since I slept through a bit I can't say whether it picked up so I would say it was average, since I really enjoyed the beginning.
Weird experience . Very recommended for small children. For us, two adults, it was a bit boring and long, not to mention the small space for legs for the average male.

Cultural. Loved it but when on for a bit long and realy didn't understand too much. Inside in air con but seating is very cramped for westerners. Overal it was a cultural event with lots of colors from light show. Music was traditional and the instruments were all new to us so this fairly interesting.

Not a must see. Was looking forward to this but must confess it was a little looooong, and I wasn't the only one to think this. Should be revamped, made shorter and perhaps some background in Englsh too might help draw more of the crowds in. Best part around the lake is the delicious local mint and lemon popsicles you can get!! A walk aound the lake is also lovely esp. in the cooler times of the day.

Very different and lovely show. I had seen puppet shows in india but water puppet show was first time. The narration with music and song was really pleasant to the ears, just that it was in Vietnamese . Kudos for the performance, stage set up and the effects. MUST GO if you are in Hanoi. It is just for an hr

Great show. A puppet show with a real difference. Very interesting to see how the cast and the puppets all work in unison together to make a great show which is just under an hour long. If you haven't see it we recommend you do.

A fun experience. Even though it is done in Vietnamese you could still make out the story line in the performance we observed. At first I thought it was going to be a waste of time however quickly found myself smiling and then laughing. If you have children do not miss it on any account, if you do not it will still be a great experience. The performers are athletes in the amount of energy they have to consume with the poles and actions of the puppets!
The live orchestra was the best. It was interesting seeing the water puppets for the first time, however I felt like if something was missing. The live music was great :-)

Entertaining show. I found this show very funny, you will have no idea what is going on the entire time because it's all in Vietnamese but it makes no sense which is hilarious! The musicians and puppeteers are very talented, really enjoyed the show

Out of this world. I was blown out of the water with this show. Highly recommended. And I won't say more cause I don't want to spoil the show! Go see it if different cultural activities and shows is your thing or if you are looking for something a bit different. Well worth your time!!!

Definitely worth a visit!. Yes, it is different, but that's what's fun about it. I think it's impressively well done and something very different from what I've seen before. The price is reasonable too. Sometimes it was a bit slow though and they spoke Vietnamese so couldn't really follow the story. Anyhow, great way to experience some culture!

One time watch. I have never seen puppets on water before so this was interesting. Only drawback ....they dont explain the storyline as everything is spoken in Vietnamese....may be a brochure will help. In case you miss it here, you can watch in Nha Trang as well !

Nice, but do pre-reading. The performance starts with ladies singing in Vietnamese and a group of artists making very nice Vietnamese music. The puppet show is nicely done with various creations moving through the water. Since everything was in Vietnamese and I had not done any pre-reading, I had no idea what the story was about. A few sentences on a brochure obtained after the show, explained it all. I wish I had been smart enough to get this brochure before the show.
A must do visit!. A 'must go' place as it is fun to watch and relaxing as well. It is all in their native language but my kids had so much fun that they asked for a 2nd show.

incrediabile performance. This show and its story was very well presented and very cleverly done. It was a wonderful experience to see such incredible talent not only the puppets but the music and the vocal.. Lasting only approximately one hour it was not drawn out too long. We would sit through this show again if back in the location..

One of the best Puppet shows. If you are visiting Hanoi, please make sure to go and see this show.The theatre is in very central location and make sure that you buy your tickets earlier as it is very popular with the locals and the tourists.If you have time enjoy freshly squeezed vege juice at the bar next door .The Puppet show is well balance in length with traditional Vietnamese singing and instrumental performances, and of course the Puppets.The puppets are very realistic and the scenes represent Vietnamese way of life.Very clever and skilful show .

A Slice of Vietnam. This is an entertaining hour of a throw back to centuries old Vietnamese entertainment. We got tickets that day and was well worth the $5, The live music and vocals are unique throwing you back to another era. It's short,unique and engaging.

Love it!. Some may consider it as childish. Precisely this is why I enjoyed it. The simplicity of short stories yet very well managed and presented. Tradition mixed with the facility of modern ages. The seats are quite small, For tall people, prefer an aisle seat which also gives you the option to get a folding chair in case you do not fit.

Amazing water puppet show. Must for a cultural feel of Vietnam. with local musicians and centuries old puppet theatre. the theatre group is world renowned and was a pleasure to watch. Just by the lake..

Entertaining. For our last night in Hanoi we went and saw the Water Puppets Show. The show is completely in Vietnamese but you can understand what is going on very easily.I would recommend you buy your tickets as early as possible to try and get seats as close to the front and in the middle.We were in about Row 5 in the middle, a good view, but as the steps up between the each row of seats is very small, and we had a couple of taller people in front which made it hard to see at some parts.The seats are very close together and not much room between each row, so if you are tall you may be cramped, but the show is less than an hour.
We really enjoyed this. We didn't know anything about what water puppets were but we loved it. Didn't matter that we didn't understand the songs or know the stories, the show was very enjoyable.

Great show, fantastic music. Great show. Remarkable puppetry. The music was authentic and created a very magical atmosphere. Although I did not understand the Vietnamese narrative, the puppets told the whole story. A must see for anyone visiting Hanoi. Tip: watch out for pick pockets as you queue for tickets, they queue with you!

It ticked the box....... The skill and overall theatrics of the water puppet show is excellent. It's (understandably) a popular attraction and so make sure you book well in advance for the time that you want. It's also worth noting that the show is done in Vietnamese - get hold of a programme ahead of time that explains what each act represents. Overall I was pleased I went but there were bigger highlights from the visit to Hanoi. As the title of this review suggests, my visit there ticked a box but little more......

Great for kids and toung at heart. We went along for a bit of cultural fun for our 4 yr old, but were pleasantly surprised at how good it was. It is a really nice traditoonal art form done well. We just rocked up am hour before and got our tix. Worth a visit, especially with kids. Pick up the guide before you go in, will help you understand whats going on.

Well, Ok..... We have a 4 yo traveling with us, so we thought this would be nice. And it was, mostly filled with adults and extremely crowded, not for the faint of heart. The facility is purpose built with high ceiling and clear views from all seats. The seats are theater style that fold up; and a good thing to. They took there seating arrangement from a budget airline; I am 6' and my knees were in my chest. The seating arrangement maximizes ticket sales and makes for an uncomfortable experience. Tends to get a bit warm as well with this many people. The music is the real attraction here. The instruments are very unique and the artists are great. The water puppets themselves are a bit dated and the show adequate (it is after all, a puppet show). I would recommend going if your in the area and you have some free time, but certainly not something you will regret not seeing.

Ok ok. I heard a lot about this play but unfortunately it turned to be an average affair.The biggest problem with this play is language. If you are not from vietnam, bet you won't even get one line properly.The concept of water puppets is nice and can keep you engaged but not for long.I hope they do this with a storyline and English language.

Unique show to see in Hanoi. The water puppet show was very different and amazing. It's very entertaining and fun and although the music and dialogues are in Vietnamese you can follow the plot and it's very enjoyable. There are special effects which I am not going to mention to not ruin the show surprise but I didn't expect it and I think it added a unique touch to the show. The price is $5 and they have several shows in a day. The audience is all tourist so you don't need to worry about the attire, it is very casual. Overall it is a good show and I definitely recommend it to see in the north since it was originated in north side of Vietnam. The whole idea is very ingenious.

Wonderful!. My friends gave this event mixed reviews, but I went to see it anyway because I like puppets. The show was amazing. There is a group playing traditional music on the side. The puppeteers behind the screen are incredibly skilled and strong, as they manipulate the puppets using long poles submerged in the water. The puppets are wonderful works of art and have surprisingly lifelike movements. Getting a good seat is critical. It is well worth paying for the more expensive seats with a better view. It's also helpful to watch some videos and learn about water puppetry in advance so that you can really appreciate the show.
Lost in translation. Obviously very cultural but lost on non Vietnamese speakers. Way too long for me.pupeteering was very educational.
Colourful show. Only a brief introduction in English. We did not really enjoy as we could not understand the language. Colourful and interesting musical.

Just OK. This would be better if they translated in English as we didn't know what was going on and the jokes they were saying was only understood by the local crowd. I actually fell asleep at one time. Interesting performance initially and must be quite hard to maneuver the puppets, but I would not go out of my way to see it.

typical vietnam!. Typical vietnam, amazing production and a very old tradition, bit difficult to understand whats going on or follow any storyline! But doesnt distract from an amazing night, which epitomises asia and especially north vietnam.

Interesting Cultural Nice Music. Wonderful skill of the musicians and puppeteers. They enjoying & cheerful. We too. Somehow feel sleepy. Maybe too tired after sightseeing on the hot weather. My wife like the music, think of buying cd elsewhere.

Once is enough. I was really looking forward to this as it seemed like a top thing to do in Hanoi, and to experience the culture. But, it wasn't as good as I thought it would be. I didn't have a clue what the story was about but it was nice to hear the music and watch people work the puppets. It's about 30-45 minutes long, which is the perfect amount of time.. any longer and we wouldve been bored. I wouldn't go to see it again, but for the culture it was nice. and for 5$.. it was alright... It wouldn't be something I recommend to others really.

Fun and Unique. This is a very interesting idea invented hundreds of years ago during flood season. I was skeptical at first, thinking it would be boring due to lack of understanding. Though I didn't understand anything they said in Vietnamese, it was easy to follow the stories and the show is very entertaining and artistic. I would not leave Hanoi without watching.

Lovely evening . It's always good to see something cultural when you travel.This was an enjoyable 40 minutes. We didn't understand a word but that was not necessary and it didn't prevent you being fascinated because it's for the young at heart. Warning, the seating is a little tight for us westerners.

interesting. Interesting. Long enough without getting boring. Make sure you get a copy outside the entrance of the order and what is happening, we found it made it more enjoyable. Lovely to hear the young kids ohh and arching... made it more enjoyable. Wonderful skill of the musicians and puppeteers, who also run the tickets, shop and other duties. Definitely make a visit. Cheap too.
Expect the unexpected. I was totally amazed at this show. I heard it was good but that's an understatement.Very very good, funny , amazing costumes and music. Inexpensive as well.Great show.

Cultural but not my thing. . Went with two friends, we bought the 100 thousand tickets which are the ones closer to the front. If I'm honest I would get the cheaper ones, unless your on the front row the seat doesn't matter. The puppet show and the singing was entertaining for the first 20-30 minutes but me and my friends soon found ourselves looking at the time to see when it would be finished. The whole show takes about 45-50 mins. It's worth going to the show for the cultural experience but don't go when tired as could feel myself nodding off towards the end as it was dark. It would also be better if the scenes were explained both in Vietnamese and English as you do get a card which helps you follow but would be nice to just have a quick reminded through the speakers as well. Was okay for a one time thing to kill some time in the night but I wouldn't go back again.
Interesting. We were looking forward to this but left disappointed. No air con in the middle of summer. Hard to see puppets but what we saw was really good. Worthwhile seeing because it is so unique

One of those things you can't not do. I'll be honest, this is probably something you'll walk out of and feel you've wasted some precious minutes of your life but it's one of those things that you just have to see when you're in Hanoi. The first 20 mins is good then it all becomes a bit same-y. The people are talented, the puppets are well made and the show is well executed. It's worth a visit, but like I said 20 mins is probably enough!
Cultural experience. It was my first time experiencing a water puppet show and it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The live music and the movement of the puppets was a joy to behold

A Must Do Cultural Show In Ha Noi!. This is a must do cultural show in Ha Noi as you will gain a valuable insight into Vietnamese work and play as portrayed through the arts. Water Puppets is only an hour show, and entertains. Its a very unique way to tell stories and steeped in Vietnamese tradition. Tickets only 100,000 ($5) and a range of shows late afternoon and evenings. Some hotels sell tickets at their front desk so then no need to head to the theatre to get them which helps. Enjoy the show.
It was nice. The water puppet was nice, but I don't have to see it again. 6 short storys about some legends. Could be better made

A unique performance in Hanoi. Visited here recently with a group, in a cental location in the old quarter set in a theater with graduated seating. A small brochure describing what each puppet story represented was given to everyone, most common languages were catered for. A small traditional vietnamese band performed beautifully before the lights dimmed and the variety of puppet performances began. Although no words were spoken the performance was accompanied by music and singing and traditional stories were told sometimes humourously about Vietnamese life and culture. The performance lasted for about 40 minutes. We all thoroughly enjoyed the show however the seating was hard and extremely squashed so much so i felt claustrophobic at times. Little puppets were on sale outside for about $5 . Overall a very entertaining performance (If you find this review helpful please tick the box tks )

Why not?. I think everyone should go to this so that they can they say they've done it. You get a program list which was the performances in english but then that's it. It is magnificent but then at times you will ask yourself "what am i watching?" Its great for all ages and is run to schedule. Not that long and right in old quarter, so why not?
Great performance. The performance is great, although no subtitle is provided. Perhaps will be better if subtitle can be provided in the roof of the house (performance stage)

Summarized Vietnamese culture. Despite the language barrier, I enjoyed the whole show. A culture is a way of life of people--the behaviors, beliefs, and values, and are definitely symbolic. You dont need people speaking same language.

Good fun, worth seeing. Good fun activity suitable for all ages. really enjoyed seeing something typical, though worth managing your expectations that the puppetry is good but limited by traditional methods - so don't expect too much!

Unique and fun. Really enjoyed the show. The traditional music and singing was nice to hear, and the puppets were very amusing. It was around 45 minutes long and it only cost approx 4 USD for seats at the front, so it really is worth a look. I know several reviewers have said they were dissapointed, but bear in mind that it is a short show and a small price, and it is just a little experience of traditional entertainment.

A bit underwhelming.... Most reviews have said this is a "must see", however, we left feeling underwhelmed at the now dated looking puppets (several had arms broken or missing altogether). Some scenes, such as the fire/water dragons were entertaining, but others lacked much in the way of excitement. Many around us were clock watching at the end.The price is reasonable for an hours escape from the bustle of Hanoi, several performances are available each day. There is a free leaflet (available in several languages) that gave the titles of each act, but would benefit from additional detail to help international visitors a better understanding of the stories.

GREAT SHOW. This is a must to do in Hanoi, It provides a great insight into Vietnamese culture. Although the show is fantastic, so are the Vietnamese band and singers, which for me was the highlight of the show. Although the show is in Vietnamese it is easy to follow for adults, not to sure for children it would be that easy.It would be good if English subtitles were provided.

Very amusement and great for children. I love it, it show us how does they work on the fields and their greatest fear: the kitty cat hahaWith love music you can really feel and understand a lot about their culture

Unusual. We took in the Water Puppet Theater since we were curious and had never heard of it. We had never seen anything like it before and probably never will again. It was quite enjoyable. It was fun to see the technical proficiency of working the puppets with rods underwater, and the musical accompaniment added Vietnamese mood and color. The singing did this too; although it is always a challenge to enjoy singing when you do not know the language. It is not so impressive that we would ever go again; but we were glad we had done it. Probably even better if you have kids.

Killed an hour . We were told we couldn't miss a puppet show in Hanoi... And the truth is we probably should have missed it! It was ok. It killed an hour for £3 so it was cheap enough. Hot inside and seats were fairly cramped. Show was in Vietnamese (obviously lol) throughout so 99% of the audience couldn't follow and most talked the whole way through it which was off putting. Most of the audience had their phones out taking videos and pictures which can seriously block your view. The Italians sitting in front of me recorded a good 15 minutes of the show... I ended up watching it through their phone! The musicians are clearly talented, but i would happily never see a puppet show again!
Not my thing, but worth going just to see. I'm glad I went to see this just as something different that you wouldn't see in the UK. I wouldn't go again but it was an interesting one time experience.

No thanks. We may have enjoyed this if we could see it. For a small fee you can photograph or video this show. Bad news for anyone behind a camera or huge iPad being held up for the entire show. Don't bother

A different kind of play. This show was quite interesting. It's cool that it's all done in water and some of the scenes were really funny. There were only the front row seats left when we got there so we paid the 100000 dong which wasnt bad anyways. It was good to see once and I'm glad I saw it, but probably not something I'd pay to see twice

Traditional show. Apparently the art of water puppetry was invented by the rice farmers. It is very clever and interesting to watch. The show lasts about an hour and is made up of about 15 short scenes, each depicting a little story, some quite funny in a very simple way. It is a charming and pleasant show.

Entertaining. We're very lucky since we bought the ticket around 7pm for a show that starts at 8pm, on Saturday. The last show is 9.15pm everyday. The seats are like in cinemas, and it's not free sitting, so be sure to check your seats on the ticket. I got the front row, which I think it's the best. The show itself was very entertaining and a must to see to know more about Vietnamese folklore and legends. An hour show.

Incredible and amazing show. A special experience. But do your fellow audience members a favor and enjoy the show without waving your camera or phone in front of others to take pictures. The show is not to be missed. Still scratching our heads to figure out how they do it. Do not leave Hanoi without seeing this.
Fun but touristy. We visited in the middle of a hot afternoon. It was quite fun but very touristy and I'm not sure I'd bother trying to take photos. Still, a good way to spend an hour.

A Must Do. My wife wanted to go and the guide books suggested it was worth seeing.I had misgivings at what seemed to me a bizarre way for an adult to spend an hour.Any misgivings were quickly dispelled as I sat down to watch an enthralling spectacle.The performers put their all into the show which is spectacular. I feel sure you will be left wondering just how they managed to do so of the scenes. I'm not going to describe the show. Best go and just enjoy the performance.

WATER PUPPET SHOW. I noted some reviewers were not impressed by this marvellous show in Hanoi. Years ago it was brought into this theatre to show what the farmers did in their communities to provide entertainment. Ignore bad reviews as this show is one of the highlights of visiting Hanoi. We booked through our hotel, the Metropole, day before we went and got front row seats which made our visit so enjoyable.

Exceded my expectations!. I went to the puppet show with very low expectations due to friends' comments and I was pleasantly surprised. We paid £3.30 for a very good seat. I enjoyed the music and singing. The puppets were very colourful and it's very pretty with candles and sparklers I thought it was very clever the way the puppeteers operated them. Apart from the introduction the performance is inVietnamese but the humour is obvious. It is very popular and does 4 shows a day. Even in low season the theatre was full for the 8pm show. It only lasts 45 minutes so even if you don't like it it doesn't"last long. A great cultural experience that might be too simple for some tastes but I'd subgroup give it a go if time allows.

Not really my thing.. I have a hard time writing a thorough review about this because it was not really my type of sight to see. Must say that a was and still am amazed by how to puppets are controlled and mastered..

Amusing. It won't exactly be a big miss if you decide to give this a pass but its pretty cool. It's especially great for families with kids. The only thing is you won't understand a single thing unless you speak Vietnamese but you pretty much get the idea of some of it though actions and the rhythm or the music.

Must See this Slice of Vietnamese Culture. Beautifully put together show. A great mix of tales from folklore & homage to the agricultural life. The puppets literally glow in the reflection of the water, doing amazing feat in water & through air. spark, smoke, laughter & awe are all well represented in the 1.5 hour show. Stage set was well designed, along with a talented live band performing. What can be improved: 1. Upon entering there is a strong odor, possibly from the water. 2. There was a Caucasian audience taking picture with a flash camera behind us non-stop throughout the show. I know there was no signage forbidding flash camera because the puppets could not complain. But I strongly advise the management to forbid the use of flash camera so other audience can enjoy the show.

Enjoy rural life .. This was a lovely puppet show which was beguiling in its tradition and simplicity. Relax into it and appreciate how different life used to be in the country in times gone by.Don't judge this by modern media standards. Its a sweet history of mythical creatures and amusing little stories. Delightful. Indulge yourself by seeing as a child again.

A 'Must-See'. Culturally unmissable, this very traditional art form is unique to Vietnam (I think!) - but don't expect Disney!! It's worth a visit and good value for money but a little twee and somewhat cheesy.

Such a Unique & Insightful Way to See Vietnamese Culture. Everywhere we went we looked for live music in Hanoi; there is an Opera House, yet no concerts going on. No matter how much we googled, searched, or inquired, all of the answers were the same: No. How can a city with such culture have no live music to be found? At least Thang Long Water Puppet Theater offered a glimpse into the ancient past of Vietnamese culture with a small orchestra of musicians playing instruments I have never seen in real life before and three women who sing in the most angelic way. The best part is that the music is incorporated into the water puppetry that you watch. You can see before your very eyes the culture and the beliefs of the people by the display of the various numbers performed by the puppets in conjunction with the music. The only downside is that for someone who is very tall, the seats are crunched together so it is not that easy to get comfortable for the little over an hour show. So if you are tall and you decide to attend a show, which you definitely should, make sure you are not alone and are sitting by someone you want to get really close to so you can lean on them while you watch the magic and splendor unfold before you.

Great afternoon out. Magical and different to any other shows I've been to. The music is beautiful so are the puppets. Short show that's definitely worth going for, situated in old quarter which allows for shopping thereafter

A delight. We really enjoyed the show. I've music a day since going is nice. Even though it's in Vietnamese and the seats are narrow, we loved it. It's a one hour show and the price is fair. Mostly recommended to all the family members.

Well worth a visit. Amazing performance, despite the majority being in Vietnamese, it was still very easy to follow and well worth a visit. Was also thoroughly enjoyed by my little ones aged 11, 8 and 7.

Cultural delight. Our guide from indochina odessey had purchased our tickets, escortec to the front row. We were unsure what to expect. I must say this was great entertinment , from the singers on the side of the stage, to the fabulous puppet masters. A enjoyable show. A must while in Hanoi

Cute puppets on water. Went to see this puppet show not really knowing what to expect and absolutely enjoyed every minute of it. The puppetry is very clever and you would swear that many of the puppets are real as their movements are so real to life. The orchestra plays beautiful music to compliment the show and the theatre is lovely, intimate and comfortable. Recommended to all ages. A++

Very unique. I have never been to a Water theatre puppet show before.
The show is very entertaining, all shows and narration in Vietnamese.
Shows only start at 4.10pm there are 4 per day.
The show runs for 50 mins. The cost for adult is 100,000 vnd. Which is 10 usd.

A great bit of entertainment.. We got tickets to see this show whilst in Hanoi. We had read mixed reviews about it and had noticed that people were saying that it wasn't worth the money. It was £3 each for the best seats in the house and even though we did not have a clue what was going on it was highly amusing for puppet show and really well worked by the puppeteers. How anyone can say that it wasn't worth £3 or even less than that if get seats further back is beyond me. Well worth a visit.

The cultural highlight of our trip. The Water Puppets were a cultural diamond for us in Vietnam. I am a fan of opera and the arts and for me this show bought everything together in a unique way with a sense of humour. The orchestra and singers that accompanied the puppets were exceptional too. Our show was all in Vietnamese, some in English were available I think. Stories were told as simple vignettes that reflected the day to day aspects of rice paddies, fishing and nature as well as history and legends. The use of smoke and fire was stunning. I regret only seeing one performance!

Terrific puppet master skills on display . I found the water puppet show a very enjoyable experience and would recommend people take the time to go. The show goes for about 45 minutes and at a cheap price of approx AUD $6 - it is a very entertaining performance. The puppets are adorable and fun for all ages. It is also a chance to hear and see some of the local musical instruments and experience some of their culture. Make sure you read the English program before the show so you can follow the story, as the performance is in Vietnamese. The theatre is cool inside and is a nice respite from the heat as well
Worth seeing !. When you arrive HN , you shouldn'n miss this kind of art . Its a wonderful experience for u to understand more about VN

Water puppet show. We bought tickets at the door few hours prior to the show.Upon entering, we were given a pamphlet with english regarding the scenes of the show. Outside of the main theatre, there were water puppet dolls for sale and a few other souvenirs. The show does not have dialogues but were accompanied by vietnamese folksong.Interesting show for whole family, worth a visit
Cultural. Great way to experience Vietnamese culture. Cheap tickets and easy to access. The puppeteers were great and so were the band. Excellent for families with children.
Enjoyable. The water puppet show was fun to watch and perfect for families. Amazing synchrony with the puppets and the band were great!

Has got air con. We had read up about the water puppets as being one of the things to do in Hanoi, to be honest I was dragged there by my girlfriend (who loved it). It was quite good to watch, but lasted for 50 minutes! On the plus side it had air conditioning and only cost 3 quid

Nice thing to do if you had spare time.. Reasonable thing to see. It's all in Vietnamese, hence a little hard to understand the story line (if there is even any), but the puppets are interesting nevertheless. The seats are very close to each other and is definitely not catered for tall people. Should buy your tickets at least a day in advance - tickets for certain times run out quite quickly.

Spoiled by an inconsiderate audience. We were impressed with the skill of the musicians and the puppeteers and enjoyed the show when we could see it. We were really disappointed to have paid the higher ticket price only to find ourselves in row K (at least half way back). The show was ruined by people holding smart phones and cameras in the air to take photos and videos during the performance, blocking our view. Some people even stood up from their seats to film portions. A no camera policy really should be enforced.

A History Lesson. Do your homework before you go to watch a show as it is the story of early days in this country. Most travel books will have a brief description of what the show is about. The puppets are amazing and the show is a most worthwhile inexpensive visit. Choose a seat in the 1st few rows if you can.

Interesting. We had heard great things about this show so it was a must do on our trip to Hanoi. We purchased what we were told were 1st class tickets that didnt seem to have any significance. The show itself was very interesting to begin with but I have to say it was a bit slow for me. Worth the time and effort to check it out but dont expect to much.

Seats could be improved. The show was delightful and cleverly performed. However, the ticket counter service was very poor - the person was quite rude in her responses when we tried to ask about the show times and prices. However, the main problem was the seating - the seats are quite close together and taller people would not find it comfortable.

Cheap and interesting. I had read a lot of reviews on here and so wasn't really sure what to expect but I enjoyed it! There's several showings a day so we booked in the morning for one of the afternoon showings and got good seats near the front. There are 14 different 'acts'. If you get a program (free, just before you enter the theatre) you will have an idea what's going on. (All the singing/speaking is in Vietnamese.)I think I was expecting much more intricate/controlled movements with the puppets, but it's all quite basic, although it's impressive how they all move around one another. It's pretty cheap, the whole thing lasts about 45 minutes and its traditional Vietnamese culture, so I would say it's worth a watch!

Interesting but boring after a while. Sorry but didn't really do it for us - it's OK but didn't live up to the hype... Found it a bit boring after a while, though there were a few nice moments. Still glad we went...

Unique experience . A must do in Vietnam! It could probably be shortened by a couple of minutes as others said but is very interesting in any event. We had front row seats which were excellent (and we didn't get wet!) As everyone likes to take pictures these days they should just add in the photo charge to the ticket price (and thus avoid wrangles with the spouse over a negligible amount ;-))

Culture in the water. A magical experience with puppets "performing" in the water for the entire 50 minute show. This gives an insight into many of the cultural aspects of rural (rice growing) life in Vietnam. Be prepared also for lions, dragons and unicorns. The dancing fish are particularly enticing. A not to be missed show on your visit to Hanoi.

Water Puppet Show - Hanoi. Now crossed off my bucket list. A strange and slightly surreal cultural event. We were told that the show had been reduced to 50 minutes because people kept falling asleep. This was not due to boredom but rather the melodious opera singing, heat and towards the end repetitive actions. All artisans/performers were very skilled and competent. We have been unable to find out why the fisherman's wife looked like Madame Lash with exposed breasts and buttocks, when all the other puppets were traditionally attired

Traditional water puppet theatre. A bit for tourist trade but fun and cleaverly done. Puppets told ancient stories and were quite funny too. Nice music to accompany. Sit near front to ensure good view. Leg room is very tight if you are over 1.7m!!

Cool show - go see it! . Definitely something to do one evening in Hanoi. It's cheap, short (50 mins) and very unusual! Those with long legs may be a bit uncomfortable, and the seats aren't particularly brilliant for seeing over the heads in front, but definitely worthwhile regardless.
Interesting!. This show was very interesting and I throughly enjoyed the live music that accompanied it! Definitely worth seeing if you've never seen one before!

Don't be hating. Yes, the seats are a little cramped. If you 6'10 you may need to be a contortionist to fit in the theatre chairs, but it's worth every penny. The variety was refreshing, the music was traditional, the theatrics and control of the puppets was fantastic. It's a great way to experience a little bit of Vietnamese tradition. If you're to posh sauce to enjoy yourself at this venue because of a little discomfort then you should go back to your five star hotel and soak your head in lotus water.

Different experience. The Water Puppet Theatre is the sort of attraction that attracts differing reactions - some say it is a "must see" while some see it as "boring". I found myself somewhere in between. It is possible to be interested in, and sensitive to, other cultures and yet find something like the water puppets not to your taste. I appreciated the talents of the musicians and the skill of the puppeters but on reflection if the performance hadn't been part of our tour I wouldn't have been unhappy at giving it a miss. To me it wasn't as good as some have found it and not as bad as others say. My advice to people deciding whether to go is to read a range of reviews here and judge for yourself.

Great show. We had a meal at Green Tangerine which is a couple of minutes walk away and well worth a visit either before or after you show. The Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre, is just across the road from the Lake of the Restored Sword the address: 57B Dinh Tien Hoang.. There are puppet shows every day at 15:30 - 17:00 - 18:30 - 20:00 - 21:15 and Sunday at 9:30, Get a vé,ticket to see the art of water puppetry which dates back to the 11th century when these puppets were used to tell stories in the rice paddies. You can buy retired puppets beside the lake (and several other places) for less then the ones for sale at the show. I have been to both the show here in Hanoi and the one in Saigon. They are a bit different the one in Saigon is funnier but the one in Hanoi is more original (water puppets started in this area) and more professional. We were lucky to have a two string harp player do a short recital before the puppet show started, it was excellent. Don't get seats in the front unless you want to get wet (in Saigon) and don't get side seats in Hanoi.

Great show but beware the seating. The puppet show is a great experience and very entertaining, especially for young children. Due to a late booking we were seated in the upper gallery and the view was poor due to not being able to see past the heads of people in rows in front. We had to stand in the back row to see. Sitting up high you also miss some of the wonder of the show too as you can see all the sticks and tricks. Seating aside though I would definitely return to see another showing.

Amazing show! A must visit. The water puppet show is a must do item if you have 40 minutes free in the evening. They have a brochure explaining the show items. Reading it before helps you get an idea. The puppets are very cute and the show is a visual treat. Though you may not exactly understand what they sing, it is nice. Try to get tickets in advance for front rows if you are keen in clicking pics or video.

Other than the side seats, a great cultural experience!. When me and my family bought the tickets at the door, we were told there were only side seats left, and we didn't mind so we purchased them. Side seats were 60,000 VND while the normal seats were 100,000 VND. It was only upon entering the theatre that we found out what side seats actually meant. We were given foldable chairs at the ends of each row. Strangely, 15 minutes into the show, there were still many main seats not taken up.Besides that, the show itself was very enjoyable, with moments of laughter here and there, and moments where you can hear the audience "ooh" and "aah" at the fire and water effects. The accompanying music is refreshing and sweet to the ears. It is a piece of Vietnamese culture not to be missed if you happen to be in the Old Quarter.
Very boring. After 30 min a felt asleep no room for Your legs. Very anoing when you are a tourist but the price was 100.000 so more then fair. Also hot inside

A taste of Vietnamese culture. We visited this to see some of the culture of Vietnam and weren't disappointed.they played to a packed theatre and it was very interesting! Musicians sat on the side of the ' lake' playing instruments and singing/ speaking and you really felt as though you had seen sow thin hog Vietnams past!

Interesting but slightly odd. We went to see this as part of our cultural education as a family of 5 during a 5 day visit to the fabulous city of Hanoi. This is an average family rating. Our scores ranged from 1.5? To 5. It is interesting, cultural, historical, unique and in my opinion a must when you visit Hanoi and have a spare hour. It is a 45min indoor live puppet show with live traditional music. I love music so this element was of interest to me. Traditional instruments played live. The story is hard to follow but it is fun to watch. Not expensive and you will glad you went.

Beautiful Vietnamese Tradition . The Water Puppet Show was on our list of things to see in Hanoi. We read some reviews about it and the majority wrote it was just for kids. We went with an open mind and found the music and singing leading up to the show was very interesting and entertaining. Then the puppet show started, each with a different story line. It was all in Vietnamese so we couldn't understand anything. The puppets were smaller than we expected but I suppose that's so they can be easily maneuvered. The puppeteers were hidden behind the curtain and it was amazing how they made those puppets dance and move around. At the end of the show the puppeteers came out from behind the curtain to take a bow. You could see the pride and gratitude on their faces that people came to watch their show and that is what did it for me! It's not about the puppets or the water, it's about the skill of the puppeteers and keeping the Vietnamese tradition, which will discontinue if the younger generation don't continue with it and that's will happen if no-one attends the show! Yes it is for kids but if you want to support traditional Vietnamese entertainment, then I would recommend it for young and old.

Great show! Can be even better if they can improve based on my suggestions. I would have given this attraction an excellent rating, however, because of the following two reasons I lowered it to Very good. The show is played in Vietnamese language and as a result foreigners like me fall short of complete enjoyment had we been able to understand what is being said. Some sort of subtitles would be just perfect! the place became quite stuffy and hot as the theatre filled uo with audience and that made us uncomfortable

Fascinating and dexterous. We'd suggest doing a little research before attending so that you're familiar with the story as it is narrated mainly in Vietnamese, although many parts have universal humour and there are programs available free as you enter the theatre. Much of it seems to revolve around gathering of food, clearly an important part of life in many cultures.The manipulation of the various puppets through the water was astounding and the accompanying traditional music supported the actions of the characters well.As with many forms of theatre, the story is only part of the entertainment, with the masterful craftsmanship and diversity of the puppets being impressive in itself, as well as the handling by the cast (hidden behind a curtain) and the use of fire to enhance and accentuate certain scenes. It was difficult at times to establish how the puppeteers were able to create such fluid movement and interaction of the characters through the water, which increased my enjoyment of the performance.

A Must Do!. After our tour guide's explanations of history and religious beliefs during a city tour the day before, is was like everything fell into place on the show. Its It's a short 45 minute show that I recommend not only cause it's interesting but also to support local culture.

A must see!. We read mixed reviews about the show before going and went in with some doubts, but the hour flew by! It was a unique show, great singing and it was interesting trying to figure out the mechanics of how it's all done!A great way to escape loud Hanoi streets to enjoy some culture and entertainment.

Fun night out for the kids!. The theatre is very grand, the puppets and sets are gorgeous. This show is much more posh that the one in Saigon, but it lacks a bit of heart. Also, it's much shorter and feels a little rushed. Still, a fun look at traditional culture and a highlight for the kids.

Beautiful and enchanting puppet show! Amazing!. I dont understand why some reviewers didnt like the Puppet Show. If you did a little bit more reading prior to going to watch the show, you would understand and appreciate it more. Yes the singing is conducted in Vietnamese, and I appreciate that even more because its traditional and keeping to their true culture and heritage.Here is what I learnt and I with everyone . The puppets are made out of wood and then lacquered. The show is performed in a waist-deep pool. A large rod supports the puppet under the water and is used by puppeteers, who are hidden behind a screen to control them.Traditional content of water puppet performance like daily life of Vietnamese farmers (cultivating, tending buffalo, catching fishes…), communal entertainment (swimming contest, dragon dancing…), or historical legends (Le Loi returns precious sword…), with modest performance way have appealed audiences for centuries. However, the artists of Thang Long Water Puppet Theater want to renew the old puppet shows with effect of light, music and combination between people and puppets.You can easily walk to the Puppet Theatre, its right opposite to Hoan Kiem Lake and buy tickets on the day or the day before to secure your seat preferences. Please note that every session is always full, so get in quick before tickets sold out on your preferred session. Also just a tip, the theatre is quite small, so if you wan to save some VND I suggest to chose the back section.Alot of websites dont clearly state the Puppet Show sessions, so I took the liberty of taking a photograph of the session times (please see below listed and photo as well) just for ease of mind for those that are planning their itinerary for Hanoi. =)Cost: 60,000 VND (back section)/ 100,000 VND (front section)Show times (daily): 3pm, 4.10pm, 5.20pm, 6.30pm, 8pm, 9.30pmDuration: 50 minutesEnjoy the show!! Its worth watching! =)

Really Interesting!. We went to the see the Water Puppets and were certainly not disappointed! It was fascinating to see the traditional art form being performed. It was in Vietnamese but they tell you the names of each of the acts so you have an idea of what is happening, and the music, emotion of the singers and the puppets' movements tell the rest!Definitely worth a visit!

See it once in your life. We got tickets because it is part of the history and I wanted to see it once. It is worth it to go if you have never been. Interesting to understand the stories and the history and the music. Be prepared to have moving and talkative children around you. It is also hard to see in that theater due to the way it is constructed.

Totally different. This is quite amazing. Still not sure how they do it. While not understanding the language you can still appreciate the action and skill of the puppeteers. 50 minutes of entertainment. Full house the night we went indicates popularity. We would recommend this as a 'different' cultural experience.
very nice show. This show is very nice, brought with humor in it, the story is being told in both Vietnamese and in English.

still a good place. I went to this theater and watched carefully till it ended. they sang in Vietnamese because it is a traditional music so foreigners may not understand at all. however, the music and puppets were still good. we can learn about another type of music in this world. if you do not like traditional music, honestly, please think carefully before you come here.
A must. Fantastic but do buy your tickets in advanced sold out days in advanced. Great show really enjoyed it.
Surprisingly a great show. I didn't have any expectations of this production but I was thoroughly entertained from start to finish.
Crazy!!. You won't understand the story but it's still a lot of fun watching the show!The music is live and also quite funny.

Just boring. For the first couple minutes it's interesting but it's getting really boring after some time. Doesn't worth to pay and watch, in the garden of Ethnology museum you can watch a shorter sample of it for free.

What are we watching?. There seemed to be a lot of hype surrounding this puppet show so we opted to take one in. The singing and the music was really good and well performed... as for the puppets I'm not so sure. The show is performed entirely in vietnamese so perhaps I would have had a better understanding/appreciation if I spoke the language. Fun to watch and a unique experience but I wouldn't make it a priority if you're limited for time in Hanoi.
Spectacular traditional show. My wife, children and I all loved the water puppets show. It's very clever and keeps you guessing as to how they do everything!

Surprise packet of the trip. We were recommended to go here but weren't certain we'd enjoy the experience. How wrong we were., this really was an excellent experience representing outstanding value. Thoroughly enjoyed by my husband and I and especially by our 2 children, aged 5 & 8. They were completely fascinated. A lovely cool escape from the heat of scorching Hanoi too.

Good. We have chosen to visit the theater in raining day...
The performance is interesting but don't expect some magic :)
If you are thinking about visiting u should buy ticket in advance, like 2 days

Book Early. Probably one of the cheapest places you can see water puppets in Vietnam with tickets starting from 60K (in Nha Trang the show costs 150K and similarly in HCM City)Decent show, just the right length of time (1hr) to keep the audience engaged.Buy your tickets early especially if you want the cheaper seats: they sell out because tour groups make large scale bookings.There is apparently a camera fee but didn't really see this being enforced.

Not recommended. Puppetry is an art and a valuable tradition in many cultures. The well designed stage and the idea of performing a puppet show "on water" are certainly something unique and attention catching. BUT (and it is a big "but"), what you have to endure as an audience is 10-odd acts of relentless epileptic attack of the puppets with water splashing and repeated vigorous actions, accompanied by squeaky and irritating oriental/Vietnamese music.Inevitably, only two questions remain in your mind after the 3rd or 4th act, "Why am I here?" and "When is this going to end?"...

Delightfully presented old school puppeteering. . What a fantastic, original and entertaining show this. No LED lighting and big screens here. Great musicians and singers support an simple set of little storied of Vietnam life and their folklore. So cleverly done. My hat is off to the puppeteers.

Brilliant. We booked through out hotel and got front row seats. Family of four with 2 teenagers. We all enjoyed it. We all laughed and we all enjoyed a piece of history. It was great to see this traditional puppet show and imagine how it must have been in the past. Great puppeteers and orchestra. This is a must for any visit to Hanoi. 45 minutes long.

A wonderful experience!. My friends from Australia and I saw this recently and I thoroughly enjoyed it. To be honest my 18 year old son was bored because it was not in English. If it were not in Vietnamese it would not be genuine. It tells the legendary history of Vietnam so be sure to read about that history as told by the puppets before seeing the show and you will enjoy it more. It was a wonderful experience! The one missing star is for my kid and should not reflect poorly on the show.

Charming little show. We popped in to the 3pm showing today after hearing mixed reviews. The tickets are a bargain at 60,000D. We sat right at the back but central and could see everything perfectly. The show is just under an hour so you are kept entertained and the puppets are wonderful. The show is cultural and cleverly performed. Lovely way to spend a rainy afternoon in Hanoi. A must see for sure.

Don't bother paying for the "best" seats . The show its self was pretty cool, but the seating was terrible. I'm 5'9 and my legs were touching the seats in front, not just a little but to the point were I had to pretty much sit sideways. We payed 100,000 for ticket type 1. As supposed to 60k for the other seats. What a waste of money, seated in row G, we could barely see the stage and I spent most of the 45 minutes dodging people's smart phones or heads In front of me. In my opinion you would have a better view up the back.

Interesting but not spectacular. Go here as part of other activities. The puppet theater is very close to the lake of swords and the center of Hanoi where many other activities can also be done. The show takes about an hour and it was fun to see, my 12 year old was not so impressed and my three year got a little scared. All in all it is fun to see how well the puppets are controlled and the occasional fire add a little dramatic flare. The saloon where the show is performed is about the size of an average size cinema.I enjoyed the show but don't expect any spectacular. I would say that, if you are nearby and have nothing to do then rest your feet and watch the show. I would see the show in conjunction of taking a tour of the old quarters or some other activity.

Great show. We didn't expect much but were positively surprised about the great show which includes live music (with singers) and gives you a feeling for Vietnamese culture. Definitively worth a visit.

Very Vietnam. This is a 'must see' if you are in Hanoi. Even the most expensive ticket is less than USD5 for a 50 min live show. It is not just a puppet show. It is puppetry accompanied by live singing and traditional instrumental music on stage. It is a very creative performance steep in Vietnam traditions, culture and lifestyle . There are several shows daily. The evening ones are at 6:30 pm and 8:00 pm.

Included in our trip. I have to be honest I wasn't looking forward to it as I though it would be a tourist trap and it was but ... It was actually good. Music and puppets were very good.Shame about the cameras/phones in the audience and also the late comers.

Pretty good. Decided to check out the water puppets because we were told it was part of Vietnamese culture and I loved it! It was quirky and difficult to infer what the stories were about as they spoke Vietnamese but that made it fun! Definitely worth checking out and only 60 000 dong ($4 AUD) for an hour long show
English translation missing. Although the show is cute and innovative, they need to start giving english translation of what they are singing else the charm for international tourists will disappear.
Fun. Fun. We enjoyed quite a bit. Amazing puppet work. Much detail. We sat in 3rd row so very easy to see the details. The right length of time for small children.

Great show but pity about cameras in the audience. This was a really professional and well done show. The cast, musicians and crew were really good and its well worth seeing. Unfortunately it was spoilt but audience members who, for some reason, felt it was acceptable to use the flash on their cameras and/or not turn off the camera sound effect on their digital cameras which was really distracting both for other audience members and (I assume) the musicians. For heavens sake people, its not that hard! Take photos if you want (I would have if I had my camera) but flash suppression modes and the options to turn off sound effects are there for a reason.

Enjoyable . This show is an enjoyable experience, our young kids loved it. The puppetry is very clever and the music played on traditional instruments is great to watch! You get to sit in air-con for a hour and enjoy some unusual entertainment for a reasonable price.
Lovely show. Completely happy we went my 8 year old was enthralled in the stories as to why this and what that was and how they got fire underwater... Was a great show, so happy went.
