Very clever traditional entertainment. I had seen the Water Puppets in Saigon a year ago and enjoyed it immensely, so comparing it with the Hanoi version was a must! I wasn't disappointed.First warning though - the entire show is in Vietnamese, but that doesn't bother me because it is quite a visual show and most of it doesn't require translating (unless of course if you have no imagination or don't like things with a cultural bent). Second warning - if you want to use a camera you need to pay a little more (unlike Saigon last year when I was able to bring some great video back to show the family). If you use a flash or phone just be aware of the rest of the audience, it can be distracting and even block a view. Third warning - book in advance to avoid queueing, especially for the evening performance.The set-up is unusual. The audience seating is normal, but the stage area comprises an area to the left to accommodate the singers and orchestra, and the rest is essentially a curtain across the back of a stage full of water. You don't have to know how the puppeteers manage to make the puppets do all sorts of things (fish, squirt water, create fire etc.) - just sit back and enjoy. The show lasts about 60 minutes and is not expensive. Not only do you get to appreciate the traditional instruments and songs live, but the unique skill and dexterity of the puppeteers behind the curtain recreate quite a different cultural experience.

Fell asleep. Maybe due to a jetlag, but I fell asleep during the show. They're basically children's stories, told in Vietnamese, with some music. Some stories are nice, others a bit more boring. Probably nicer with children.

A must see for travelers who want to waste their time and money. I had no idea about the show before I bought the tickets, I still didn't have any after watching the show. Seemed like the AC wasn't working and the space was tiny as hell......
Cultural. This was ok to watch. It was all in Vietnamese however I got the drift of what the puppets were doing. It was good to watch once. Glad I saw it though

Wonderful escapism suitable for all ages. My second time here! Just wonderful, even though the voice-over is in Vietnamese. You don't need to understand to appreciate the amazing dexterity of the puppeteers, because the action and music give you the context of the story. It is just an hour long so no time to get bored or fidgety.

Get rid of those cameras!. Fabulous experience but marred by people using flash photography and filming the show - have some consideration for those behind you. Highly annoying. Should be banned.
Show itself is 45 minutes long, need to book but amazing performance. Loved it.

Enjoyed the show. As part of our tour of Vietnam we took in the Water Puppet show in Hanoi. We were not disappointed. Earlier in the day we had visited the Museum of Ethnology and seen the authentic water puppets and viewed an old water puppet stage in the outdoor exhibits, so had something to relate to when attending the show. The live music is extraordinary and the puppetry, considering it is done from behind a stage, standing in water is also terrific. The show isn't very long, maybe an hour in length, but the theatre is air conditioned, the seats comfortable, and the show very affordable. I think it is worth seeing when in Hanoi.

Fun for everyone. This is the fourth time I have seen the water puppets. Twice in Australia and twice in Vietnam. Each time I have thoroughly enjoyed the spectacle and short vignettes of life around water in Vietnam. This time I was inspired by the beautiful music, particularly an instrument I had not noticed before. A single stringed instrument which could create beautiful sounds. Well worth a visit, and enjoyable for the whole family.

Cultural, different, not overwhelming. We are glad we took the opportunity to see the show. The musicians did an excellent job, despite looking a little bored. I guess four shows a day gets a little tiring! The music was played on traditional instruments and the puppetry was good. The length was perfect, any longer and it would have got dull. At just 60,000 dong there is no reason not to take an hour out of your evening schedule. I recommend booking early to avoid queuing. We had no queue at lunchtime but it was much longer in the evening.

Boring experience!!. We were recommended the water puppet show by friends. The theatre is cramped and there is no space to move once all are seated. This makes it a bit suffocating as it was quite warm inside and it was packed. The show was 1 hour long and we could not understand anything. They were talking in Vietnamese, hence we could not make sense of what was going on. The puppets came and went and the whole experience was boring. We wanted to leave 5 minutes into the show. If you miss this, you don't miss anything.

Great Show. I went to this show as part of my Hanoi tour in October 2010. The unique thing was that I happened to be in Hanoi the night they were celebrating the 1000 anniversary of the city. There was a wonderful festive atmosphere & tonnes of people in the streets that was fun to be a part of. As far as the show, the theatre seats were a bit hard & had very little legroom even for someone like me who is just a shade under 6 feet tall. Had I been 6'4" it would have been very uncomfortable. I enjoyed the show very much. The music was good and the puppet techniques were very skilled & very adept at making the puppets come to life & project character. In my mind it is a show well worth seeing. You need special permission to photograph the show though (they want you to pay for the privilege to do so). I think this is a must see when in Hanoi.

Air conditioned escape from the hear. I had no expectations of this to begin with as I didn't know anything about it. We were desperate to escape the heat, use the bathroom and sit down. The show is not good or interesting and I wouldn't recommend (even the kids sitting beside us were bored and a few people in front left) but we were able to rest our feet and eyes in a theatre with a fan.

Interesting sample of water puppetry. I found this performance entertaining, easy to understand, and unique. I'm glad we went. However, I am also glad I went into it with low expectations for audience behavior. Many people were speaking loudly during the performance. The worst was when someone let their three children wander up to the stage in the middle of the performance. It was distracting to the entire audience and performers. This is clearly the guardian's fault; however, it would have been nice if the theater had kindly ushered the children back to their seats. I saw a previous review stating their children could not see from the back. Maybe this provoked it? So parents, buy front row seats. I brought earplugs. Theater very warm.

Interesting performance. While most of the acts could be understood easily and some parts were indeed funny, the accidental setting a side prop (bunch of leaves) on fire by the water dragons was really hilarious. There were desperate attempts behind the screen to spray water to put out the fire. For 100,000 dong for seats in front, the 50-minute performance was a welcome break from the heat and humidity outside (not that the theatre was well-ventilated). Be warned that the seats are cramped, even for Asians like myself.

Much better than anticipated. Thought this was going to another ho hum polite clapping of something pretty mundaneHow wrong could I be! It's fascinating and quite numerous in places and wasn't until it was nearly over did I figure out how it was doneGood for arrange of ages and really well doneReally quite memorable

Sadly water torture at its finest. We did enjoy the first 15 - 20 minutes but after that it didn't live up to expectations as a great attraction to visit. At the end the theatre emptied quickly as most felt the same as us.

A must see . When visiting Hanoi this is definitely a must as it only lasted an hour or so and there are 4 shows throughout the day, with an extra one on Sunday morning. It was cheap too, it cost us 100,000 dong per ticket for good seats, but you could pay 60,000 to sit further back. The band that played were very good and it gave a great insight in to an ancient tradition and the Vietnamese culture. The actual puppetry was brilliant and some parts were quite funny.

Great for adults, not so much for kids. A fun and culturally significant experience! We took our two little boys and it was a bit tough for them as everything happens in the water and it was hard to see over the audience, but the music was wonderful and the artistry was impressive.

A unique experience. This was a great and entertaining show. The mini orchestra played and sung well and it was funny in parts. The bad points were that first of all the row of people behind us would not stop talking! The show in general was quite amusing but some could say it went on a bit too long.

Let down by all the cameras.... My boyfriend and I went on the Lonely Planet recommendation and visited this hanoi classic. Sadly you can get in for 60,000 dong if you want to take photos - such a big mistake for the theatre to introduce this. Our viewing was honestly ruined by the multitude of flashing cameras and iPhones throughout the performance.

amazing. We didn't really expect anything but this show was awesome. I recommend buing the tickets forehand. Personally we got them the same day. Our 9-year old loved it. It is a truely beautiful way to experience the vietnameese culture.

"Interesting water puppet show". The water puppet show was not only for children adults enjoyed it as well. I thought it was well done gave the viewers an insight into Vietnamese fable characters. It lasted about 50 minutes. Cost $5.

Great show. This was a great show especially the music and harpist. A good family event.
The puppetry was exquisite and entertaining.

A great experience the kids will enjoy as well.. The Thang Long Water Pupper Theater was a really good experience for the whole family. The show is set with puppets in water accompanied by a live band that plays music to each part of the show. The puppets depict all kinds of stories with humour that is universal. There are lights, action and even fireworks. The show is entirely in Vietnamese but it did not matter one bit to our English only speaking family. The way the puppets move on the water with the operators of the puppets submerged behind a screen is really impressive and clever. Must see if visiting Hanoi. Get there early as the shows are very popular.

Buffalo tours water puppet tour with extras. The water puppet tour was the first thing I did after arriving in Hanoi. The show itself was great - very interesting, loved the traditional music and particularly loved the dragons.Twan (? Spelling) was my guide and was beyond awesome. I had let him know I was in Vietnam for a wedding and wanted to get something made. He took me to an au dai tailor to get a traditional dress made, helping with all of the translating in the process.He then not only gave advice about where to eat but took me there on a scooter - an amazing experience to ride around the streets of Hanoi! Had a great pho bo before he returned me to the hotel. Many thanks Twan for the most amazing introduction to Vietnam!

Very clever. Thought this was very clever .BUT ..it was so boring I fell asleep ..and the only thing that kept my husband awake was filming it so he could tell every one how boring it is ...that aside (apparently) it's one of THE things to do in Hanoi ..

Unexpectedly good show. I visited the theater when I was a little kid so I did not have much memory. It was until last yea that I have chances to take my foreign friends and my cousins who had been away from the country to the Water Puppet. I did not expect much but the show surprisingly impressed me.I'm not really into 'traditional' music, but it went well with the performance and the atmosphere. I really enjoyed the show with lots of pleasure and excitement.It could be better if the foreigners can understand the story. Tickets should be booked/bought in advance.
Entertaining. Although I don't understand anything about the language, but the story is quite simple. So don't worry about the language. It's something you shouldn't miss if you visit Hanoi.
Nice. Enjoyed the show at the water puppet theatre. Classic old building but a bit on the sly side these days. But most enjoyable.
Well worth a visit...... Would not go a second time but well worth "one hour" of your time.Lovely for children. Nice story, great puppetry interesting music.

Traditional. Thoroughly enjoyed the water puppet show in this old theatre very cheesey but most enjoyable to see something that has been a traditional form of entertainment for thousand of years. Excellent puppeteers, and also wonderful musicians playing on traditional instruments loved it!
Vietnamese Heritage. The show lasted around 45 minutes and is a must when visiting Hanoi. It is part of the Vietnamese heritage and is very entertaining and very clever.

Thang Long Water Puppet Show. Tonight we went to the water puppet show. It was as oddly unforgettable as the Beijing opera we saw 15 years ago. Though not one empty seat in the house, it is a tourist show you can miss.

Fabulous performance!. Loved every minute of this amazing performance. The traditional live orchestra and singers were fabulous and each segment of the puppet show amazed us. The puppeteers were extremely skillful. Very entertaining!

Well worth a visit - Very skillful presentation. This is not just a touristy thing. We noticed a lot of Vietnamese people as well. The presentation was unique Vietnamese water puppet show and was well choreographed and skillfully presented not to mention the live music to go with.The show is about one hour long. Make sure to buy tickets in advance as shows can be sold out quickly. The theater is near the Hoàn Kiếm Lake and air conditioned. The rows of seats are quite close to each other with very limited leg space. Not very conducive to get out in the middle of the performance if you wish to do so though.The puppeteers are very skilled and have conducted international shows. Good for children who could understand what is going on. Not a good idea to take babies. Tickets in good seats could be pricey by Vietnamese standards (500,000 VND).A recommended visit.

I wouldn't go again. The locals told us to go to this water puppet show. We paid 100 000dong for better seats (that is only $6au) but don't pay to upgrade if you do go. The show went for about 45 min but 5 min would have been long enough.

Enjoyable. Ok so it's for the tourists but what is wrong with that, some of the tourists were out of town Vietnamese. I found it an entertaining and skilful presentation, I especially enjoyed the opportunity to heard traditional music. The theatre is air conditioned with ranked setting so everyone can see, this is very popular so you will need to book ahead. If you are traveling onward to Ho Chi Minh City they also have a water puppet theatre but it is outdoor.

Much better than I expected. I've seen the snippets on TV and wasn't really expecting to enjoy the Water Puppets. OK I was wrong, it was delightful! Fast moving, very clever and just the right length of show so you really enjoyed it without being over-done.Book early for you selected show, they do a number of sessions each day, as all seats are numbered and the closer to the "Stage" the better your view - all front half of the theatre seats are the same price and quite cheap. Seats are comfortable - but very little leg room.

One of those things you have to see in Vietnam. Just visited the theatre tonight and watched the water puppet show. I was very impressed by this piece of local culture and both the musicians and puppeteers are very talented. The puppets themselves are big and we sat in the back row for a cheaper ticket price and still didn't have a problem seeing the show. The puppets that represent the Dragons and the Phoenix were my favourites. Definitely make time to go but the tickets do sell quickly so you may want to buy tickets a day in advance.

Totally worth a look!. The show lasts about an hour and is really entertaining and quite beautiful. The show takes the form of a series of short sketches involving different traditionally characters and each performance is accompanied by traditional Vietnamese instruments.We were a group of adults however, this show would be perfect for small children or family groups - it doesn't last very long and I think small children would definitely find the puppets magical - especially the dragon!We had a lovely evening (there's a lovely little coffee shop next door over looking the lake).The only draw back is that there's not a lot of leg room!
Lovely gor the kids. It was nice but not extraordinary. My 7yo loved it. It's ok if you go with the free ticket from the hotel, they ppl keep entering way after the show has started
Not worth a visit. It's 50minutes of the same thing. the history behind it was kinda of interesting but the show inself was very repetitive.

A Must for all Visitors. An extremely popular attraction, that is a must for all tourists. A traditional old style puppet show which has been performed in front of audiences for decades . Do not expect a Punch and Judy style performance. The songs sung and instruments used are a past reminders of things long gone.So try to book early, and choose your desired performance. The theater is attached to a coffee shop that takes advantage of the tourist trade and so if you are on a budget make sure your well watered up.Adults and kids will enjoy, however young children might find it difficult to sit still. I have rated this attraction as average as it is a must on your visit. To Hanoi but on leaving you either love it or hate it...

Thang Long Water Puppet Show - Delightful. 8 days in the close surrounds of Hoan Kiem Lake Hanoi would not have been complete without attending an evening performance at the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre. Set on the shores of Hoan Kiem Lake, this fascinating theatre offers a number of sessions throughout the day, with beautifully crafted water puppets depicting the local history and legends surrounding the lake itself. The show is well presented in both local and english languages with folk singers and musicians providing the soundtrack to the amazing puppet performances. The show has toured quite extensively around the world and I highly recommend a visit to this spectacle. The bookings are inexpensive but be aware that it is very popular, with busloads of tourists frequently arriving, so arrive a little early to guarantee a preferred seat. Nice coffee shop in the entrance and souvenirs and photos are available in the foyer area along with other details and models based on the history of this amazing show.

Unique Vietnamese puppets in water. This is very unique, water puppets -- it is only in Vietnam where I've seen this. The beauty of it is that the entire production is very well preserved, depicting ancient Vietnamese culture, music & song. It is also very ingenious how they are actually performed although the puppeteers come out at the end and we see them submerged waist-deep in water. The ticket price is very reasonable, they display 100,000VND, although we paid 60,000VND as there is an option depending on seating but we were in center mid-section.

Entertaining . Moves along very quicklyVery clever and highly entertaining Children will thoroughly enjoy puppetsOnly disappointment was lack of respect by spectators using flashes on iPhones and blocking views

Enjoyable and fun show. It's a hour hour show that moves quite quickly. Started with some traditional instruments playing including a beautiful solo on a single string harp. The scenes with the puppets run in quick succession and they are entertaining and quite often funny. If you go, make sue you get a program for your language just as you enter the actual theatre doors.
Recommended. Very cute show, worth the money. Would recommend it , easy to understand and easy to find. Glad we went.

Amazing and unique Viet Nam performing art :). The Water Puppet show at the Thang Long Theater (next to Hoan Kiem Lake and the heart of the Old Quarter) is a delightful performance that's enjoyed by folks of all ages :) This unique Viet Nam art form will delight your senses... the lovely music performed by talented singers and instrumentalists are combined with the amazing actions of the "puppets" (which are not the traditional types operated via dangling strings, but via long poles and cables hidden beneath the water surface). The show's themes include humorous topics, depictions of rural traditions, and important history as well. Enjoy the Thang Long Water Puppet performances :)Hint: try to reserve a seat towards the front, which will give you the best views during this wonderful show... you can purchase tickets in advance and select your seating at that time :)
Amazing value, excellent entertainment. We went as a family with a child and two adults. This was such an entertaining evening at a great value!

OK, kids will enjoy but may to be for everyone's taste. Wasn't really sure what I was in for, and still not entirely sure what I saw. The show is a selection of short puppet dances, all in Vietnamese, with only a limited explanation from the flyer available before the show. I spent most of the show trying to work out how they did it, but otherwise wasn't my cup of tea. Seats are also not great if you have someone tall in front as the action happens low down and you may have a head in the way for some of it. Good if you have kids, want to fill an hour, or listen to some very skilled musicians (there is a live Vietnamese orchestra accompanying the puppets who were in themselves very good).

Skilled water movements (using hands). 15mins to 20mins instead of an hour is sufficient! The overall performance is a bit draggy. However if you sit through the entire performance.. You will appreciate the opera singers and Vietnamese way of life & sense of humour. They should have substile somewhere! And it's really stuffy to sit in during summer!!
Unique Experience. This is a great experience. The puppeteers were very interesting. Worth a visit for a unique experience.

Not fantastic but worth visiting once. . Came at the recommendation of random travellers we met along the way. It wasn't too hard to find in the heart of Hanoi and buying tickets was fairly easy. We weren't expecting much, especially as I used to watch puppet shows as a kid. But its a cultural eye opener Vietnamese styled. The show was ok. Some parts somewhat interesting and the finale was good But this is not something I would actually return to watch.

Interesting, but performance could be better. Enjoyed the water puppet theatre, but the orchestra was disappointing. The musicians were constantly speaking to one another during the performance which was quite distracting. Overall enjoyable experience though.

How to dance on water... A Dutch author, Maarten Biesheuvel describes in one of his books that he was in the middle of the sea and in the middle of the night he saw someone riding on a motorbike on the water. The biker explained him that he first learned how to put a needle on the water so it would not sink. This story flashed up in my mind when I saw the Hanoi Water puppet group during their first tour through Europe in the eighties. The Vietnamese name Múa rối nước, means "puppets that dance on water". I saw them in Antwerp and I have seen them later several times. And it is always amazing how they keep on developing. Last year I wrote an article about the Vietnamese Water Puppet Theatre them for a Puppeteer Magazine and I made several pictures when they were preparing themselves to play, but when I visited them this year they had changed again. Always developing themselves. It looks easy but it is difficult what they do, Visit a few other Water Puppet theatres and you see the difference. When you’re able to visit a performance outside, somewhere on a lake. Then you understand why the puppets do not talk, with all the surrounding noise you could not understand them. The stories also had to be short and good recognizable from a distance. And how they do it? Well, the special tricks are secret, they stay into the family. But it is great to see how the puppets really dance over the water, running from here to there without disturbing each other. Outside it is really funny to see, in the Ha Noi theatre it becomes a bit of magic.
So much a part of Vietnamese culture. We attended this show as a part of our tour. It's so much fun to watch the masters controlling their puppets in the water. It was a great show!

Love the Performance!. Very good stage settings, they actually play real Vietnamese traditional musical instruments on the stage, especially the one string the Dan Bau, which I amazed the most! I loved to hear the Dan Bau!For the Water Puppet show also a great performance, they even have fire-dragon performance, and some local people plot, it just that the show is in Vietnamese, we don't really understand what it's really about. I recommend probably a translation on screen that can be put below/above the stage??Overall, I love it! Go for it!Vietnam tour would not be complete without seeing the Water Puppet Show, it's a MUST do!

Beyond Expectations!. I've heard that improvements are always made to the Hanoi water puppet show, so as to bring new experiences to the audience. It was my first time here, but I was truly blown away by the pyrotechnics used, as well as the innovative / creative / interactive play with water using different types of puppets. Although it was all in Vietnamese and I did not understand a word of it, it was quite a unique experience. Well worth the (little bit of) money spent!

Great performance. Although the seating was very cramped (and some potential oh&s issues if there was a fire), the actual performance was very entertaining. Recommended specially for younger children.

A pleasant but incomprehensible experience. We didn't understand a word of the show as it was all in Vietnamese but in all honesty you didn't need to. The puppets run about slapping each other for about an hour. It's good fun and beautiful settings.
Random but worth a vist. This show gives you a look into Vietnamese culture and traditions. It was a bit random but worth the visit. The show took about an hour and there was no English translation.

great night would recommend.Geoff. Ithuohght that the theatre was excellent. It was different to showas that I have seen before.An excellent night was had by my wife and I, & it was ridiculous entrance fee.Something like $5us each.Well worth iy.

Eye-Opening. Wanted to watch this since my first visit 3 years ago and finally I managed to watched it in Hanoi. It's my first puppet show. I like the music and the show =)However, it would be better if I understand Vietnamese language. So, it will be better for foreigners to have a brochure of the water puppet show which you can get it for free just outside the theatre hall as it will show the program flow.You can ask the your hotel manager to help buying the tickets and thus saving the troubles of buying the tickets by your own.
Overrated?. The music was entertaining but the puppets were only interesting for 3 or 4 of the 14 scenes in the show. Very warm - don't go if you are feeling sleepy!

must see. It is a part of the cultural visit to Vietnam, the theater is not one of the best but the show is amazing . Dont miss this entertaining acting of puppets, and gives you an insight of the past , the olden times i mean and how life is evolved to modernity.

Worth a visit. My partner and I had very different views following our visit here but it was certainly worth a visit whilst in Hanoi. The queues were very long so arrive well in advance to purchase your tickets. The show is all in Vietnamese and personally I didn't find it easy to follow so just enjoyed the concept and the music. My parter hated it! But at 45 minutes and 60'000 VND just try it.

Funny and very well done. Although not in English, you can still get a grasp of the story. Very well performed with live music from traditional instruments and the puppets looked almost real as they jumped and splashed around in the water. Try getting front row seats :)
Must see cultural experience. The water Puppet theatre was a quaint insight into Vietnam's history, culture and traditions. An interesting way to spend a couple of hours.

Go along!. What's delightful peep into Vietnamese culture! Invented in the rice fields, the puppets are a wonderful work of art, the puppeteers very clever and the stories delightful. The shows run for about an hour.
Classic Hanoi. You will find the water puppet theatre mostly filled with tourists. It's a nice spot of entertainment and a part of the Hanoi experience.

Must-visit... DO not miss this!. I have seen puupet shows in my life but nothing compares to the theatrical performance of this show. Do not forget to carry a brochure of this show (right outside theater hall) and keep consulting it in between acts to better understand what's going on. I wish their brochures had a bit more information though.

Wouldn't want to be longer. We visited the water puppet theatre with our children aged 16, 11 and 9. Amongst the five of us, there were mixed impressions. My 9 yo and I really liked it but my husband and 16yo thought it was a bit lame. It was fairly touristy but really showed the traditional art of puppetry and old world stories of prized creatures like the phoenix, dragon and tortoise. There were 14 stories told in all and this took about 40 mins. I liked the story about the lake of the restored sword best, especially after the visit earlier in the day to the Hoan Kiem Lake and the Ngoc Son temple. I felt that the puppet show gave these traditional stories more meaning. I also admired the skill of the puppeteers and the musicians. As a first timer in Vietnam, I feel it's important to see these traditional things, even if they are a bit touristy. If I was a repeat visitor, I probably would be over this kind of thing. The other thing is that the visit to the theatre gave us a welcome reprieve from the summer heat.
Amazing show. Great show around the olden traditions culture & life in vietnam. Highly recommend to spend that 1 hour.

Cultural experience with fun. Got nothing to do on the final evening in Hanoi and watched this show upon the advice from my tour agent. The show was full of lively folklore and everyday life events of Vietnamese performed by muppets. Lots of laughter from the audience. Exceeded my expectation. Much better than watching Ted 2.

Surprisingly great!!. Didn't know what to expect but the performance was really entertaining and the music great!! It was only 100,000 dong each and lasted an hour. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting hanoi :)

A first class cultural attraction in Hanoi . Had a great surprise at the quality of the production: the puppetry, music, another theatre. It's makes for a lovely break from the heat to fo in and absorb the show. Maybe less excitement for the teenage kids, but they are hard to please. Watch out for times. The 3.30 show we aimed for wasn't in - maybe because it's low season.

Good to know it. I like it, its different from theater or even puppets in Europe. I suggest to read about the play in advance because its in vietnamese and you can understand much better if you know about the different acts before. they charge extra for the cameras (not much 20.000) but its the first time in my life. better if you hide it.
excellent. It was a real mindopener to see the life of the farmers acting out by puppets. Very nicely and brilliantly made. We enjoyed every minute of it, and even liked the music.

An experience and traditional. To be honest, I did not really enjoy the show, but as it is a traditional Vietnamese form of entertainment, you should make the time to see the show. The show only takes about an hour and leg room is not great. I am sure children would enjoy - so if travelling with children take them along - as it is not expensive. The 6:30pm show was not that crowded - so would be a good option.

Amazing experience ever! Proud of our contry. 1st time I had a chance to enjoy a real Water Puppet Show - an unique tradition of Vietnam. At the first moments of plays, its very emotional touch. Full of spiritual beauty!

If you're interested in tradition. We weren't interested in the water puppet theater untill our guide gave us the history of its roots in providing entertainment for the workers in the rice fields. It's entertaining and definitely different than anything else you've ever seen. Kids would love it for sure.

Cultural value. Puppet show lasted more than 1 hour, in a not big building, this is a traditional art form of Vietnam, using the carved wooden figures float on water and are controlled by persons behind the curtain, many visitors come here to see mostly foreigners. If you are researching folk culture you should go to see once.

An entertaining look into the old Vietnamese cultural art form. The show is about an hour and is done using wooden puppets controlled from the back. There is a group of musicians that play traditional music along with the show. At times there are narration and dialogue but it is in Vietnamese. There is an outline of the show in many languages so that you can follow along with what each of the shows represent.
Don't go there. Time and money wasted, don't go. Lack of professionalism by the crew of the show (expect the musicians). The theater is very old and the seats are very uncomfortable.

Tradition Kept Alive. Knowing that this is an aged old tradition of the Viet people is reason enough to see it. The show isn't too long which is great. The theatre can get a little warm, so bring a hand fan. The vocal performance was great and even though thee is no English spoken, the fables can be understood through these cute puppets. I enjoyed the show and I think it is a must see for any culture loving tourist. Tip: out of the different sessions available, we chose the 6.30 session as I thought most people would be embarking on all the restaurants for dinner at this time. Most people would either want a pre dinner or post dinner show. I was right. The session before was full and quite crowded. The 6.30 session was comfortable. Less people in theatre = cooler atmosphere.
Very entertaining. Quite different, would definitely recommend for families with kids. The music and singers were the best part, absolutely amazing.

Entertaining cultural experience. Of course, I don't speak Vietnamese so plenty of the show's nuance was lost on me, and the singing women had side conversations / looked bored at times. But that aside (and it's fine ultimately), it was definitely a worthwhile experience while here. They have plenty of shows per day at $5 the max ticket price for an hour show -- no reason not to go. It was a unique performance experience with some traditional music and themes, and the little translated program listing gives enough information that you can follow the gist of what each song is about.
Best visit in Hanoi!. Don´t miss it! Most authentical experience in Vietnam! Great performance, we trully enjoyed every minute. Live music and traditional instruments use was a plus!
Unique experience, worth a visit. Does a good job displaying the history and culture of Vietnam. Seats are spaced too close though, so tall persons might have some trouble getting comfortable.
meracus 2 hanoi. Very entertaining for our grandchildren aged 6 and 8. We still enjoy after three visits. Conveniently located.

A cultural experience. It was truly an experience to see for ourselves the art of water puppetry and how it was performed. It was entertaining and humorous in some parts and it really demonstrated how the farmers entertained themselves during the monsoon season.
Great value. Great little entertaining show and only cost a few dollars to see. Fast paced and like nothing else I've seen. Music is excellent. Well worth doing.

If you have extra time.... this is actually a beautiful ancient art from Vietnam...paid 100,000 dong each for the entrance but the ushers keep on allowing people go in and out of the theater during the show which made us difficult to focus.some members of the band looked very sluggish and tired as if they dont want what they do, they talk to each other in between the shows and some are not focused.the puppet show must have been a great show if these things will be corrected

A must for family with young children. We went for a 6.30pm show and and all our 4 kids, boys n girls between 3-11 love it! Though we didn't understand a word of it, we enjoyed every single minute if it. It amazingly managed to keep even my hyper 3 year old to sit still for about an hour! To be honest, this theatre was our second choice as we had wanted to watch the water puppet at the other comparatively new theatre (on the other side of the lake), but the other theatre only had 1 session/day, and we had missed their 5pm show. Two thumbs up!

Great cultural experience . Wasn't sure what I was expecting when I went, i wasn't disappointed, the music was as good as the puppets, If you like music, culture or art you'll be sure to like,Great way to spend a hour !

Enjoyable evening - worth the money . Took our 4 year old to this show & glad we did. It was entertaining and good value for money. Overall enjoyable however show went for 45mins and we felt that was a bit long 35 mins would have been better as we all found ourselves loosing a bit of interest at the end.

A Visual Treat !. We loved the puppet show. Both the puppet show and the musical instruments used were unique and different . The puppets are very colorful and the whole act is so well coordinated in spite of the fact that puppets are gliding in water . Its a 1 hour show and just opposite to the lake. Its definitely worth it when in Old Quarters. Dont think too much..go for it !

Great mix of Puppetry and Music. Perfect combination of music and puppetry. The show I went to, had kids and kids at heart in the audience genuinely entertained. With programme guides available in a number of languages, it's easy to follow the acts despite the language barrier. Definitely a must-see!

Exquisite cultural experience. My (sceptical) husband and I both loved this performance. Our hotel arranged excellent seats and we were mesmorised by the music, singing and performance. Definitely a do not miss and extremely good value for money. Finally an attraction which offers relevant souvenirs and we have a lovely 'fairy' puppet back home. Only downside were 3 'little princes' in the row behind us. Parents, please do not take your kids out unless they are civilised - and you are not doing them any favours by allowing them to behave so badly. This went beyond natural exhuberance and was blatant disregard for anyone else enjoying the show. Maybe consider having adult only shows.

Great 45 min entertainment. The puppet show was quite unique and entertaining. We thoroughly enjoyed it a lot more than people around us as we were following the write up given at the entrance as to what happens next. Altho i wish the write up was a bit more detailed, couple of lines more for each part would have been perfect.
Different. Wasn't what I was expecting, but nevertheless it was interesting to watch. Good thing to see once in your life time I guess.

Cultural entertainment. A wonderful waterpuppet show..i was impressed how they did it. Its not boring or childish..its culture. The theatre is very nice, theres AC and good seats. Try to get as close as you can to the water, you can take beautiful pictures there. The traditional music played on special local instruments is very nice. The performance is done in 14 parts,each has it special effects.. Its pretty impressive how they do all the dances, jumps, funny things,...in the water. At the end you will see all the actors..its definatly worth a visit and not expensive at all.

Unusual and worth a trip. This is a show of puppets performing to a live orchestra with dialog sung by the musicians. The action is conducted over a pool of water. The effect is unique and fascinating. The musicians are very skilled and the voices beautiful. Even without understanding the words, the story can still be appreciated

Simply Superb!. Do not miss this - it is what it says - water puppets! I did not expect to be impressed, but I was completely captivated, by all these wonderful little characters. The music was also heavenly.

Essential Hanoi cultural experience!. Such a fabulous, funny and enlightening experience. From the crowds rushing in, to the lady who does all the ticketing manually through to the sheer vigour and authenticity of the musicians. This is one Hanoi highlight that shouldn't be missed!

Unique and entertaining. At first we were really skeptical. We actually expected some kind of tourist trap. But we're so happy we went there. For a pretty low price you get a unique view in an age old tradition and it's very funny and entertaining. The time flew by. We enjoyed the traditional music, the puppet show and the AC as well :-) Don't doubt, just do it.
A must do in Hanoi!. This is definitely a must do thing while visiting Hanoi and Vietnam, specially because this is something you don't see in Europe or many other destinations!

Puppetry in Motion. Presented in an air conditioned theatre seating about three hundred you can't help but wonder how are they maneuvering the dozen action figures in the meter deep pool. There's a five piece traditional Vietnamese band providing music as the puppets glide or should I say swim through their routines. There are fourteen acts and the show lasts an hour. Tickets are inexpensive and at the end the puppeteers present themselves to the audience. This ancient art is still practiced as I witnessed two other water shows during my travels. The theatre is located in Old Hanoi where there is also great shopping.

Unique Must See Performance . A very unique performance. It was fascinating to watch the musician playing the dan bau (monochord instrument) before the puppets entered. Despite not understanding the language, it was mesmerizing to watch the graceful movements of the puppets on the water. The use of (what appeared to be) real fire at one point further enhanced this hypnotic effect. All in all, it was like nothing I have ever seen before, and would recommend it for both the music and puppetry.
A lovely experience. We bought tickets from the theatre in the afternoon for the night's performance. Had great seats and were thoroughly entertained by the performance of the water puppeteers.

Live traditional music and water puppets !!. What a fabulous experience. Don't bother paying for a camera ticket to take photos it is quite hard to get a decent one, spend a couple of dollars more and buy a book when you leave. The live music and singing was beautiful and matches the puppets actions perfectly. All the puppets are very colourful and its fascinating to see a water puppet dragon breathing fire !Parts of the story are quite funny when the fisherman is trying to catch the fish in his basket.The show is only about an 50 minutes long, the theatre is clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful.Make sure you stay right til the end and see the puppeteers.I didn't expect my husband to enjoy this show but he thought it was fantastic and a great cultural experience.

not for all audiences. I really enjoyed the performance, but if you don't have a general artistic / performance interest, I'd not recommend seeing it.It is 45 minutes long and it is pretty much the same for the most part. Different characters, same type of movements.Also the seats are small and the rows too close to one another. If you have long legs, make sure you sit on the aisle, so you can strech / have more space.I enjoyed it. My boyfriend, not so much.

Adorable..Will leave you smiling. I have seen videos of it on utube, but seeing this live was super fun and is highly recommended.The musicians and singers, assemble on one side of the stage and then the show begins and is essentially a quick fire series of acts, depecting mythology, village life, symbiosis and rivalry between humans and animals and mystical dances. All set to wonderful folk instrumental music and songs, sung live !! A lot of it, is fairly comic.It was interesting to see the use of pyrotechniques and lamps in the performance, in some of the sequences. The show last approx an hour and is a great way to experience an art form, unique to this region. The water puppeters join in at the end for a bow.Try and get the middle seats, for the best possible viewing angles.The only gripe I may have is that, the ventilation in the theatre is poor or the air conditioning was turned low and with the smoke machine used during the performance, there is a bit of the stale air.

Good. Good show to go watch. Enjoyed it. Only thing is seating is very cramped. Also get there early or book in advance for tickets it may be sold out if you just show up.Singers, music & performance all very good.

Interesting and fun. I couldn't understand a word that was spoken (all in Vietnamese) but it was very visually appealing and the accompanying musicians were great. Very interesting was of storytelling.
What a lovely place!. Telling many stories, in a beautiful way, this water puppet show was such a refreshing change to the stresses of the old town. A must for everyone nearby!

Cute and Impressive. I must admit that I went along thinking that this would be a cheesy "ticklist" thing to do, but I left with a big smile on my face!Went to the last performance of the day at 8pm and it was probably around two thirds full. Paid 60k dong rather than the 100k dong, but there was minimal seating police so could've sat anywhere really. Ended up sitting around 6 rows from the front and it was fine.Paid 20k dong to take photos, but once again there did not seem to be policing of this and pretty sure that many of the people around me taking photos and filming had not paid anything extra.Regardless, it's extraordinary value for money and very cleverly done. Even though it's largely conducted in Vietnamese this did not detract, if anything it made the singing and music more enchanting.A must-do in Hanoi.

Very Clever and Even A Little Comical. I dragged my husband to the water puppet show and so he proceeded to sleep through this but I loved it. The puppeteers are very clever the way they manipulate those puppets and each sequence had a wee story which was entertaining and sometimes even a bit comical. Well worth the hour or so and the few dollars it cost.

The BEST PUPPET Show !! Must See !!. We LOVED IT !!! It's one of those shows that is enjoyed by kids and grownups as well...We were beautifully surprised by the show. It's not the usual puppet show. The v fact that it's a Water puppet makes it different, but the whole concept , the stories , the live artists making all the right sounds to go with the puppets , the vibrant colors , the beautiful precision of the puppeteers...everything together made this show a Unique experience.PS - try and book tickets in advance to get the Best seats . N yes..even Teenagers will enjoy it..my 21 n 15 yr old kids LOVED it :)

Delightful. I would recommend this very clever and amusing show. In fact it should not be missed. I also enjoyed the accompanying music and even though the storyteller sang in her native language, I liked that too. It was so authentic.

Short and entertaining. The live theater interprets the traditional stories of Vietnam through some very well managed water puppets. You'll never see anything quite like it again. The fire breathing dragons and the carp were the highlight of the show for me.

Tradition and fun. I've been to these performances many times over the past 15 years, and they always make me smile. The skill involved is pretty amazing, but it's hard to see since they make it look easy. Some of the stories are cuter or more complicated to tell than others, but the entire performance, including the music, is slick and professional. (If you want a far less polished and more traditional show, catch the one at the Ethnology Museum.) You may need to get your tickets early because some shows attended by bus-loads of tourists sell out. Buy the tickets and then go for a walk in the very nearby Old Quarter or around Hoan Kiem lake.

"Cute Show". we had a nice time at the theater the puppet show it was a pretty big theater they had several different mini acts with traditional music and different puppets the show is only 45 min or so it is a nice break to get out of the heat and in the air conditioner... it was very interesting to see a long time tradition and very interesting to watch especially hearing lots about it.... even though we did not understand what they were saying somehow we understood :-) we laughed and enjoyed ourselves.. I hope you enjoy it to!!!!

Cultural show . Water puppets was a great way to spend an hour. We went to the 18.30 showing and it cost 200,000vnd. (100,000vnd per adult and 60,000vnd for children)Show lasted just under the hour. Musicians were very good and the show was good. Would recommend a visit.
A Must see but.... I was expecting something more, maybe a little bit boring. Better for family with kids. Don't try if you are tired...

Skilful. Interesting old building. Visited as part of tour group. Puppet operatives very skilled and endured partial submergence in water for approx. 1 hour. musical accompaniment. Not my type of show but worth a visit.

Interesting. My wife and I bought tickets for 3pm session on the day. It was very full but not sold out. Seats comfortable and good view of the show.The show was well performed although we didn't understand the story as it isn't spoken in English.It still interests me how they performed the show as some of the puppets mover very fast so it would be difficult for a person to be operating them.We are pleased we went and as most people say, it is a show everyone should go to when in Hanoi.Great location.

Interesting, cultural experience. The show was recommended to us by the front desk staff of Sofitel Legend, Hanoi. They booked it for us in advance. It is a huge theater and people standing in line as we arrived. Show was sold out. A little brochure in English helped us to understand what happened on the (water)stage. It was a interesting cultural experience worth seeing.

Cultural Show. We got to experience this show on a very very hot night in Hanoi. It was good to see this show near the end of our trip as all of our local guide had used the local story's in our visits in Ho Chi Minh City and Hoi An.The puppets were great, as well as the music, even though it was all in another language, I understood quite a bit of the storied.I can fully recommend to go see this show.

New experience. I ve never knew there is such thing as water puppet. It was very new to me and very interesting to watch. The down part was that everything was in Vietnamese. I don't understand a word but i was fun to see the puppets moving around in the water.

Very traditional...Worth a visit!. Would definitely recommend watching this whilst in Hanoi.Very traditional and accompanied by live music. The puppets are fantastic and they show tells stories of traditions of the city.Prices are cheap so well worth the experience Can also buy the puppets afterwards for very cheap - 140,000 VND, so around 4-5 pounds! They make lovely presents for kids!

Beautiful, cultural, entertaining. I loved this show, it was a real Vietnamese theatre experience. It's totally impressive and accompanied by live musicians and vocals. Its much more than a puppet show. For sure worth seeing!!

Even though is a Must See, I must say. That it was quite boring most of the time. Best if you could do even a bit of reading beforehand about their mythology, so that the show gets some meaning to you, and especially to kids.I would still recommend to go there- gives an insight into their traditional culture. They accept either Viet Dong (cash) or USD (cash). So was very convinient to pay with the USD change I had recieved the night before from the Visa On Arrival.
Hanoi water puppet show. Great show in a cute little theatre. Fantastic music with wonderful water puppetry. Younger children will be enthralled! Photography allowed too.

Ok to kill time or get a bit of off beat culture.. Didn't know what to expect with this one. Was good to watch, glad it was 40 mins or so as it did get boring tbh. Was different. Good to see if u have time to burn. Was 100k entry in the evening.  Also watch as you go up the stairs as someone will try to sell you a ticket for 1 USD, a camera ticket if you are holding a camera they will sell you this. I said NO and just carried on walking, whilst saying I was not going to take any pictures then. So what about all the people I saw in the theater with there phones out taking photo's ? Does stack up does it. Watchout for the drivers that jump on you as you come out of the theater, so annoying !

Great Show!. Pretty cool show to watch. It was something new and exciting that we did. Instead of seeing temples or museums in Hanoi, this is definitely something that was different and we both enjoyed watching it. The only thing is that everything is in Vietnamese, so we couldn't really understand the dialogue but it is still enjoyable nonetheless.

Amazing puppetry. Definitely a must whilst in Hanoi. Situated near one corner of Hoan Kiem Lake. The one hour show is a spectacular of puppet wizardry on water accompanied by traditional singers and musicians. The idea started many generations ago by the peasants in the rice fields who entertained themselves after work and the show is based on this tradition. Try and book in advance to get front seats and avoid "blocking heads". There is a souvenir shop and restaurant. Not really suitable for disabled people but I am sure the staff are willing to assist.

Good fun. We all enjoyed our visit to the water Puppet Theatre. Located right beside Ho Kiem Lake and there are several shows daily. Inexpensive and a good insight into the history and culture of the area. The puppetry is simple and amusing and there is no need to know the language.

Traditional entertainment. Very skillful puppeteering, good playing of local musical instruments, an entertaining hour. Pick up a flyer at the entrance that gives a title for each segment, as obviously the singing is in Vietnamese, but with this and a little knowledge of local legend and culture its not too difficult to follow. The only drawback came from other audience members -the man in front of my husband constantly moved his head about, so my husband had to also -possible knock-on effect therefore right to the back?

It's a traditional show. Yes, as is suggested, this is a typical local thing. It's nice to experience, but I find it interesting as well as boring. Great synergy by the performers for sure! However, the theatre is way too stuffy and hot! Please fix/enhance the air system in the theatre as I was feeling unwell due to the crowd and seats are very close to one another.
Amazing. My boyfriend and i book ticket at 15:20 I like water puppet show,i like vietnamese musicThe ticket price 100.000vnd better 60.000vnd

A fun traditional show. It is quite interesting with different vignettes played out by a range of water puppets. The accompanying music is very 'cultural' but I didn't always find it easy to listen to. The show is cute and funny at times too. All the puppets are quite different and the stories are easy to understand. It's definitely worth an hour sitting in a warm, slightly cramped theatre.
Fun, fun, fun. The Vietnamese water puppets are superb. It was a fun evening for our family. The theater was a short walk from our hotel and a great venue.

Interesting and Enjoyable Show. My boyfriend and I were very impressed with the Water Puppet Theatre! We weren't sure what to expect, so it definitely exceeded our expectations! Live music, air conditioning, and an enjoyable cultural experience! Definitely a fun evening activity! : )
Great show !!. Well worth the hour & the crowds.The puppeteers make their puppets themselves.They tell stories related to history & lore Very enjoyable.
Water Puppets- . Worth a visit, good show and they keep you entertained! Things happen that you don't expect, would love to know what they were saying.

Lovely way to spend an evening in Hanoi. Excellent way to spend an hour or so on a Saturday evening in Hanoi. The show is in Vietnamese with a small guide available in various languages to tell you what each act is about. The acts are short skits accompanied by live music or singing and tell stories of Vietnamese folklore using the puppets.Cameras are allowed in the theatre and you can take photos throughout the performance. We were lucky enough to be sitting on row A which was excellent - we had tried at 5.20pm to get tickets for the 6.30 performance but it was sold out so we went for the 8pm instead. Do try to book ahead if you can - as a foreigner you will probably be charged 100,000 VND for Type 1 tickets but this is still a bargain. After the show we enjoyed some drinks and live music in the bar next door - most enjoyable!
MUST SEE SHOW. not to be missed when in hanio the show is on at several times during the day so convenient for everybody ,i was not sure before we went but we enjoyed the whole show and story line

Amazing Water Puppets Show. I went to water puppets show with my Japanese friend in March. And how nice it was, specially for Japanese guy she was soo enjoyed it. This is first time I saw the show, so now I can understand why foreigners would like to come here to explore the cultural of Vietnam. I would definitely will come back for next trip to Hanoi.Book it as soonest possible for front seat. Travel as business
Very entertaining. Visited this as part of a tour, so not sure of costs, but a very entertaining show. We were at the front so had a great view but nearly got wet.

A unique art- absolutely must see!. The water puppet art is incredible- the puppets seem to come to life in the water and it is absolutely magical. I enjoyed the music very much and the set is wonderful. There were some children in the audience who were spell bound and excited- I think this would be a great activity for any family tourists. The show is about 50 minutes, which I thought was perfect. The cheap seats have great views - I would spend extra for the expensive ones. This was a top highlight of Hanoi for me.

Initially sceptical, but it grows on you. Our day trip included a visit to the Water Puppet Show. I had a blinding headache and was somewhat apprehensive.After some five or six minutes my headache had all but gone and I was intrigued! There is an indescribable skill involved; moving the underwater sticks and strings and not getting caught up with others fascinated me! Naturally, the show uses Vietnamese music, an acquired taste, and all spoken words are in Vietnamese, but for us this did not detract from the overall attraction.For some thirty minutes or so, you can escape the realities of your everyday world and feast on the fun of the Water Puppets. Enjoy!

Fascinating!!. The Water Puppets are really something so different. Even though the 'show' is in Vietnamese it is certainly worth the few dollars it cost. The show is well done and something to remember

Great music, clever performance.... I wasn't too sure if I would enjoy this as I had heard it was boring, but I thought it was fantastic. It is very clever, I have no idea how they did most of the performance. The show was 45 mins, and the time went really quick...the music was brilliant, I would have enjoyed listening that that on its own, the puppets were an added bonus...

Oh God. I do not get Vietnamese music. Or the instruments. And the performance was in Vietnamese! Would not recommend!The most interesting part was when we caught a glimpse, in silhouette, of the men behind a screen, making the water puppetry work.

Really Fun. The water puppet theatre host shows about 4 times every day so you will definitely find a time to suit your schedule. The show lasts only about 1 hour and costs $5 pp. You do have to pay for bringing cameras and camcorders into the theatre. The space is tight for tall people (not much leg room) but it's worth cramming in for the hour. There is air con and fans so even a full theatre is quite cool. The show itself is just about long enough. It's made up of short stories acted out by the puppeteers in a pool on the stage - you have to see it for yourself.

You must visit this Theater. We saw a wonderful puppet show here. The music was very attractive, you could feel a soul in it. They performed a show like the whole history of the Vietnam. I especially loved the singers, their voices are so amazing! And also, how the puppet moved in the water, everything was awsome. Once when you get to Ha Noi, you should ask your hotel's reception desk to book a show to see how a water puppet show goes!Note: The only thing that got us pissed of was the women, who was on the tickets desk. She was not so helpful. We went to buy 2 tickets for the show at around 5:30pm and her face was like "Well, see it or leave it. I don't really care if you want to buy a ticket from me". That's why you should ask your reception desk to try not to see that angry women.

a beautiful show. Saw a lot of positive reviews so we decided to give this a go. We were not disappointed. As other reviewers have said book early. We turned up about 20 mins before hoping to get in but it was fully booked. However we were able to get in to the next show. The story is simple but the work of the puppet masters is amazing. The music that accompanies the show is beautiful. A very worthwhile experience. (Even bought some water puppets - however if you walk outside to one of the stalls you can get them cheaper).

A must, enjoyable music, nice show. . I found it quite interesting and beautiful. The music is amazing and also the so complex work of the people who control the puppets.My only complain is about they let people use cameras and phones. Even that I was in 3th row, there where cameras blocking me the show! there was a man who was recording ALL the show, I needed even to ask him please to low his camera cause was blocking me.They should do the same that people at the Ca Tru singing show, they don't allow people use cameras or phones, at the beginning you are like "oh, I want to record this", but then, a t the end you realize you enjoyed so much and deeply the show without being worried about recording, take pictures or being blocked by others.

The kids will love it, and you'll be left smiling too.. Thanks to the Lonely Planet I read about the wee gem. With or without kids, for the small cost, you should experience this if you have an hour to spare one afternoon. The puppeteers have performed around the world and it is an excellent show, like nothing else you would have ever experienced. The whole show is on/in water so the technique and skill involved keep you engaged even if the story lines at times are a wee bit basic (traditional folk stories), albeit charming. One of the highlights, if you are into traditional music, are the orchestra and singers set just to the side of the pool. Outstanding musicians perform beautiful renditions of Vietnamese cultural music to support the show, including the voice overs for the puppets. Warning, the theatre is hot (they have fans blowing which helps) and the seating is VERY tight. If you are over 6 foot and talk nicely to the ushers (like I did) then they may let you sit on the aisle. If you find the top of the lake (hard to miss!), then the theatre is just across the road opposite. Make sure you book (we asked the hotel concierge to do so) as nearly every show books out and you'll be disappointed. I scored this a 4/5 as I guess it wont be everyone's cup-of-tea. If you take it for what it is and soak up the culture you will score it a 5 for sure. It's not expensive and its a part of this city. Yes near the end you start hoping it's the last act, but you still should be pleased you've experienced this little piece of Vietnam in a very old theatre. I was.

Amazing skills - a must visit in Hanoi. Found out about this unique show through various net reviews. It was a great experience. At some point, you need to let go of thinking of how they do it, and just enjoy the brilliance and talent of the artists.

It's ok but you get bored quickly. At first it's quite interesting but then it got boring quite quickly as it becomes quite random and you don't really know what's going on (despite the leaflet giving the titles of each dance).

Liked it. My friend wanted to see this. I wasn't too excited to watch a puppet show but I was interested how water puppeteering works. We booked premium seats (~$10 I think) and got seated right at the front row. I ended up loving the show, its concept, and the skill and creativity involved. I also loved the instrumental music. I was glad i held on to the programme (available in English and a couple other languages) otherwise I would have barely any idea what the segment was about. This hour-long show is entirely in Vietnamese. One of tour guides mentioned that water puppeteering is native and unique to Northern Vietnam. If you're up for something local, this is a must see. The Vietnam Museum of Ethnology also has a short water puppet show around 10am on non-rainy days. We visited the museum on a drizzling morning. But I would not expect the museum's to be as good as the Thang Long group, IMO.

Recommended for elderly and those with a pacemaker. The show is a perfect opportunity to have a decent siesta; mind you - it'll cost you because it is a tourist trap and the price is jacked up!Skip the show; save the money for a spa treatment or a decent dinner at a finer restaurant - the siesta? Why don't you have one in your hotel...

A unique experience. We had read reviews of this theatre experience so decided it was something not to miss. Our hotel booked our tickets for us. The theatre was full so it was important to book.There were several short plays which were all explained in the program. It was unlike any puppet show you could imagine. The puppets were stunning and the showmanship was extraordinary. This style of puppet play apparently had its roots in the wet rice fields. It is an experience not yo be missed if you visit Hanoi.

It wasn't for me.. There are plenty of good reviews for this show, but it didn't do it for me. One, I can't understand a word they are saying the whole time. Two, these performers do multiple shows a day, every day. To me it seemed as if they were just going through the motions. Trying to get the job done. I didn't feel any energy in the performance. Lets just say I didn't get it. Oh well.

Really pleasantly surprised. My jury was out about this attraction when my husband said it was on his "Hanoi to Do' list. What a pleasant surprise I got. This was entertainment theatre at its most clever. Whilst we couldn't understand the story behind the puppet show we could get the main themes behind it. The puppet masters are amazingly clever. We bought tickets earlier in the day (and went to the 6.30pm show). I would advise to prebook your tickets as it was almost fully booked out when we got there. Also check the session times at the theatre - they differ quite a bit with each brochure you see, and even some sessions on the day were not available at the actual theatre.About 45 minutes of great entertainment. I would highly recommend visiting the Water Puppets for all age groups.

beautiful entertainment. Very magical, the orchestra was great and the instruments were a mixture of string, horns and gongs with traditional Vietnamese music and the play was narrated by song and speech.Often simple folk tales from Vietnamese traditional folk law and mythology.I found it quite lovely and I think most people would enjoy this for its ethnic value and beautiful stage craft.

A unique glimpse into traditional Vietnamese culture. For me, the water puppet show was an interesting and enjoyable glimpse into the traditional Vietnamese culture. The puppets were cute and scenes of village life were brought to life during the 50 minute show. I especially enjoyed the dragon and fish dances as well as the phoenix scenes. However, I do not speak Vietnamese so I did not understand the dialogues. There are brochures in different languages before you enter the theater that gives visitors some information about the show.Yes, I would recommend this show as it is unique and very Vietnamese.

Very enjoyable. We loved the water puppet show. Very entertaining. The only reason why I have given it a rating of four instead of five is because I had a little trouble seeing the stage. Still got a good look but my view of the stage wasn't uninterrupted

Interesting to say the least!. My husband and I to the water puppet show tonight - and where do I start! It was certainly an experience we'll remember for a while to come! The talented puppeteers use a variety of puppets to perform short routines representing Vietnamese history and culture. The limited narration is in Vietnamese (and sadly neither of us speak Vietnamese!) so we just enjoyed the puppets and music. It's an interesting experience, something worth doing if you have some spare time and want to escape the hustle and bustle! I wouldn't rush back but glad we went all the same!

Did not meet my expectations. Based on the great reviews on TA, I was expecting something magical. It is just okay IMO. The seats were narrow, so it was uncomfortable to be seated for an hour. The AC wasn't sufficient.
Go for it if you have some time to kill.
Only if you reallllyyyyy have nothing to do..... Puppets were cute and their movements were impressive but gets old real fast. Also there's no air conditioning.

Fun puppet show. We were a little nervous about this but it ended up being really cute and fun. Like other reviewers said, you have to go into it with a child-like and open-minded point of view and a couple of beers before might have also helped haha! We would definitely recommend this to others!

Interesting!. Was pleasantly surprised! Really colourful and full of life! Great show for children too. Stories about Vietnamese culture and heritage by water puppets, unique and interesting. Definate must see

OK if you have some spare time.. My daughter and I saw this show as part of our tour.A good insight into traditional entertainment. Children would really enjoy the show they would love the characters and the stories are fun.  Although we found it interesting and the people controlling the puppets talented, we both felt we would not see it again.The theater was small so everyone had a good view of the water stage, the same with the musicians for the show. I found the instruments they played interesting.

Different - for the history and culture this is worth the visit. We had time to kill before our flight so booked in to see the show. My husband feels it is 45 minutes he won't get back in his life but for an interesting experience I enjoyed it. The puppetry is fun, and although we had no idea what the songs were about the representation of life in the villages was interesting.

Very nice show. We saw the water puppet show as part of a Gate 1 tour. The theater is fairly small so there are really no bad seats but you get the best views sitting in the center. Our group sat in the back in the last three rows in the center and had good views. The seats are tiered in each row. The show lasts about an hour and is fun to see. Would recommend seeing it if visiting Hanoi and is a show for people of all ages. A few singers and musicians in local costume are also part of the show. Very enjoyable.

good place and nice show. I feel very happy to see the show , it's really exciting and fun , with traditional music of Vietnam has given me a sense of love over the nation .My family and I have had the experience of culture as well as the lives of people through the show Vietnam , it gives me a lot of inspiration surge when traveling in Vietnam .I can not forget this place and will highly comment further on the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre and introduce to my friend about your traditional culture unique in Hanoi .

Nice local experience! . Very quick and funny.. They have several shows during the day and it lasts about an hour maximum.. Tickets cost 8 dollars or less and people from your hotel can arrange it for you or you can step in last minute and get it.. Simple but beautiful and interesting to see some local stuff..you can see it before you go out to dine.
cool watter puppet show. show and live music/singing were great but i would like to have translation because i did not get the story from the show :)

『 EXCELLENT 』. Thang Long Water Puppet Theater is located near Hoan Kiem Lake.
You should reserve tickets of show.
Because show is very popular in HAN.
Water-Puppet is very cute!!!
I recommend this attraction.

Great experience. The water puppet theater is a great experience - a good combination of music and visuals. It was short enough, and gave a glimpse into the Hanoi past. I would recommend if you're nearby.

water puppets. I enjoyed the show some people on our tour where not that impressed. It was invented by simple villagers to amuse them and there children, It was well done if taken in that context. The was well put on, the puppeteers where in the water behind a screen.

Interesting enough I guess but goes on a bit. It's not incredible but it's fairly harmless and gives a small insight into some of the local culture. It lasts a bit longer than it needs to though.We didn't book in advance and somehow ended up on the front row so we got a great view.Unlike most theatre based shows they let you take photos so do remember to take a camera.

Lively and Entertaining Performance. I thought "Ho-hum" as I settled into my front row seat at the Thang Long Water Puppet Theater in Hanoi. The traditional music began and the storyteller, speaking in Vietnamese, unfolded the tales as they were dramatized by master puppeteers in the water before me. I had the foresight to pick up a program in English which allowed me to follow along and understand each of the vignettes and even laugh at the jokes. The program is essential to ultimate enjoyment.This traditional form of entertainment dates back a thousand or so years and this is the best place in the country to see it. I loved the live singers; I loved the traditional 10 or so piece orchestra; and I thought the brightly painted puppets charming. There were firework breathing dragons, smoke, military battles, and water buffalo and peasants plowing the fields. At the end, the puppeteers who had been waist deep in water, came out to take a bow to the cheers of all present.I loved this experience and encourage any and all to spend the 100,000 dong (five dollars) to see this show.

Really fun show. You need to be a kid at heart to watch the show and I am, so really enjoyed the show.Suggest you try to get seats as close to the front as possible, especially if you want to take photos or film. The musicians are excellent and it's all live music.They have several times in the afternoon to see the show. We just walked up and bought tickets, but tour buses do go to this theatre, so you may want to book your tickets ahead of time. Can even buy yourself some miniature copies of the puppets.Would have liked more translation into English of the stories and symbolism of the puppets, but still enjoyed it.If this review is helpful, please tick below:

Brilliant show. This is an excellent show and high quality water puppetry. Music, puppets, fireworks and lighting all gel very well together and made me feel sorry that I don't understand Vietnamese so I could follow the stories better (though the broad strokes are easily self-explanatory).With its 100,000 Dong price tag it's one of the costlier attractions of Hanoi, but it's well worth it in my eyes. It's notable, however, that you have to pay extra to take pictures or film, but I think that's fair enough.I can particularly recommend this trip for families. Frankly, when I saw a family with a young child enter and sit down in the first row, I felt a certain amount of dread, quickly vindicated by the child starting to wail. When the show started it quickly shut up, though, so I'd say that's certainly a point for the puppeteers.

Dancing dragons and more. This was a great show. Never seen puppets on water before and the short vignettes were great. Enjoyed the live music and the singing. Seats were comfortable and just to the right of the entrance into the theatre are programmes in English. We paid 100000 dong or 5 dollars for an interesting and entertaining 45 minutes. I will not tell you the different scenes as it would spoil the fun of seeing it Well worth an hour in the day to see. If you found the review helpful please let me know all feedback is appreciated.

NIce break from the traffic. I don't know why some people said they fell asleep in the theatre. It had to be the heat and tireness and obviously not this well thought of production. The traditional music used here has very lively drumming. It is not the slow sleepy type. All the ladies sing beautifully. The way they do puppets in a small pool is amazing. It's enchanting and you can not afford to miss it.

Puppet theater with a twist. It's best to go to this show without any expectations because you will be surprised by this kind of traditional masterpiece. It really makes for a good laugh and brought back some childhood memories. The fantastic 50min show is for every age and well worth a visit.Tickets cost 60,000D/100,000D depending if you want to sit in the front or back. It costs extra to bring in your camera and take pictures, but it is best to just enjoy the show and leave the camera in your bag.

Well done . I was not sure what to expect but it is well worth the visit. Life music- so beautiful. The water puppet theater is very impressive. You don't have to understand Vietnamese to have a good time.

A must-see. Very interesting and funny experience - something to see once. 50 minutes show nice for kids and adults alike. Great to see the puppeters at the end, would have been even better to see them actually working the puppets (they are doing an incredible job)

Don't miss this. Although some will put this on the list of touristy activities because all the tour groups will book it, I would not be put off. This is authentic Vietnamese culture and all appearances are that you are seeing a genuine article not changed for tourists. We enjoyed it very much.

A great way to spend an hour. Bought our ticket the day before so were seated in the middle of the third row.
We found the performence very good and educational - a lot of humor even though you do not understand a word spoken.
GO THERE.

Maybe not my thing. Not really sure what I was expecting but left after a few minutes. When I could see past the tall guy in front of me it was a bunch of puppets in water. Maybe if I understood Vietnamese I would get the joke.

Interesting show but do grab a copy of the programme list as the entire performance is in Vietnamese. Our hotel package include a free water puppet show at the Thang Long Puppet Theatre.
