very interesting for the little one. this show is something new to us. for the first 20mins, it can be very entertaining because it is foreign. however, the next 25mins, it is more or less the same repeated puppets with different singing and moves. we dozed off somewhere there... but the little one was entertained throughout!

unusual show. A very interestning show, the puppets are a pice of art, the actors stay the whole time in water. The stories are not always understandable, but the playing is so charming and special. Do not miss it!
Must see. This a visual treat , and a must see. Touristy but amazing control of puppets .. no strings attached :)
an hour i will not get back.. was interesting to see, however an hour was too long and it wasnt clear what was happening. plus it was overpriced compared to other attractions
Good Show. The show is good, however needs a translation in English for the wording that the Puppet speaks; so that the audience could understand the conversation.

A very unique theatre experience. We visited with two other couples in our party and all thoroughly enjoyed the show,the music the puppets quite different from anything we had previously seen. Could not believe the charge of $5 for a National Puppet troupe. I would definitely recommend this to travellers to Hanoi. I don't t know why people were surprised the show was in Vietnamese, that is the country we were visiting!

Good but better if you're mildly deaf. We were in the third row and I loved the instruments, but maybe because I've taken so many buses in Vietnam I just did not enjoy the singing. It's cute at first, but when the singers have the mic so close to their mouths....Visually it was spectacular, especially the fish, flaming dragons and frogs. It was sometimes a bit samey but it was quite interesting. Some reviews have said they needed subtitles, but they actually give you a programme with the individual dances/acts. They don't interconnect, they are all individual and not speaking Vietnamese is not a hindrance. It's good for kids I think, and definitely sit in the first rows so you can actually see the show and the water!
It was funny!. Didn't expect it to be fun to watch. We were laughing hard in the theater. Get the ticket early, so you will be in the front role or middle role.
Not worth to buy VIP seat. Just purchase normal seat ticket as no one care what you brought. They only care your money. Do not put high expectations of it.
Just good enough. If i was a baby, i would fell more exciting but this is ok for an hour if you have time. I may recommend it to the families having small children

Fun Show. So the show is in all Vietnamese but if you read up on Vietnams history you should be able to follow it. The musicians are great and the show itself is pretty cool. Our 7 year old and a local who was with us 7 year old loved it. The artistry it takes to do this is amazing. Overall worth a visit at least once. Only cost $5 for seats up front. AC in theater as well.

Loved it. I went because my husband is a puppeteer and he has got me interested in the variety of methods and ways of puppetry. However due to the reviews here my expectation was definitely below average. I left pretty impressed! It's not something spectacular that will blow your mind but it is definitely entertaining, especially for the kiddies.The narration is in Vietnamese, you can pick up a brochure to understand the skit. It'd be great if there were subtitles but I think a lot of the jokes (particularly puns) would be lost in translation anyway. Besides the language just adds authenticity to it... I mean, you don't need explaining what the puppets are doing - fishing, flirting, etc. They have got the movement right. I was mesmerized when at one point early in the show they used firecrackers in the mouth of the dragon puppets!At one point it does feel tad dragged if you don't understand it, maybe about 3/4 into the show but I still recommend it for something different. It doesn't look that difficult but there were actually 10 puppeteers involved for the entire show.They also display puppets upstairs right before you enter the theater.

Sounds cheesey, but it's great. This ws included in our tour and I did not expect to enjoy it, but it was excellent. The live music was wonderful and the water puppets clever and funny. It'sjust the right length of time too.
Do Not Miss!. Great show! We were surprised that our children (8 and 11 yrs) enjoyed it as much as we did! Prices were at 60k to 100K VND per person - not expensive at all.

Excellent for the price. So cheap and just a laugh. Bit cramped but just a nice authentic vibe. It is spoken in Vietnamese but that doesn't take anything away from it, keeps it real. The design and effort and history behind it was just all very well planned out.

Good but not really my thing. The puppetry/music is pretty impressive although this wasn't really for me. It was nice to see as is something i have never seen before but I have to admit after the first starting five minutes I was wondering what on earth I had come to! The start was a conversation between a puppet and one of the musicians, which is all in vietnamese so never had a clue what was going on, although this was expected, I assumed the show would speak through actions! Each of the acts I also thought I never had a clue what was going on but we picked up a running order which (think we were meant to be given at the start but somehow missed this) which basically told us what we though was going on was indeed going on!To explain one act had a boy on a water buffalo playing a flute moving back on forth across the water, no idea why this was happening or what it was meant to symbolise - turns out it was just meant to be "Boy on water buffalo playing flyte" as the description read! The other acts all follow a similar patter. At least for the show we saw.Overall I am glad I went but for me 20-30 minutes would have been plenty, 50 minutes was just a bit too much and I was getting a bit fed up. Considering the price and that it only really takes an hour out your day I would say give it a go!

Great show, shady service. So we bought the tickets a day ahead, making sure that we had it all organised and would get nice seats. We bought the most expensive tickets they have - 100,000 dong. The sales lady wrote the seats on our tickets and off we went. When we came to the theater, we saw that there was already someone sitting on our seats - apparently the seats were double booked. When I approached one of the people who show you to your seats, he simply waived me off and told me to sit on the corner - whereas we had seats right in the center. He didn't even want to explain anything. Anyway, when the show started, there were people from the back, who were moved up front, even though I'm pretty sure they paid for the cheapest ticket. I don't know how that works, but it was disappointing. As for the show - it is really worth the visit - the mini orchestra is beautiful, the show is a lot of fun and you get to see the culture. Highly recommend it, just make sure you get the seats that you booked.

Waste of time but probably good for kids. Just some moving puppets with background of scraggy singing.
Kids might enjoy the physical aspects as its probably different from other things they are used but it gets boring for adults after 10mins.

For something different. The kids enjoyed the water puppet show even though it's in full Vietnamese. It's easy to follow and the music and singing is lovely. In particular we liked the dragon and fairy performances. We had a great guide through Buffalo tours who walked us through the local streets and smaller lanes. Only suggested improvement is the seating. Kids found it hard to see. Short of changing all the seating, some cushions for shorter people would be great!

Great fun. Really worth seeing - clever and amusing as well as culturally interesting. The only problem we had was the lack of leg room in the theatre - my husband is 6'4 and he had to sit side on, which was pretty uncomfortable. If you're tall i.e over 5'11" try to book seats in the front row.
Bright and cheerful. I saw these puppets in 1990. I liked the current version better with brightly painted puppets and sets, lovely music and singing. It is now quite a professional production.

Traditional puppet show of Vietnam. Located next to Hoan Kiem Lake in the city (walking distance to 36 old street). There are 3-4 shows each day which lasts for around 1 hour. Audience will be seated in cinema-theater seating arrangement with seat number.The show began with some Vietnamese local song. It is a very skillful performance. The only disadvantage is the show is performed in Vietnamese language. No narrative in English languages during the show, except the announcement made by the MC. The show performed in series of short stories, covering some legends stories in ancient Vietnam and some livings lifestyle of Vietnamese. The only legend story I understand is the returning of the sword by King in Hoan Kiem Lake.I was impressed by some additional tricks by the puppeteers in the water, i.e by shooting fire from the mouth of dragons. Some stories are performed in humour especially related to the daily lifestyle of Vietnamese. A-must visit place when you are in Hanoi.

Something different. This is a very well thought out and executed theater show. The musician play well, the puppets are great and the little episodes have variety and humour. All this for $5 - no wonder it's popular - you may need to book ahead.

Speachless. This was a very beautiful experience. The wonderful singers,musicians and the fantastic puppeteers. You have a good idea as to what the story is about even though its not in english. All round a must see....
Skillful water puppeteer. I can't understand the story but still enjoyed the show. All the plays are about Vietnam folklore and culture, I guess.

A slice of culture. A nice bit of culture. Not too heavy going. Lighthearted storytelling that transcends language. Everything's in Vietnamese, so be prepared for that, though there's a little bit of helpful literature that you can pick up at the door. The theater is usually packed so get your tickets early.

Wonderful cultural experience. Ok, so it is a bit touristy and it probably isn't exactly what puppetry is like in rural Vietnam but it gave our kids a feel of the music and costumes of the area. If you have kids this is a great performance to take them.

Definitely see this!. To experience traditional Vietnamese folk music, skilled water puppetry and an evening of entertainment for all the family, you must come and see this. I recommend getting the first class ticket so you get a seat in the front rows for that extra special experience.

Unique. Definitely worth seeing! Wasn't really sure what to expect but it turned out to be a great show. You don't need to speak Vietnamese as there is just singing and a bit of dialogue but the puppets actions really tell the story.

great artistry... subtitles needed. the water puppets were amazing, you get to wonder how they do it. the local Vietnamese music was quite interesting as well.. But once you get over the initial amazement one can't help but sleep through the show; it gets pretty BORING specially when you don't understand whats happening. A playbill or just flier with a summary of the scenes would make this better.
Good to do once. It was interesting, and neat to hear the music with the show. I would like more historical background on each segment to better understand what was going on. Good to do once!

Very entertaining!. Quite unique ! There was a live traditional band and singers who were superb. The puppets told a story which was sometimes difficult to follow but it didn't really matter.Downside was no air con.

Good place to visit before dinner!. The theatre is located close to the central lake and old quarter in central Hanoi. There are several shows each day and you can usually get a ticket at the door. The show is somewhat similar to that staged in Saigon but it is still well worth going to see.The puppeteers' skills are very good and we enjoyed the show. The music is also very good.This is a good place to visit in the early evening as it provides good entertainment before going to eat.

Facinating experience - water puppet SHOW!. One of the "must see" in Ha Noi. Just amazing what can be done and communicated with these wodden puppets with support from live traditional song and music. Very well worth a visit!

Interesting show to attend. Water pupets show demonstrates the activities of farmers in rural villages of Red River Delta. Come to see how Vietnamese people in the rural areas live and work. Then you can compare with your life in your homeland. Our guests advise that Cosmos Travel Vietnam Co., Ltd need to recommend this show to travelers, because it is unique around the world
Worth seeing!. We couldn't understand a single word, but it was an enjoyable show. I would recommend paying the USD5 for the front seats for a better view
Amazing Water Puppets. So clever the way that the puppets are manipulated in the water tank from behind a screen - very colourful.

Better than I expected.... I guess I wasn't sure what to expect, so I was pleasantly surprised. My favorite part was the music that was played by the band (orchestra?) during the performance. It was great to see the different types of string instruments played by the musicians that I have never experienced before. I couldn't understand the words (all in Vietnamese of course) but you didn't really need to in order to enjoy.
Water Puppet Show. A show not to miss , very local and they talk and sing all in Vietnam , the performance was excellence and the voice was good.
Water Puppet Show. It was good. Nothing spectacular though. Just different from other puppet shows as it is done in the water.

watch out in the front row!. A visit to the Water Puppet Theatre is a must do experience in Hanoi. Watch out for splashing if you sit in the front row. Also, the space between the rows is short so try and sit at the end of the row if you are over average height. Recommend going back at different times to catch different shows.
A spectacular show worth seeing. I was spellbound and awed by the presentation and the preservation and dissemination of culture and arts through such medium.

Fun entertainment!. The music and singers were great!! The show was fun and even had some humor and surprising special effects! I would recommend paying extra for the closer seats since the puppets are small..

sooooo long and repetitive. This show could have been cut in half. Some of the effects were fine to start with but all then proceeded to become somewhat mundane and repetitive , actually boring However what I found interesting is that during the remainder of our tour many of the stories portrayed were referenced in various attractions we visited.Suggested to the organisers - provide a very brief introduction to each of the stories ( the distributed program gave scant detail) and cut the show in half

The best ever. This was a great show to see. The musicians who played their instruments and also sang along with the movement of the puppets and the colourful puppets, boats and comic humour used. These people really know how to create a show. Don't miss this show they have many performances each day.

Family enjoyed the show. I agree with the last reviewer – the show is entertaining. The key is understanding what you are seeing or else you'd say it's boring, especially since the show is in Vietnamese. Our kids felt the same way. It's worth going to since tickets aren't expensive and it's less than an hour (and they were prompt). Also, there's not a lot of family entertainment in Hanoi. This is the best of it!

Seat in front, flyers a must. Show was good and entertaining. The price was also just right. Flyers at the door are a must to enable you to understand the show.Seat as front as possible since the seats aren't well distributed, hence making viewing poor if there is a tall person in front of you.

Poorly coordinated and not amusing. It was pretty cute for the first five minutes then it became very boring. The puppets are really small so best to get front row seats. The stories were mildly interesting. The puppets dance could be better coordinated.

Entertaining.. If you wanna learn about the myth and legend about Vietnamese people and it's culture, this is the right place. BUT, read the flyers provided near the theatre entrance door so you'd have more understanding on what you gonna watch or else you'll say it boring.
a nice experience. a great fun and wonder to see how they do this!! also helps to understand VIETNAMESE traditions an old art surviving with great efforts

Brilliant do go , best 100,000 Dong I spent in Hanoi. I echo was other reviews say, This is quite unusual and in places very funny,. There are about 14 set pieces, some hard to follow but "Chasing Frogs" and "Chasing the fox that tries to catch the ducks" was hilarious.

Thumbs up. Very cool, very entertaining, very clever. The only minor down side is that the seats appear to have been designed for Vietnamese children, I am glad that I am not American, or I fear I may not have been able to fit in at all, but other than that I fully recommend parting with 5 bucks for the ticket (unless you are a normal sized American, in which case perhaps just wait for the DVD to come out, so that you can watch it from the comfort of your own home, whilst enjoying a stuff crust, meat lovers pizza with extra cheese, washed down with a gallon of that weak dirty water that you have the audacity to call coffee). I may have got a little off topic.
Worth a visit. This show is wonderful to see, especially for children. It was truly amazing how they performed it, and very easily understood.

Something very different. This is an excellent show. It last about one hour. Although the singing and speaking is in Vietnamese, much of it is understandable through the movements of the puppets. Well worth a visit.

Don't miss this show!. I'm not young, by any means, but this puppet show makes you feel young at heart. The skill of the puppet makers, puppeteers and musicians is incredible; even 50 minutes of traditional Vietnamese music didn't grate on my ears. The traditional folk stories were brought to life by the weaving, ducking, diving, soaring, superbly crafted puppets - I can't begin to fathom how. The show is so reasonably priced that you don't need to think twice about going, but do buy tickets early if you can, to get good seats.

So amusing!. This was really an enjoyable experience and fun to watch. The puppeteers manoeuvred the puppets superbly and made them come to life. The individual little stories were amusing with the characters ducking and giving in the water. The music that accompanied the stories was performed on traditional instruments. There were two singers whose voices blended so well together. I'd you are in Hanoi I would recommend you visit the show as it adds a new dimension to puppets. The puppeteers actually stand waist deep in the water. As it is only approximately 45 minutes in length it will not take up too much time. Be warned you can take photographs of the show if you pay a small fee. A person in front of me had his camera held up in the air to tasks photos a lot of the time. A real pain.

Strange experience, but a must do!. Very cute puppet showDon't expect much, it was very twee and very cuteNothing in English but very culturalI would recommend, if the day is too hot or raining Lovely hourLive performances

Culturally Rich. Vietnam is very rich in culture and tradition which includes farming, family, romantic relationships and the like. If you want a fun, visible cultural introduction about the country on your first time in Ha Noi, you should get yourself a ticket for the Thang Long Water puppet show. It might not have everything you need but it's worth a seat . The only thing tip I could give you is that you should go there at least an hour before the show and purchase your tickets so that you can get a good seat. Don't get a seat far from from the stage..the closer the seat to the stage the better to avoid hands and shoulders and heads of people taking photos in front of you. if you're into videos.. make sure you got a very good HD camera and for still photos make sure the composition is right to take videos/photos on low light.

Entertaining and very different. This should not be missed, it is very skillfully performed and a unique experience. My only minor complaint was that it may have gone on a bit too long but I was very tired after a long day so this may be a bit harsh.

Nice. We were staying very close to the Water Puppet Theater and decided to go for it one evening as we had heard good reviews about it. There are a few shows every day with the timings displayed outside the theater. We picked an evening time. The language used is only Vietnamese. The show starts with songs and is then followed by the puppet show. The show is divided into several little stories like chapters details of which are given in the pamphlet (which is available in English free of charge). The show is pretty nice with various colourful puppets dancing on water. The duration of the show is 45 minutes and it is a nice way to get some insight into the culture of Vietnam.

nice to see. the show itself it's funny and well done, the theatre has really small seats and you can pay 100vnd or 60vnd based on the seats but at some point none was checking were the people were sitting.

Part of the Hanoi 'bucket' list. If you're coming to Hanoi you've got to do it at some time. Despite it being originally aimed at children, and the seats having associated leg room, and that you won't understand the language unless you speak Vietnamese, it's a VERY entertaining 50 minutes, so you've got to go!

Cultural enrichment. One of the highlights of our trip to Hanoi. Well worth the 100,000vnd each person for an hour's entertainment. Unique style of manoeuvring the puppets underwater using long pools. With live musicians and singers, you experience and glimpse some of the history and life in the fishing villages in north Vietnam sprinkled with a dash of humour. Language was not a barrier even though the show was in Vietnamese.

Don't miss it. This is a very traditional theatre, set near the heart of Hanoi in an older building. I love puppetry and so the notion of puppet theatre was not new to me. However, it was the first "water" puppet performance I'd seen, and I was delighted. Children are thrilled. In fact, I'd say that you have to be somewhat jaded to not have a good time for the fairly short performances. Do not expect Cirque du Soleil. This is a developing country and the puppetry reflects the customs, culture and capacity of the Vietnamese, with considerable nods to the tourist audience. I think it is a must-see if you have the time.

Entertaining. This really is a must see if you visit Hanoi, but only once! I don't think we were supposed to giggle but we couldn't help it. The show is quite tacky but very cleverly done by very talented people.
Must-see. The puppet show itself is marvellous, but do watch the beautiful singers and musicians. The musical instruments and the way they are played are a show in itself!

An very enjoyable show, worthwhile seeing. Having seen several puppet shows, we were not that enthusiastic about the show. However, it was so hot in Hanoi during our visit - 42 F that we decided to escape the afternoon heat into the theatre where there is at least some air conditions.We were surprised that the show was really good ,had a lot of laughs and because our tour guides have told us the basic life of the Vietnamese as well the folklore we can appreciate and stories even more even though we could not understand the singing.It's amazing how skillful the puppeteers to maneuver the puppets so well, synchronizing all the movements so well.It's amazing that they all stood in the water all through the show. Can't figure out how they control the puppets. It was lighthearted and fun.

Really weird but really fun(ny). This is essential when in Hanoi, the whole thing is really weird but if you don't take it too seriously you will really enjoy yourself. Its cheap and lasts just 45minutes

Nice but nothing fantastic. I guess this is a bit of a must see when you visit Hanoi but just between you and me it was a little boring. Of course the narration is all in Vietnamese however an English pamphlet is supplied so you can follow along. The music was great and so were the singers but the puppets show itself was somewhat repetitive.

Unexpectedly Enjoyable. We decided to visit the water puppet theater on a whim. It seemed like it would be a cheap, short, post-dinner entertainment when we were feeling too tired to do much else with our night.I didn't expect much since reviews had said it was hard to follow as it was not in English.This was not the case though!I enjoyed myself a lot, laughing out loud quite a bit along with the rest of the crowd, and never feeling the least bit bored. I found the actually mechanics of the puppetry fascinating, and the acts were slap-stick enough to be humorous without language.I picked up an English pamphlet at the door which gave a brief introduction of each act, and this was more than enough to comprehend what was going on.I would recommend this to everyone. It is very professionally done, despite the cheap price, and even with a busy schedule it should be easy enough to fit in.

Fun!. So much fun, who doesn't love a puppet! The show was lively and colourful and the music was great. You don't have to speak Vietnamese to understand what is going on. A joy to watch. The only issue was with the theatre seats, they are very close together leaving barely enough leg room.
Very interesting. A must see when you are in Hanoi. It's very interesting. They have changed the scenarios and it became amazing. The music was very beautiful. I loved this show very much.

The Water Puppet Theater...An Odd but Unique Experience. The Water Puppet Theater is an odd but unique experience that one should attend at least once. Though difficult to describe and accept in this age of modern digital technology, the Water Puppet show returns to basic wooden puppets that perform on a stage of water. There is a live band that sits atop the stage and voices the puppets as well a playing music. It's a 45 minute show that can be oddly entertaining. Young Children will appreciate this much more than adults but all should see from a cultural angle.
Amazing show. A must watch. I thought it will be boring but i end up loving it. Amaze at how they do it... just fascinating.

Delightfull, you shouldn't miss it!. I was not sure of what to expect... Some wooden dolls popping out of the water sounded mildly entertaining. But I was surprised by the inventiveness of the little animations, the funny stories and the live music. Sometimes it was a tat bit too loud though. The whole show is worthwile and I was well entertained!

A little on the dull side. Thoroughly enjoyed watching the musicians playing their instruments in their wonderful costumes . The actual puppet show was very average and repetitive but would not like to undermine the skill it may take to manipulate them. Never the less it was all of $5 so not a great loss

Love This .. This is the third time I have seen the water puppets and each time the performances are a little different but still excellent ...Book the seats closer to the stage ,even though they are a little more expensive ,it is much cooler than sitting at the back and visually easier .

Interesting but very cramped. The art of the Vietnamese water puppet show can be fascinating though viewers should be warned that the magic disappears after the third dance and the seats are incredibly small and uncomfortable for anyone over 5 foot 5.
If you have any leg conditions they should avoid this place or just stand through the performance in the back row

Funny show! (without subtitles haha). The show got Vietnamese humor but all Vietnamese, no English translation.
Not bad for a $3 show, but English version might be better understood and enjoyed.

Puppets in Water. . . .. not much else to say other than this is a must-see if visiting Hanoi. Traditional Vietnamese culture well presented. An hour long show, about the max you can stand as a foreigner but professionally presented. If you have kids under 12, they will love it.

Never again. Puppet show.
Well well well.......
One hour of my life I won't see again.
This might have been great in the 17th century in a small village in Vietnam , but not today .
Most of the people I spoke to after the show we're not impressed, some fell asleep.

Enjoyable, but a little long. We managed to secure front row seats for 100 dong per person and while it was exciting to watch a traditional performance, it did get a little tiresome towards the end.... worth the price for watching it and somewhere to go for the evening.

Keep an open mind. We stepped into the theatre with little expectations but instead, we were mesmerised by the puppets. I think the performance lasted about an hour but during that time, we were taken on a musical trip through Vietnam's folk lore. Although the performance was all in Vietnamese, we could more or less understand the show as everything was visual. The seats, though, was quite cramped even for Asians to sit. Could have been more comfortable.

Different but a bit dull. We were lucky to get front row seats, so had a great view. The musical and singing performances were good, but overall the show was a little too long (at around 40 minutes). I think children would probably enjoy it.
Something Difference. This is an interesting place to visit, although it is a bit humid. Something difference and not expensive to experience while in Hanoi.

Folk music and traditional instruments. There are several performances a day. You can choose to go there during the afternoon or at night. It is what we expected about a water puppet Theater, all sang in Vietnamese. It lasts around 45 minutes and after a while is more of the same. What we liked the most was the Vietnamese Folk Songs and the traditional instrumetns.

Interesting but hard to see. It was great to see a traditional form of entertainment while in Hanoi. Just be warned to rows of seating are very close together and although we were only about 8 rows back the visibility was really bad. If you are on the shortish side like me it might be worth ensuring that you get a seat in the first couple of rows.

Entertaining hour. I have very low expectations for this. The only reason we ended up here was that we had an extra few days to kill in Hanoi and had run out of activities. We were pleasantly surprised and entertained by this performance and would definitely recommend it if you are looking to do something with a bit of local flair for the afternoon. It is an intricate and lively display of skill by the puppeteers and definitely worth the small fee to sit and enjoy for an hour in the AC on a hot day. Word of warning the seats are super tiny if you are over 6' (180cm) like me prepare to have your knees in your chest. Otherwise a pleasant experience.

A taste of Vietnamese Culture. Very entertaining - and I liked the Vietnamese Folk Songs that the Vietnamese performers sang. There's different musical instruments used in the show and the water puppet show itself is entertaining. It's around 50 minutes long and it kept us entertained. Very well done, whimsical and kept my attention. Love the Vietnamese folk songs.

Very Entertaining!. A lot of work and co-ordinating goes into making this a fine performance, well done to the people who are controlling the puppets, not to mention being in the cold water the whole time.The lighting in the theatre was a bit dark, that's our only complaint.

One Must Go. I was not keen on it but we went as how can one go to Hanoi and not partake in this traditional and long standing act.Its well done, its not expensive, it lasts under an hour and its a nice way to cool off and rest before you continue with the rest of your activities.

Something unique in the Old Quarter. My partner & I were not sure about this show, whether we would enjoy it, but we splurged for the front area seating (it's a couple dollars more) and were pleasantly surprised. It was impressive how the puppeteers manipulate the sometimes quite large puppets from under the water...while the singing is in Vietnamese, there is an English guide available that introduces each scene, and you call tell what's happening by watching. Highly recommended for something different.

Not so good. This was a struggle to get through. If I could have squeezed out past the people I was sitting next to I would have. It was so hot and crowded I could barley breath. The seats are designed to sit small people. Perhaps in the colder months it may have been ok.

Worth a watch. (Note: each show's programme is different! Mine was folklore, some other shows are just narration and depiction of local culture.)I loved the authenticity of the show and the spirit of the arts and culture of Vietnam presented through the show. In a way I felt like it wasn't just for show for tourist dollars. Locals were watching too and in fact, the whole show was in Vietnamese. I loved watching the musicians play the traditional Vietnamese folk music and mickey-mouse the actions of the water puppets, it was pretty interesting to watch that live. The water puppets were controlled very masterfully and with many different stories from local folklore and legend. They even made one of the water puppets climb up a tree. Since I didn't understand the words, I just appreciated the show for its artistry. Art doesn't have to be understood to be appreciated!
Unexpected enjoyment. It's very clever and well worth seeing. Need to book ahead unless in a tour group. To this day I don't know how they manipulated all the puppets.

The Water Puppets have it all. This is the one, the most famous of all water puppet shows in the world. It has toured internationally and every time I go I see the veteran muicans and singers. Stories told with the puppets have a long history in Viet Nam and yes, they are performed in a body of water. If your large then book the front row. Great 45 minutes, film or photo to your hearts content, but most importantly, live the performance. It's one of beautiful color, action and song. your senses are awakened by the sights and sounds. This is a must, and at the conclusion, give a big cheer to the musicans, singers and puppeteers. It's magical.
So nice!. Sit down and enjoy the 1,000 years old show of the puppets. We were very surprised and enjoyed the show very much. It must be hard working for the players to keep the puppets moving.

Lost in Vietnamese language. The puppet show was nice but it could have been better if there were any English brochure that give a further detailed explanation on what's going on since the whole show was conducted in Vietnamese language.

A must in Hanoi. This show is a must if you visit Hanoi. The show is extremely unique, and we loved watching the musicians play all of the different instruments. It was definitely not what we expected, and was a bit too long, however we still enjoyed it. We went on a day when it was 100 degrees and the theater was very hot and uncomfortable, so I would avoid going to the show on a very hot day. I would also recommend getting the more expensive tickets, as the theater is pretty big and the puppets are very small. I recommend this to anyone visiting Hanoi.

Shiny gold puppets ducking and weaving. Only thing that would have improved it is more background in different languages - but I guess the question is - which language? There is only so much a puppet in water can do, and they did it well, especially the fish puppets, though the Phoenix dance was brilliant. Watch for the Asian version of the unicorn which does not have a spike on its forehead, and the dragons too.

Great Show. The water puppet performance was very good - although the performers seemed a bit bored, two of them were talking and laughing through most of the performance while playing their instruments. Very long and detailed show, it's very enjoyable. The performers are very talented and a water puppet show is definitely something you should see while in Vietnam.We saw a show at the end of a very long day, so some of our group fell asleep as the performance was quite long.Also it should be noted that if you are more than 5ft tall your knees will definitely be touching the seat in front of you.

Really interesting. The water puppet theater was really interesting and enjoyable, even though we didn't really understand it since it was all in Vietnamese. The music and singing was excellent and the puppetry only got better toward the end. It was certainly not what we expected, but a really interesting and fun experience. While we thought all the performers were exceptionally talented, we thought they seemed a little bored with the whole thing.

Research the puppet show story before hand….there are no translations. Having done some research on this world renewed water puppet show before I came to Hanoi, I managed to persuade my wife to go for a show on a hot afternoon by telling her it would be a good way to get out of the heat….tricky, I know ;-)The theatre itself is quite obvious if you are at the north end of Hoan Kiem lake, it it at the north/north-east end of the lake, across the busy road. The show is about 1 hr long and we were seated in air-conditioned comfort. If anything, the fans blowing the cold air at the audience tends to make it too cold for some (like my wife). Seating is determined by the ticketing staff so be there early if you want to get front row seats. Otherwise, tickets are usually available even if you arrive last minute.I enjoyed the traditional Vietnamese show, especially the singing parts (which were quite melodic and soulful), even if I didn't understand what the artistes were singing about. The entire show is in Vietnamese, with no translations. Having read up on the story of Hoan Kiem lake before I came to Hanoi, as well as hearing the story from our tour guide, I could guess that the show was about how the lake got its name from the golden turtle who snatched King Le's sword and got it back in the end.Still, the repertoire of what you can do with puppets was quite limited, causing us to fall asleep a few times, 3 quarters into the show. The air conditioning and late afternoon tiredness after a long day of touring didn't help matters either. Our interest was briefly awakened by the fireworks-breathing water-dragons but otherwise, you could guess how the show ended…with a happy ending!I would recommend anyone looking for authentic Vietnamese culture to come see it one time but to skip any return trips.P/S: We had some time after the show and spent it looking at the puppets on display on the 2nd floor of the theatre, on the right hand side of the theatre entrance.

Very special show. We was watching for the Water Puppet performances are excellent. Vividly reflects the lives of the people of Vietnam. On Rice civilization, the cultural characteristics of Vietnam. The main character is the uncle TEU, very attractive. You should look for this show at the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre right next to Hoan Kiem Lake.
Entertaining!. The show is not in English, however, it's very easy to understand with the animated performances and my favourite was the little firework show and all in the water! Interesting!

Fun even though we couldn't understand the words. We went to the 4.10pm show which lasted an hour, and you can buy tickets ahead of any of the performances. The puppeteers stand in waist deep water behind a curtain, manipulating the puppets using long bamboo rods. The puppets comprise wooden figures, animals, and fire-breathing dragons. They dance and move through the water to the music of a live band sitting to one side of the stage. Before you enter the theatre, take a card (in several different languages) from a stand by the door. This lists the fifteen items to be performed, giving some but not enough detail. There is obviously much humour in the antics of the puppets, so it is frustrating not to understand the Vietnamese words. The seats have very little leg room, so anyone over 5' 8" tall will be jammed against the row in front. Try to buy a seat on the end of a row, or in the front row. You can pay extra to take photographs during the performance.

Fun for all ages. It was a sudden idea to go to the show. There are quite a few performances, so it wasn't a long wait. Buying the ticket was easy and then it's just a matter of waiting around till you can sit down.There is not a lot of legroom, so you will be squished for the hour or so but still in air-conditioned comfort. The annoyance of people using their phones and even ipads (with the flap of the cover open so it's double the size!!) to film is still prevalent. Fortunately as the show goes on less people can be bothered to keep filming.I didn't understand a word, but it's fun, the music is lovely, the singing delightful, and the clever It's a must do if you go to Hanoi.

Water Puppet Show. When in Hanoi they say its a must to see the puppet show. Look you have to do it but for me ...... boring and a waste of 3/4 of an hour. Had no idea what it was about and to make things worse rats were running under our feet ! The best part - the end
Not to be missed.. My kids also loved it (9 and 11 years old). Duration 1 hour, interesting music, good explanation of the show.

worth the price. The show was very interesting. The music was amazing as the musicians seemed to genuinely love their job. Don't know why all the negative reviews are posted. I would suggest seeing this show. Only rated down 1 because of the seats. Being 6 foot 4, I was very cramped.

Very cute show. I was here early April and went to a 4pm show and paid $3 for my ticket. I really enjoyed it. I had no idea what the story line was, and yes some of it was cheesy, but overall, I thought it was thoroughly entertaining. It was about an hour long and the girls singing had very good voices. I recommend it for sure, but don’t go in with a serious attitude, it’s entertainment.

Not just for children!. I was told that this was really meant for children. I found it a very skilled and excellent performance. However it was mostly ruined by people holding up tablets to take photographs and by flash photography in general. CAMERAS etc SHOULD BE BANNED out of respect for the performers and those in the audience who actually came to see and listen to the show.

Traditional, but an acquired taste. We saw the puppet show as part of a group, traveling Vietnam.It is cleverly done, but wasn't really our cup of tea. Other's in the group felt the same, whereas some loved it - it's a personal thing.The seating is very tight, and we found it lacked in leg room.

Entertaining and Impressive. The show was about an hour long, and we were glad to have a program since all the singing was in Vietnamese. Very impressive what they can do underwater! Such an entertaining show and the "expensive" tickets were only $5. Great date night.

Vietnamese puppet show. The Vietnamese puppet show was good to see once. Since it is part of their culture you should see it. When we saw the show it was a day after traveling from the USA so we were tired, it was hot, the seats were not too comfortable and my dada fell asleep. I enjoyed it and afterwards they showed us how they did the show by opening the curtains so we could see the people behind the scenes. I enjoyed it but once was enough.

Fun for all. The water puppet theater was a great show and for only $10! The hour long show with music and traditional Vietnamese singing.It is amazing what the performers can do with the large puppets. Even if you are in Hanoi alone it is worth a stop.Beware the shows are mostly SOLD OUT so you need to make sure you get tickets in advance

A little too long but still enjoyed this show. We arrived at 2.30pm which was perfect timing for the 3 o'clock show. We got the more expensive tickets (100,000 VD) and think it was probably worth it. I would recommend this show but it did feel like it was for children or older people as it is mainly tourists but is all in Vietnamese so music and the visual is basically all of it.

Amazing show. Even though the show was performed in Vietnamese language but I could get the overall story.
The actors & musicians are amazing!

You'll only see this in Hanoi. I was fascinated by this puppet show- so inventive and unusual, although one of my traveling companions slept through it. I think this is well worth the time and cost and would encourage everyone to check it out.

Slippy when wet!. My partner and I didn't really know what to expect from this show but I must say that we really did enjoy it.It was amazing what the puppertiers were able to do without drowning! Remaining underwater whilst their puppets act out the story.We sat in the front and came close to getting wet numerous of times. Some may sayba truely interactive experience!Overall a uniquely cultural show and a fun night in Vietnam

Great show. Wonderful puppets, great musicians, extremely cheap and great air con - it's unbeatable for a great start to an evening out with the kids - or without them! - in Hanoi. Everything was explained very well in English and the scenes themselves are really inspiring and entertaining. Don't miss it.

A fun show and great introduction to Vietnamese culture. My friend and I LOVED the water puppet show. Well-performed, beautiful, and totally enchanting. Make sure you grab a copy of the play bill on your way in, it will help you understand what's going on and it's available in several languages. In theory you should pay to bring in your camera, but unless you're in the front row, your pictures won't work out well due to the lighting. This is a great thing to do in the evening when you're ready for a sit-down.
Highly recommended. For something different and that will be enjoyed by all ages, go! The puppets are clever and well synchronized with the music. All ages will enjoy it and is great value.

Too long for the kids. Very well produced and performed show, it's just a little too long for kids. Our boy is 8 and he was squirming around after 20 minutes. A steady procession of families leaving before the end suggested a similar experience.

My wife's review. Look, not necessarily my cup of tea, but guys you know when your wife would like to do something !Overall a pleasant afternoon & very talented performance. The music & puppeteers put on a great show.My only criticism of the show is the limited description, of the plot, in any othe language. That being said it's not too hard to use your imagination. Possible to prebook a session to your liking.

Really nice hour. We didn't expect much to be honest. however it was really quite enjoyable. Our 2 boys (6 & 4) enjoyed it and were kept in their Seats and entertained for the whole hour, which is impressive. The music and singing was great and the puppets fun - felt cultural. All round a very enjoyable hour - and at 100vnd each, great value.

Definitely must during your stay!. After you get tired walking around Hoam Kiem Lake it's good to spend one more hour and rest during the show. Ticket costs either 80.000 or 100.000 VND depending on the day and hour of the show. It's all in Vietnamese but worth to see it. You can enjoy the art of watter puppets and traditional songs.

Not a bad way to spend an hour. I didn't know too much about the legacy of water puppet shows in Hanoi but I had definitaly heard about it so at only 100k VND a ticket i thought what the hell.I'll start by saying my expectations were very low...so low in fact that I was hoping to be seated near a door so i can make a suttle exit if i didnt like it.The show isnt in english so I could only hope to enjoy the visual display and performance although there was a bit of a problem with that - The theatres seating isnt very well set out. You have less leg room then an economy flight on an airline and my view was partially blocked by the persons head in front of me. There was a retard next to him that was holding his phone up trying to film the whole thing but the girl next to me told him off and he stopped it.The show only goes for 45 mins so if your in Hanoi... why not...just dont expect it to rock your worldI really do think they need to ban the use of cameras/phones during the show becuase it was highly annoying!

I wasn't sure exactly what I was watching ... but I liked it. I remember that I'd been drinking before I watched this performance with my tour group ... as a result I thought it was the most hilarious thing ever . Sober ... however , it would probably be less so ... It was a good family/tour activity and I would recommend it to others.

Water puppets, North end of lake. Quite entertaining, but all a bit rushed. It was nice to sit down and be entertained for an hour but later we went to the Louts Water Puppets (West side of lake) and it was much better.

Charming! Don't miss this!. Delightful,, quaint and quite charming. Even though the dialogue, music and stories are all in Vietnamese, it's possible to follow some of the story plots owing to the water puppets' body language, as well as that of the narrators, singers and musicians. Expert puppeteers. Very tight squeeze in all the seats!

"A bit weird". The Thang Long Water Pupper Theater is one of those tourist traps that is exactly in the name. It is a trap that catches it's prey. I do not understand why some places stay in business because of the age of the tourist trap. I'd say to stay away.

Nice show. It is situated near the lake and is really a tourist attraction. There is a live band and the stories speak for themselves. The amount of movements they can make with the puppets is quite amazing ! They show is played several times a day.
Water Puppets. fun!This was really different and if you only have one trip to Vietnam you should definitely see this. Quite
Worth seeing because is unique. Worth seeing because is unique - did not think it was great entertainment. But don't let this put you off - have a look yourself.

interesting show. very unique puppet since the player is getting wet because they stand in the water pool. i think every show always full so you need to buy ticket early. dont be late because it will disturbing other. the front seat more expensive than back seat. but you can enjoy n watch it clearly.

interesting. very interesting but only in Vietnamese, so we did not understand the story, Very traditional, including music. So if you do not like traditional Vietnamese music and theatre then don't go

OK for the kids, otherwise give it a miss!. The Water Puppets may well be a traditional entertainment, but it's difficult to tell how authentic the experience is, as it is unashamedly a tourist trap, and I didn't see any Vietnamese faces in the packed auditorium on the afternoon I visited. The entertainment is vaguely entertaining, and would probably be worthwhile if you have kids in tow. But it's all a bit twee for adults.The most annoying thing is that the first half of the performance was totally spoilt by selfish people raising phones, cameras and even hulking big tablets aloft to photograph every scene, obliterating the view of people behind them. This basically went on repeatedly until even they started to get bored. The theatre staff did nothing to prevent this, and obviously don't care, as they are raking it in for every performance. You"re not missing anything if you give this experience a wide berth!

For the young at heart. If your travelling with children, then the puppet show is a must. If you havnt had any cultural hit before Hanoi then this is a must. Even if you have weary feet, just sit relax and enjoy. Who cares if you fall asleep, if you do this means your getting the most out of your holidays. Not for everyone. Only cost $5 (100,000dong) pretty good hourly rate for air-con, dark cool, sit down.Do it for the kids !

Fascinating. Comfortable and entertaining show. Wonderful skills on display and a delightful cultural insight. Short, cheap and great fun. Would have been even better if the people in front had the courtesy to keep their cameras and phones down...Maybe the venue should put a no photography restriction in place.

Fun. We originally bought our $5 tickets and didn't have a clue what it was for but were told we had to do it !! It was a lot of fun. It is all in the local language so we didn't have a clue really what was going on but the music and puppets were entertaining. Took us a while to figure out how it was done. Good times. Nice AC.

I enjoyed it!. Went here on 16th march as part of a tour we were on. I really enjoyed it, but my partner didn't, but then when I looked around whilst there the majority of the men in the audience were asleep!I thought that the puppetry was very clever and the accompanying music played by a live band good. It was an experience that I probably won't get to do again (partner's probably glad about that), but saying that I am glad that we went.RegardsBaslady
The wife enjoyed it more than me.. Water puppets. What can I say? It was alright, but I can't say it was the best experience of the holiday. Sorry, but just not my thing.

I really disappointed. The ethnological museum, i can see them but with the comments of the Vietnamese who sympathize with the story. In the theater, the music is less traditional.I did not think this was so special. Sure, some of this was cleverly done and exotic, but I probably would have been able to leave the room for 10 minutes and been completely satisfied.

Went out of curiosity. And did not regret. The show is not too long, so you don't risk much. The band backing the show was worth an "A" I loved how they used all the local percussions to go along those lively water puppets.
nice show. Our hotel organised tickets for this spectacle. It was very nice, especial the traditional music. You can follow the show even if you don't understand english.

Worth going!. The show is very cheap, the theater has AC! WOOHOO! and the show is unique and entertaining. It only takes about 40 mins and it really is amazing how the make the puppets move in the water.If anything to have a nice rest in an AC room while being entertained! Tickets were only 3usd! worth every penny!

A must-see in Hanoi. Yes, it is very touristy and the show lasts for only 45 minutes - BUT it is a great piece of non-political, non-sexist enjoyable fun. The theatre is near Hoan Kien Lake on the edge of the Old Quarter. Tickets should be bought in advance to avoid missing out. Be prepared for bus loads of tourists so get there early to avoid the crush.The show is amazing and hilarious. The art of the puppeteers is excellent. The band and singers that give voice to each of the "acts" or vignettes are very good as well. The stage is a pool of water which is murky so that the mechanisms of the puppets are hidden from view. At the end of the show, the puppeteers come out from behind the curtain and it is then that you realise that they have been standing in waist deep water to run the puppets.Don't miss this show when in Hanoi. It is the best one in Vietnam.
Ok night good lighthearted fun. Ok it might be a bit naff but we laughed and had fun it's traditional cheap and a great way to spend some time just enjoying what it is a light hearted show

Really worth it!. The water puppet in Hanoi is a funny and original experience. The company has a world reputation and the people moving the puppets are extraordinary. Try to book at least one day in advance. The cost of the ticket is very reasonable. The show lasts around 45 minutes. Try to get seats in the first row or on the aisle not to get covered by the heads of the people seating in front of you. Even if the story is told in Vietnamese, the movement of the puppets is so realistic and creative that you don't need translation. If you visit Hanoi with kids, this will be a perfect entertainment for them. Enjoy.

Hilarious!. It is so touristy, but really good fun!I'm not sure we were supposed to find it as funny as we did, but the flailing arms of the marionettes had me and my daughter in stitches. Some great photo opportunities too. I recommend the sunday matinee as kids are less than half price and photos can be taken without a permit (1 adult and 1 child for 140 000 dong). Bargain!
Water puppets. Excellent show! recommendd this but you have to have short legs. Your knees hit the chairs in front. Apart from the seating being very tiny the show is worth the visit.
Very entertaining. My family, kids aged 9, 10 and 15, all thoroughly enjoyed this unique show. I was worried it would be boring! How wrong I was. Highly recommend it and excellent value.

Okay for the price..  One thing to point out immediately is it is allocated seats so check where you are going to be before paying for ticket. The theatre is in doors so you might be better off at an earlier showing. It was good entertainment though started watching clock after half hour as no storyline in English. Ok for 45 mins and money but number of cameras and low tiering were a bit annoying. Good luck if you are any taller than 5ft6!

Interesting but not informative. The puppet movement are awesome. But without any translation or scripts, I have no idea what they sang and what exactly they want to tell. Although the foot space is crazily small, i chose to have a nap in a hot day.

Great fun even if you don't understand Vietnamese. Even though we didn't understand a word of the Vietnamese we were hugely entertained by this show we did though struggle to get in as each performance seems to be booked out by group bookings. Coach loads of people are unloaded at the start of each of these many performances on each day.  we persevered at the ticket window insisting on waiting for a cancellation even though the lady said there would be none. There was live singing while the puppets were moving around in the water and I would have to say the singing was fantastic particularly the two lead girls. All in all an outing not to be missed.

A different type of show. It is worth going to see this show. It does not cost a lot and lasts for less than an hour. The puppets are amazing and the way they move fascinating. It has a great visual and sound effect. I thought the taking of photos throughout the show spoiled it. Flashes were continually going off and people were holding up their iPads which got in the way. I am sure lots of them had not paid the extra to take photos as there was no one checking up on this.
Entertaining. Great show. Loved the music and the insight into Vietnamese culture. Definitely value for money. Fun for kids too.
Awful . Worst thing I've ever seen I would rather watch some one burn to death no joke the people should be ashamed to charge 5 dollars to enter and the price of drinks is a joke

A must watch show in Hanoi. Very excellent and interesting show with 2 type of price range, 100k dong and 60k dong. Drop by as early as you can to get the ticket to avoid disappointment. My experience was the ticket sold out at around 2pm for the day and I have to purchase for another day.

Get there early, and don't take a taxi. Our taxi went all over Hanoi before getting us to the theatre so we arrived only a few minutes before starting, we were given seats right up the very very top and back so couldn't see a thing, we moved to another seat that was empty so we could see and were told off, we just ignored them and stayed in our spot. The performance had moments that were lovely, but was just average for the most part.

A different kind of cultural experience. Cheap ($5), quick (45 mins) and entertaining, this show is an experience unique to Vietnam. While the stories are specific to Vietnamese culture, they aren't difficult to understand. The puppets are quite clever and the musical accompaniment is great. The shows are done every hour in the old quarter of the city. Arrange through your hotel or stop by the ticket office. Try to get seats in the first two rows (we were in the first row and it was perfect!). The kids in the audience were quite enthralled.

Utterly Charming. My hostel recommended that I go see the Water Puppet performance, and so glad I did. Isn't too badly priced, although quickly goes that way if you want to take video or photos as you've have to buy another ticket - not sure what happens if they catch you doing it and you don't have one.The show has several performances, and is very easy to understand as its almost a completely physical performance. Every act is different and shows just what you can do with water puppets - Some are admittedly a little bit dull, but think the dragon's and their fire/water act is fantastic and a must see.

Excellant, a must see.. As others have said, a must see. the performance was only about 50 mins, but went very quickly. Admission is very cheap, by our standards, but booking is essential. The performance is really interesting and clever and while relates to Vietnamese rural life it is easy to understand. if not in a roup, hotels can arrange tickets and taxi/cyclo transport.

Worth it! But pre book your tickets to get good seats. It is one of those cultural experiences you must do, for $5 and an hour of your time it's definitely worth it. I dropped past the ticket box at around noon to buy my ticket for the 4:15 show which meant I was in the 2nd row, it's a small theatre but I'm not sure if I would have enjoyed it as much if I didn't have a good view. Music, singing, and puppets are all great and the show only lasts 50 to 60 minutes which is just enough time to enjoy without getting bored. One of those things you only need to see once but should be done while you're there.
A unique experience. A really different experience and clearly a popular one. Great effects, memorable musical accompaniment, and a cheery cast. Well worth a visit.

Love, love, loved it!!. I had previously read the reviews on Trip advisor for the water puppets and some of the reviews were mixed. So I'm happy to report that I truly loved the water puppet show. It was so uplifting to experience the theatre in Vietnamese song combined with the cutest little wooden puppets known to man, the splish and splash of the water puppeteers was adorable. In my opinion it didn't go for long enough, I could have watched them for another hour!!

Good to see. This show was just around the corner from our hotel.We went to this puppet show and we enjoyed it. it was entertaining. it goes for around 50 min.The puppets were good and Although we couldn't understand it (it is in Vietnamese) the people who run this show are very good. they sing and tell a story. The puppeteers do a great job.be warned though it does book out fast, so go and book in advance. we were going to go on the sunday but it was fully booked.

One of those must-experience things but might have been happy to miss!. We were keen to seen the Water Puppets because its one of those 'when in Rome, do as the Romans etc etc' and it was interesting and reasonably entertaining, but culturally a long way from our idea of entertaining really. Worth a look, but if you don't manage to get there, its not the end of the world.

Hanoi Puppet Theatre. Our tour of Hanoi included a show at the puppet theatre. For anyone visiting Hanoi this is a must see feature. Simply amazing what the local puppeteers presented. The 6 piece band/singers dressed in local uniforms were expectational. The theme of the presentation based around the rural life in the rice fields was very informative.

Don't bother. Should have listened to my instincts - it was not even worth £3.00 . The musicians were lovely but the puppet show not that interesting to be honest. The theatre must have been build for locals because at 5ft 7in I should hardly fit my legs in an after 20 mins it was miserable

Water puppets... unique and fun. The show was very interesting. The theatre itself was comfy and a good get-away from the noon-day heat. The show was both informative as it highlighted rural and agricultural life styles in the form of puppets, and was unique given that it was on water. The traditional costumes of the live band and singers, and the puppeteers too, added a nice touch. Lighting and colour well done. Photographs don't turn out great given the constant movement though...

Nice music, nice show. The theater itself is very small and crowded, the only entrance is the walkway and staircase going up and crowd always stuck blocking the whole entrance. The seat is design for Asian, we see lot of western tourist with big size is hardly fit into the seat. The show with their local language without any translate or subtitle, cannot understand the story.
Good experience. A good experience enjoying the water puppet show. However, we do not understand their dialogue. Maybe they should have a translate screen beside the main stage.
Good experience. It was 1 hour show that I never been before, all the artists are really skillful to manage their puppets under water. It is a great art to introduce to the world.

Interesting to see a traditional entertainment type but of limited entertainment value. The length of the show is quite short so if you are in Hanoi it is probably worthwhile going from the point of view of having the experience of seeing a traditional entertainment. It is quite clever and we couldn't quite work out how it was operated. However if you have seen a water puppet show once, you probably wouldn't want to go again as the entertainment value is quite limited.

Only 5 backs for place in the first row, plus.... two if you want to use camera, for movie - little bit more...I never thought that puppet masters all performance stayed deep in the water...Very valuable, absolutely unique Vietnamese art...

Enjoyed the show. The water puppet show is a must-see in Hanoi. It is very touristy, however, and they seem to pack in the people, running several shows per day, back to back. The theatre space itself is crowded and the seats are closely spaced. Still, we are glad we saw it.

Enjoyable but don't go without good seats. Our original seats were about midway up steep stairs. The puppets looked tiny and we had trouble seeing. Once the show started we moved down to empty seats and enjoyed the show while trying to figure out how it all operated. It seems that the good seats are bought up by big tour operators so if you are on a private tour or with a small group and really want to see this, bring binoculars or make sure that your seats are in the first 7-10 rows.

A disappointing experience. We had been very much looking forward to this, but where you sit is the key to your enjoyment. We were half way back and had a good view of the back of heads, which meant we couldn't see all the production. Legroom also very tight for taller westerners. What we were able to see of the production was very clever, so if you are booking this make sure you book seats as near to the front as possible.

Great for kids of all ages. We really were not sure what to expect but we loved it! The show is naive in the best possible way, utterly charming and without pretension but with enormous skill and artistry. The puppetry is great but so is the music and the players make what is often a challenging sound approachable and enjoyable to a western ear without compromising the musics roots.But most of all it is just great great fun and should not be missed.

A fun traditional show. Was a great thing to do whilst in Hanoi. I would recommend buying tickets during the day as it was packed and annoyingly they let people in once the show had started. A fun thing to do. Very clever.

Quirky and interesting. A cultural experience worth doing.. It only costs about $5 to see this show which lasts about 50 minutes. It is quite interesting with different vignettes played out by a range of water puppets. The accompanying music is very 'cultural' but I didn't always find it easy to listen to. The show is cute and funny at times too. All the puppets are quite different and the stories are easy to understand. It's definitely worth an hour sitting in a warm, slightly cramped theatre.

Unique, funny and creative.. Yes, it was crowded; no I couldn't understand the language; yes there were a few inconsiderate people overusing their cameras. But it was funny and obviously extremely well done with both musicians and puppeteers clearly experts in their fields. I really enjoyed it.
a delightful show. Well worth a visit only cost a few pounds to watch the show, very clever the way it is done and lots of fun for all the family. I really enjoyed it.
Unique show. The show exhibits the creativity and humor of the the Vietnamese people. I wish there was a translation of what they were saying. Nonetheless, even without one, the show made me laugh.
interesting!. this is one of my favourite time during my time in vietnam. they played very special form of music and film. amazing!

Unique entertainment. We didn't know what to expect when we bought tickets for the water puppets and we were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful singing, instruments, stories, and quite amazing puppetry on/under water. This is a unique experience and a wonderful event to attend before or after dinner.

Third time and still amuses me. Despite seeing this performance 3 times, it is still wonderful to watch again. The musicians and singers are highly animated as is the entire show. The water puppet performers are incredible in the way they move these puppets. This visit was super crowded, standing room only, and unfortunately we were seated behind an inconsiderate young couple with a approx 3 month old baby that they continually held up high so that 'it' could see the performance. Despite this, we enjoyed it and it remains one of my favourite shows when in Vietnam. No lift available so for the mobility challenged, it is a slow climb down the stairs with limited railing.

Surprisingly very enjoyable. Well obviously we can't understand a single words in the play but the water puppet show is very creative and funny at times and you sort of able to understand the story line by itself. The movement were amazing and up until now we still couldn't think of how they managed to do it :)

It could have been missed. I was not that impressed with the show. The theatre is beautiful. The singers and the musicians are great, but the puppetry is not interesting. The puppets are not seen very well. The movements are the same for 45 minutes and all together, I did not enjoy it. So, if you just want to see it in order to just have seen it, then fine. If not I would recommend to use your time better in Hanoi especially if you are limited in time.
For the Old and the Young.. I thoroughly enjoyed the show. The dragons, fish and the figures of Vietnam all made this show a must see when in Hanoi.

Water Puppets. I had seen a Water Puppet show at the Adelaide festival but was keen to see it in the home city. It was well worth it. No, I didnt understand what was going on but none the less I enjoyed it as a cultural experience. If you are open to different styles of theatre then go!

Grab a leaflet / programme. The show runs for 45mins and has 17 acts. It is tempting to video a lot of the show but don't ruin the experience for others. Out of the 17 parts to the show - only 3 or 4 are worthy of getting the camera out. The best special effects happen in the first ten minutes - with 4 swirling dragons that squirt water and have fireworks coming out their mouths.What follows are some very funny scenes involving fish, frogs, a legend about a golden turtle. If you pick up a leaflet when you arrive it will briefly tell you what to expect. The puppeteers come out at the end. It is all very cleverly done.
Loved it. Something different..a real taste of Vietnamese tradition.You have to pay a small feel take photos.We enjoyed it.

Must see. One of the must see place. The play has performed in an auditorium, which theater-like atmosphere. The play was about traditional folk story of Vietnam, which we didn't understand well. However, the highlight was puppets in the water and light and sound was just right.
Must see. Great show, very well put together by very talented artists, both musicians and puppeteers. Covers many of the traditions of Vietnam

A special experience. One of the must do things in Hanoi is a visit to the Water Puppets. Located in the old city opposite the lake, you are taken back in time as you watch this traditional art. The shows are very entertaining and you leave feeling happy and a little more connected with the people and culture of northern Vietnam
Great night out. What a change really enjoyed this place great show really interesting and different well worth a visit

Terrible. Do go unless u want to sleep in the theater. Paid for the premium and slept the whole damn show. The place is old and you wouldnt understand what its about as its spoken in viet, local language. Theres no subtitles either, hence you wouldn't know what the hell its about. As i walked out of the theater, i just hated myself for spending an hour sleeping there. Ha ha ha. Ps: if you wanna watch live muppets, please dont use your camera to record them, a pic or two is appreciated. But not recording the whole show its better then for u to watch the muppets on tv as its damn distracting.

Interesting. Possibly overrated ? people keep pointing their digital cameras in front of others which made it difficult to see. I am sure there is skills involved to do this but it was difficult to appreciate
Good fun, don't need to know the lyrics!. Visited with kids aged 7 and 10. Good fun, even without the language. At 45 minutes it's also short enough to maintain the attention span.
Wonderfull. that is really the theater what is really something special ,all theater was something new to see.WE really liked it very much.

Interesting show. Theatre was packed with large tour groups most of whom had iPads and mobile phones which they used to capture most of the show and had to manoeuvre around them to see.Great cultural experience with local singing and a puppet show in the water with the puppeteers behind a black screen. Very quirky and different. No english translation but easy to understand what was going on. Show lasted about an hour which was long enough for me.

A cultural experience. The water puppet theater was really interesting and enjoyable, even though we didn't really understand it since it was all in Vietnamese. The music and singing was excellent and the puppetry only got better toward the end. It was certainly not what we expected, but a really interesting and fun experience. We attended the late showing and the crowd was pretty small, only 1/4 full. We had good seats. While we thought all the performers were exceptionally talented, we thought they seemed a little bored with the whole thing. A little more enthusiasm on their part would have garnered five starts rather than only four. At 50 minutes long, the show was just right! Perhaps a non-starter, but it would be more interesting for foreigners who do not speak Vietnamese if the story being acted out could be explained either in verbal or written form in English. At the end of each scene, there was awkward silence because the audience full of foreigners didn't know the culturally-appropriate response to what they had just witnessed. Therefore there was only applause at the end.

Interesting to watch. Was advised to do this as a highlight of Hanoi. It was set in a little theater with a small pool at the front. Traditional singing and great puppetry follows for the next hour and some parts are very humorous. Not in English but you can figure out whats happening. What spoilt it most was people lifting Ipads, mobile phones etc high up to film the show and I had someone in front of me doing it for the whole show and i basically had to watch it through her Ipad.Visited here with a groups of friends and they would all probably give it 5 stars but i just thought it was okay. I would advise a visit here if you are in Hanoi.

Interesting. The show was just long enough without getting boring. Interesting to see but if you missed it, you wouldn't be missing too much. The seats are cramped without much legroom. Maybe because we went still having jetlag I could have done without it?

Fantastic. Its a proper theater seating around 300 guests. The stage is a pool !! And its here that the puppet drama is enacted with live traditional viet music. Very proffessionally done and of a high standard. The water puppetry is very unique to vietnam and this I believe is one of the best places to watch it. A must see experience.

Master Puppeteers. Superb show great opportunity for photographs try and get a seat as close to the stage as possible. You must go when you are in Hanoi very traditional lively performance.Colourful with live singers and instrumentalists, good special effects we loved it.
water puppets show. different sort of show very clever show was about a hourWorth seeing was within walking distance to our hotel

Entertaining Hour!. The theatre is small, the seats are very small for 6footers, but the entertainment is very Vietnamese. The singing is outstanding...done by two girls who you could see were enjoying every moment. The evening consists of aproximately nine small plays about paddy fields and rivers...still not sure how it was done though. An easy hours worth of entertainment.

Only go if you have nothing else to do. Boring, monotonous and slightly amusing, I was keen to see this because of its origins in Hanoi. Packed into a little theatre I was more than nervous about how I could get out in an emergency, because once you were sitting there was no way out!
A Treat. Different and no engkish spoken but it was very entertaining. Book tickets in Hanoi cheaper than on line
Unique. It is amazing how this puppetry is accomplished. Some of the presentations are a little hokey, but overall it is worth seeing.

OK. The show is just OK. You don't have to hurry nor have to let it go if you have time. Nice traditional music and singing. I am not tall at all, but the leg room is very small indeed. Some parts are repetitious and monotonous. Photography should be banned here, you will see why.
Interesting and novel. Good way to spend an hour or so - interesting skill if you haven't seen it before and lively show. Not a "must do", but not something you'd get anywhere

Entertaining cultural experience. We attended this performance as part of our tour of Vietnam. We had heard much about it from others who had been here. The theatre is in the area of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. This is the first time we had seen a puppet show performed in water. The show lasted about 45 minutes. It was a very entertaining way of telling a folk story. The performance, singing and musicians were good. The show was well attended, almost all the seats were occupied. It is worth including in a visit to Hanoi.

Really fun and a must do in Vietnam. Very different, well organised, nice air conditioning. Good way to spend an hour in Hanoi. We booked our ticket via the hotel 100,000 dong each, and got front row seats and avoided queuing at the box office.

Great Show- A Must See. This was a wonderful and popular show, so make sure to get your tickets in advance.
